OBnML7GXWJC_UE4qPj0WfA.text: You know your in the Mandlay Bay and you want to get something that is not going to totally screw up your expense account.  Overall the standard fare is good and stick to the basics of a bar and grill type of food and you're good for a good meal.  Yes you're still in the hotel so it is going to cost you, I had a nice big meal-size salad and it was enough for a good lunch.  I sat at the bar and a very friendly bar tender kept my ice tea filled up the whole time.

Obani-3bg8blMHLJ-XMzZw.text: This is for the bakery section only, although Citizen offers meals as well.   The Raspberry shortbread was really, really good. Buttery, thick, shale-like layers with a generous amount of raspberry filling and crumbles on top. The banana chip muffin was okay, but the chips were interesting in that they melted at the slightest touch. If I blew on it, three chips disinegrated immediately!   When I asked for the banana chip muffin, they accidentally gave me banana bread, and when I went back to the counter to exchange it, they told me to keep it so I gave it to my homie who said it was the best thing of the 5 things we got.   With so many other bakery options on the Strip, I wouldn't make a special trip here, but it was nice that they had counter seating available for snackers like us :)

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry shortbread, banana chip muffin, and banana bread.

6Nu9pM8EG7hHMcVUodpX3Q.text: A quick, friendly, breakfast at the bar before our conference was almost everything I expected. My breakfast potatoes and English muffin under my eggs Benedict were both extremely dry, but the flavor was good.   Bartender was excellent and the service was relatively fast for the area and time. I'd recommend it!

tPD55nHYqZ09ThZWzVX-ow.text: Fun place loved the decor and the food was very yummy! Tony had great recommendations!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Shot Rib Lasagna! Loved the Blue Berry Spritz drink!

IOA2VYi9eiXeCHGxjCt-nw.text: Great spot for a quick bite to eat inside Mandalay Bay. The menu has lots of variety with offerings to please most everyone in the family. Waiters and waitresses are accommodating and efficient. It's nice that this place has takeout too. If you don't want to sit in the restaurant you can order and take your food back to your room. Also, there is a separate to go area for picking up items on the go.

4HmMlXSI81SLA1wMZNEeUw.text: I gave this place two chances.  For lunch, I had the rice bowl with salmon which consisted of 90% rice, 2 pieces of broccoli, 2 snap peas, 2 carrot slices, and 2 slices of zucchini.  They should call the dish "Brown Rice with a few veggies".   The salmon was cooked well which made me bump them up from 1 star to 2 stars.  Add a sparkling water, tax and tip, I ended up paying $46.  Definitely not worth even half the price tag.   The second meal was breakfast.  The coffee was good but I didn't get further than that.  They were out of oatmeal which is the only thing on the menu you can eat if you are gluten-free and can't have eggs.  My suggestion is they pop of gluten-free bread in their freezer so people have some more options.  Also, swap real maple syrup for the fake stuff.  It's all just a reminder that high prices don't equal high quality.

-xAXdrxMJu9NGIXSlhSDIA.text: With so many Las Vegas strip hotels and even (many) more eating establishments to choose from, how did I find myself eating at the counter of this casino deli on a Sunday afternoon watching a women's college softball game? Don't ask! But it did have one of the best BLT's I've ever had. Go figure? The service was slow, the place was noisy, my bar stool got bumped twenty times by patrons, buses and waiters but damn what a sandwich. Everything about it was so damn good! Portions, plating, sides (mine was slaw), pickles and peppers - wow everything - great!  If I found myself in that same predicament again I would definitely go back again minus the woman's college softball game.

hvASYcrOFFK924xihb3LZw.text: Had dinner at Citizen's one night during a business trip and our group was exhausted.  Our waiter Giddeon, was amazing, he helped us with the choices on the menu and got our food out quickly and correctly.  I ordered a veggie bowl which contained rice, veggies and pieces of steak.  It was acceptable, but I wouldn't recommend it as one of their best dishes.  My coworkers had lasagna and the Citizens prime rib dinner.  Both are huge portions and both were delicious! I should've gone with one of those selections!  The lasagna was nice and tasty with a great short rib bolognese sauce, served with garlic toast, simply delicious.  The prime rib looked amazing, although I did not try it, the broccoli was nice and crunchy, cooked to perfection.  The steak fries were to die for.  Went back the next day and had the turkey avocado sandwich- exceptional! huge portion- was only able to eat half, but it was simply delicious served on cranberry bread. The mixture of the aioli and the sweetness of the bread was perfect.  My coworker order the mahi mahi fish tacos, I think it was 3 tacos to the order, they were a good size, served with fries, also very good.  I highly recommend this place and their service.

jyd50kp_kIpy2X0ky6-Jug.text: Service was great.  Friendly and pretty attentive considering we are sitting outside in the corner. Food and drink was decent.

HUXcHxpAti4j_cz-tyELHw.text: I give kudos to this place because it's the only eatery (besides Subway) that's open 24 hours in Mandalay Bay or The Delano. Note: the evening menu does change and doesn't provide a lot of options. I ordered a cheese quesadilla which was yummy and fresh, but something I could make at home.   We ate there for dinner and the crispy shrimp On the appetizer menu was so delicious! I'd go back just to order that. We also had the Mac and cheese, which was tasty, but comparable to other places. We also had the spinach dip and mashed potatoes which I wouldn't order again. Tasteless and the spinach dip said it had artichoke, but the pieces were so small and infrequent I can't even consider it to have artichoke.   Service both times was mediocre. My opinion: go there when all other options are exhausted. And thanks Citizens for staying open for the drunk people!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and Cheese. Pretty good!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious appetizer! Would go back only for this and the fact it&#39;s the only 24 hour eatery in Mandalay Bay.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citizen&#39;s Artichoke and Spinach dip? No artichoke! Mashed potatoes, bland, in the background.

rMhizypw0qoIovRYOstJkQ.text: In between several more upscale restaurants lies Citizens, which has a little bit of everything to satisfy the general American palette.  We showed up as they were transitioning from breakfast to lunch, but no worries, they still sat us down and gave us some chips and pico de gallo to munch on while we waited for the kitchen to shift. The pico was basic, but this isn't the type of restaurant to serve something more elaborate. We ate it all up without complaint.   For lunch, we both ordered a reuben with corned beef and fries.  Service was prompt at this point. Our sandwiches had nicely toasted bread, an inch or so of juicy corned beef, melty cheese, and a nice layer of sauerkraut.  No complaints from other of us.  We both enjoyed our meals and ate up most of the fries.    My only complaint on this otherwise standard satisfactory establishment is that it is a bit pricy. It's Vegas though, so expect to pay a bit more for everything.

c4ofCp6bwGp8BEBH3d_k7w.text: Citizens is a fairly new restaurant on the Strip, located at the Mandalay. I believe it opened earlier this year... Like many new restaurants at the higher end casinos, the interior is re-done and has an upscale feel. Service here was fantastic--our server was very accomodating to our unusual requests, and he was speedy. How was the food? Hmmm... I ordered one of their signature items: the meatball grinder (meatball, gravy, and provolone sandwich). It was missing something... I would start with a thicker gravy with some added punch. In any case, I got the feeling their recipe was missing a key ingredient(s) and was real close to being perfect--meatballs had decent flavor, lots of provolone, and good, soft bread... Pic is posted here yelp.com/biz_photos/citi... Another member of our party had ordered the Muffaletta. I think I'm just not a muffaletta person as the sandwich didn't connect with me. Visually, it did look good though... With both sandwiches failing to wow me, great service and good decor isn't enough to woo a return visit from me... =(

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of their cocktails... The American Pie... Ordered only because of the movie series...! XD  that is a slice of an apple..
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball grinder sandwich...
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xWgl9ecfYdaDxrDugd30Aw.text: Since my mom was still sleeping my dad invite my brother and I to grab some breakfast. And since we didn't want to go far we found this restaurant and decided to give it a try. My brother ordered the ultimate breakfast which included pancakes, two eggs, a slice of ham and potatoes, my dad had the classic eggs ham potatoes and toast. I settled for the body builders omelette which was made with egg whites, veggies and chicken breast with a side of fruits. I really enjoyed the omelette it was perfectly cooked and satisfied my cravings!

1uPIjd_EAM3H13q-sNGCdw.text: I don't know how to really rate this place   We stayed at Mandalay Bay 10/21-10/25 2017 first night I saw the place we decided to put our name in the list and was told that waiting was 1hour so decided to move to another resto but what we did I ordered a food for my partner to go and still was told waiting was 30 mins I ask if we order and just eat on the other side since it empty I was told a big NO so decided just to pick up to go since too lazy to walk  Then my friends ordered roast beef sandwich and chicken salad but when our ordered came it was a roast beef  sandwich and a chicken salad sandwich we questioned them and they stated it was a misunderstanding so what the lady did took the bread in-front  of us toss it into the trash and said there your salad  and we ask there is a difference the lady stated yes ask for the $2  Even it happened we went back got seated since it was early.  Order and everything  So here is my final rating  Chris server 5x5   STARS JP manager 3.5 STARS never convince us what action will be done  Food 2.5 STARS Atmosphere 3 STARS  OVERALl its a 2 STARS  SORRY your place needed a lot of improvement

oW0PyFwZnQ48RBWttEVgkg.text: Had lunch at the bar to watch football. We were served by Erick who kept us entertained all the while providing  exceptional service. Although the place was packed, he was on top of his game, anticipating our needs and doing it all with a smile on his face. Food was great (BLAT and Nachos) and I would definitely return, especially if I saw Erick behind the bar.

2MiYfYxTmTmby-_4KQXMDg.text: Writing for take-out only.  The staff was friendly and remembered me after I came back the next day to order again.    The first night we ordered the BBQ Ribs, the Truffle Cream Prosciutto Penne Pasta w/ Chicken, and Mac N Cheese.     The BBQ ribs came at a full rack, there was so much food that it's hard to complain about but the BBQ sauce was just overwhelming with hotness and spice that I had to take some of it off the meat.    The truffle pasta was REALLY good.  The really strong truffle scent could be smelled through the carryout tray and bag.  Each bite was so delicious.  This was really good that I had to get it again the next day.  What I found though was the consistency of the ingredients was off.  The second time I ordered this, there was far less prosciutto in the dish.  The chicken was  fine though and there were also peas which gave the pasta some color.    The Mac N Cheese was pretty good too.  Mixed w/ ham and peas and crunchy bread crumbs on top, it was a good side dish.  While the food was not bad, the price was astronomical.  The pasta, for example, was $30 w/ chicken.   While it was enough pasta to probably feed two people, I can't help but feel bad afterwards for spending that much on one pasta in a place that's not really 'fancy'.  Of course, this is the Strip we're talking about.  So while staying at the Mandalay Bay, I suppose I'd go here again.  Otherwise, not making my way through the parking lot and crowd for this.

dyd8Gdz1Go42b3PcCSa5QA.text: Food was good, we just had the shrimp tempura and quesadilla appetizers, although it was rather overpriced. Along with a mimosa and ice tea, the bill came to $68, including tax and 15% gratuity.   The servers were very polite, although when we went up to the counter beforehand the hostess was asleep and we stood there awkwardly until she woke up and noticed us.   However the biggest blow was that we'd only gone for the Egg Benedict that was disingenuously advertised as a brunch menu item available all day. However, the waitress told us it was only a breakfast item that they stop serving around 10. In my opinion, brunch is usually something you expect in the afternoon as well.  So two stars for the food, one star for the politeness of the servers.

q1xYQCThIDSgl_71VLj6tw.text: Quick service and the food was delicious. Had a huge breakfast and didn't have to break the bank to pay for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EdomZVqFhxHnu3cu6BxQjQ.text: I needed decadent sweets for some of my clients and went to Citizens at Mandalay Bay and LOVED our server Shania who was professional, helpful and friendly when I ordered dessert after dessert that she carefully packed for me with skill and love. Oh, the dessert is so beautiful and there are so many choices! I needed a very large order and we were in and out very quickly thanks to Shania. My husband and I were so impressed that we asked for the Manager and met JP who came around the corner impeccably dressed and professional and he greeted me and my husband with a huge and engaging smile. What a charismatic man/manger. My husband and I were restaurant managers and oftentimes we find managers lacking in customer service - JP is so much better than 5 stars and he should be commended! How you care for customers and staff trickles down and Shania is a fine example of his excellent skill with managing a team who made us feel like part of the Citizen family! Management please give JP a raise and promote Shania. We will be back!

1Z_KotYO5a5oMKP7pouJIw.text: First place we ate at in Vegas, services was slow, waited on food for long time, all our food was cold, eggs Benedict was ok, egg white omelet was terrible, blue berry pancakes were like eating card board, cut up potatoes were good. Pricey but what in Vegas is not.

bXuDEnVtbzQfjyBjB0g0Hg.text: Lotus our server was fantastic . She was prompt for us and went above and beyond for us. She was fun and informative and I will be a repeat customer because of our server .. she kept my ginger ale full thanks !

7dbCfvnDSdV3XTXxAuyV2g.text: The ultimate mary was pretty neat, stacked with all the fixings.  Tasted pretty good as well.  We waited half an hour (no joke, had already finished my bloody mary + all the food on it) before the turkey burger would arrive.  When it came, the burger was luke warm at best, but the buns ontop and under were COLD.  It was as if they just came out of the freezer without being heated.  Disappointed.

yizYk0ovWE3tZO4-LX_uMQ.text: Very expensive, as Las Vegas is no longer inexpensive in the food department; however the service was great, with a smile and quick. Rachael, my server was pleasant and even though she was really busy - she served with a smile

rFvwc2w1eQVRf4QYJUBP4g.text: My wife and I spent the week in Vegas to attend the Keller Williams Real Estate conference. It was our first time in Vegas. We had breakfast here and Shanna served us. She was so joyful, accommodating (my wife has a gluten allergy), and prompt! Talk about service with a smile! She got us in and out quickly and was so pleasant. The juice was awesome! Definitely go see Shanna at Citizen!

5ABNniB_RqCWGB60nShKgA.text: I am writing this review because of excellent service we received from Teasha. She waited on us for breakfast during Interbike 2016 and was so good that we returned to the restaurant the next morning and asked for her. She was cheerful, helpful and extremely efficient. She didn't even write anything down but got all of our orders perfectly. Marjorie Rugg - you have a great waitress in Teasha and we hope to see her again next September while we are attending Interbike 2017.

2E00_J140gwVcEQImdz4ww.text: Erick with a CK was amazing! Definitely made my day! It was my pleasure having him serve me. Best bartender I've experienced this trip

CxI_2LjrAAKZz6I135AARA.text: OK I realize this is a tourist trap in Mandalay Bay where there is limited lunch choices for a reasonable price.  However, the service here is terrible.    Saturday afternoon -- half empty.  We came in and were seated.  15 mins to take our order.  AFTER we ordered another group of four was seated, order taken, and food arrived for them before we were served -- our order was not complicated.  Order came wrong -- asked for cole slaw and got fries.  Other party paid and were gone before we got our check.  Never saw the waiter until we asked for him.  Two simple taco plates, two cups of soup, one club sandwich and four soda = $94.00 (minus tip which I did not leave).    Walk down the Strip a little and get something more reasonable.

dBSYWNr2P_AiyCmNeZjbgA.text: First off I don't understand why this place only has 3 stars, we really enjoyed it. Hubby and I came here for the hangover brunch on Sunday after an epic Vegas night. I had the chicken chilaquiles, super cheesy and a little spicy. The highlight for me was the most perfect Bloody Mary, they have the option of bottomless Bloody Marys but you have to hook them up yourself, I opted to have the bartender make mine and it was delish. My husband had the bacon burger and he loved it. The service was on point, everyone was asking how we were doing not just our server. Seriously loved this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangover Brunch

2ZlPeKP0iTtokeYuWXexAQ.text: I love this restaurant and especially their wonderful to-go counter.  The hostess always greet and are very polite as well as the counter staff. On several occasions the manager working named Margaret or Marjorie (not sure but she works morning and afternoon) has been extremely rude and unfriendly. She doesn't smile or make eye contact with anyone and looks miserable. It's very sad to see someone dislike their job as much as she does and I'm sure her employees pick up on it. Hire someone friendly they are supposed to turn around bad experiences not create them.

rPomrMralRfT5iUmLpZYKw.text: Bland overpriced breakfast with servers who had no clue what they were doing and were more interested in chatting with their friends instead of serving us.  Coffee cups sat empty for 10 minutes.  Eggs benedict looked pathetic and had no taste.  Eggs were horribly overdone.  Toast... man, what is it with breakfasts in the U.S. and places not able to simply TOAST toast?  We were served cold bread... when we finally were able to ask for 'toast', they gave us cold bread again that was slightly tan on one side.

jNqx3eUwoa8Du7CiV9ow4g.text: Going to citizens for my birthday dinner, not sure if I'm going to get the Frisco or the spaghetti both are delish! GreAt spot to meet and eat.

MLh32UGthi2Ka_l06Luo_A.text: Me and my friend came here because Delano would not let us check in due to some issue on their end so we had time to kill and plus we were pretty much starving. This was a good choice and their food is very generously portioned.   We started with a couple of their signature cocktails. Those were pretty weak and pricey for what you get, not really worth the price and not as delicious as the name and description made them out to be.  For food got the tots and mac n cheese and the french dip. The tots is a huge portion covered in cheese sauce. It was good but I think it could use a little more seasoning. The mac n cheese was flavorful but the crispy topping was bland and didn't add anything to the dish. My french dip was just OK, the saving grace was the dip which was super flavorful and delicious. I was dipping everything from the tots to the sandwich into it.   We came at off hour so it was not busy and service was quick and prompt. Would come back for a quick bite next time we are at Mandalay.

e_dyUvTqTrJaSZ8eQeyXGg.text: Had another awesome lunch with my kids at Citizen's. Arturo Camacho was our server and he was fantastic! Service was great and he took great care of us. He made sure we had a great experience! Thank You!

JH4PmXbPyeMZPCdp1LkFew.text: Ask for Chris. He gives you that genuine feeling that you would expect from this concept. Not only does he give sincere, efficient service, he is happy to do it. MORE SERVERS SHOULD BE LIKE CHRIS. Fine diner my whole life, this guy has got what it takes.

Q7mnjxEiIkeQtypEr2fhbQ.text: This place is yummy! We decided not to do brunch, but lunch instead. Here's the breakdown: Signature Bellini: very very yummy. We ordered a second round Queso and chips: the dip was very tasty and not too spicy. However, the chips were stale. We asked our waiter to bring fresh ones, and the 2nd batch was not much better.  French dip: overflowing with meat and caramelized onions, used a knife and fork. Very tasty, recommend for sure.  BBQ salad: typical salad. Didn't have much dressing, but didn't really need it. The toppings were tasty.   Would we come back again: for sure

A9yWf6voJ-hYUWW8J0SLFQ.text: Wow! You can start with the bright eyed waitress Rachel and stop there!! She really made my experience!! I wandered in here by accident and was greeted with such smiles I said I MUST dine in! I asked Rachel about flavored coffee and she suggested caramel!! It was simply amazing!! Then I ordered the smoked salmon Benedict!! Wowsies!! It was simply amazing!! I guess I know where I am having breakfast every day while I am In town!! Their lunch looks great too!!! If you stay at Mandalay Bay you must try this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Salmon Benedict

W2mYbBpW0EZO_JyCZqnjkQ.text: Went here last night for dinner and it took almost 45 minutes for us to get our food. There were several tables that came in after us and got their food before we got ours. Maybe it was just a fluke but, not apology or explanation as to why it took so long to get our food. The food was good but, overpriced. The service makes the experience and I will not go back.

Gxzfyo8NgHXaLjWrMbrA7w.text: Was looking forward to having lunch here after spending the day with my family. Up until I was told you had no space in a semi empty restaurant with an empty patio to accommodate a party of 3 adults and a baby in a stroller. They didn't even bother in saying we can put the carrier in a sling or anything. It was just we have no space for you. I've seen chairs and tables moved and space made for everything else but can't make it for a baby. Sad to know that's how you take care of customers. Won't ever go back.

JB2IgT_a7ocyvArwN3LB6Q.text: Was a little disappointed that they didn't have any beers on tap, but was glad to have the Stone Arrogant Bastard from the bottle.  Got the 18 hour prime rib, and was pleasantly surprised.  The steak was very thick, and yet tender and flavorful.

4QZhHqUMt0NOktDGmm4PVA.text: KEEP YOUR RECEIPT!  I left my receipt and the bartender added a nice $10 bonus tip for herself.  My credit card was charged $10 more than the total I wrote in (with a 20% tip I might add).  Shady stuff...

cRywyfVqRJPG__0NZfxG8w.text: Service was amazing. The problem with this place is that it's over priced as far as the type of food you're getting.  Well that's what I get for trying to get a good meal in a hotel.

iWnftSll1giCRa1nKHgalg.text: Erick was super friendly and great service. Good portion sizes. Not too bad on prices considering the location. Great quality comfort food. We went for appetizers before the show last night. Fries were hot. Loved that they had options (floured seasoned fries or steak fries). Condiments were chilled. Hot wings were perfectly sauced and hot, along with chilled fresh dressings. Servers could use some back up with beverage top offs. Great stop before a show. Citizens Mimosa was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9JK5kADgCfhpIqFF_YZrUQ.text: Another example of subpar service at a Mandalay Bay restaurant.   I stopped by for lunch with a friend, and we found seats at the bar. The bartender barely even tried to fake friendliness, and proceeded to mess up an order that consisted of 2 salads. Luckily, the server who actually brought food to us was accommodating and fixed the order.  The salad was on par with what you would get at a Chili's, but cost twice as much. Nothing special to see here, folks.

_Ok1Di0y9YigoEi1f49a9A.text: Omg! What can I say! I come here every time I am in Vegas. 4 check ins to date. I even used to come here when it was red white and blue. The food is delicious and it never bothers my stomach. Like ever. And I cannot say that about most restaurants. The past trip to Vegas which was in June we went twice. I had the turkey Reuben and it was delicious. I cannot say enough positive things about this restaurant. The waiters and waitresses are very friendly and the hostess is great. Sometimes we have to wait because of all the conventions and it gets busy but hey it's well worth the wait. Great for large parties to.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UPwvJpe-oxG4GCIVNQGwgQ.text: Citizens Kitchen and Bar was my fave lunch spot on my recent visit to Las Vegas. We stopped here on a whim and were so glad we did. My husband got the French dip and I ordered the Reuben. We both loved our food. The Reuben was great and the corned beef was of high quality. The dressing and sauerkraut were really good and the bread was perfectly toasted. The French fries had the right amount of crisp too. When we went they were swamped due to lunch traffic from a convention but they still had good service and we were quickly taken care of. Overall, good spot for a bite but a little pricey.

m4TSdXs-mpv0qR2S-wWyQg.text: Food was good, cafe lattes were outstanding. They have the best chocolate cake.  Service was great for  breakfast if you dine in however if you are trying to order at the takeout  counter good luck. Several different times I came in to order and no one was even at the counter and when someone would finally wonder over and ask what I wanted the service was less than friendly.

ZA9b7utxrT7oYPBFezSg-w.text: We had a group of 6 and had a good experience. The food was pricey but good! After a long night of drinking it was nice to have some soup! Our server wasn't the best did not stay on top of our drinks and had to be asked numerous times for refills. Aside from that it was a good place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toasted Reuben Sandwich with fries! My fiancé said it was one of the best Reuben&#39;s he has ever had!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Soup was delicious! Huge bowl!

8Zf8kBHf-wjnc66o-BiiLA.text: Are you kidding me? I asked for a Pinot griego, the waitress said they don't have that yet. I see several bottles on the shelf. I wanted to say, I'll help my self. Never mind! Ordered a French dip and onion ring, it was not any better than Arby's. But four times the price. Could not chew the sandwich

HLpZDNBpO2WIN_A3MWqXoQ.text: Late night snack in Mandalay. Lots of pastries to choose from. They even have salads, donuts, cookies, pies and more.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Late night snack. Not too sweet. Good portion. Open late.

J1wi60czOAx3Af5UCmNNQw.text: We ate here after a concert at Mandalay Bay beach.  This was the only place that was open after the show.   The food was ok and definitely tasted better because we were drinking.   My issue isn't  the food.   My bill was charged to my room and the following morning when I got ready to check out I noticed the  waitress increased the tip.    It took on call to the front desk and two calls to the restaurant before the issue was fixed.   Sadly the restaurant manager didn't seem supposed by the fraud that had occurred.

Ha2o1XkMFnUQRNKBxAajjg.text: Came here for breakfast during a big convention weekend and was surprised to see the staff handle their tables pretty well despite the chaos.  As for food,  nothing special at all.  In fact, very underwhelming.  I had the Greek omelette with egg whites and friend had the eggs Benedict sub salmon.  Mine was tasteless, even the side of fruit! Friend's smoked salmon tasted funny and potatoes were underdone.  Wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict - salmon tasted weird
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek omelette with egg whites and side of fruit - not good

Axoe0kdbj1GRWnlRUHnm6g.text: Actually struggled to contain my displeasure here. Watched your bartender talk down to bar guests. Question their orders in a condescending manner. I get that you are high volume and have a transient business but if you are in guest service then appreciate that is your job. We all make choices and decide to some to work, if you don't like your job the please don't come to work.

b6-KmdHaRAt7U2IjlIu_sQ.text: Food is delicious but overpriced (no big surprise) but the service was so bad and odd and slow. Here's an actual exchange when I walked up to the register.    Me: "Hi, can I get a Diet Coke?" Cashier: "No." (goes back to sorting register or whatever she's doing ) Me:  staring at her because I think it's a joke. Finally I say "you don't have Diet Coke?" Cashier: "No, sorry." (Goes back to doing stuff) Me: "You don't have any diet soda?" Cashier: "We don't have Diet Coke, but we have Diet pop."   Me: "Umm... do you have Diet Pepsi?" Cashier: "Yeah we have Diet Pepsi." Me: "Ok I'll have that." Cashier: "Mountain Dew?" Me: (So flabbergasted I'm now holding back laughter) "No, Diet Pepsi please".  This is just one amusing example but basically the service is slow and totally checked out.   I recommend it for a laugh.  The food is good tho and open all night.

n2SLGNowWPpV1BlyJ-tc8A.text: Our experience was so bad we were looking around for hidden cameras thinking we were being pranked, NOPE! From our long wait for a hostess to talk to us, our long wait for a waiter, wrong food arriving, when it finally arrived it was cold, our waiter never came back to even speak to us after taking our order, asking for sugar for our tea from the busboy and he never brought it, the service at this place is abysmal. And the cherry on top, the worst stomach ache of my life from the food I ate. Mandalay Bay, you need to fix this restaurant! ASAP!

_XvQCEfFsEqCODGEz7P1fA.text: We have been here many times and the service has always been poor. Few of the servers smile or seem to care. Yesterday was a different experience. Our server was Lisa and she was amazing! She was very friendly, was smiling, and was very quick getting our order out to us. We will be back and ask for her to be our server next time we come to Vegas!

N0P-cP63Usi2WOGihq8WvQ.text: Citizens is not inexpensive (it's in a Vegas hotel, after all), and its not the quickest, but we ate there four times over a 4-day stay. We really enjoyed the food.  It took us a few minutes to figure out that the long line at breakfast was for take-out. Look for the shorter line...with a podium...if you want to sit down and be served. My favorite meal was when I ordered a plain two-egg breakfast. My over-medium eggs were done perfectly. Bacon was beautifully crispy. Potatoes were browned just like I like them. A short stack of delicious, small blueberry pancakes was included. Having had no dinner the previous night, I didn't hesitate to dig in...and almost finished it all.  I can't say the same for subsequent meals.  The portions are ridiculously huge. Wastefully so. Next time we go, we will keep sharing in mind. I loved the Creme Brulee French Toast. It was delectable and included a generous portion of fruit garnish.  I was able to finish about half of it.  Same thing for my BLT with Avocado.  There was so much bacon I couldn't get it in my mouth!  After I ditched maybe half the bacon, I was able to enjoy around 3/4 of the remaining sandwich.  The fries that came with it were the best!  Among our meals, the only real disappointment was the full order of pancakes.  They were much less fluffy than the small ones served with my eggs. They just weren't quite as good. They contained lots of blueberries, so I ate the blueberry islands and forgot the rest.  Again...terribly wasteful. But pretty tasty.  Oh...almost forgot. They serve LaVazza coffee. My favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée French Toast.

WTVM4bazzUSKtaVH0E03KA.text: I enjoyed breakfast at Citizens during my recent visit to Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. A Thursday morning, I was seated right away and promptly greeted by my server. My coffee came quickly, but unfortunately I had to ask several times for a refill - a huge pet peeve.  I selected the corned beef hash served with two poached eggs and hollandaise sauce, sans the sauce. I prefer Tobasco. The hash was quite good and the eggs were perfectly prepared. The portion was just right and I left feeling full and satisfied, albeit a tad under-caffienated.  All-in-all I enjoyed my breakfast and would dine here again, but I wish the service had been more attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citizens breakfast menu.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4B93gCH7-8XyIAbSXfaZAQ.text: Overall the experience was good with some areas for improvement in customer service. Wish our waiter would've been more personable, especially considering we mentioned it was my friend's 1st time in Vegas & it was her birthday weekend. Besides that, the presentation and portions of the food helps you to feel better about the prices. I believe everyone enjoyed their meals. I had the Ultimate nachos with chicken minus the jalapenos.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Nachos

wYyxsFjagV7wxY3IOd0iNg.text: Located at Mandalay Bay, went in for the $49 Prime Rib Special, unfortunately they ran out of Prime Rib. The bartender, who was awesome, made some recommendations. I had the French Dip, my wife had the patty melt, and both were outstanding. The Cole slaw and macaroni salad were also great. The couple next to us ordered dessert. The slices of cake were enormous. They took most of it to go. Will go again but will get there earlier and hope they have the Prime Rib.

UQlqouZpE0zjrokm4AzWOQ.text: Pricey but convenient, and a good business tactic for them being the closest to Light Nightclub.  Grubbers appear to veer toward this eatery after clubbing, as I observed.  The workers look tired but seem to maintain their patience.  Loco Moco for $17 is expensive and should be served without gravy spilled on the side of the bowl if I'm gonna be giving you my money for this high priced dish.  Quality issue guys.  I'll give them raves for their Reuben sandwich with crispy seasoned fries though.  Really delish!  Reminds me of Junior's in New York!  But not the cost; even in the east coast it's less and you get more meat.  I like them enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hoaginess of the Reuben (googly eyes growly tummy)
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I loved it was just a hoagy portion
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco and Reuben Sammy great seasoned fries

7XWTZlg9D2NLQQjPRyfYVA.text: "Every time I come in the kitchen, you in the kitchen." -- Friday (1995)  So disappointing. After an amazing show at House of Blues, my friends and I were starving. We wandered through our hotel looking to see what was open and had a menu of lighter fare and found Citizens. They could seat us right away so we went for it.  The service was horrific. Slow, and when our waiter did show up he was so quiet you could barely hear him and anything we did understand, he was a but rude. We ordered our sandwiches, soups, pastas, etc. and he disappeared. Drinks were barely filled and it took ages to get our food.  Once we actually got our food, it was nothing to write home about - although my club-like sandwich was huge. However, it was so dry it was very hard to get through. My pasta salad was pretty decent, but not really what you want to be excited about when you order a sandwich.   This is definitely on my list to avoid in the future - I'd probably have to be desperate to eat here again.  Pretty disappointing since it seemed like it should have been a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey avocado sandwich with pasta salad

GTmxelWCzXfYoj2umDz7_Q.text: This place is charming and has delicious food.   Love the decor and theme of this restaurant. The customer service was on point and very friendly.   I had the bacon burger with a side of mac n' cheese. Wow out of this world, the bacon is so delicious you will want more and more.   I will definitely be coming back to try other menu items that caught my eye.   Thank you for the great experience and delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon burger, fries, Mac n cheese. Very delicious!

x20lBd_kju8pm7wBnhOW3g.text: I came here with a group of friends for lunch and overall would give it 3.5 stars.  It is your typical casual Las Vegas lunch spot with American Food. Food: Portions are large and for the price it is a pretty good value.   Teriyaki salmon bowl:  filling, but the salmon portion was very small compared to the huge amount of brown rice. BLT sandwich: Tons of bacon and my friend said it was very tasty. Fish and Chips- the piece of fish is enormous and my friend really enjoyed the dish. The fries here are delicious and they have a good wine/beer list.  Customer Service: very friendly and accommodating.  They were easily able to split checks for us.  Overall I would not go out of my way to eat here as there are multiple restaurants in all the Las Vegas hotels that are very comparable.  But if you happen to be in the Mandalay Bay hotel and want a casual spot to eat at, this would be a good spot.

a_rUGe1YLQQ-ve9X0KKGBg.text: Okay. Food is pretty good. Seating is efficient. Biggest issue is customization of your order. They ask about how you want your eggs but the result doesn't match with the results. Went here yesterday and today. Yesterday I ordered two poached eggs, medium. I received one very easy and one very hard. Today, they were both in the easy side. Lady next to me similarly complained that he fried eggs were under cooked for what she ordered. I think this gets lost in their desire to turn over tables quic

tF53il-OctkmPX4KFf2MQw.text: I'm very conflicted on this place - my wife and I have been there for breakfast a few times while in Vegas.   The food itself is decent.  My wife usually goes for the eggs benedict and she enjoys it - she gives them a 4/5 (and she eats them just about everywhere).  I've had a number of different breakfast dishes and find them to be good, but not any better than anywhere else.    I find the service to be very inconsistent however.  Like others have written when they are busy service can be really slow (I know it's difficult when it is busy - but this is Vegas and you know weekends will be extremely busy - you should plan around that).  So if it looks busy and you're in a rush you might want to avoid this place.   The weird part is that even when they're not busy service is hit and miss.  Most recently they couldn't get our order straight.  My wife was offered fruit or hash browns with her meal - she ended up being given both (although it looked like a half order of each).  I asked for bacon with mine and ended up with ham.  They fixed it all and no problem but she wrote our order down and it wasn't busy... How do you mess that up?

pLlci9eYphZ0K-BaIn28EQ.text: WARNING: the "Late Night" menu starts at 7:55PM.  This is so crazy that I drove all the way from Wynn to eat my usual, fish & chips, brick chicken, gumbo, etc... but wasn't to be...  what good is all of good reviews if you can't order the lunch / dinner when you get there?... This place is soooo lame now.   My fav place of 5 years, quickly became a place that I will never go back.  This place will probably go out of business if they keep pulling BS and can't take care of "regulars" like me.  Time to look for new place that I can leave good reviews for y'all yelpers!

EDAYX3jkPjqrThaLkTbMcQ.text: Wonderful! Very nice atmosphere, great service and delicious food. I had a cheese burger, fries and water. Everything was prepared well.

lZPRDxV5sU7G-9s_2wl3mA.text: I gave Citizens two tries while in Vegas, mostly at the urging of a coworker who wanted to return to try breakfast, but I wouldn't have been back after my first meal, which was a lunch.  The first time we went, we stopped for lunch and sat on the patio. My coworker ordered a burger and asked for no onions on it. I ordered the fish tacos. We waited a good 25 minutes for our food, which is an eternity in lunch hour time, and the restaurant wasn't even close to full. When our food arrived, my coworkers burger had onions on it. He stated this to the waitress and she just gave him a dead stare and then walked off. He picked them off, and said the rest of the burger was ok.   The fish tacos were itty bitty. I was confused and wondered if I had accidentally ordered off the appetizer menu, but nope....they were listed as one of the lunch specialities of the place. The three tiniest fish tacos of my life were not worth the $24 price tag attached to them, especially since my only "sides" were tiny cups of pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole to put on the tiny tacos. If, after spending $24 on three tacos I have to stop somewhere else to get something to eat so I don't pass out from hunger by 2:00, we have a problem. Our waitress ignored us, and we had to ask for every single drink refill we got.   I was ready to boycott the place for life, but my coworker is a more kind and forgiving soul than I am (or a glutton for punishment), so we went back for breakfast a couple of days later. We each ordered an omelet. My coworker asked for no guacamole on his....and they messed up his order.....again. I ordered a denver omelet and washed it down with some of the worst coffee of my life (which was $4...yes, for a cup of black coffee.....yes, you read that right).   My coworker bought both of these meals, and I can't say I would ever come back, even if the food was being paid for by someone else. I am giving the place two stars because the decor inside is nice and the fish tacos (all six bites of 'em) were tasty. Otherwise, this place would be a solid one star.

CANH3EK44lfIvkMfdAM4BQ.text: Came here after a night out with the boys.  I don't recall much but I did order a reuben sandwich.  Let's just say she would be disappointed if she saw it!  Yep the sandwich itself was massive and for sure I wasn't able to finish it....or was it!?  Needless to say, I ended up downing the whole thing while chatting away about the night.  The toast was crunchy from the outside and soft towards the middle, giving it a nice crunch while you sink your teeth into the warm cornbeef.  Add a little zing and sting from the sauce and we're all good.    The place itself was packing quick from the late-nighters.  Loud as it should be while some of the unlucky one continue to work their magic for one last hurrah at a one-nighter! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #foodporn #nomnom #latenighteatsaftertheclub

cFgQVG6ai8IfDXdzS2Pvnw.text: Some of the most overpriced bland food ever.  The breakfast platter had what they called poached eggs, terrible.  Service was just average.

XVd7ZY8TKlfCAX-2yMqI5Q.text: not sure why this place only has 3 stars, because it's amazing! great drinks, good music playing, decor is awesome, and food is delish! the house salad is not your average bagged lettuce salad, it has arugula and spring mix! the moscow mules are delish too! highly recommend this place!

ll-z1cxI_hVNfuGXRZ17QA.text: We ordered an avocado turkey sandwich and a chicken soup to go at the express bar since we had a commitment and we didn't have much time. When we received the small little soup which we paid $9 for it, it was only 80% filled. We went back to ask the lady to filled it to the top,  and she just  said it is just the way it is and she made me feel really bad like I'm begging for food. I would think that such a nice restaurant in a expensive hotel mandaley bay will accommodate such a reasonable request. Maybe you should Train your staffs better.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-FNcDCYjc3xx5rP5MUVUjA.text: We stopped in here yesterday for a quick smoothie while shopping at LUSH cosmetics. First, it wasn't quick at all ! Second, it was 10 bucks for a tiny cup! That is not OK even if we were in Madalay Bay. Then when my wife had her cup up, I saw a date 4-8 written with a sharpie on the bottom. This smoothie lacked flavor completely and was very chunky. I hope the date on the bottoms doesn't mean it was prepped ahead of time!?!?!   Needless to say, we ended up throwing the thing away! I literally feel like a threw a ten dollar bill in the trash ! What a waste of time and money !! We will not go back here EVER!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GBzAEPTbt41IgYmlVR88jg.text: Really an exceptional spot, great food, awesome service. Chris Stanford really hooked us up. Looking forward to come back again.

IshHqnEYvzBcWikuXX7NHw.text: We went for breakfast just about everyday we were in Mandalay Bay.  My husband really loved the crab cake eggs Benedict. The French toast dish & Belgian Waffles were also thoroughly enjoyed by family members.  Our breakfast experience with Citizens was that it was a  solid way to start our vacation days.

W5ZVqoIWrnU9Tr6mTwf0zA.text: Are these ppl serious??! How patient do they think drunk ppl are? hahaa All we wanted was a bit of water n to be able to place our order ... No demands of the timeliness in which u brought it out... Just some water and attention. Ughh. They took so long we went to their to-go area and picked up our own "cheese platter" appetizer yelp.com/biz_photos/citi... to hold us over until someone decided to come talk to us. Closest place at the moment that was open though. I hate that beggars can't be choosers--I'll just be a whiny beggar then :/

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese fries
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French opinion soup
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Qinuoa  vegetable salad, served cold but good for a late night option

aBsu1Z2QX6W1T2bHkXHiMw.text: Located in the Mandalay Ba, my and my 6 friends walked around to find something substantial to eat. After looking at the outrageous prices at some of the other restaurants we decided on eating here as it wasn't crowded at 1pm on Saturday afternoon. Average price of a meal was somewhere between $10-16 and they had a very quick moving to go line.  Came here on a sat around 1:30 with 6 people, 5 min wait to be seated. The food was a different story. Ray was our server. He was so sweet but we waited over 30min for our food even though the restaurant was less than 1/2 full.  As my friend said: "this is the quintessential restaurant that needs to serve bread or chips." The waiting time was horrible as everyone in the restaurant can see the kitchen and see the food being lined up and just waiting to come to the table.  We ordered fish tacos, loco moco and frisco melt. 1)Fish tacos came with 3 tacos and all the fixings: gauc, salsa and sour cream 2)Locomoco was a substantial size but pretty pricey for 17$ and IT IS NOT A BURGER. it is literally rice served with a hamburger patty and gravy and an egg overeasy. Really not sure why it is listed under the burger section 3) 2 of us order the FRISCO MELT: totally bomb and the price of 16$ on the strip was great. Melty melty cheese with sourdough bread and fried onions served with mayo and ketchup and French fries on the side.  Mouth already watering even just thinking about it. Great meal for a pre-drinking night on the strip. Would come here again. Price was reasonably and food was good. Service a totally different story.   The funniest part of this place is that the atmosphere music was that CD "That what I call music" circa 1999

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melted onions on the frisco melt
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi mahi
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco

igg4nX0w-FUiruPZrWI3iw.text: So this is my first time coming here. We waited extremely long for our food to arrive I ordered chiliquiles with over easy eggs. The eggs were definitely not over easy. I expressed concerns about the wait time to the manager on duty Amanda who instead of apologizing for the wait said the ticket was dinner in 20 minutes. It might have been printed in 20 minutes but that's not when I ordered my meal. My daughter's volleyball team was seated next to ours and they ordered and finished eating their meals and or food had not come out. I can appreciate a place being busy. What I can't appreciate is the look that this manager gave me when I told her the eggs were not over easy. She wasn't too concerned about improving my experience. The pancakes were very blonde looking and tasted like rubber. There are many other places to eat in Vegas go head over there. I should have went to Hash House. Lesson learned. I wish this place was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amanda the manager didn&#39;t have a problem with this egg. Definitely not over easy. I could pick up the entire yolk.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rubber pancakes

FecFNhhZmphXQ1ExJS-3Bw.text: What is advertised as Juice is actually a flavorless smoothie. I got the Ginger Snap and there's neither ginger nor snap to it. I'd get more flavor chewing on a celery stick. The blend job was abhorrent with lumps and leaves floating in the concoction. Not to mention the staff was lifeless and frigid... note to management -- don't put people on the AM shift if they're not morning people! The entire experience left me with a bad taste in my mouth... literally and figuratively!

s34wnqhEh6GktyKK4x1T6g.text: I've never been here before and it's not clear that there is a walk up (take out) and dine in(sit down).  I walked up and asked for a sandwich. My daughter and I sat down to eat and when my sandwich was ready they asked me to leave because I didn't get seated by a hostess?? There were literally only 2 tables being used and they asked me to leave? Why?  Also- the gal at the register doesn't make it clear that everything is a la cart. So if you order a sandwich please don't expect to get chips or even a pickle with it. LOL.

ShreXqEYnfJc7vBHcPHsyg.text: I will start off by saying that I am a local. I could have went to any sandwich joint/cafe off the strip and paid a LOT less, HOWEVER, I knew I was on the Strip. If you are on the Strip, you're going to pay twice any amount for that sandwich. Get over it. I ordered the tarragon chicken sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the turkey and avocado on wheat instead of whichever roll they had listed on the menu. The staff was happy to accommodate to our requests and were more than friendly. My sandwich was out of this world delicious. The bread was so surprisingly delightful. Crusty, but with a soft pillowy center. One sandwich was nearly more than enough for me. The boyfriend and I usually order two things and trade halves. His turkey/avocado sandwich was exactly what he was looking for and made to satisfaction. It wasn't anything that lifted my eyebrows but there was absolutely nothing wrong with it. All good here if you're just looking for a quick sandwich.

gqVQUyvSNU2M9tLX3BjgIw.text: Please don't eat here!! I love to eat, trust this is True! For the price and the sake of being surrounded by highly renowned chefs/ restaurants this place was a letdown. My husband, friends and I came here for breakfast and the food was cold. (How do you mess up breakfast?!) My eggs Benedict was overly poached and hash browns were cold. I asked if they could just bring out another side of hot hash browns and that's exactly what I got. My second plate of hash browns tasted like rubbery overheated hash. What do you expect if it came out a few mid later. Despite the reviews we gave it shot and the reviews were right, sadly. I mentioned to the waitress that my eggs were suppose to be runny and dripping yolk over my toast and all she could do was apologize. The manager on shift was snooty when she came over to our table. She asked why we didn't enjoy our food and asked if we would like another dish but had an unfriendly demeanor. We felt really awkward and just wanted to leave. Denny's would have been a better choice.

BaGWwgHigqaDMD-0hvStoQ.text: Basic bacon, egg, and cheese on a kaiser used to be simple and delish now it's served in a plastic container with very crispy potato hash and much more expensive. Fruit bowl is huge. Wish things at this great grab and go would go back to paring it down. They do have lemon for tea unlike Starbucks around the corner.

7JUqe5Ed34dLIaJAgL4rPw.text: Food was good 4 stars, the hostess Dana was a witch and needed an attitude adjustment. When a customer asks for a booth and you have one open sit them there even if your server is being double sat. Don't give them crap for their request. They are your CUSTOMER. They make your job possible like my clients make my job possible.

YUOHnaq_POWVwj5CEW9Xhw.text: Citizens gets 5 stars in my book. Hands down the best place to eat after 12a.m in vegas. Prices might seem a little high but when you see the portions you won't be complaining and let's face it, this is vegas and you have to pay for quality.  The staff is great here and upbeat. If you find yourself in Mandalay Bay stop by citizens for a bite!

L5Cqfw4bIHWwmQB-MubcLw.text: Outstanding service, not once but twice by Landa!  Her smile lit up the room each morning I had breakfast.  The food wasn't bad either!  If I owned or managed a restaurant I would want Landa on my staff!

niJ1vjXqq6qMhUDQkOAnOQ.text: World famous bacon egg on a kaiser roll. Add .50 for a donut. Mistake. . 50 more drops the kaiser roll entirely and they serve the eggs and bacon between 2 donuts . True gastrononsense. Dirty tables no attention to detail in cleaning. Why no spoons on their tables. Tragic won't come here again.

DgtTP7Z0h_5uSyahU_o61A.text: Delicious breakfast.  We split the ultimate- tons of food and the hash browns were the best I have ever had.  Waitress was the nicest and best we have had in Vegas.  Definitely will come back.

K2GFE7b3UrSfZeYMvCLQfg.text: Ugh. Absent service and super rude when he did come by. When we finally stopped someone else to ask for more water and our check, our waiter came over with attitude and excuses. As we ignored him and stood to leave he yelled sarcastically at our backs about whatever he had been doing. Food was 24-hour Vegas food. Blah.

Chr68jvINDstTMg1D0ExdA.text: My wife and I come to vegas each year for a conference, and have eaten here often, this last time though, the service was extremely sub par.  Our server 'Danny' made zero effort to check and see if the kitchen could make my wife two eggs for her special food allergies, and brought us the wrong sides.  My wife couldn't eat, and I got the wrong thing. I think we'll keep walking next time and eat at the border grill.

p8u1wXj7uGgJG0RWLvgT-w.text: This was a very inefficient operation that doesn't represent the Mandalay Bay brand well. There were many people working, a lot of activity, many customers waiting and not a lot of results.

lvPtNBO5CUjzPChjJmBy-Q.text: We ordered the calamari, cheese dip and fish and chips. Food was mediocre and pricey. Our bill came out to $80 (inc tip). Servings were generous though. The calamari was mostly fried flour. We were very disappointed by the juice bar. It isn't really juice, but more smoothie. We spent $30 for three drinks and barely made through a quarter of each drink. Gave them an extra star for decor and the servers were polite and friendly.

7JShVsdCgFD0CZv5WZpGtQ.text: We stayed at MB recently and tried this out for lunch...some healthier menu options than other places at MB.  I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and loved it...very filling.  My wife ordered the turkey burger...she liked it, but felt it may have been a bit undercooked.  Not a cheap place, but this is Vegas.

SVLq1bhftYhfDsFMVUvHOQ.text: Bland. Slow. Cold. Food came out one at a time - one of our girls didn't get her gross breakfast burrito until 30 min after we all got our food.  "crispy potatoes" inside of breakfast burrito were mushy French fries. Mgr. tried to "save" the service by offering "shots" which ended up being watered down blueberry vodka - I swear I saw him spit into one bringing it up to his mouth at the bar.  SAVE YOURSELF and avoid.

vZIH8AzIUS6gb7G9MJxqpA.text: Excellent!  Love this place, great service as well as food.  I've been here 4 times and love their French dip-get it!  Raquel is an amazing bartender!  You have to sit at her bar, immaculate!  Clean organized and ready to serve you with a smile.  I've tended bar for 10 years myself and she hits the nail right on the head.  Can't wait to go back!!!

riXotLTXsHBU_3C_9EfsTQ.text: Fast, friendly service but mediocre breakfast items. I expected the banana nut pancakes to have the latter IN the pancake but no: they were a stack of 3 plain pancakes with a sliced banana and some nuts sprinkles on top. That said, they were fine.  ($14) So was the granola & fruit parfait. ($10) The corned beef hash ($16) was nothing to write home about. And forgo the $14 basket of 4 'fresh' bakery items.  The Krispy Kreme doughnut was scrumptious but the other items (croissant, cheese Danish and apple tart) tasted stale.

uNBHUbeg8jYlkuuvpzWhdQ.text: Love this place. You can always get a healthy smoothy when it's 4am instead of getting some junk at some fast food place. I always get the chunky monkey protein smoothy. It's quick and it's 24hrs. I wish there were more of these is the city.

gym3Eg2-TQ-2rugtWHViHQ.text: Citizens is the best 24 hour restaurant in Las Vegas. It is the perfect place to grab a bite at any time of the day. Try the French onion soup or if your really hungry, get the prime rib. Also If your in a hurry you can always order from the deli counter.

-7TK0rOqXPvMn-dHXDQeeg.text: Amazing food the giant meatball was such an awesome app. Great cocktail program. Good vibe.

2x3QvMfIvpkC2gLuqSuCkQ.text: I stay at Mandalay Bay for two weeks at a time about 5 times a year so I am always looking for a place to eat. Citizens is ok but the customer service is lacking. The food is pretty typical of what you get in Vegas prep aired to an average standard at an inflated price. The staff is also pretty typical Vegas, lacK of experience with a pulse. I often dine alone since my trips are for business. I work for one of the shows out here so I am always around the building. The often blank stare no personality hostess is put off by having to seat one and will always try and get you to sit at the bar. The bar with its uncomfortable foo foo hard plastic bar stools is always loud due to its hard tile surfaces. The service is unpredictable depending on who is working at the bar. The take out can be a good option but it's take it as it is. Pre made and don,t ask for it any other way. Once again young no personality who gives a shit attitude. Even Burger King will give it to you your way if you ask at a fraction of the price. They are open all the time which is a plus since I often finish working late.

PvjO1UNSEl-JA-ZuFRHtnw.text: Glen is the best server we've had out of several at the Mandalay Bay resort thus far. Fast, friendly, and accurate! Thanks Glen!!

m1pHOYo8wjjGkvFxBe92pw.text: I've had fair experiences here before but this last week was poor and I feel I must leave a review. Four of us had a business breakfast before a trade show. One of us had a bagel. Two of us had eggs and bacon and one of our group had an omelet. Three coffees and a water. Our bill came to $92!!! Outrageous. The eggs were fair (I've had better at Denny's). The bacon was cold and greasy--not crisp. The hash browns were room temperature and without flavor. Never again, Citizens.

hIeYm0BaSvTeBhE6mict4Q.text: I was very pleased with my meal after giving this restaurant a shot. It's conveniently across from The Light Nightclub which is the whole reason why we even ate there in the first place.  For starters, the service is grand! I had a great time cracking jokes with our waiter as well as for some of the other staff. They're extremely helpful and always try to guide you in the right direction. The food was averagely priced and not bad at all. The wait time wasn't that bad either but that was probably because we were there an hr before closing time.  I enjoyed the salad I chose as well as the drinks they stirred up for me. The rest of my group really enjoyed their burgers here too. I think knowing that this restaurant exists will better my future stays at the Mandalay Bay.  I'm looking forward to see what other tasty meals I'll have here.

6J65Dbfe3CgzcgitNBtQyg.text: I never received such horrible customer service in my life.  It all started when my friend and I asked for 2 cups of water (tap).  They told us it cost $1.00 each, which really set me back because at least in California, charging for tap water is illegal.  I was raising that concern to my friend until the cashier barked at us "SINCE YOU GUYS ARE MAKING SUCH A BIG DEAL OUT OF THIS, JUST TAKE THE WATER AND DON'T PAY. IT'S FREE".  Incredibly rude.  I tried to not overreact and ignored her flagrant unprofessionalism, and proceeded to sit down to eat my sandwich.  As my friend was about to sit next to me, she yelled at us "YOU CAN'T SIT THERE, YOU HAVE TO SIT OUTSIDE AT THE PATIO".  I looked around to see if the indoor tables were closed or something, but there were a bunch of people sitting around us.  I then realized that this was some sort of punishment for complaining about the water surcharge.  What the hell.  If I wasn't so tired and hungry, I would've raised hell.  I guess that's what Yelp is for.

DBZQAOm2zwWi8LC49ra5iw.text: My review is not really for Dinner at Citizens, we sat on the 'patio' with a bunch of friends and had coffee and dessert....which was delicious!   The staff was really fun and friendly. Service was fast, and we all enjoyed our choices!  What more can you ask for while sitting in a casino with friends?

Exx87LZBOkGf-b0_dqOX2Q.text: Poor experience, had to pay an extra $7.00 for a salad without  cheese, then they didn't give us dressing, and Heather had a ton of attitude. Food was good, service was not...

tZzLmJ8tjWiZ9w94o4aMMQ.text: A great casual place to grab a drink during the day at The Mandalay Bay. Very nice atmosphere and vibe. While we didn't eat this time, we have our last trip and the food is spot on!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my goodness- french onion soup!

hrdi-3MNSN_CmXshSS_1rg.text: I wasnt that impressed with Citizens. The service was really slow and the food was eh. The restaurant is located in the Mandalay Bay right across from Light. The decor is nice and casual with a pretty open floor plan. There are big windows that allow you to people watch while you eat. We went there twice because they are the only place open 24 hrs. Before the club I had the chicken penne. The penne was cooked perfectly but the sauce to pasta ratio was way off, the penne was swimming. After the club I had the fish and chips. The cod is nice and large but its the breading that killed the dish for me. The cod was beer battered but there was so much beer in the batter, it made my fish taste like fried bud light. Way too over powering to finish not even hot sauce could save it. Id go back if in Vegas again but I would just try my luck with other items.

dosTlZDf8SRgwVzrDq6FlA.text: Wow this place was great , Amazing Rueban and fish Tacos are a must!! Service was also to the "T"

02roZVJncWmMhM-5ie-Elw.text: Stopped by today with my husband and had Destiny as my waitress. She was extremely informative and super sweet. She suggested the BBQ chicken salad and it was delicious.  My husband ordered the turkey sandwich with avocado, she was right about the cranberry bread was awesome my husband really enjoyed it.  A little pricey but really big portions.

9DRRnK713luk0ZbeZlM5uQ.text: Good food at a decent price for a big Vegas hotel. I had a turkey and avocado sandwich which was stuffed full of fresh sliced turkey. It came with crisp french fries. It was a nice presentation. The sandwich was easy to eat too, it didn't fall apart when I picked it up. It came on sliced cranberry walnut bread that had a good texture and flavor. I could only finish half of it. The other half was my breakfast the next day. I also got a good bloody mary, nicely spiced. Service was good. The interior was too noisy for my taste, between the high ceilings and tiled floors, so we ate in the sidewalk cafe section. That's a better place to watch people anyway, and half the fun of coming to Las Vegas. Good bargain for the money. I recommend it!

o-lUfx3N_mNgPjWPbM5EtQ.text: This past weekend we were in Vegas and stayed at Mandalay Bay.  We stopped at Citizens late on Friday night as we needed just a bit of food to get us through till breakfast.  I ordered the grilled cheese - which looked awesome - but in reality, it was awful.  It tasted bad from the get go and had me throwing up later that night.  $11 for a grilled cheese that will make you sick?  Ya, I think not.  Sunday morning on our way out, my girlfriends stopped there to grab a quick bite and it pretty much ended in the same result.  NO one liked the food. Service was meh...Definitely don't think we will be going back there.

SdoVbMATdQSq2bze_-lHXQ.text: I was in Las Vegas on the weekend of September 7 and stopped in to this restaurant on a Sunday around 11 AM. The place is pretty big and I went to the bar since I was alone, as a friend I was with could not handle Las Vegas :-) I was served by the bartender Lizzy. I had just come off a pretty wild night so I was not looking for an all booze drink, but something tasty and classy for breakfast. Lizzie made me a double chocolate espresso martini. She used a rye based vodka which was very good. For breakfast food, I ordered off of their Sunday brunch menu and had a French Toast Creme Brule.it was pretty good tasting and I would recommend it if you are here for a breakfast item. I had a second drink which is also very good. The bartender was extremely attentive and professional and fun! The atmosphere is also very fun there with seating options in a dining room or the bar. There appears to be a 24 hour cafe as well located in the restaurant. I highly recommend the place and do suggest you visit the bar when you are in Las Vegas.

X69yhlxAzfBLBN77645YMw.text: Truly a 3-star restaurant. Citizens has a down to earth vibe that reminds you of a Classic American diner...until you see the $4 price for a cup of coffee. But then again, you're not really in America, you're in Vegas.   Unlike other Mandalay spots, this is a good spot if you know how to order. The $8 side of eggs during brunch is RIDICULOUS. Don't do it. Interestingly, the $2 side of toast is worth it: two slices so large they are a breakfast in themselves. My regular way to start the day at a Vegas trade show at Mandalay is with the chocolate peanut butter smoothie ($9) and that side of toast ($2). For $11, it's a great starter to an intense day on your feet.   And speaking of being on your feet, the floors in Mandalay leading into Citizens are crazy slippery. I'm shocked people aren't breaking their hips on a regular basis. I ate at Citizens twice this week while in town for the Project trade show and nearly fell over another guest waiting in line for a table.   The service at Citizens definitely makes up for the overpriced menu. Servers are cheery but not cheesy and just conversational enough. Not bad, but really overpriced (isn't everything in Vegas), so definitely NOT great.

B2fKLxlI_-SSEVnkU4Aw7A.text: This place is overpriced and has meh service.   I ordered the croissant BLT and Turkey.  It was dry and just tasted boring compared to to others. It was expensive $17 for a sandwich.  The burger was also dry. Service was slow and not very enthusiastic. The two hosteses in the front were not friendly at all.

d-qMo326qJwIZhXwRlFyvw.text: Can't give it a zero damn got seated with 2 other tables full and could not get service after 15 minutes and there were plenty of employees and servers working really wanted to try the food.

3HXyZhtBrpRYjEUTdoVEGQ.text: Easy access for good all American food when you're at a Vegas convention at Mandalay Bay.  Staff is nice and they also have a convenient to go deli section.  Overall, I would recommend.

_2iuLVmAeTp-CA-pLiaYgQ.text: Stopped here for dinner one night while walking the strip. Totally overpriced for the quality and atmosphere, in my opinion, but that's the strip. This is in Mandalay Bay, near all the nicer restaurants, so it's cheaper than everything around it.  The portions here are enormous, which helps make up for the prices. My husband ordered the fish and chips and they brought him an entire fish, battered and fried. Come hungry! I had a pasta dish which wasn't terrible, but definitely not worth the price. They also charged us both different prices than what was listed on the menu.  The dining room is kind of cramped and really dark. Our waiter was friendly.  Overall, it was a decent meal, but I wouldn't go back here.

oqsarc_7EQUkhMrOo8COgw.text: Like most people mentioned previously, it's mediocre food with Vegas price. It's convenient because it's open 24/7, and you don't need a reservation, but the food is just ok. I had the crab cake benedict for breakfast and it was not very good, and the soups I had for dinner were super salty (chicken noodle & french onion) to the point of being inedible. Would I eat here if u had a choice? No. Is is convenient? Yes.

mFz-1WOqDPDUVRbQEhoKag.text: We met with our out of town friend after her day at a convention yesterday and decided to try out Citizens Kitchen & Bar.  My husband and I split the Fish & Chips and my friend got a cheeseburger with no bun.  We all had fries.  Not the healthiest of meals but we were all hungry and looking forward to a quiet place to sit and catch up.  My husband is a fast eater and got through his food fast and within 1/2 an hour, was in the bathroom.  We left earlier then planned as he was not feeling well.  My friend managed to get back to her room before her stomach started bothering her and I made it home.  All night & morning, we all had diahhrea and stomach issues.  I called them in the morning and asked to speak to a manager to let them know what happened so maybe others wouldn't get sick.  I got a snotty, arogant manager who told me they hadn't had any other complaints and since we didn't all eat the same food, it couldn't possibly be food poisoning.  I told her we all had something fried so maybe there was an issue with their fryers and they should look into it.  She said OK - and hung up on me.  What great customer service!    We spend $70 on 2 meals & 2 sodas and ended up sick as dogs and we basically got - nope, didn't happen, don't care - see you.  Mind you I know their mentality - these people won't be back and we won't have to worry about it again although I did start the conversation letting her know we were locals but that didn't even seem to matter - and it shouldn't - bad food or service should not be for anyone, local or tourists.  But we will definately not be going there again and I will let everyone know what happened so they don't have to experience it themselves.  All of this could have been resolved with a little bit of compasion - it wasn't like I was asking for a free meal or anything - just for them to acknowledge and do something so no one else would get sick.  It might have been a one off but I won't recommend it to anyone - if management doesn't care, why should their employees?

i7VqADSxG3rl3vi4SFnHXQ.text: The food isn't great, the service isn't great, and it's pretty over priced for what you get. That being said it's Vegas and everything is overpriced. Nevertheless, This place makes a good breakfast spot if you're staying in Mandalay because not too many places around the resort are open that early.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AxV7ggEqiDRXahlfq1NSzQ.text: We had a bit of a situation brew this morning at Citizens trying to get our group of nine seated/order breakfast. Our server, Shanna, saved the day. Sensing the issue, she rushed over to the host stand and with Herculean patience (and quick action) got us seated and well-fed in minutes. No sweat. She did it with smile. She did it with grace.   I cannot stress this enough: Shanna made the difference between a one star non-breakfast and a five star experience. Thank you, Shanna! You're wondrous.

LilYWH47sb5qW1oc2AJXEw.text: Had the Prime Rib,  it was perfectly cooked (med rare) and tender;  did not need a knife to cut cut it.  The Horseradish sauce was on the weak side,  our server brought some grated horseradish,  it was a perfect compliment to the Prime Rib.

Gr_Utzh22WH3FYmexnJinw.text: A perfect place to get 24/7 food at Mandalay Bay!  Great service, drinks and food!  Swing by the walk up for awesome pre-packaged or warm food to go! Easy-peasy!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was a warm breakfast sandwich I picked up on our way to the race.  So god!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I don&#39;t remember what the waiter called this...it had a bunch of different booze in it and was delicious!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A yummy Mango Mojito and Ultimate Nachos to share!  They were huge...pic doesn&#39;t do them justice!

_NrzgYmH89k9e3m-V8ZQ2g.text: I enjoyed breakfast here on a Saturday morning around 9am. They were able to substitute the potatoes that came on the side of each omelette with fruit, so that was a bonus.  Service was fairly fast and friendly so I would definitely come back here for a healthier eating option.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Body builder with fruit substitute

TNvEmJwdh2zLJKXf6dr_zg.text: Good for a late night dinner after a night of drinking, but not a place I would go back to otherwise.   A co-worker and I stopped by around 2 am after a party to grab a bite to eat before heading to our rooms for the night. Citizen at least has that going for them - They were one of the only places serving food at 2am on a Tuesday night in Mandalay Bay!  I ordered a Bacon Burger ($18) and a Titos and Soda ($14) and she ordered a breakfast burrito. Drinks are generous with a good amount of alcohol in it. My burger, on the other hand, was dry and came without bacon (on a bacon burger... Makes sense right?) If you want any cheese on it that will cost you an extra $2 as well. Fries were good, but a bit over fried.   Their main menu looked good, so I would stop by again to try the daytime chef and see if it's any better. Maybe they are hoping that the late night crowd won't care if they don't make their food right? Either way, it wasn't a total hit or a total miss. Just kind of blah.

pg6_zuppDh3eXD03J1pTrg.text: It's not the best place to eat in Vegas, but it's somewhat casual of a dinner place without being a chain. Food was alright for the most part - some mistakes but nothing that would preclude me from eating here again.  I got the Loco Moco - it's a confirmed rice dish, not a burger dish as the menu confusingly makes it sound like. My buddy got the steak frites, which interestingly enough, was not the proper execution of that dish.  Decent drinks menu, but a lot of the beers are served in cans. They might give you a glass to pour it in if you ask.   Service was friendly and well-organized.

iDH6qWmCDGXAaPuh8l3rZA.text: Many of the restaurants inside Mandalay Bay are on the pricier end, but Citizens offered an eye-catching Prime Rib dinner deal served with broccoli, salad, baked potato and glass of house wine. All of this for $49 per person!  We saw this as quite a bargain, especially considering that the glass of wine costs about $10 by itself.   The hostess told us at the door that the prime rib would be 8 ounces, but it turned out to be a whopping 14!  Our waiter laughed with us as our jaws dropped when the entrees arrived. (He was friendly and provided great service throughout our meal.)  Wow, I've never eaten so much beef in one sitting. It was cooked to a perfect medium as requested, but could have used a bit more seasoning and the quality of the meat wasn't that great. It had a somewhat grainy texture. Considering the price of the dinner deal though, we couldn't expect the best cut of beef. For something more top notch, StripSteak is down the hall, but at much steeper prices of course. You get what you pay for! As for the side items, our portions of Caesar salad were generous, crisp and fresh. The baked potato was huge, topped with cheese, sour cream and some chives, but was still unfortunately dry and starchy inside as opposed to being fluffy.  If you order this dinner special, make sure to come hungry!   Citizens is open 24 hours and serves typical American fare day and night.
