Peering around at neighboring tables, their burgers and fries looked delicious so I'd recommend just based on appearance! The main restaurant is sit-down, but they also have a deli section for ordering items like sandwiches, salads and desserts at the counter to grab and go.   3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $49 Prime Rib Dinner - 14 oz!! (side salad not pictured)

BX96ZNni23n3Ib9lHwdUSw.text: Stopped by here on a trip. My sister thought the restaurant looked cool, she was right. The whole restaurant has an industrial type feel with both a sit down restaurant and counter for you to grab a quick bite. The service was pretty good overall. The place was very clean and seemed like the employees work hard to make their customers feel comfortable. The food is good, not great, but definitely good for a nice lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Avocado

YO3tfBYAjChnhGcmNzOCIQ.text: There's lots of beautiful restaurants in Mandalay Bay, but Citizens Kitchen is the right choice for something simple & lunchy.  I came for a Cobb Salad, and it really hit the spot. While it doesn't have the cobb-cornerstone of avocado, it was delicious nonetheless.  The ingredients are all very fresh & sitting pretty on a crisp bed of iceberg lettuce. I like that the egg whites & yolks are chopped and topped separately, in case you want more of one than the other.  The check-in deal is a slice of cheesecake! I was feeling stuffed from the cobb, but my server happily boxed it to-go.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cobb, sub ranch on the side - $19

DFPo5IVfwnczlL0MpWSJsw.text: Eh...Comme ci comme ca. Came here for lunch about noon on a Thursday and it was dead besides a couple other people in the restaurant. We were seated in the back and the environment was dark and somewhat dreary; actually the entire Mandalay Bay hotel is dark and somewhat uninviting. Our waitress was quick to get our drinks and our order, and the food came out in a timely fashion.   First out was chicken noodle soup with "butter crackers"...the soup was good but nothing special and the butter crackers that were cleverly worded on the menu were simply saltines with a slab of butter plastered in the middle...sort of strange. Next came our salads; we got the bbq chicken and the cobb that were both significant in size. They were ok, but nothing special. While our waitress was attentive neither she or any of the staff seemed very happy to be working there. The experience was underwhelming all around. There are lots of fantastic places to eat on the strip, I suggest skipping this joint and finding a better option for your tastebuds.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sGVi1xVbYmgyTCWsLTUxjA.text: We stopped here for lunch and a drink. Food was okay. We sat at the bar and our server was Raquel. She was pleasant but seemed a little distracted. My friend ordered an alcoholic drink and she never brought it to us. Our food was brought out and I had to flag her down to remind her of our drink. When it came to pay she brought us the wrong check. We didn't look at the check and just paid it. As we were about to leave, she brought us our check to which we told her we had already paid the bill and she insisted we didn't. She asked us for our receipt as proof we paid, which we presented to her and she realized she made a mistake, but did not apologize or own the mistake. She asked us to pay our current bill and assured us she would refund the wrong bill, which she did back onto our credit card, but has taken a few days to return onto our credit card.

BjGzAspR93UyfC37xZujtg.text: Good place to grab a quick breakfast before heading out to the pool. My protein omelet was good but the potatoes served with it were old and cold.   Good service though and probably one of the cheaper breakfast places at Mandalay Bay.

D_eFUcstRFY8ueelp6TLKg.text: Skip Lupo (over priced and bland) and go next door to Citizens. They have a fair variety of food you'd want after a night of professional competitive drinking, or your just looking for something thats quick, taste good, and priced right; especially if you have kids. No one like paying $50-$60 a plate in Vegas for three kids that eat half a plate each then want nothing but ice cream anyways..  Non the less the servers and bartenders (Katie) are awesome, and the food is always good and prepared quickly. Never had a bad experience in the many years we've come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Avocado Sandwich. Can never go wrong with this or the Tuna Melt

KHhNjWlfiEnsRlLQn8mEkg.text: The crab cake Benedict is AMAZING! Pricy place but WELL worth the money. Huge portions, especially on the pancakes. The rasberry tea is SO good, not too sweet. Everything that the table ordered looked beyond my expectations. Delicious. A++. Definitely come here if you have the chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ryZxUnF9gX2k3YYaNoHStw.text: I was skeptical about giving this place a try after reading the reviews but decided to still give it a try. Especially since it was convenient to just go downstairs and eat. I was greeted by the hostess and asked if I wanted to sit at the bar or wait for a table. I went ahead and chose the bar since I was hungry and even after reading the mixed reviews about the female bartender. So I sit down and of course there's a female bartender there (I'm hoping it's not the same one from the reviews but it had to be from my experience). She hands me a menu and paper placemat. I'm looking at the drink menu and I don't see mimosas. So I asked her if they serve mimosas. In a very sarcastic way she tells me,  are you asking for a mimosa? We have champagne. I'm like ok well I'm asking because I didn't see them on your menu. . I get my mimosa and end up waiting to order because my bf texts me to say he can meet me. So when she asked what I wanted to order I said I was going to wait for my bf. She grabs the menu and walks away. My bf walks in she got him his drink and I then had to ask her for the menu again. She grabs 2 menus and just puts them in front of us like she's bothered. We proceed to order since she asked if we were ready. I start to tell her my order and she walks away. Why ask me if I'm ready to order if you're going to walk away as I start to speak? So anyways,  she takes our order comes back with silverware and places my bfs nice and neat in front of him while she legitimately just threw a knife and a fork in front of me. I wish I would have taken a picture!! We get our food and not once did she ask us how our food was or if we needed anything. I ordered their kale and brown rice salad and added chicken. My bf ordered chicken wings. Half way thru my salad I find a hair in it!!!! So I asked for the manager and she did remove it from our bill. Now thru all this the staff was changing shifts. A new bartender was setting up for his shift and instead of the female that took our order asking us what happened the Male bartender was the one that addressed it and he didn't even serve us!! We did start to joke about it and because of the Male bartender is the ONLY reason we decided to leave a tip because I was not going to leave her a penny!! She's truly is rude!! She's clearly unhappy with her job. Maybe she should find employment elsewhere where she won't be bitter and rude to customers.   Also,  while I was waiting for my bf to arrive. I heard a Male waiter call a customer a bitch because she asked if their fish was fresh. He says something to the affect of, oh yeah its brought in daily and sarcastically tells his coworker what does she expect?.... mmmmm seriously? A customer asks a question and she's a bitch for it?   So some employees really take their job for granted there and need to seek employment elsewhere!!   I gave 2 stars simply because even tho there was a hair in my food it was still good and the other star for the Male bartender that understands you catch more bees with hunny instead of vinegar.   So when you read the reviews about bad service. They aren't lying!!!

BkaVrNXUfNNqy-jAczc1Cw.text: The only thing I would recommend from here is the Cafe Au Lait. That and the service is the only reason I am giving this place two stars. I ordered from the take out area and got the Turkey Avocado sandwich, but had them hold on the avocado spread because of an allergy. They honored my request without a problem, and the sandwich had a good amount of meat, however the bread was stale as all hell. The edges were hard and dry almost an inch in. I also ordered a chocolate chip cookie which was also stale. I can't speak for the sit down restaurant area and that food, but I would stay away from the to-go counter unless you're getting a cafe au lait, that was good and made fresh to order. I was not a late night order either, I place my order just before 7pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just look at that stale bread, just about stands on its own, waves and all.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good, but stale as anything.

EVh9_A_i6vTWx-i-0BUhRw.text: I was here for a drink one night, and for a smoothie the next morning while staying at Mandalay Bay. The drink I got was one of their special cocktails -- I can't remember its name, but it was whiskey with some sort of fruit flavor served in a martini glass and a sugar rim. It was strong and tasted pretty awesome, but the sugar rim wasn't necessary at all.   The smoothie I got was carrot, ginger, apple, and agave nectar -- again, my forgetful ass can't remember the name. It was pretty decent, but nothing great. I mostly say that because I didn't taste any ginger at all. It was like a carrot and apple smoothie. Meh.  Aesthetic of Citizen is great. That much I know. Can't say anything about the food since I didn't have any (not vegan friendly for anyone who is wondering or cares), but they don't skimp on the drinks, and the smoothies aren't terrible for a quick breakfast.

8jaUiuJnXbEGIm9Mk_oXqw.text: Was not even going to write this review if the cashier was a bit nicer. I know its 5:30am and you're tired but you are working in a 24/7 restaurant inside a     Hotel, your menu is not from Gordon Ramsay whats a little bit of effort to make my order a bit right eh? Smile a little, say hello atleast. And don't roll your eyes  n customers.   Btw. I wanted breakfast not garbage. $18.xx for this Bacon,Ham & Cheese they got me. Not even happy even if its free. stale bread, flat and overcooked eggs, It seemed like reheated potatoes and bacon. Blah.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gmwt1aCxzgVso1gmj3YNVw.text: Shameful service. I was treated terribly at the register, they had no one at the front kiosk to seat people so I stood there for what felt like forever, and when I asked for some help or clarity on a menu item they folks there were absolutely disrespectful. Not to mention that a teriyaki bowl with chicken is almost $30! Go anywhere else! This is my second time eating at a Mandalay Bay restaurant and you'd be better off walking across the street to Chipotle. I'll never stay here again...

aZbHrjiO82ywl-rvmW6tBQ.text: I dine out often. And happen to find this place inside the Mandalay bay casino was very disappointed with my sandwich. The worst chicken salad recipe. Tasteless.the bread was awful. Quite possible the worst tasting Bread. They could of possibly fixed it by grilling it. All i ordered was a chicken salad sandwich and water. $19.00. WAY overpriced

TCaLgBJKuOr0AV5JCqkpfg.text: The chicken soup was too salty. Pizzas were just ok. It opens 24 hours so we went to it right after the MJ one show.

ofT8iMff-xf703wJhkQ5PQ.text: Zero stars if possible. Staff was rude - refused to seat us with a drink - while she's carrying a cup of coffee the whole time.   Served 20year olds alcohol. Not a place to spend your money. Try any of the other 30 restaurants in the building.   Management should be fired for lack of awareness.

C9VakEntLEkw_dJCwYrdFw.text: Ordered takeaway food there: if you like Starbucks-like food quality or worse, but wanna pay 2 times more and wait 5 times longer, it is the perfect place to visit

hKA4xQHBsX5rSO0mEv7FMg.text: Customer service was really good. The spinach dip is not good has no flavor and the pizza is kinda dry.

TMleDRRIQxUvKmH4a3rtuw.text: Location and service is the only thing that is good here. Food looks good but it's stone cold, not just our meal but others around us had same problem. Best to not eat here until they have their kitchen running better. They did redo the entire breakfast and well the toast and potatoes were still cold. They did give us a discount and free coffee. Will not be going there again for breakfast. Oh well....

p0zz_0kupOhwO2-EKBPO5g.text: Very very bad customer service ,I think owner doesn't pay enough to employee to the better service or not enough trainee .charge too much and not service .very bad .

wfWNDJul-Co-KIP8pjhB2A.text: Expect frozen food. Bought a veggie pizza with no cheese. Came back to tell us they can't make the pizza because the pizza is frozen and can't be altered.   Expect $1 frozen food to be priced at $18 dollars.   Enjoy

X1h-HnNs58jN_WcaufcM9w.text: This place is amazing! Much better than in room dining- just thinking about it makes me wanna  the food was seasoned to perfection.. and down from the customer service to the presentation it was awesome.. next time I'll go there instead!

8tvaM4LdUjwD1U3zXTLqhA.text: Wow.. worst service ever... servers are rude and i just felt unwelcome! Jason wich is our server is rude! Never again will I come here. Wow

7IaTvhhmyl0mfYBaBYF6ZA.text: My husband and I loved this place so much we went 3x during our stay. The food quality is great and the price point is exactly what it should be. All the staff is friendly. There is a variety of items offered and everything we got was very good. Big portions and quality food. Only bad thing I could say if I was really being picky is that the chicken and fried onions in the salad was served cold. I realize that many places serve salads this way and it is just a matter of preference. Overall citizens is a great place to go for breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night. Also they are open 24 hours which is another plus-hard to find anymore.

HQy5xCQucIIsYL5qVe9S7w.text: I ordered the chicken noodle soup that was priced $10 dollars thinking that it'd be anywhere near satisfying for its price. Turns out it's approximately 8 ounces of bland 1 piece small chicken pieced soup. I hate writing bad reviews for businesses but this is a prime example of a strip establishment overpricing its customers just because they could. I'm a Vegas local and it's disappointing as fck

KSDW7HYBpBKP13VMnV80lA.text: How does this place get 3 stars?!  My experience here was quite good. I mean, look at my sandwich!  Others have said that the service here is poor. I admit, it wasn't great...and that's with a near empty restaurant...but it wasn't horrible.    My only regret is not seeing the free cheesecake that came with my check-in :(

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you&#39;re wondering, yes, it was as good as it looks.

nQkgmYUCsZK4oAOj7DRB3A.text: First time here. Ordered my food. Ordered a pizza. Sat and waited for my pizza. Watch customers after me order food and get their food. Ask about my pizza. Apparently they lost it or didn't make it or whatever the case was. No apology no manager no anything. Just a quick "your pizza b out soon" ..... the manager brings the pizza. Calls my name. Sees my get up. Doesn't make any eye contact the entire time. Looks down at the pizza and doesn't say a word. Just nods one time as he looks down with a straight face and hands it to my hand and walks away. Great customer service

zmu5hPolAxaV5_g9eVvJHQ.text: Affordable dining when compared to the rest of the restaurants at M Bay.  The staff is very accomodating and handled a large party of eleven under a tight time constraint.  Rushing off to see Michael Jackson The One and did not want to miss any portion of the show.  Most popular and newest of the Cirque shows in Vegas.  Very good service by Justin!  Nice large sandwiches, while the Loco Moco needed additional gravy.  Salads were also huge.  Also good for late nights.

1uwtQ478--wnpH1j056ezQ.text: We were staying at Mandalay Bay for work and decided to stop in after for some food. Jonathan greeted us and took our order. The food was amazing but our server was even better! Jonathan was kind, prompt and sweet! We even came back a second time on our stay to have him as our server. Food and staff are highly recommended!

yebMLrPk5UcdY-vV5k1Wpw.text: The food was great, but I docked off a star for the painfully slow service and inattentive staff.   I came with a group of 4 and we came in the late afternoon for lunch. Even though there were empty tables, it took around 10 minutes before we were seated. We ordered as soon as possible because we were starving and it took 30 minutes for our food to come out even though none of the dishes we ordered were complex. We ordered two salads, an artichoke dip, and a teriyaki chicken bowl. I got the BBQ chicken salad, and it was pretty good. There were a lot of different ingredients, such as beans, onion rings, corn, and avocado, so I didn't get sick of it. Portions were pretty big, and I was actually full from the salad, but I don't think it was worth $19. I also tried the artichoke dip, which was pretty good! It came with two different kinds of chips. I liked the pita one better. The artichoke dip was hot, creamy, and cheesy.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ chicken salad

cqVzQqGdJYdQ_fSLbCJrOg.text: Their prices are insane. Food is mediocre, like eating at Chilis but paying 5 times as much. Ladies and gentleman, Las Vegas, The Greatest Show (um scam) On Earth.

Kn8SpHxUiglCOwxoNh_6zA.text: The phrase "premium mediocre" was invented for this place. The bacon on the BLT and the Cobb was cold and congealed, the salad dressing was basically vinegar with no flavor, and the service was non-existent. We had to chase down our waiter for our drinks. We had to chase down our waiter for the check. We had to chase down our waiter for a pen to sign. We won't be chasing down anything to come back.

_-Qf9coOJXcB4nQkhc1z_Q.text: 4/29/2018 2am this review is for the the cashier, with glasses, earrings and had a very rude sassy attitude. After waiting 30 mins in line, I proceeded to order a sandwich and the rudely said we don't serve sandwiches and you have to order from a certain menu. I calmly asked why there was no sign that stated  this. He rudely said he was the sign and tried to obnoxiously shake my hand. This "guy" obviously does not know anything about customer services. He should quit but I'm sure since he is working this crap job he can't do anything better. If you can't do a simple minimal job you will not make it in life. Good luck.

ZT0VdvxdAg8KrVLXpQZXdw.text: I'll just share my experience. Although service was good, the food was not worth the price. Appetizer (chili fries), 1 salad (Caesar), 1 entree (penne no chicken), soda and tea was $92!!!  I can't give this more than 1 star because I expect the whole package. Especially for $92!!!

NKtJIOF2RxtVDZQNHNRdtA.text: We were heading to Starbucks but decided to check Citizens out for coffee since it was something new. So disappointed! First off, we waited in line for almost 30 minutes. I understand, Vegas is busy and everyone wants coffee BUT the line isn't long because this place is busy, the line is long because the service is so slow. You think a place that offers coffee and breakfast would be better staffed in the morning. There was only one girl working the register for the to-go cafe and restaurant. She was supper sweet and it wasn't her fault the wait was so long.  So it was finally our turn...Yay! Right? Well, we waited for a very long time to be told that they were out of mocha lattes. Wth?  Ugh. Go to Starbucks!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They give u a lot of room for cream. Or maybe they were low on coffee since they were out of mochas.

PrY6N58a5PCUUMiqKWBXUg.text: Excellent food! Great service! They're very quick with service, and very friendly. You can have a great meal and move along so you can explore the rest of Fabulous Las Vegas!   Lobster roll, turkey sandwich, anything you get will be amazing! Lizzy is a great bartender also.

WzXIf99d2FigdPo3jVRiTw.text: This place is so fun! Chicken club and blueberry spritzer were amazing! And Tony even remembered my berries . Thanks for being a great server Tony!

wAYlvQ7T8icr_oF3fnv1Lg.text: Looking for a quick bite before we went to see the Michael Jackson One show.  Cheaper than most restaurants at Mandalay Bay with a good variety of appetizers and main courses. The appetizer of Disco Fries was the best part.  Piping hot and nice ooey gooey cheese with bacon over crisp waffle fried. Could have been more generous with the bacon.  The gravy we asked for on the side and made a nice accompaniment rather than slathered on the top.  The Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos for $26.00 were a rip off.  Let's just call them slaw tacos.  The ratio of fish to slaw was one part fish and six parts slaw.   Should have sent them back.  I had to dissect the taco just to get to the fish. The slaw was dripping in over sweet mayo sauce.   The teriyaki chicken bowl for $22.00 was boring.  Tasted like frozen veggies were used.  Service was good.

ZLpjwumVCsmGbZFGtCkF5A.text: My wife, kids and I, all locals, ate here before the shark encounter last Saturday.  My wife had the quinoa salad with a Firestone beer, I had the lobster roll with Lagunitas ale.  The kids had a cheese quesadilla and grilled cheese.  Our sides were the coleslaw.  Every thing was really good; not a morsel left.  The service was really good too; the waitress recommended the beers and did a good job with her recommendations.  I would make a point to have lunch here again.  I would recommend reconsidering all the tile though; it is loud in this restaurant.

hfaFjXV4_DSPflF93-Cvhw.text: Great breakfast fresh smoothie! Ordered a fruit bowl. At these prices I'd expect organic produce - no such luck. Also there was such a huge line of convention attendees (myself included) trying to get to our booths on time and only one staff member taking orders in their take away line and only one person actually fulfilling the orders. A needlessly long wait ensued!!! Smoothie was great though.

eag53WM4dpIViqZpAiUe7A.text: Food is decent. Visited this restaurant on two separate occasions and the management should fire them selves. There's absolutely no leadership. All of the waitstaff run around like chickens with their heads chopped off. There's Apsley no organization whatsoever. Fail!!!

bSTYbrrRHl9OkGwGMyiIeg.text: I could see this place being like a regular breakfast place, the food is good, the portions are okay, and the prices are a little high but nothing more than you would expect in a tourist area. Not the greatest breakfast place I've even been to but about 5th or 6th on the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California omelet, the hash brown tater tots side is better than the omelet itself.

f9vaaeXLJ0P8mwgzoVjBDA.text: It's nice that it is open late and that things are premade so it can be a quick grab and go, but it also is annoying that things are premade because you cannot customize anything. I don't like mayo and unfortunately every premade sandwich has mayo. I got the cous cous salad (twice). It was pretty good, although probably not worth the $12. Just veggies and cous cous, no meat at all. Something you could get at a deli or supermarket for like $4.    They have breakfast sandwiches too. I didn't have them, but I get the feeling they'd be descent.

eiKQs_jkBYOBzIni1s3Y8A.text: I ordered corned beef and ginger snap, quality of the food is great.  Corned beef is not overly grease, great crispy texture and very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef and ginger snap

QyUlzVLOEhafyIQ2946GGA.text: This place is right smackdab in the middle of Mandalay Bay and it has tremendous comfort food for you to enjoy.  The portions are really formidable and the food is quite satisfying.  The staff is pretty funny and they really do take their time to make sure you are having a great meal.  Sometimes the place can get a little noisy from when the crowds come through, but if you can catch it during a lull, its a real nice place to grab some top-notch food that won't break your bank while in Vegas.

JB3PsWQ4omsPoiKH8I2GDg.text: Enjoyed this place for dinner. For what we ordered, the serving was huge. Got the nachos and filled us up (2.5 people because one person only had a few bites) We didn't even need anything else really! Drinks were strong. Waitress was nice!

PhTLsooKR0K8hviR1-akrw.text: Over-priced for what it is, but I have to give props to any place which has Hot Browns on their menu.  That alone is worth the price of admission as getting that dish made decently outside of Louisville is a dicey proposition at best.  But, True to its reputation, the Hot Brown at Citizens more than lived up to expectations.  And that's coming from an honest-to-gods native of the 'Ville.  Just like you wouldn't question the judgment of a True-to-life Quebecois when it comes to poutine, when somebody's from that region known as Kentuckiana their word is law when it comes to hot browns.  Frankly, you can skip everything else since it's what you can find in any half-decent all-night coffee shot/diner.

gLbNqIxm1G2Z8XFZZojaxA.text: Decent food, casual. VERY noisy. I had the Teriyaki bowl with brown rice and chicken. It was good.  Like most teriyaki sauce it was a but sweet for my preference but luckily there wasn't a ton on it. The chicken comes on a wooden skewer, fire grilled so it has lots of delicious flavor.   Had a side mixed green salad to start, which was nice and fresh. Tell them easy on the dressing tho. Otherwise the dressing overpowers the salad.   The bar seating is fine if you are in a hurry.

j73oO43jWI4MPq2xyWbDlw.text: Best place to be after an all night drink fest!  My boyfriend & I shared the patty melt. It was by far the best patty melt I have EVER tasted (and I wasn't drunk)!! I'm still thinking about it 2 days later.   As far as service goes, we didn't have a problem whatsoever.  The hostess and waiter were on it during our late night visit.     In closing, I say GET THE PATTY MELT!

ZJ27iqCoNKtJuK1puxA_RA.text: The set up of this restaurant is pretty cool. It's very casual with like sandwiches, salads and things as their food. My cousin and I just really wanted some fries, and we were really disappointed. We ordered just a side of fries, and when it came out we could tell that the fries were old and re-fried. We wanted to make a comment but we were in too much of a rush to tell the cashier. I will come back again and give this restaurant another shot. However, I may not order their fries this time. ENJOY!

lyozArkNEla60LOVhGqSYA.text: Items here are actually quite expensive, especially for what they are.  Cost aside though, the food here is purely average.  If you decide to order something here, it is likely pre made.  All of the sandwiches were pre assembled and sitting together in a large container with the same sandwiches.  The smoothies were pretty good. We tried the green machine smoothie and I thought it was enjoyable.  The cashiers here both times I visited were pretty nice and service was not an issue, although I did order something that they didn't already have pre made, so I did have to wait a little bit longer than everyone else, including a few people who ordered after me.

Wovxi5P1024n404aIhxN8g.text: $42 for a small take out lunch for two of two caprese sandwiches, a kale salad, and a water. They were out of the ingredients for the PB&j for the entire week of our stay, and the caprese took 10+ min to make because they had to "go downstairs to get the mozzarella." What? Why do you not have the ingredients on hand to make take out items? Food was mediocre too. Huge disappointment after getting excited about the menu. :(

3__zYenpw6kGgSECt8RxAQ.text: Was here about a year ago and came back to the same great food and service. Great environment also, and Lotus is a very organized and attentive server!

KB6oMI0fhAbLDW2uWQ5ruA.text: Never would have thought you could get such amazing customer service at 130am this Resturant has the looks and taste that we all deserve. The food was amazing and beer selection was just what I like the scenery of lovely ladies all around you that are just leaving club Light was a plus but not at good as my food lol Definitely coming back I recommend trying any of there burgers or steak or really anything on the menu. Awesome

pNiheJ1h5I79geHqzhZ_sQ.text: I have ordered take out from here several times. The food is just ok. Prices are a bit high. The carrot cake is amazing.

TLHjphNzqJnlwtNLQ1Ej7g.text: I had lunch here with my husband during a business trip.  I had the best grilled chicken sandwich of my entire life here.  My husband, however, had a spoiled grilled chicken caesar salad, and subsequently spent the next two days in the bathroom between conferences. :( I hate to give a 2 star review, especially when the service was so good, but spoiled food is not okay with me.  If it were not for that, I would revisit.

TIh5RNSCkQcEVrfXaZzEDw.text: We tried the pre-show special for $29.  It came with either salad or onion soup,  prime rib,  and chocolate cake.   Salad was pretty decent but the prime rib tasted very dry.  Definitely not worth $29.  :(

9uoSZLI6AsnnWPTkRHLmPQ.text: Our server Art was attentive, helpful, and funny. The portion sizes are bigger than expected and completely welcome. We ordered the Brick Chicken and the Meatloaf, both were delicious. We skipped dessert but only because we were so full and on our way to another location. Definitely will return the next time we visit Las Vegas. Thank you, Art!

Hk4SxcsGbsgecMj297k9xg.text: Really pricey for the quality. However, it is a go-to for a quick bite for breakfast. The warm sandwiches may be a little too greasy for the health conscious. They also have Krispie Kreme donuts for a ridic price. Freshly made juices may be your best deal.

Apli2gCAskztZTrW2Ap1zA.text: The food was ok.  Well maybe.  After taking my $35 they told me I could not eat in the place.  They had me leave.  I promptly returned the viscous salad to the unapologetic which manning the payment station.  Tell people they can't find there before taking their money.  Also hire a few people that handle this crap better than a 24/7 McD.

O1ziCx476U8R8wsaHYABKw.text: The fish and chips is some of the best I've ever had. The French dip was also super delicious. Our waiter was great!

yOkcKmj83U_SGCvML8H3Qw.text: Went to Citizens for breakfast and had a wonderful waiter at the bar named Steven! He was awesome great customer service and conversation.  Made me the most fabulous Mimosa! Thanks Steven you were awesome!

Z2GKNsjOUvm1KGPttwFZgA.text: Stumbled upon Citizen on a quite Monday morning.  Tim was an awesome server and really was spot on with his recommendations.  French toast was great and the orange zest in the whipped cream was a nice touch.  The breakfast burrito was great and had tons of flavor with good guacamole.  Fresh fruit smoothie was made from scratch, not from a mix.  Cool vibe, decor, and good tunes.  A solid discovery!

I6C3ZnKRjdCGUun5lqfVQA.text: Last night we had dinner and drinks at Citizens for the first time. We have walked by several times and decided to give it a try.  I need to share with you our experience.  Lizzy was soooo friendly and provided excellent customer service!! The food and service was so wonderful we came back tonight.  Thank you Lizzy!  We will be back soon!!!!!

L1bWLvgsmz0kQI-H_dHbJA.text: Had a great meal.  Lotus was a wonderful  waitress. There were 6 of us and she got our order right without writing it down.  Everyone loved their food.  Highly recommend this place.

24cj7he6-s36Sdm_RYKC3A.text: This place has the best sandwiches in vegas.  The portions are HUGE!  It's a perfect place to eat after partying at Light.

Xun-nSzpjQ7Lm7nQad5Zcw.text: Meh. Service is decent. Food selection is mediocre. Food is okay. This place is pricey, hence the two star rating. Actually, this place is not worth the money in all honesty. That being said, it's open late, choices are rather limited

16H8CbN5aEbkGbfoKQkhow.text: I've been here before on another trip to Vegas, and enjoyed the food, this trip I have mixed reviews....The first day we stopped in for lunch, I ordered a chicken Caesar a box of cut fruit, and a sandwich to share - the fruit came to me molded, and when I asked for a new one, she gladly gave it to me, but put the old one back in the case!  A bottle of water was $5 - bringing our small-ish lunch to share to $40.  We thought we'd give it another try the following day, it was better - the food may have been restocked overnight, not sure, but sandwich was great, fruit was fresher, water was still $5 - and total was $43 again, but better experience over all.  Ate out on the patio outside, not served, may be a different experience - overall great when on the go in Vegas, just a little pricey for a sandwich and salad.

nYAUNemc4-VJqhlXQHf5pQ.text: $45 for two take out bagel sandwiches and two drinks?? The bagels were stale AND soggy...Plus, I was sick for a whole day after eating that!! Worst food experience ever. I cannot recommend this place to even my worst enemy.

MfwKFjZ4Bniw56Y_tsLP3w.text: This real estate used to be the Burger Bar...  But 10am hungers could be just for breakfast foods now. Vegas is known for its edgy entertainment, gaudy bling, and top notch reviewed eaterys. Despite that flashy sign, this one is average, and I will only wonder what that Burger at 10am would have tasted like.  Lox and cream cheese, side of hashbrowns: Nice platter, medium smoked salmon, nice smooth shreddable texture, just enough to cover that not so thick plain bagel. Need more cream cheese - the design squares are nice, but not functional. Easy on the red onions was good, and a nice pile of capers is always good too. Maybe it was the not typical squirt of lemon from me, but the usual salty flavors weren't there in harmony as usual.  SIde of hashbrowns was nice. Perfect portion sized tater tot crumbled hash nicely mixed with peppers.  Nice but not glamorous or creative, and the taste is what you'd expect, but my novice could do this at home, and have, which is why I shouldn't pay to eat this out.

AfTsEDBFcwn20kMEci74Yw.text: This place is amazing located inside of mandalay bay it has the best brunch in vegas on sat and sun, known as the hangover brunch . If u have a late night in vegas and want to get back on track i definitely recommend there hang over brunch

wMkKJBuD61ebOxJloiZVnA.text: The absolute best chicken wings I have had in years.  Other than that, pretty pedestrian.  Considering the price, I cannot give it more than 3 stars; and even that is sketchy.

JM9LurUtsyvloKDLWYah5w.text: Food was just okay and no one was very happy.  When the waiter talked to us it seemed forced/fake. I would not go back.

rJOVjBY7gdXTmFAg6rCyzA.text: Citizens is just a horrible example of a standard hotel restaurant.  The food was mediocre but priced on the high end of other similar restaurants.  The service was poor and the server was very inattentive.

Bw4KQwaJIQrCJxvnCpH7bA.text: We had breakfast here on Halloween morning. I had the traditional Eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes. BEST EGGS BENEDICT I ever had....Seriously. Best coffee too. They serve Lavazzo Coffee which is amazing and very smooth in taste. Can't wait to go back. Oh and was waitress was super sweet.

e3Z26fjYZoY1CaMppl-uFg.text: What a great find. We went for lunch last Saturday after arriving in Vegas and glad we picked this place. We ordered the French Dip and it was delicious. My only complaint would be a lighter side like fruit as an option. But the sandwich was flavorful, the au jus delicious and really a great meal. I'd recommend asking for horseradish on the side for an extra kick but either way it's good.

2Uaoj3oiTbzQkWC7Z-a78A.text: Lizzy is the only reason I come here. Well, her and the food. It's good, but it just tastes a little better when she's there. I don't know how that works, but it does!

F9nyzqPoncO81hAXaly-CA.text: Got here at 10:45pm on a Saturday and got seated right away.  I had the fish tacos that are good but better for lunch. My hubby had the French dip that was a real winner. I'm coming back for that next time.

dN8SGLX4X9p1W1TnoohE-g.text: Just want to say I had a great experience at this place. Sat at bar and was very busy. Got my drink and food fast. Bartender Raquel was super friendly and very professional. I would recommend this place to my friends and family and will definitely be back.

D-e6pchXXNbm_PUcOZGUWw.text: Coming back to the hotel late the only place that was open was Citizens Kitchen and Bar. We were seated quickly and our orders were taken after our drink orders. The ultimate nachos with chicken had our names written all over it. Once the gigantic portion of the nachos arrived we could tell that their name was not a mistaken. There was a giant stack of nachos covered by sour cream, salsa, cheddar cheese, olives, beans, cheese wiz like cheese, jalapenos, and chicken. 4 of us split the order, with it being a meal for 2 of us and a side for the other 2. These nachos definitely hit the late night craving. There is plenty of nachos to share, and we even had some left at the end as they do get heavy with the cheese whiz on it. Most of the nachos retained their crispyness and crunch, except for the bunch on the bottom that were smothered in the cheese whiz. While at Citizens I did see giant and I mean giant pieces of cake that I will want to try on my next trip to Las Vegas.

FsogoYux8thh4NjuXbwwsg.text: If you are walking through Mandalay Bay and decide you are hungry, do not choose to stop here.  We were hungry and we saw this place. It didn't look like there was a long wait, so we put our name in. She said 10 minutes. After 25 mins I asked what's up. She said "That time was an estimation and as soon as the "right" table opens we will be sat". I said ok.. 5 mins later we had a table. Now mind you the surrounding 4 tables were empty too. We sat there for at least 10 minutes  before anyone even came over. We ordered drinks, I a soda, my nephews soda and the last a water no lemon. When guy finally brought the drinks he brought water with lemon. My mom is allergic so we asked if he would just change it out. He had the worst attitude and when he came back he tossed the water on the table.This was completely offensive. I located the manager and asked or another server. The new server was nice but extremely slow. The surrounding tables all got their food long before we did. It was just not a fun experience. We will never, ever be back!

fvt-plzqrYNjCTzk__M6ag.text: Got a snack to go here. The smoothie was just ok and WAY overpriced, even for Vegas. They forgot my pretzel and banana, I didn't get them until I asked 15 minutes later. Barely got an apology. Not a big fan.

K1EOoPwvMy6KKa-vyu_V5g.text: average at best. breakfast was bland. service a bit sloppy.not a good breakfast place.

wUDcYqsK77wucT5QOJSlhw.text: Nice lunch here.  Soup and salad were good but way overpriced at $19, had a very good sandwich with chicken, bacon, avocado though.

nTSPZpBprCZhQ4mR_dydAA.text: Went to get a sandwich the one I wanted was already pre made. I don't eat turkey only wanted ham they said make your own. So I did and instead of paying 11-14 dollars I paid 24 because I got extra chesse abd avocado but didn't even get the extra cheese didn't expect it to be that much. I will never go there again

S_HkQLHvw-2tatT8mhKwXg.text: Great food at a great price. Atmosphere is excellent with a great vibe. I'm at Mandalay Bay weekly and I get my latte here every time. Beer selection is great, and juice menu impressive. I'd give it 5 stars if the lady working at the register didn't have a melt down over a receipt not printing and swear up a storm in front of my toddler. Was pretty unbelievable.

o3yGHl5iqaQXLDm_9ubC2g.text: Story:  I ordered a slice if cake at around 11pm that my wife and I was going to share.  We had no idea of how much it was going to cost. Upon paying my wife asked for a cup of water. I followed. Total came to nearly 12 bucks and I hand over the credit card. Cashier hands me card back and wife says, why so expensive?  Found out it costs $1 per cup for tap water. I was upset but cashier tells me sorry, already ran the card. I left feeling ripped off.  While my wife picked up cake I asked for manager to come to my table. Sean came over and listened to my complaint. Afterwards I learned employee was new, and that the $1 charge was because of night club people often came in just for water.  He then asked how he could make it right. In the end he did way more than we asked. He turned around an a angry customer.  Having said that the cake was really good as well. I'd go back. Hopefully they will be informing customers about the charge for water.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tap water cost $1 each AND they don&#39;t tell you when you ask for it. After they ran my card I asked why so expensive. Too bad!

4TZPqWeAw72-JEdZ3GXE1A.text: Def not a bad spot for Vegas. The hash browns were really good. Service was good. I like higher quality food but it's tough to find in Vegas. I was in a rush , so I picked this place. I  would go there again, in a pinch!

LK0qcEGkTILsgxI0bWFGZQ.text: The food was pretty good. But one of the employees there named Diana was the best!! She deserves 2 raises. She's got it goin on... She be parkin lot pimpin in her dunks!

mIE_eym8gGn0bYpvl_vH0w.text: I had the best time coming to this place. I am so glad that I was able to find it in Mandalay Bay. So I just came here with a friend just to watch a show and we had plenty of time to kill. The bottomless mimosas were absolutely amazing. The bartender Lizzy was so nice and genuine and had the most funniest conversations with us ever. Also Glen who is a waiter there is great as well. These people have amazing customer service and made me and my friend have nothing but an amazing experience full of laughter and fun with these people. They are so wonderful at customer interaction and multitasking. If you are going to go to the bar, I would put in a request for Lizzy. If you are looking for a sit down, Glen is great too. In my personal opinion, this place is the best for a breakfast, brunch, and lunch. I would definitely come back here again. Atmospheres great and so are the employees. Thank you Lizzy and Glen for an amazing experience, I will see you guys soon!

GctjLqsjSPxxLtPGn60l_A.text: Horrible experience.  Took 25 minutes from order to get my cold (expected) sandwich, an Italian Muffeleta, when the place was maybe 1/3 full.  Got the sandwich, and the bun was so stale I could have built a house with them.  I would have stayed and complained, but was already late for a conference by then.

X8q2Kmg5Gj0bgJ_ZNA-y7Q.text: I was in love with this place. We ate here 3 times in our Vegas weekend and loved everything we tried. The bacon burger was my favorite. I will go back when I go back to Vegas.

hWY534z1dIo_67ogS0l5hQ.text: Went there late night and they have a very limited after hours menu. Food was just ok. Little pricey for what we got but the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ISpYtiE1s6saDmcMQhQz2w.text: Really awesome breakfast. Try a smoothie I'm fairly sure it saved our lives after a rough Vegas night before.

Ijb3wweh__DSTxHViwo5Fg.text: I stayed at THEhotel with my friends and we ate here because it was the least expensive compared to the other places nearby. I will say that they have tasty sandwiches, salads and burgers. Great for the price! Service was good too, so no complaints here with this place. The decor was pretty cool as well.

A-WR2zw51mhbKHPbUhXsmQ.text: Server was horrible!! My friend ordered waffle fries with his Classic Burger and received regular fries. When questioned where his waffle fries were, the server explained that they were out. Would have been nice to learn that earlier!  I ordered potato salad with my Baconator Burger. I requested the burger to be cooked medium. The server explained that the Baconator was just like the Classic Burger except with "bacon, bacon, and more bacon." That sounded great to me, which is why I ordered it.  The burger was not at all what I expected. First, the server simply dropped our food off and scurried away quickly. He didn't check in on us until half of our food was gone.  Next, I never received my potato salad. Instead, I received plain fries like my friend did.  Third, the bacon was not thick or piled on like I expected. I received 4 thin slices, that's it!!  Last, my burger was overcooked! I ordered medium and was given a chewy charred burger.  This place has some major improvements to make before I ever go back!

w10iuUc2vmytVZCWZ4jnnw.text: Just grabbed a bagel and hot chocolate. Delicious. The croissant dish was had by a fellow guest...looked out of this world. Easy, quaint place to grab a bite.

tf8cxunjmMsUEGolevZhTQ.text: After getting in on a super-delayed flight, standing in line at 2 am for check-in, and making our way to the room, the ONLY place with food that was open was Citizens.  The very comfortable comfort food did the trick, and the price was pretty super.  Also of note was the service.  It was hoping, as you would expect, and the servers were high energy.  Citizens hit the spot!

5U_hLkVaDj58aTrgOQhM-g.text: I stopped in one morning during my conference and ordered the Bellylicious juice.  It was fresh, tasty and filling enough to carry me through my morning.  The grab and go counter is pretty busy, but the line moves fast.  The pastry case wasn't overly appealing, but honestly I really only needed/wanted the juice.

pobN1_PcqwmjoEOqYUc-lQ.text: Service was good, but the food was not (at least for me it wasn't).  Tried the meatloaf and the macaroni and cheese... *sigh*.  My friend had the double patty melt and he liked it.  Maybe next time we go back to Mandalay Bay, I'll give them another try (but a different menu item for sure).

RLtqsynUPF0t0UMouBlqjA.text: The cheeseburgers here are really good and the nachos are great with large portions to share.

mIy1Xd7UOMJ7DE2NyWmzMw.text: Food (Breakfast) was wonderful.  Waffles, steak, and Juice smoothies were great actually.  The price is a different story - yes it is expensive.  We had lunch here as well - their Steak chili frieds are fabulous.  Sandwiches are ok.  Cobb salad was no bueno, but bbq chicken salad is good.  Their servers are decent.  They screwed up our togo order (horribly) - that is why the 3 stars instead of 4 stars.

kLOVJWJqhWuiOXNfHVRGAA.text: This is a review for the cafe part of Citizens, not the actual restaurant.  Hungry after a night of partying and wanting something of sustenance in our systems before hitting Daylight, our group wandered into Citizens to pick up some food.  Between Boyfriend and I, we got a bottle of water, a fresh fruit bowl and a croissant. And it totaled to just over $16. WHAT. WHAAAT. The bottle of water itself was $5. FIVE DOLLARS. Even my croissant was only $3.50 (ONLY, she says). My poor wallet.  At least the food was okay. The croissant was light, flaky and huge, so I suppose it kind of made up for the price. The fruit was pretty good -- but unless it's spoiled, it's kind of hard to mess that up.  The other members of our group got various salads (I distinctly remember seeing the quinoa salad) and a tuna sandwich. Their food looked pretty good, but I didn't try it. Regardless, I didn't hear any complaints, so I suppose it was decent enough to satisfy our appetites.  Next time, I think I'll just go hunt down either a Starbucks or something instead if I'm craving a croissant. That's just ridiculous.

Vzt67gUG2U0R9ntWrRThFA.text: Everything at lunch was yummy. We started with the chili cheese fries and they were very good and upscale comfort food. I had the turkey, avocado, sprout, w/muenster sammi. I wish they had listed the tomato on the menu so I could tell them to leave it off but I pulled it off and am ok with that. I switched the bread type to sourdough. Waitress was nice and attentive. Service was fast & good overall.

qHesOxylc1IVBMkaNCWvKQ.text: Stopped in to grab breakfast in this place since it was in the Mandalay where we were staying and it was pretty good. It sits in the back of the casino and it has a ful menu including take out sandwiches which looked delicious and breakfast items.   We ate some eggs and toast etc, but the best was the crumbled tater tots mixed with red peppers, best I have tasted. It gets pretty crowded and you may end up waiting but it was worth it. Prices were right and service was fast and friendly! Place is decorated like a kitchen and it was pretty cool inside. Not sure what the dinner menu looks like but it might be good!

XgtXGxIvO4kRS9GQz_O46w.text: We had an excellent experience at Citizen, and we totally credit our server, Michael for it.   We were passing time during the college basketball championship game and decided to go to the aquarium and grab a bite to eat. We were seated at a nice table and the kids ordered sandwiches and I had a Maryland Mary (their version of a Bloody Mary) which is made with a homemade Bloody Mary mix. The sandwiches were a full meal, very nicely done. The Bloody Mary was REALLY good: very spicy and very flavorful. Couldn't even taste the vodka, which is how I like it, but it was definitely there. Yum.   Our server Michael was very attentive, we didn't order a large or fancy meal, but we were treated like we did. Our water glasses were always full. We felt like he genuinely cared about our dining experience.   We will definitely be back!

t3laEcHWiAc6X5c3EwT9Pg.text: Not sure about the bad reviews but we really enjoyed the place. Open 24 hours and serving comfort foods. We had the Mahi fish tacos which was very nice portion of 3 tacos. The veg had a nice Kale salad with goat cheese and a wonderful dressing. The food at the Mandalay bay was outstanding overall and made staying there a real plus. They also have a nice grab and go area in the lobby of the restaurant that had a nice selection.

R6jbr5bNo6C1B25wqVePgQ.text: I wanted to update my review to A-OK. The reason? The owner reached out to me and invited me back into the restaurant for a different experience, which really says something. I was impressed by this action. Thanks, Jara.  I'm going to say that the menu sounds really good. I'm hoping that the service has changed since my last visit. Best of luck to this restaurant. Keep listening to your customers and I think you will do A-OK.  Review from Feb 2, 2013.  The scene:  Citizens Kitchen & Bar Hotel: Mandalay Bay Date: Saturday, February 2, 2013 Time: 12:00 pm There was a UFC fight the same day. Picture lots of men on steroids with tons of testosterone, pent up rage and Affliction t-shirts.  HA Food: 1 Turkey Sandwich, 2 Iced Teas and Chicken Soup= $66.00  I was craving some comfort food to help revitalize my energy levels. I had a giant sandwich on my mind, so I walked through the Casino in hopes of eating at the Red, White and Blue Restaurant. I come to find out that my favorite sandwich spot is closed and Citizen's Kitchen & Bar has replaced my go-to sandwich spot. Citizens prides itself on non fancy, REAL comfort food. The vibe is new American mixed with old fashioned comfort.  The environment was great, the service and food..not so much. When we arrived for lunch, there was one other group at the bar. We were told by our server that we were the first lunch customers EVER.   Since we were the first lunch customers, I didn't come with ridiculously high standards. I was here with the most relaxed group of foodies. I grew up in a restaurant, so I'm always pretty calm and understanding when things go wrong, however there were so many mistakes and unkept promises, I was embarrassed for the restaurant. Charles Barkley showed up 1 hour after us and still got served before us. Haha  It took us 2 hours to get a cup of chicken noodle soup and a hot turkey sandwich. We were told 6 times that our food would be out soon. The hot turkey sandwich with gravy was COLD. One turkey sandwich, one cup of soup and 2 iced teas cost us $66.00, no joke.   The manager did not listen to us and acted as if we were an inconvenience.  We didn't get a discount, but they offered us free pastries. We  were not interested. We won't be coming back here.   Tip of the day: You are better off going to Subway or a food court for lunch.  Take your $66.00 to STK, getting a mouthwatering steak + the mac and cheese and enjoy ridiculously superb service.

-rrnWbSPLKsJZ9ja6MsMMQ.text: I was surprised to find this was the only place open to eat at 1:30 am on my last visit to Mandalay Bay.  This used to be my hotel and I always thought there were more options.  Anyways, I ended up eating here 2x within 4 hours.    You can sit down in the restaurant and have a decent menu available to you or you can order from the counter.  The latter is better, over priced smaller bites.  The former has a wider selection - Vegas strip priced diner food.  I wish there were more options.  But at 4:30 in the morning after being up all night and still wasted, this place ain't bad.    p.s.  the pastries at the counter are good.

dKHVzcw0BVKzhIlsNK50Ow.text: Came here to get brunch with my friends and we had a great time. We had Stephanie helping us out. She was very sweet.  I got the Caesar salad and my friend got the lobster roll.  My salad was okay but the lobster roll was delicious. I took a picture of it.  Definitely will come back for the lobster roll.  I also had coffee which was standard.  This place is nicely decorated and there's seating outside-ish.  It wasn't really outside since you are still inside Mandaly Bay.  When we were leaving, my friend left his credit card and Stephanie ran after us to give it back to him.  4 stars for Stephanie for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll with fries
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QtXQLHkgcghFSwSc1e4Jvw.text: My husband and I had one of the best experiences with a lovely server named Jeanine. She guided us through the menu and gave us exactly what we were looking for to eat. Jeanine was so pleasant and sold us on buying two more to go.  Viva las Vegas !!!

hY2T37F4zXru0o2MqFohXw.text: $4 for coffee water!  We walked all over the Strip to find a good cup of coffee. McDonald's coffee is far superior. That should give you an idea had bad this coffee tasted.  Sorry McDonald's, I should not have compared you to such horrible coffee.  Side note. The service was really good.

-47KCsOUfxmDd6hPEb-x8A.text: one-word review: SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW  Surprisingly bad. Took forever to get drinks, took forever to get food. Server was apologetic and nice and friendly, but that only goes so far.  My friend got a burger. Asked for jalapenos on the side. Told it would be extra, no problem. Jalapenos never showed up, we complained. By the time the server returned my friend had already finished his burger. Server came to explain they ran out of jalapenos. Burger itself was a bad, obviously frozen patty. Oh, and they forgot the fries as well, which were uninspiring.  My salad was fine, a C+/B- level type meal.  I'd be shocked if that initial 5-star review was not a shill post. This place was baaaaaaad.

aMevxoQllNgeDNwbmETsNQ.text: Good, bad or otherwise this place has northern comfort food. Pastrami and beef short ribs amongst other things.  (I don't know how good) For us southerners.. They don't change out their old grease often enough.  The fried food we had was greasy and not good quality. I could barely eat half of my shrimp tempura. Wife had chicken tenders (better at kfc) we split order of fries. Service was rushed and not good at all.  I'm from Houston and go out to eat all the time.

j4F4QGIuoHNSjsNnQDhGhQ.text: The only late night option for food in the Mandalay Bay located in the back part of the casino near the nightclub & Mandalay Bay arena. The food is pricey, I think I blew 20 bucks for a sandwich & some chips (and just when I though the blackjack worked me over bad that night.) despite my resentment for the price that food was actually decent, not worth the price but if you're starving it hits the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham &amp; turkey sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m too drunk to enjoy this over priced meal... the beer was 8 bucks.

lD1bJ9ZYaRGl18bLWmFpBg.text: The service here is completely horrible. The food is overpriced and at the end of the day not good at all. The manager Amanda was rude and unprofessional. If you're planning to eat at Mandalay Bay I would save the trouble and go upstairs to mandalay place to eat.

gVeh6nPrKNKeWRmN7f_6kw.text: Turkey burger 18.00 too big for one appetite. Fries are spiced perfectly. Mac n Cheese tastes like old recipe. Really good. Happy hour well drink was less than 6 ounces vodka n orange juice. 5.00 I will come back with more Freind to share with.

xBz4zi9kk2sODESDFysHbg.text: Came to take out my girlfriend and friend on their day off and right when I walked in the whole mood was KILLED!!! I'm not going to ruin anyone's job and say names. But everyone looks so sad to be there like misery. Food was good. Service shit, don't waste your time.

V07QT2TAb_Cq8FuLyx-O1A.text: We were seated on the "outside" patio.   Our waitress was friendly but rarely visited our table to check in on us. We didn't get any water or coffee refills, even after asking.   The food was mediocre and overpriced for the quality.   A cute and convenient spot but not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own omelette with substitute fruit for potatoes.

cwLEpn80Bh97337vnLQXbw.text: The chicken club sandwich was really good but I think it was missing some avocado. It has chicken breast, bacon, lettuce, and tomato on sourdough bread. The turkey avocado on a cranberry bread was really good but it was missing some bacon flavor. I would give this place a 5 but it was missing just a little twist in both sandwiches. Besides that, everything was really good. The fries were all crunchy just the way I like it. For two sandwiches and a drink, I don't think the price was worth it. It was definitely overpriced. I spent about $45....but I guess that's what you get for visiting Vegas, spend big or go home.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Turkey Avocado Sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken club sandwich

W2Ba-_sQXDxIsJs7J7EBxw.text: We were in Vegas with kids. The kids really liked the breakfast. It's expensive, Vegas prices, but the food was good. The waffles are big and can be shared with small kids. I had a fruit bowl and it was really good and refreshing. Don't be fooled by the menu board, there is sit down dining on both ends of the restaurant sign.

irSMNm4fP8LW4YDZmRU3Iw.text: I just left from my table still hungry after waiting for over an hour and watching at least 6 different parties be seated AFTER me enjoying their meal. My waitress only came over twice, once after I'd been sitting 20+ minutes to take my order and once again 40 minutes after that to ask me what I ordered. Bish, BYE!   Now I'm in bed starving eating a $5 hummus and pretzel chip snack back.

WfBHM5Si1acaQWO6Am4_Vw.text: Good food, good atmosphere. We ate here mostly because of the convenience. The good was good. Prices were more than most places, but that's Vegas. The prices were better than most other restaurants in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Dip
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick Chicken

z8JFiCqUx8QGQAcGQMJwDg.text: Our 2nd meal at "Citizens Kitchen and Bar".   In two words, "Excellent meal"! All the wait staff are very friendly, professional and accommodating. Our table host/server, Jenna, was attentive, personable and made sure everything was just the way we wanted. If you go there and want excellent service, make a request to be seated in her section.  You will be a return customer for sure! J & M Anthem

wOLjoa9O3_XaEodRM9ZpjA.text: Food sucks, service is worse, manager called me dear.  Plenty of room to sit in the dining area but won't seat us because we just wanted dessert.  Told us we can sit at outside seating but tables were all dirty.   Waited 10 minutes for them to box up cheese cake.

jhpzOUwYE9kOO5E-4CHpoA.text: Since we were staying at Mandalay Bay, this place quickly became a "go to" for the weekend. Highly recommend their chicken wings, crispy & tasty, especially with the sweet Thai chili sauce! The pizza was OK. For some late afternoon or late night snacks/drinks, it's a good option!

h-pCpRsV-5RqRDgcdWiKpA.text: David who works at this Citizens is the BEST. I gave him a massive order and he handled it like a champ and organized it all so well. Very impressed. He should get employee of the month if that's a thing there. Thank you DAVID!!!

S487es72mDL4hY_crsqZjQ.text: This morning I purchased the mixed fruit cup, doughnuts and milks. The doughnuts were cold and after giving our 14 month old the blueberries, we noticed mold on the cantaloupe(pictures attached.) Nothing screams "We're not fresh!" More than these signs. I took them back and they refunded my whole order. I had a chance to speak with both the manager and GM. It seemed as if the GM didn't appreciate any of my feedback/concerns, i.e., Moral duty to notify the health department, my daughter can get sick,etc... I believe her response was "we gave you back your money what more do you want?" Almost as if I was keeping her from far more important things. The comment that really got her goose was when I told her I would also email the CEO. Her response to me was that I was making it difficult and she should just go ahead and charge me for the milks. Nice one! Just go ahead and punish anyone who disagrees with you. We came here for  dinner Wednesday night and they were out of the prime rib they advertised so I settled for the NY steak frites. Dinner was decent for our party, the server was pleasant even after one of the kids spilled their drink. We've been here since Tuesday and leaving on Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moldy fruit cups for $8 and ice cold Donuts. The real question is how many can I buy?

tC32osCH765WCPwu-7b2Tw.text: We were there Wednesday morning around 1am last night and the host wasn't so friendly. She told us the wait was 30 minutes for two people and we ended up waiting for more than 50 mins. I had to go up to ask her and she said another 20 mins. Good thing, Michael took over when she went on break and he gave us a table right away. It wasn't even that busy. Not sure what her problem was. She didn't seems happy there. Geez. Definitely won't be back.

IwNA8YHMC3oqjgO5-wW08A.text: Great for lunch. My husband and I shared the chili and mahi-mahi tacos. The waiter said the fish tacos are what "made the restaurant famous" and the did not disappoint. They were tasty and of good quality.   The chili was spicy and yummy.   The atmosphere was that if an English dinner and the service was friendly and top notch. A great place for lunch.

NJciXvwDTG7l-zjQ57t-uA.text: Stopped in after a concert. It was pretty late so it is all that was open.   Now that I have been there, I would for sure go back.  Got on the wait list and waited about 15 minutes. We sat on the patio, if it's a patio, since it's inside the building, but outside the restaurant. Got it? It was good because we could people watch.   I ordered the Loco Moco. Great choice to absorb any alcohol. lol  The meat was cooked just right and had quality taste to it. I liked the stickiness to the rice. I think the gravy could have had a little more flavor to it, but it wasn't bad at all.  Give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6xW0pAQDezfDORZ1C9WrHA.text: I went to see For the Record: Baz before it leaves Mandalay Bay and I decided to try Citizens for something different.  I was rather pleased with my meal and service there.  My server, Tony, answered some questions I had about the menu and he told me about some specials.  I ordered a small Caesar salad for a starter.  For the main, he recommended the fish tacos and I went with that.  For dessert, I again took his recommendation and ordered the carrot cake.  It was good following his advice!  The Cesar salad was a normal one, nothing special.  They could have left the hard piece of bread with baked cheese on it.  The bread was indeed hard and there was no cheese flavor.  It looked better than it tasted.  I have only gotten fish tacos once before so this was almost a new entree for me.  The tacos were filled to the brim.  The mahi mahi was tasty, there was some slaw, and each taco had a slice of avocado along with some chipotle aioli.  There were three side containers of sour cream, guacamole, and pico.  The tacos were juicy and messy eating, but worth it.    The carrot cake was a gigantic slice of goodness.  It was rich cake with a good cream cheese icing and nuts sprinkled liberally on the icing.  You are paying Strip prices for tacos you could get from a street vendor for much less.  The restaurant was almost empty and the quiet was enjoyable.  Tony was a great server and I'm glad I gave Citizens a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Caesar salad.

kabiZU6Wc4xVWhqErWSnYg.text: Solid establishment. Sat at the bar and the Barntender EJ was professional and courteous.  His "What up dawg?" and "I got you bro, you already know" made me feel welcome. Like my friend was serving me drinks. Keep EJ... as a matter of fact, give him a raise.

zWIa2FJCAbBctuG4lTdAXQ.text: Tried to place an order for pick up and was put on hold for 20 mins.. no one ever picked up. So I tried calling back thinking there was an issue, and was hung up on 3 times.  I understand if it's busy but you can't just hang up on people if you don't feel like providing takeout.

IRlNUEZCIHnZeW8Fv46M7w.text: BEST BLOODY MARY IN VEGAS  RAQUEL The bartender does an amazing job putting it together.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLOODY MARY MADE BY RAQUEL

aAtQenoisJy24DIP__cV3Q.text: This is the best breakfast i've ever had in Mandelay bay I love there eggs benedicts and their chockate chip pancakes best place in Las Vegas

ImAcZfs4CS4gDS_MY4QTtQ.text: We eat here every time we stay at Mandalay Bay. They are open 24 hours and we have already had to go dinner last night and a sit down meal in the restaurant tonight. My husband had a burger last night and the brick chicken tonight, I had the bbq chicken salad last night and the turkey burger in a lettuce wrap tonight. The service was great both to go and in the restaurant. The margarita was awesome and the food was delicious. The service is fast and this is one of the most reasonably priced resort restaurant with delicious food. All American fare and a full bar. Did not disappoint.

cnhv1gQV3aWXKPRG9YP8wg.text: Service is very bad here. Food is fine. Nothing award winning but they're not trying to. It's a diner attitude with higher prices but Mandalay has you under their thumb if it's late and you want to sit down and eat. So you just have to write your review and hope your experience is better than mine. I have ruled out eating here next time I stay at Mandalay.

q8jPQZN3xPXJxG_bBHSdog.text: Good service, the pretzel bite app was good for the table to share. We ordered the chicken sandwich, burger, and teriyaki bowl and all were tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

m0PgaTEWcFx6IqbmmPa4gw.text: Right in the heart of Mandalay Bay is a casual cafe that surprised me with it's huge portions.  We had the $ 50 Prime Rib special.  Boy was that beef large, served with massive baked potato and healthy heaping of broccoli.  I thought I was going to be rolled out of this place.  The place happens to be busy on weekdays, some wait for getting our orders but it was fine. People watching can't be avoided. NOTE: place can be very noisy.  The price for inside Vegas Strip major hotel is not gougy like many around here.

8oAXJOkN39oEIlM2zDCyPQ.text: Not sure why only 3 star average, the food was incredibly delicious and service was fast! We have the French dip the mahi-mahi tacos the giant BLT sandwich and a kids hotdog. Everything came out in about 10 minutes at the most part and absolutely delicious. Prices are actually reasonable considering we're at Mandalay Bay on the strip.

cTSzF8woQoLYofVpOnW9jQ.text: I love this place. The food is always delicious, the employees are personable. I never have to flag anyone down for a coffee top off. I made the poor choice to mix it up on day 3 of a conference and tried Della's kitchen on the Delano side. The food and service were not comparable at all. Lesson learned. Lisa is fantastic by the way. If she is your waitress you are in for a joyous experience!

_0cdOdlXhkwYWIIiJk6iTA.text: Citizens had always been convenient for my family and I when we're at the mandalay. The only place that is open all hours, and a good quick but when you're looking for alternative food for a day at the pool. The food is ok nothing to rave about kinda taste like buffet food but the staff is always friendly. The one saving grace that always has me coming back is the banana bread peanut butter and jelly. Definitely come back for it.

16bCzHEIzia-aVyk1bgkFQ.text: Today I had an extraordinary and memorable experience at Citizens Kitchen and Bar at the Mandalay Bay Hotel. Extraordinary enough to take the time to write this review.   Along with one of my colleagues, we had breakfast prior to a convention around 730am. Our server was polite, helpful and prompt. After we completed our meal, I ordered a latte to go. While there we ran into fellow colleagues and stayed another 15-20 minutes. Of course, the coffee was cold as ice by then, which I despise. I asked Oliver if he could warm up the latte before leaving. He said sure, please wait.   Turns out that Oliver had the barista prepare me a brand new latte. I was shocked with his service, demeanor, it's all in a days work attitude. And he would not allow me to pay for it or even accept a tip!  Oliver is a rare find in the crazy world of Las Vegas hotel dining. Thank you Oliver for making my day. Well done!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you Oliver!

8Sh1NLIcL2soLHN4MUQAmQ.text: Best chocolate cake ever. Had the perfect amount of fudge and batter combo. All that was missing was a tall glass of milk.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 7 Layer Chocolate Cake

fFc2iXi7q_jxzB0aBJltPw.text: Pretty poor food, service (messed up order, speaking a robot that clearly does not care) and so overpriced. We came here looking for a small meal since we were in the road all through dinner time to get here. We had Caesar salad (Lettuce with a few croutons), tuna melt (awful), burger (so so), bratwurst (so so.)

Gl-aF3f4Rn7o_fz-rPBtVg.text: I had breakfast here and it was so good that I was willing to pay the Vegas prices a second time. The first morning my hubby and I shared the egg and cheese croissant without the ham and potatoes. The breakfast sandwich was two eggs that were shaped like an omelt like but fluffy like scrambled eggs with melted cheese. Since I am a pescatarian we got it without the ham. The croissant was lightly toasted so there was crispy factor to the sandwhich. The side of potatoes were cut into bite sized pieces and seasoned enough that it wasn't over powering but also doesn't require you to use ketchup for flavor. We also ordered an everything bagel toasted with cream cheese on the side that wasn't everything enough for me.  I like the egg and cheese croissant and potatoes so much that I order it again the next day.

MrchScXyZmvW_n5Gpp7dRw.text: Great place for breakfast. The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated. Our server Jaime was very pleasant and attentive.   I ordered the steak and eggs. Everything was delicious! The steak was well done, flavorful and very juicy. The potatoes were seasoned and soo yummy.  The wheat toast came with semi melted better and apple jelly, another great pairing. I asked for over hard fried eggs and the cook got it right!   Food and service wise it was a 5+ star.  I took off a star for paper straws which I HATE!, no fresh squeezed oj and no coke products lol.   Definitely a restaurant to come back to.

ojWjH8deQccNauHFF0xHkg.text: We went for a quick lunch. Their prime rib combo dinner was delicious and huge. Definitely worth the money. Their seafood gumbo was amazing. Service was great and efficient. Very casual and relaxing.

p4Sx-FF3Z7TNvbnKLNUzgg.text: Was out in Vegas for a girls weekend. We stayed at the Hotel so we decided to eat here. I'm not sure why such a low rating. Service was okay. Wasn't good not bad. The food however was bomb! Chilaquiles were on point bad well as the french toast. I thought the food was so good that I want to bring my Hubby me t time we are out here.

5xAz7-d-fvuqauScfhhe8w.text: Late review.  My husband and I visited this place daily for breakfast in 2017.  The food and service were both good.

5uQc2HjLPizQgv-H22NerA.text: I came here after a concert I attended at the Mandalay Beach- for the record I left the concert early because I was hungry.   I came to citizens and they had a limited menu, the pricing was very high for the quality of food. Another issue I had was every time I asked for something my server made it seem like it was an inconvenience as his friends were there that night. I asked him if there was a chipotle sauce and he said no, I asked him if I could redeem my dessert check in from yelp and again it was no. There was no alternative to anything I was asking for.   Other people came and he ignored them as well. Lack of service and lack of flavor. Will not be returning.

OnHI1b6Y6L-mqeWdO4_VCQ.text: Ordered the French dip, took over 20 mins to come and by the time it arrive my sandwich was cold and was not flavorful as expected. Too many options on the strip I recommend you to skip this place.

J10GP0WDmTYVcQkA4sAurA.text: Skip CITIZENS. It's a Sat morning in Las Vegas. Citizens in Mandalay Bay has nothing available!! No cappuccino no macchiato no caffe latte no cafe au lait and no cafe mocha and no breakfast burritos nor bacon egg and cheese sandwich. Only half of juices available. But you can get a regular coffee fruit croissant. Even the girls at the counter acted snooty and could care less, but they sure expected a tip. Pathetic!  First gal never poured our regular coffee even though there was only one couple on line behind us. 2nd gal ROXANNE claimed that my MLife card had no points. I explained I wanted bill for MLife discount and gave her my credit card or offered room number and she refused saying my MLife card was incorrect.  Later, I had to spend time with MLife from my hotel room phone to fix the problem. Well there was no problem! Only problem was ROXANNE at CITZiZENS!  Thankfully Ashley at MLife applied the discount over the phone so I wouldn't have to stand in line. Thank you Ashley at MLife.  SKIP CITIZENS!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fr1fi6FHPSLGsJIOWaAb6A.text: Stopped by here because we needed a quick bite to eat before the Michael Jackson One show.  Thought it would be faster if we went to the bar. Took a while for the bartender to show up, but once she did service was fine. We had the chili cheese kobe beef fries, which hit the spot. Decent place to watch sports as well.

3g9iCoTg_2A7SH5vld94BA.text: Awesome place when you don't want to eat a huge expensive buffet! Homemade food with a cool vibe. Love this place and glad it's near the Mandalay Bay casino!

9BLc4ug86a8TOoNh8MC5jA.text: Probably the best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had.  And the Cole slaw was great also.  Definitely recommend

BbMl25O3OeqzPugLdy3JZQ.text: Great breakfast! Eggs Benedict was awesome! Service was friendly and fast. Coffee tasted great, was really surprised to find this place so good for breakfast

gUTpxy0-oPbgHUX9XbP1Eg.text: Was looking for a super quick bite. The Mahi Mahi fish tacos blew me away. Some of the best I've had outside of San Diego or Mexico.

CzqaQCEcvO8qqXE4BWmlKA.text: Would I come here if I was not staying here at MB, no. Would I eat here when I am, YES. One yummy dish and I'm sold. French dip all they way for those seeking to fill a simple light palate with some yummy meat. Light and  fluffy french dip all the way.

ee2Hj7CU_Z-dQt_t4KRWmg.text: Came here for a late night snack.  They're 24/7 and have a smaller menu during late hours.  We were starving but the hot dip, chicken soup and corn beef hash were all tasty.

So18ZHyXCN-Hz_qdyV-BOQ.text: On the tab Shrimp Cocktail French Onion Soup Kobe Chilli Chicken Noodle Prime Rib A bunch of Juices  PRO: Lots of tables Easy to get a table on a Friday night during MLK weekend Get the KOBE Chilli  CONS: The juices.. it was a frothy juice so we couldn't call it a juice or a smoothie. For the price, pass on it.  Overall, typical American food and nothing noteworthy.

iNJoVKxoT9ovrE541uPkUw.text: Good food and good service... The only restaurant open when your arrived after midnight.

WVtAsXGw7qGhuVwHUOlZGg.text: Maybe being in l Las Vegas a few days spoils you, had an afternoon snack , it was just ok, attentive service, bland fish tacos, horrible Quessadilla!!   Overall  not a Fan.
