syBIT6wbyH6yxb_GDa2vYw.text: I always come here when I am loaded since anything taste good when you are loaded. I order the same damn item, the Chicken Club Sandwich and Seasoned Fries. It's on point. If you are staying at Mandalay Bay or Delano, this would be your only late night spot to grub at. Unless you want diarehea cause you can run your fat ass across the street for Panda Express or Mc Donald's.  Room service always takes over an hour and it's overpriced. Believe it or not, the food from here and room service is the SAME S%$#. Service is pretty awsome considering the waiters always deal with annoying people that can't even sit up.   They have what most American type eaterys offer, you know....Burger and Sandwiches. You can also pick up something togo quicly since there are pre made sandwiches located at the togo counter, duh. You will also fine a varity of random sweets and yogurts.   You have the option of sitting outdoor or indoor. I prefer outdoor cause I like to make fun of others while eating. It is very entertaining actually, it's similar to that of a zoo.

KmDSuABHfXNkoj1ezhnp7w.text: Mind-bendingly slow service without a smile. Definitely not coming back here in a hurry

wsyvJZjrnlAKxjl2hgLGBw.text: Citizens' menu features mostly comfort foods and is open 24 hours.  I ordered the French Dip with french fries and a side of macaroni and cheese, and it was extremely delicious!  However, there really isn't much else I would have ordered from this restaurant.  Our server was friendly, but nothing too spectacular.  THE FRENCH DIP WAS THE BEST FRENCH DIP I HAVE EVER HAD!  The meat was of high quality, the au jus was tasty, and the bread was delicious as well.  It all went together so perfectly, although a tad bit salty (which was to be expected).  The french fries were sliced thinly and crispy, with some kind of seasoning that was perfect!  The macaroni and cheese was extremely tasty with peas and ham inside.  The cheese was so creamy and flavorful and the breadcrumbs that topped the dish was perfectly sprinkled with herbs.    Citizens is a very casual barstaurant with an interesting atmosphere.  My meal was served on a silver tray that was reminiscent of a elementary school cafeteria tray.  My friend's sandwich was served on a cutting board.  The "kitchen" theme here is very prevalent and unique in Las Vegas.  I would definitely go back to Citizens again.  I went for lunch, so I would be interesting in checking out their drinks one night as well.  Or perhaps to try their 24 sliders in 24 minutes challenge!

Bopb9q3oq6xRSxe0NmL9cg.text: Side steamed veggies: broccoli had black-moldy goodness on it.   French onion soup: HUGE & covered in a massive amount of cheese .... Delicious.   Like the atmosphere and staff was friendly & attentive. 3 stars because they gave me veggies that should have been tossed out but instead served it to me - great presentation though.   Customer service 5 stars.  Soup: 4 stars.

QOF4PRyrqrCnTdP-Yh2xPw.text: Was just here, picked up a fresh juice. It was tasty.   The cashier couldn't have been more unfriendly, totally flat and unwelcoming.   I've been in the service industry for 8+ yrs even if you are having a bad day, you still have to suck it up, put a smile on your face and be nice to customers!   So juice gets five stars, service gets two stars.

FQzU22lgc7WLyKuMSSaoaQ.text: Two regrettable experiences at this restaurant earns them one star in my book. The food was average and the service was spectacularly surly, and sour. The staff acted like they were doing us a favor by even addressing us. With all of the fine dining options and high caliber service in Vegas, this seems to me like a very poor choice. New management, please!

GTVy9KjSIG3DBEFaat8RUQ.text: A last night minute resort after Kevin Hart show.  A couple of friends and myself forced ourselves to get over the fact chicken wings were priced at $18 and a small cup of soup $10 the food was horrible. The wings had some sort of sauce sloped over it and the soup was blah! The pastrami sandwich was dry and the bread stale. Eat at your own risk LV.,,

jC4ELUPbFmToTqK7e4Jk2w.text: What do you do when you're jet-lagged to within an inch of your life and know that if you don't eat soon you're going to Hulk out and make the news?  The Hublet and I checked into Mandalay Bay for the 2013 IT Expo, threw our suitcases on the bed and dragged ourselves downstairs to try to bolt down some food before falling into an exhaustion coma.  We chose Citizens as it was the first non-formal place to eat that our tired feet brought us to.  The staff are polite and efficient, but the restaurant has a quick turnover feel to it and you do feel a scoosh rushed, however looking at the sea of people passing by you understand their desire to capitalize on the moneymaking potential.  We ended up visiting Citizens twice during our stay in Vegas and tried the following:  * Calamari appetizer: excellent.  I usually hate Marinara sauce with my calamari, preferred the gentle kiss of lemon juice, but their spicy sauce was a nice accompaniment. * BBQ Chicken Salad: basic but well done, although the chicken had a dry 'cooked earlier in the day & added at the last minute' feel.  Pretty to look at, well sized and filling. * Mushroom Blue Burger: this was a messy, messy meal that I enjoyed every second of.  Towering high, barely held together by a skewer, this rapidly fell apart and more napkins gave their lives here than for any other meal in Vegas.  Their sacrifice was not in vain. * Chicken Club Sandwich: the sourdough bread was the champion here, besides that it was a Club that wasn't any more or less tasty than any other Club sandwich, and the accompanying side of fries were delicious.  Prices are higher than you'd expect for somewhere that feels like a lunch place, however I rapidly learned that everything is a little pricier in Vegas, so this is a good average priced choice by Vegas standards.    The food is tasty but not life changing, however by Vegas standards this is a great low-key place for grabbing a quick bite to eat.

O4DoiTwrOx2H_krJGj7Z8A.text: The food is quite expensive but it is located inside the casino so it's something that should be expected. Our waiter was Art and he was very nice and answered our question well. He was also worked well considering how busy it was. The food was also good. The spaghetti had really good garlic bread with it.  You also get free cheesecake if you check in

J8gWOVvt7VPMwIS0ojOyjg.text: Stay away from this place. I gave it a generous two stars only because the manager offered us a free desert by commenting on the food (which we passed). I thought the place would carry on the same quality as its former self ( RED WHITE & BLUE RESTAURANT). Had the mahi mahi fish tacos from the servers recommendation. I couldn't figure out if I was eating coleslaw or fish tacos. Very runny tacos. Wifey had the quinoa and kale salad. Terribel. The quinoa was not cooked all the way thru. Pricey and lame.

tMgYvba-3kTKskpK9P6llg.text: the turkey avocado is unreal!!!!! i could eat it everyday... Cranberry walnut bread, lemon aioli(wow), sprouts, tomato, lettuce... Delist I love Mandalay bay!

fUIyLNLKwziF58sAWLzcNg.text: Love this place! Staff are super friendly and hospitable! Wells and Heather were awesome! Great food! Great staff ! Great service!!!!

QDiBovfhSzTw6-Z1vW7uMA.text: It was... Not that great. First off it is very pricey. Two of us our bill was over $50 and that's with no alcohol. Its run by Lightgroup and i have a bad taste in my mouth from them already. Service was sub par for Vegas and sitting where people are constantly walking right next to you is not enjoyable. The hostesses were probably the best part of the whole experience. The food was dennys quality so don't expect something amazing. (the belgian waffle was pretty amazing though!)

LQ-pYtf0X_ncExcW_YMGgg.text: First off, the hostesses offer you the option of sitting down to eat or getting the same food at the counter. They don't tell you that the people working the counter have no idea what is going on and you could probably finish two meals sitting while you wait in that ridiculous line. We opted for the line though b/c we didn't know. There were like 10 employees working behind this counter and they could barely pour a cup of coffee. Three of them were working on one person's order b/c she must have had a comp meal or something but really there were at least 20 people in line while we listened to this. Once we made it to order, I just got the yogurt b/c I knew the wait for eggs might take until lunch. My friends got the banana pancakes and eggs benedict. The pancakes were huge, doughy and honestly just gross. There was nothing redeeming about them. The eggs benedict was okay but nothing too great. I highly recommend the breakfast at Raffles as a good alternative in Mandalay Bay. The outside of Citizens looks great but it's really not work the $15 yogurt and coffee breakfast.

fpqT_J_HEj0cl330f-KtSQ.text: Waited for ready salad 30 mins and it was in the fridge . When we got it they told us we have to eat on the patio even though we were at the dinning room. We didn't want to  leave.We are Vegas locals and will not come back here. Unfortunately this is the only place working in Mandalay Bay late. :/

RkTEus17SnkaZrP9Kclwhw.text: I know there were some touch reviews but due to the good service and mega portion sizes, we will give them a four stars! Now the seating during a conference took a long time and the outside chairs are a little uncomfortable, however the short rib lasagna and fish and chips were stellar!

TRF8wMTfCQVVn6-OsWmR5g.text: Long wait.  Kitchen needs a ton of help. Food was terrible.   Had an 18 dollar burger and tasted like a hamburger at an elementary school.   Dry.  Came out not hot.    Fries came out warm and fresh tho.   Fries were just decent for an expensive cafe in Vegas.    The only saving grace was the service from the waiter.  He was on top of it.

JN7yZWH3JKjKxviJXdB89Q.text: Wanted to give a shout out to Destiny  Her customer service and professionalism was great !!!! And kept the Conversation fun. Ask for her station when you go there ! 5 star !

Y-Fn-bqHn475xf2HaR6ztw.text: Be prepared to eat if you get the Super Nachos. We had that and a pizza and still had left overs for the next day. Some of the best pizza I've had btw. About as pricey as most of the other restaurants around but definitely on the pricey side, which was expected.

9zG5SAh15f3ITEAKpwayFQ.text: Food here is decent, despite some of the reviews. My issues here are the service, which is usually by totally over it servers who have no real interest in being there. My server this past Sunday was openly telling tables how he hadn't slept the night prior, so his possible lack of attention to detail should be forgiven. Having said that, the turkey sandwich was really great.   My second visit, at about midnight, was about the same service wise. However, they severely limit the menu past 11pm which is really annoying. While I understand the need to do that, the menu they use is almost exclusively appetizers, two pizzas and a burger. They need a bit more variety to make it an actual 24 hour cafe. The nachos were pretty good though.

bKc70rriaSiP2-sHtzTvJA.text: We came here for the late night menu. Ummmm, let's see $22 burger, $20 shrimp tempura and $14 pizza. This is the most overpriced restaurant I've ever been to in my life. Save yourself from less than average food and go elsewhere. This place is an absolute rip off. Our waiter was very nice though.

3OuuNBxuF1XzEIPIU4lxcQ.text: Dropping my rating from a two star to a one star DISASTER!  I just wrote a review for the Citizens Kitchen & Bar last week.  I mentioned that the waiter George was "AMAZING!"   I retract my statement.  He is unethical and unprofessional.  He automatically included an 18% tip in our bill (see my original review) and not tell us about it (he got a 40% or an $80 tip on a $210 total bill).   We would have been OK with the 18% tip for a party of 8, but just tell us about it so we wouldn't double tip you!  We just checked our credit card statements, and George DOUBLE CHARGED us when we asked him to split our bills.  This means that he charged us 150% for our food and drink bill!  UNETHICAL!  Here's a summary of this horrible restaurant:  1)  We weren't told that Waiter George included an 18% tip on our bill. 2)  We added an additional 20% tip, raising his tip to $85+ on a $210 bill. 3)  We were charged an additional 50% for our food, bringing our total charge to $300+ on a food tab of $168. 4)  To top it off, the food is HORRIBLE here!  AVOID!  Shame on the owners and wait staff of Citizens Kitchen & Bar!  We're working with the credit card companies to resolve this mess!  Food Grade:  D+ Service Grade:  F Worth the Money Grade:  F Overall Impression Grade:  F!

vMe-l-H3Wt47ihmpOUu9OQ.text: Go here! My family got two cubans, one turkey avocado and one grilled chicken sandwich. They were all so good! They were able to make bread accommodations no problem if you didn't want the bread it's served on. the waiter was very nice and efficient. Portions were large as well. I would go back!

DqcOhGEg45FUCFheBXjBgQ.text: I met up with some friends for lunch at Citizens when at Mandalay Bay for a conference. The first things I noticed were how trendy the restaurant was and how friendly the wait staff was! Our waitress went above and beyond to make sure we had a good experience and genuinely seems to enjoy her job. I ordered a reuben and potato salad, which I definitely enjoyed. The Reuben was particularly good and was large enough quantity for me, even when I was really hungry. Unfortunately I checked in too late to enjoy the free cheesecake, but I'll get it next time lol. The food was priced about the same as the other restaurants in Mandalay, which was not too expensive. Overall, I enjoyed my experience.

2VuwYgIhwIe2cZC4Z0SpAg.text: Art was great. He brought us everything we needed. Everyone enjoyed their entrees. The prime rib and salmon quinoa salad was great. Thanks for getting us out in time for our show.

K7qs9bKdyHYsaEQUsC0qmw.text: They f#$&ing suck!!! Been here 3 times with other people, each time the service is awful!!! Takes forever to get your food and the servers obviously don't work for tips, cause if they did, it would be so much better.....

alEC5_DniunaCNQ6TdD-CA.text: I have stopped here several times every time I stay here at the Mandalay.  Service is awesome and food is yummy!  I ordered the Ruben sandwich per our waiter's choice.....it was delicious!  Until next time!

GJN3ctpGxl2NLY1MjHF-Ag.text: We stayed in the Mandalay Bay and ate breakfast here every morning.  The food is reasonably priced for Vegas and they offer a large variety of choices.  The servers can sometimes be a little slow to get to your table (happened two out of the three times we ate there) but they are all friendly.  I did like the atmosphere, it was simplistic upper-scale decor.    We didn't eat breakfast here but it looked like they had a lot of tasty sandwiches.  If you do not feel like sitting there and eating they do have a display case with pre-made food.  Just a tip if you are doing Paleo or low carb they do offer a protein box!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yogurt parfait Vegas style

HfECVuxJfwWU24gud7bqtQ.text: Greeting- nice Vibe- none Service- very good Price- good for vegas Bathroom- casino bathrooms- pass Food The pastrami sandwich is tasty and all homemade $18. Big portion with good fries Burger $17 is good WIGB? Yes

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

-f2StPMpDFHa1rYE2PdZhw.text: I've been to Vegas a plethora of times in my life, and a hand full since turning 21, my goal was to learn how to do Vegas right by 25 and I think I've succeeded. One of the keys is finding solid meals, not meals where you want to stuff yourself but something just right to fill your stomach before an eventful night. Citizens got the job done for me on this visit. Their burgers specifically.   The meat is quality meat, ordered it medium rare, medium and medium well, all 3 times cooked to my exact demands and each and every time it was mouth watering. 4.5/5  Ingredients were fresh each and every time as well, the one time I ordered the bacon burger, it came through too. No staleness in any part of my burger.   Bun- Bun was good, maybe a 4/5 which is good for my standards.   Fries- For being just normal fries they left a great impression on me. Crispy and tasteful, mm mm delicioso.  Customer service was very mediocre though. That's all there is to say about that here.  If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay or any hotel within the block and you're looking for a quick bite, rely on Citizens to get the job done, they are open 24/7 which is reliability at its finest.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On some to go shit

AE9lrfU3u5E-pGxNvY2nqA.text: Stayed at the Delano and ate breakfast here. Great service from Robert and nicely prepared omelette and ham/eggs. A bit pricey but higher end ingredients used. Nice job!

_ijDZGcaE8xGpee7A27JTA.text: Loved this place! Justin, our waiter was so professional, best server in LV. Food was hot and delicious. My son loved his maui maui tacos, and my beef dip was yummy.  Thank you!

sf8WxJ9vZ3Otv8cHIR64UA.text: Erick the bartender was terrible! We were the only ones at the bar mind you and it took him forever to greet us and get us menus. My boyfriend asked for a Bloody Mary and he said he'd be right back to tell us type of vodka used and he proceeded to make 8 drinks for the servers then came to us 10 minutes later to just tell us type of vodka. He was complaining loudly to a server that he hadn't slept in two days. When my boyfriend asked for our tab he proceeded again to make more drinks, give a sever inventory on Grey Goose and came back much later to tell us only how much the tab was and if we needed to view a copy. So unprofessional- what would happen if it had been a full bar?

xKKyGd8Yj5F5upq_k2UWxw.text: Everything was old not fresh sitting in the hot trays on the line! Very gross overpriced!

DW973O_cGwROnPs2Ci4upg.text: Awful experience. Ordered the mean and green... taste is probably 3 stars. Guess what? It's not fresh juice. At all. Sign says "fresh juice". We waited literally 20 mins for two smoothies. Totally unacceptable. And the "fresh juice" smoothies were made from concentrate. Don't waste your time with this place. You're better off not eating at all.

OtJhjBl0reqm1vBFPUgLKg.text: At 3am, after a fun evening out, we were hungry. Citizens Kitchen was the closest option between the club and the bed. My friend ordered a burger and told me it tasted good. I noticed that there was a check-in deal for a free slice of cheesecake (with the purchase of a signature entree) and in True Yelper fashion, I inquired about it.  Our server was so nice and gave me a free slice of cheesecake because my friend had ordered an entree (although there were no signature entrees at this time at night). It was creamy and delicious. We also found out that even though Citizens wasn't on the written list of places were we could use our $100 American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts credit, we were able to get it deducted from our bill when we checked out. Score!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Free&#34; Cheesecake with purchase of an entree. It tasted so good at 3am

r-2iQpPC57l7REzvIko3qw.text: We have always had a great experience here. Their menu is small, but what they serve is great.  The Frisco melt is great and the fries that come with it are super crispy.  The fish and chips had great fish with crispy and good breading. Good service and good food.

XHG_Ewl7PmWMRdP3q2h75A.text: The best option late at night in the Mandalay / Delano when room service has a 2 hr wait. It's not too much effort to come down here. Nachos were excellent, quesadilla was pretty good with lots of fresh guacamole, pizza not great. But if you need pizza then come here and just order it. Baked goods also looked delicious.   Nothing on the day menu appealed to me - would not be interested in normal sober dining here.

FxLQ94Gc0Rofni1LHlaj7Q.text: The food was bad ., simple. Bad !! Our server was really nice and accommodating. They are open 24 hours so they were really busy . I got the pizza and soup .. very dissatisfied  Will never eat again at the hotel restaurant

Z51GaQ8epqqL51PgQzAnAA.text: Well to start the manager took my order and wow was she extremely rude she said I can't take cash because my system is down???? She could only take credit cards. As soon as she said that, a girl walked up to the register and the manager turned and walked away and the young lady said yes I can take cash!? What's that about. So I ordered the turkey sandwich in a wrap and yuck I didn't even finish half. What a waste of money !

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oI5PX_ozS1y4LnlR9ro7VQ.text: This was probably the most ok'est of ok restaurants to me personally. My boyfriend and I came for dinner and a drink on a Friday night. There was no wait which was nice and the server was super friendly, but the food was just really ok. I felt it was pretty overpriced for what it was.  We started with the tempura shrimp as an appetizer. The flavor was good, but it only came with about 5 pieces and wasn't anything too special. For an entree I had the Caesar salad. The portion size was large and taste was good, but once again nothing special. Probably the two most exciting things about my meal were my Bloody Mary and the giant carrot cake. Those were the only things I could recommend.  I'm not sure I'd come back here again unless it was really the only option open or around.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French dip with fries
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad

2VGiiqY8RNfD55eOngg2DA.text: Good option for lunch within the Mandalay Bar Hotel. Decent selections for sandwiches. I was going to chose the BLTA (Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato, Avocado) but instead chose to get the Tuna Melt. This was one of their signature items. It was good! Very large. I chose another one of their signature items as my side...Mac and Cheese. This was also great. Very gooey.

wcW-sWK9gwy8n-QxuusaoQ.text: I ordered 2 item from the counter. The salad was pre-made, and from the taste, I would say at least 4 hours prior. The wrap was ok, but after I ordered, a girl looked came to the cash register, presumably to look st the order, then went to the sandwich-making station immediately behind the counter and proceeded to restock the containers. The other workers seemed more concerned with talking amongst themselves. The very obese man that took the orders at the counter had to ask the guy that ordered in front of me what he had, then go make his smoothie. Then he noticed I was waiting and asked me what I had... I get the wrap over 20 min later. F this place.

KSrZkKwD2vJZm2bW7d1dAg.text: I really do not understand the bad reviews.  I ate here twice while in town (once for lunch and once for breakfast) and each time the staff was friendly and efficient.  Food was really good, too!    I also like that you can get a Macallan 18 neat for $24 versus in the other restaurants and bars inside Mandalay at $68.  So stop in and get your Mac 18 here versus elsewhere so you can have nearly 3 for the price of one. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BYO Omelette
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito

JM8maoxNrYGmDnjfqH7Mng.text: I think this place gets a bad wrap. They are good at what they are. A quick, decent priced, 24 hour diner. I have had breakfast here 2 times and lunch.  Service was friendly, food was quick and good, prices were ok, pastries are Awesome!  My go to breakfast spot!

cK5vxGf98TLxT4NW4c10kg.text: Ordered a $15 PB&J at 10:45pm.  Slower than crap and the thing was slapped together with so much carelessnes it was impossible to eat. Come on, this is the MANDALAY right? WTF!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aDPiycUKduxXI8GKdv_xPQ.text: Pros: Citizen's is open 24/7 so it was really convenient when we arrived to Vegas at 5 am when most places are closed. We've dined in before and have ordered take out multiple as well.. both of which was a decent experience. The staff is friendly and helpful.   Con: They did not provide Au Jus or Horseradish for our prime rib order so it wasn't really enjoyable plain.   What we've ordered here:   Appetizers: *Shrimp Tempura $20 (approx 7 pcs)  *Potato Skins $16  *Buffalo Wings $18 (12 pc)  *Chicken Tenders $16 (4 pc)  *Disco Fries $16 "Waffle Fries, cheddar, mozzarella, bacon, gravy"   Signature Entrees:  *Citizens Prime Rib Dinner $39 "Slow Roasted, Loaded Baked Potato, Steamed Broccoli"  *Steak Frites $36 "14 oz NY Strip, Crispy Steak Fries" *Lasagna $29 "Short Rib Bolognese, Three Cheese Blend, Tomato Gravy, Garlic Bread" *BBQ Ribs $26 "Full Rack, Slaw, Onion Rings"   Sides:  *Mac & Cheese $8 "Bacon, white cheddar, & scallion"  Soup:  *Chili $16 "Kobe Sirloin, Kidney Beans, Cheddar, Sour Cream, Cornbread Muffin"   Salad:  *Caesar Salad $16   Dessert:  *Cheesecake- I do not recall the price per slice.  *Carrot Cake $9/ slice   Late Night Menu:  *Classic Hamburger with Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Cheese $20 ($18 + $2 to add a slice of cheese)

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Hamburger w. lettuce, tomato, onions $18 + $2 to add a slice of cheese. Came with fries
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato Skins $16
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tenders $16 (4 pc)

GoPMEBgqLJS6UH8e23XK5w.text: I ordered a turkey wrap and roasted beef sandwich today and waited for near half an hour without getting my food. Turned out they just forgot to make them. The staff did not even apologize. I complained to the manager and she was apologetic and offered to refund. It was an odd and unbelievable experience.

Q3d3GVMosGoGDYo6CiBYog.text: I'm writing the review even before receiving the food. I gave 2 stars just bcz I didn't taste the food yet. It would be 1 star. Their service sucks. I mean the host and server.  R they kidding me? I sat before 2 other parties. They sit 3 different parties right next to each other.  I got seated first. Waited fxxxing 10 mins while looking at other parties are getting service. Which restaurant serves the people who got seated last.   Furthermore!! This server took my drink to refill and forgot about it and never came back.  Wow.. unbelievable.

jeA3Zan1Wk1PIZ6rOcKCyQ.text: This place has one of the best bar tenders I have ever met!  His  name Erick. He was so friendly and knowledgeable and made my overall experience amazing. I wasn't sure what I wanted so Erick suggested the wings and WARM apple pie which were AMAZING!!! "She likes hers well done with all flats" ;). Erick had a full bar and still made you feel like you had his undivided attention. I don't think this place would be the same without him! The food was great but the service from Erick was the reason I came back 2 times during my stay!

wyCpeqe8X7HbHvk-tj29XQ.text: Citizens is separated into two areas. The main part is the to-go deli like area (left side) and the other is the nicer, sit down Bar (right). This review is for the To go deli.  It is an in-house establishment staffed by Mandalay Bay. I mainly came here because I wanted to use the credits I got from staying at Mandalay Bay. I have to conclude that if you aren't spending credits from the hotel, avoid using your hard earned money here.  The first day, I had the Chicken Salad Wrap ($10) and a latte ($5). The wrap wasn't too bad, but it was extremely plain. I wouldn't eat it....if it wasn't "free." Mcdonald's make better lattes (from its machines). Maybe it was, unfortunately, the person who was making drinks that day.  The Turkey Avocado, doesn't have actual Avocados. I believe it's a dressing. I had already left the premise to go back for questioning.  The smoothies are $10 each. I am from LA, but I'm not sure I felt my 'cold pressed uprising' agrees they are 'worth it.' They are prepared fresh.  Reflecting, I think my expectations for Citizens is a little too high. While the prices are high to reflect the convenience of eating at the hotel, I just feel it lacks so much. In Vegas, there are many eateries and lots of options if you are willing to look.  I definitely think sitting down at Citizens might have been a smarter choice, but the starting plate is about $17. If I could do it all over again, maybe I should have settle for a few cocktails and call it a day.

pON6xQ6x5o-IT8Hu2Dz2pQ.text: We stopped by for lunch - visiting for a trade show. Never been here before and had a pleasurable experience. Food was excellent and generous portions provided.   Our server, Oliver, was awesome - friendly, knowledgeable and we got a good vibe with his service.   We will definitely eat here again - especially if Oliver is there!

Jj13y3L7SupOSlJ4nlO6yA.text: French dip was superb! Brick chicken was decent, a little bland and tasteless.  The kids loved the pasta.  Great atmosphere and our server Sveum was on point with outstanding customer service.

3OunPeAI8icn3Vz-WsXpsw.text: Editing review: my waiter comped my meal so I'm revising to 2 stars.   I've eaten here before and am very disappointed with my breakfast experience.   I ordered the Ultimate breakfast because I wanted pancakes badly and all the other breakfast staples.   I sent the eggs back twice. I ordered over medium and both times they were less cooked than over easy.   The breakfast potatoes were soggy when they should've been crisp. Definitely taken out of a warming tray.   The pancakes which was the whole reason we came here were tough! I couldn't cut thru them with a fork and i had to stop eating after 1 bite because chewing the hard shell was too much for me.   Coffee was only refilled once. For a breakfast that costs $30, I expect it to be fresh. And I got something less than that.   I finally settled on eating the soggy potatoes after he took my eggs away. I gave the pancakes away to my fiance. His omelet was bland at best.

R8tePSceS4iO3vpeHEKEFA.text: I had the lasagna, garlic bread, belline and artichoke dip appetizer.  The lasagna had short rib meat and was so yummy!!!   Would definitely recommend it!  Tony was our waiter and did a great job!

9v7jIKpWUQOiJQyKgsfoFw.text: Food here is always fantastic! But the best thing is to sit at the bar during the week and chat it up with Raquel.  She is an awesome bartender, and makes this place awesome!

09SewoizTkNuKK7pWV6UXw.text: Food was ok.  Just your generic restaurant.  Feels like an upscale version of Applebee's. Save your money.  Service was friendly

U9I3eZH_5QAG2DH1QLgOVg.text: Great flavors, professional and poised service, and yummy dessert.  I had the BBQ Chicken Salad and it was delicious and a generous portion! It didn't have BBQ or isn't your typical BBQ but the flavors all matched and the toppings gave it variety and texture.  The waiter was super nice and never rushed us. It was reasonably priced for being on the strip.  We had the cheesecake and the bread pudding and we all loved the cheesecake. It was huge!  I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken salad. The lettuce is lightly dressed under the generous toppings.

dNn9Mm3R23_c_1JSfzAn4Q.text: Cafe says its 24 hours - well not exactly. Waited 5 minutes in one line to be told they weren't seething for breakfast but weren't seating for lunch but I could wait in another line for take out order. It gets better. Waited in other line to be told they weren't serving breakfast or lunch - so no sandwiches etc but I could buy a bag if chips and a drink. Also if I bought them I could not sit in their dining area because they're in - wait for it- transition. At the ripe old age of 52, I have never gone to a place with a big sign that says 24 hour service inside a 24 hour hotel inside a 24 hour inside near 1000 restaurants that serve at least part of all their menu all the time, to wait 15 minutes for the high privilege of buying a bag of chips and some no name coffee.

nakrB2fnkOHWnM-3HeM8jQ.text: Considering everywhere is disgustingly overpriced for mediocre food, this place was ok. I'm comparing it to a few other places that were very disappointing like cafe bellagio, and some gross cafe at the paris.  We grabbed a fairly quick bite here before seeing santana down the hall. We were seated quickly but our server was busy and opportunistic thinking her tip from the larger groups was going to be better so we were overlooked often. We had to request multiple times for things like, another plate, silverware,  refills were really hard to come by. Service was a 2-3 star experience.  I got the fish and chips and compared to my other meals this one was enjoyable and a ridiculously huge portion.

VJxnsNsGZGSvVDZFF5qxSQ.text: Good food for great prices compared to other restaurants in Mandalay Bay. The staff is so friendly we dined here two nights in a row. I recommend the carrot cake! Ask to be served by Junior or Mandi and theyll take care of you.

JLHkPh3zmqyxZgaV1ZpD8g.text: It's funny, you can always identify an ineffective manager when the easiest most simple request is denied for an unknown reason. ...Ate dinner at Citizens the first night of my stay in Las Vegas. The next morning I went there for coffee and here is where the problem arose. I eat oatmeal as I have a special diet for breakfast.  I asked for hot water with my coffee and after a discussion with I guess her manager, the waitress came back and said I could have the coffee but would have to eat the oatmeal elsewhere. I mean they are not crowded, I'm at the Bar so I don't take up a precious table. Won't be eating there again this trip just to reward their service. Went down the hallway at Mandolay Bay to the next eatery and they had no problem with the hot water.  I love yelp as you get to make sure the owners realize how their employees treat their customers.

3NhHM9HYXBaHgonriinS2g.text: I definitely would recommend this place. We went to this place right before the MJ One show.  We didn't make reservations and was seated within 5 minutes. We were pressed for time and I swear I've never had faster service. I had the grilled hockey sandwich and it was delicious. They give you a lot of food! I couldn't finish my fries. Definitely trendy and nice atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Spritz
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of seating area

5JplsfBKVgrMAkEAQlzViA.text: Their late night menu is IT!! So good and god sized portions ask for Erick super informative and so helpful! And FAST! Never had to ask for refills and such a great personality

S7huJRcXRZCxY54bPPkuJA.text: I love Citizens. They have a delicious breakfast and great coffee. For dinner, the meatloaf is so, so good! Great beer choices. I eat here multiple times every time I stay or have an event at Mandalay Bay. A+!

PScT8TUN7Dg-VpY6vAjC5w.text: When in town for the usual conventions, I usually stop in for the killer turkey avocado sandwich. I also make it a point to sit at the bar - bartender Raquel is super cool, funny and always makes me feel welcome  - Thank you!

Mz0q8mn96R0MbaNiZcLZIQ.text: Awesome. We just drove in from LA and wanted a quick bite. This restaurant is great, the portions are just right and service reminded me of old Vegas. Our server was Eric and he was awesome

r_BcL69u65LG3jWad9iMeQ.text: If you are craving a Bloody Mary, this is the place to be. Best I have ever had! If you happen to have Lotus as your sever, you are indeed lucky in Vegas!   Great evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blood Mary extraordinaire

v5FBeWAaya-wJEHIAJmXiQ.text: Citizens has great food, service, and charm. Chris Sveum was a great server and made my sons birthday fun!  A great 24 hour cafe!

2raOyM8-2IsqIAfafnHRTQ.text: Skip it, skip it, skip it.  Food was just okay, service was less than okay, and the prices for the food were the equivalent to spending steak money on a 10% patty.  When my wife asked the server what was on tap, he said "nothing" and walked away with no suggestions,  If you find yourself stuck at Mandalay Bay on a Sunday night, understand: They know it too.    They shut everything down but this hole, so you have no choice on where to go.  Tip, order a Pizza or walk to Jack in the Box!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SbIiV19XLIB4ZSzA1Hl6IQ.text: I have been coming to Vegas for years, particularly for an annual convention at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. This means that pickup lunch to carry with me is pretty important and having something that doesn't taste extremely processed or like it's been sitting in the glass showcase for days is also important. Here's where Citizens comes in.   For breakfast, they are ok. The early morning staff doesn't seem to be very helpful, perhaps that's because the coffee is pretty weak. There is a decent amount of confusion when it comes to seating and they are pretty unfriendly. Service was pretty slow - so do I recommend coming here to sit down? Not really.   BUT!!!! The sandwiches and salads are SO GOOD! I highly recommend the quinoa or the kale salad - both of them top my list as does the turkey sandwich. But if I had to go with one, I would choose one of their amazing salads.   The staff here is ok and the confusion due to long lines in the restaurant can get annoying but I say that salads are worth it, just take them to go or be prepared to sit there for a very long time. Also, cocktail of choice is the Berry Wise.   Happy eating! Recommended.

agtOtmnFmfoPZbxNAX7aIA.text: The quality of the food was very good. Nice size portion on the ruben that I had. If you want a special bloody mary ask Raquel the bar tender to make if for you. It has a split crab leg, shrimp, a beef stick and 3 shots of Vodka in it. Raquel was my server and she is very good and always has a nice smile.

R24fE7QaRc6-wG4a514ZMA.text: Restaurant looks great from the outside and my review is specifically for the Tuna Salad wrap. Not impressed at all. For $11, it was totally not worth it. The wrap was pretty much tasteless. There is no seasoning in the tuna and it's on a regular flour tortilla. I expected a lot more for the price I was paying. The size of the wrap is decent, but do not go to this place if you're expecting a gourmet tuna salad sandwich/wrap. The only reason I gave this 2 stars was because the staff was friendly.

jyzRfQjayU0JAB1PY8JSwQ.text: I have visited this venue a few times during my stay since the conference that our companies had was held here in mandalay bay. I had excellent fish and chips and wonderful fish tacos as well as very fulfilling french onion soup.  I notice that this place can get super pack in just a minute since the swarm of people that come in during that special lunch hour window rushing to be seated. And thats why i will give a little acknowledgement to the efficient little asian guy who gets our group going in and out, on point with all the drinks and food order as well as willing to deal with 10 different split check. We appreciate your speed and your tenacity to handle our needy group. I think his name is tommy.   All and all, i am looking forward to dine in this place again soon.

l2ty4JotJKKPyq2X56v9XQ.text: The food was horrible! It was so bland I asked for hot sauce and it still didn't help the flavor. Avoid this place if possible!

Jjuvp4kwgRcnLo2ehbAmDA.text: I can only review the take-out togo spot centered between the Kitchen and the Bar.  This spot I believe is 24 hours, as I find myself wandering in here to get to my room at 4 AM.  Basic food that will help you get on your way, and isn't fastfoody and greasy.  If you are from Southern California, think of it as an expensive, upscale Corner Bakery.  The items I got here were the turkey and avocado sandwhich (Very good, even at $14) and the breakfast burrito (decent, at $14).  You pay top dollar for being in the lobby of a top-notch Casino/Hotel (Mandalay Bay), so if you're looking for a dollar menu, call a taxi and have them take you off the strip.  Food on the strip will always have twice the price tag.

mC5yTt3YFL6LZtzPntMDMQ.text: MB's 24 hour cafe is perfectly positioned across from the nightclub. ha!  We left the club early and beat the crowd. Good thing too! Not many people were seated, therefore our service was excellent. They have the usual selection you would find at any 24 hour Vegas hotel cafe including a fully stocked bar. I ordered a breakfast croissant, nothing special stood out. It was tasty, a little on the oily side, but satisfying nonetheless. Hubs ordered a loco moco. I wasn't a big fan of the long grain rice they use or the gravy. Our server was friendly and prompt. She came by to check in on us and take refills in a timely manner. Decent place to grab a late night bite and clean.

OWCKpte59RbOOdEkpxy29w.text: Avoid this place!  The service was terrible.  It started with the hostess who had a lot of attitude (not in a good way).  Then the waiter told me that the item I wanted to order would take 25 minuets, so I ordered something else.  It turns out that the alternative took about the same amount of time.  The food was mediocre at best.  There are so many other dining options at Mandalay Bay.

jB3AFabSkOWaDr-8JYubJA.text: After a night at Foundation Room, me and my date had a case of the late night munchies. Citizens Kitchen and Bar was like a shining beacon that drew late diners in like a moth to a flame. Honestly though, it was our our only dining option at 1AM inside Mandalay Bay (thank goodness for 24 hour eating establishments, right?). Citizens was actually pretty crowded at this time of night. We only had a 5 minute wait to be seated, so no sweat.  Citizens is washed in bright lighting and white decor. Me and my gal pal were seated at a small table amid all the hustle and bustle. Our waiter promptly arrived to take our drink orders. When I got to looking at the menu, I quickly realized Citizens wasn't really a vegetarian friendly kind of place. I wasn't too worried because I was hungry but not like starving or anything so I was fine with getting an appetizer. Artichoke dip and chips it is! Unfortunately, I wasn't able to get a photo because my phone had died. :( The food came out in less than 10 minutes and was a good sized serving. I wasn't able to finish it all and left full. The dip had a great consistency and tasted great. Chips were yummy too.    Worth a Return Visit? I wouldn't go out if my way for Citizens, but if I find myself at Mandalay Bay in the wee hours of the morning I'd have no qualms about coming back.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #138

50j_ZVsqlHCXAYTq9aSYCQ.text: Here's the thing: if the menu says the quesadilla has a three-cheese blend, salsa, sour cream and guacamole, then please ONLY have it come with the three cheese blend, salsa, sour cream and guacamole.  It's frustrating to be served a $16 quesadilla (over $20 with tax and tip) that comes with chipotle aioli slathered inside when it isn't listed.  I ate a whole slice hating it before I realized what it was.  Yuck!  (I guess if you like chipotle aioli, great, but if you don't, please list it on the menu. Chipotle aioli is kind of a big deal to people that don't like it.)  Not worth the money, but the service was sweet and understanding.  They credited me, but it's noted for next time.

r99PV6fGeJJiACPvYv_ZLA.text: Had breakfast here.  Decided not to do a buffet and come into this restaurant in Mandalay Bay.  It was relaxing and food was excellent.  Crab Cake Benedict was excellent.  Breakfast Burrito was good, but I didn't like french fries inside burrito and it was not that flavorful.  This place isn't cheap but it was good.  Service was good.  No lines to get in when buffet restaurant had a wait.

CnBPfInMY9T1mWv1leusJA.text: Besides the server, this place is a disappointment. Ppl who order and got here way after we did, got their food way before we did. How did that work? We got our food 30 mins or so after we ordered. And when we got our food, my food was super salty!! I was mad, sad, and definitely HANGRY!!

GZ2RQUFpEDHI2e-6CxP19Q.text: Completely fucked up take out order. Asked me what I ordered like they didn't have the receipt. Gave us wrong drinks and less drinks than ordered. Terrible.

1mDWfXHSnK5SC3nQJ5DsvA.text: My favorite thing about this place?  It's open 24 hours!!  It's pretty awesome when your in Vegas knowing you'll be up all night and hungry at any time.    It's basic comfort food so nothing to adventurous.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad and dang it was a freaking huge portion!  There were 5 different portions to it and was separated by avocado slices.  The waiter was very helpful to the table and it was excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Chicken Salad.

aFSknazRsig7YVvgohUkcA.text: Good munchy late nite? Yes please!  The only 24hr eatery in Mandalay Bay and it's a life saver.  After long night of dancing at Light nightclub, Citizens was a few steps away.  Got seated relatively fast and we quickly ordered off the one page menu.  Our party of four ordered quite a few items to share and all was quite good.   The Prime rib was AWESOME!  Highly recommended.   The Mahi mahi fish taco was ok and had a spicy kick in it.  The Cheese dip chips was amazing!  The dipping of cheese and chili was perfect filling for the late night cravings. The Buffalo wings were ok.  It was a bit acidic for a late night food but the taste was still good.  Server was really busy and the whole place was understaffed.  On a Saturday night, one large section was held down by only one server.  He seemed very collected but I can tell, he was a little overwhelmed with the requests from each table.  We didn't bother him much but there was a tables that had many requests every time he walks by- not sure if the server forgot and had to be reminded or it was simply the patrons asking for different stuff each time.  I wouldn't mind coming back again especially for the prime rib and the cheese dip chips.

pIlCnbXdAm20PK0MFKh8RA.text: I hate overly priced restaurants. But when you are hankerin for something to eat and you are 25 stories up, overly priced doesn't seem so bad. This is a decent place to get a late nite bite or treat at Mandalay Bay. And for that only I give it 3 stars.   I certainly would't come here otherwise. But if I'm at Mandalay Bay I would.

S9PknPGV5m6O2LzJT7RLGA.text: A few colleagues and I stopped by Citizens Kitchen and Bar located in the Mandalay Bay Hotel on the evening of Monday, October 17th.  I ordered the French Dip which consisted of thin sliced prime rib, caramelized onions, Provolone cheese, and Au Jus.  It came with a side of fries (which were hot temperature wise and salted perfectly) and a pickle spear.  It was somewhat challenging to dip in the Au Jus because of the bread.  It was more of a hoagie bun and full of meat, so it made it hard to get that big sandwich into the little "cup" of Au Jus.  However, when I was able to dip it, it was good.  Justin, our waiter, was FANTASTIC!!!  He was very talkative and friendly, and checked up on us quite a bit to ensure that we had everything we needed.  He is an asset to the restaurant.  If you are hungry late night, or anytime really, then sneak into Citizens for a bite.  You'll walk away happy!

5SbMdoZJfvTrqWmaVNxuOA.text: As typical of Vegas casino food it's expensive. Let's get that out of the way. It's about $20 a plate. That said, the food is actually quite good. I came for breakfast and they were fast and very friendly. When I finished up they gave me some extra coffee in a to go cup which was very nice. Overall I'd certainly eat here again.

dkZecWfBPBSaXEINCjlmwA.text: Why can't I just give zero stars? The guy with glasses and earrings that takes the Togo orders was unbelievable.This happened on Sunday at 2:00am 4/29. There was a fridge that displayed sandwiches and other variety of treats. When we tried to order the food, the guy told us they don't have sandwiches and that we needed to order from the menu. We apologized and said we didn't see a sign so we weren't aware. He snapped at us and said "I AM YOUR SIGN." That's cute, haven't heard that one before. Is this the kind of customer service a restaurant at the Mandalay Bay should have? Sucks that I'm staying at the hotel and had to be treated like this. Maybe he didn't want to be there or he was having a bad day, doesn't matter though... you can't let that show when you're working. It's just not professional.

ddah7iAyZvL51NmVgRyLFQ.text: We ordered food from their cafe's counter. When we sat down at one of their tables, a server came to tell us that, because we didn't order directly from a server, we couldn't sit at a table. 95% of their tables were completely free. The server then reiterated "you have to leave"  Save your money for somewhere that doesn't kick out its customers.

houutVh1vq0_Zau--V45Hg.text: We had brunch here on vacation. We both ordered the ultimate breakfast. 2 eggs, bacon, homestyle potatoes and 3 pancakes. I had scrambled and my husband had over easy. The scrambled were fine but the over easy were overcooked. No runny yolk at all. Bacon and potatoes were good but cold. The pancakes were hands down the worst ever. They were cold, hard as a rock and sponge like. We tried cutting them with a knife and it was impossible. We ended up not eating them. I've had microwavable pancakes with more texture and flavor. Disappointing for a $21 A piece breakfast. Terrible slow service. The cafe wasn't even busy and it took forever to get cold food. The fact that it wasn't busy, in the main entry from Mandalay Bay to the restaurants, should have tipped us off that this was not the best choice.

0U_406lAHbz5FkGl1RVu3w.text: First off, a disclaimer.  I would like to point out that this experience happened while I was high on acid. This fact does not have any bearing on the specific rating of the food in general that will follow.   We entered the restaurant. I was greeted at the bar by a man that was quite muscularity toned and had a curly fancy mustache. He had a mildy creepy vibe about him, but he was nice. At this point I figured that I would just order a Reuben sandwich (one of my favorite go to's lately)  The food came and though the exterior was only lukewarm, the interior sandwich was what seemed like 600+ degrees and nearly resulted in 3rd degree oral burns. As I bit into the sandwich, it had the consistency and taste of what I can only imagine a mixture of elmers glue, sawdust and corned beef meat flavoring would taste like. How can you fuck up a Reuben sandwich this badly!?   It felt  like I was chewing sandpaper in my mouth. Remember now, my mouth is already burned by the hot coals of mysterious corned beef meat dust.  Unfortunately, this was all happening on top of loss of my overall perception of time and space. It was utterly horrible and terrifying as this moment started to replay over and over in my head. Mere seconds felt like hours.  I had to work very very VERY hard to eat through the sandwich that not only was shit, but also very highly priced. I proceeded to eat it because I was starving and wasn't going to be able to eat for a while. After complaining about the food with my buddy and also seeing that a fellow customer had walked out and complained about their food, we went onto the venue. It was at this point that I suddenly felt nauseously ill and proceeded to go to the bathroom to vomit profusely and watch this piece of shit sandwich enter the toilet in a plasmatic form all while mentally transforming through different layers of human existence and universes in my head due to the trip. After I had removed the majority of the sandwich from my system I realized that I had a little bit of coke left from the previous day.  I did a couple Trump bumps before exiting the bathroom.  Overall for food and atmosphere, I confidently rate this restaurant a - 1 out of 5.   EDIT. I just remembered that I had forgotten how shitty the cold French fries were. -5 out of 5. That's zero for you math geeks out there.

sQFvYlDTHua4uDN--TtTnA.text: This place is a haphazard operation late night with rude staff, poor quality food and unreasonable wait time PERIOD! The staff is unsupervised and behave as if they are going out of their way to serve. I stood back and watched. This is not aimed at an individual but the whole staffs' attitude towards customers. Something is definitely wrong. BTW, my comments are not from only one visit but three in the past 4 months. Good luck!

XJyywYGxucuW4iXtaeUbgQ.text: Our rodeo girls group and me sitting here now having breakfast of variety. All excellent and same service. Did not take long to get either, with the busy crowd.

T2ouwe-570DJ9eTXVzL2sQ.text: Worst host told my party of 3 to wait 15 minutes then proceeded to seat other people complain to manager disinterested in making it right

Exc9Ch8Q2PqCSagenoENMA.text: Best bloody Mary's in town and great service in the bar. I believe her name was Raquel.

wy_AGU4mvTP4khwpeNQgkQ.text: I ordered a Caramel Macchiato and I get this cup that is 1/4 full.  I was thinking "really"????  I went back and talked to the girl who made it and she was so rude.  She said it was an Italian macchiato. I don't care you don't serve a 1/4 cup of a shot with foam. Get smaller cups if that's what you are going to serve so the customer from Texas  isn't disappointed.  Secondly the girl says to me "what do u want?"    I said not this. I want more coffee and substance. Give me a Cappuccino. She handed me a cup without me knowing and I said is this mine?  She said yes.   Rude!   If you're not happy making customers happy. Find a new job!!!!!!!!

JESIojfY8M8qNzB-FnM1mQ.text: Stopped by here for lunch and was seated right away. They have a bar and wide range of food options. I had the quiche and mixed green salad. It was hot and delicious! I'm picky about quiche and this was excellent. The salad was fresh and had a nice lemon vinaigrette. Great service too. Would visit again. A little pricy but pretty much everything is in LV.

kaNtoaobuz2kg6eS27Pf6Q.text: The food here wasn't bad, but it wasn't particularly good either. Pair that with the relatively high prices ($9 breakfast burrito, $9 smoothies, etc) and it's not a particularly high value proposition.   The smoothie I got was the "Green..." something? I can't remember. But it had Kale and Avocado in it, and wasn't bad. My stomach wasn't feeling to great from a heavy dinner the night before, and it had a soothing effect. However it wan't the best kale smoothy I've had, and was probably the most expensive I've ever had at $9, so ehhh...   The breakfast burrito wasn't particularly good, but it was hearty and satisfying. They are pre-made in the morning, so you can't change anything about them. And while they are pre-made they need to be grilled to order, so they take quite some time. The worst of both worlds overall, but still was the best option for a relatively quick and hearty breakfast in the morning.   Still, we stopped by here almost every morning that we were staying at Mandalay bay for a business conference, as there really wasn't much competition for quick morning eats in the vicinity.   I would likely stop by and get food here if I was attending morning conference sessions at the Mandalay Bay conference center again, but probably not outside of that circumstance.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5vQzrL-W_9FKGyHTPtKHzQ.text: Fish and chips were plain and  fries were soggy. BBQ ribs were more flavorful than the fish and chips but doesn't compare to other places. Ordered a lemonade and the cups were beyond dirty and when I asked for another cup because of how dirty it was, he came back with another cup but it was just as dirty as if he took a washcloth and rubbed off the dirt. Beyond disgusted. Wouldn't come back. The bill was a whopping $65 for some plain food.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ ribs: $26 fish and chips: $25. It wasn&#39;t worth it honestly.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

3KtYCVbYcUsEx1BHwHHDSQ.text: Food is great but service here is terrible (Joseph) just makes excuses and has an attitude for not putting our apps in. Excuse after excuse just make the situation right just handled very poorly won't came back here because of Joseph

CmCWx_lcp8Hhv7-v9G9Mdw.text: I don't know about others, but my meal was awesome. Killer Reuben. Dad had a fab turkey burger. Great coffee and the server Robert was very attentive. We were here for lunch on a Monday so it wasn't too busy. Highly recommended!

jPULPxtRzOnG6C_tNRAtAg.text: Although Mandalay Bay already has a cafe(Raffles), the food here is very similar to Vegas cafes with exception of some specialty entrees. A little bit pricey for cafe food but pretty good quality.   Came here for dinner on a Saturday night, not too busy and were immediately seated. The server was very friendly, took our order right away and frequently came back to check on our table. There wasn't a long wait for the food to come out as compared to the irritatingly slow food at Raffles.  The Tuna Melt I ordered was superb! I know it's a simple dish, but you can tell a huge difference between the sandwich here and a $5.99 melt somewhere else. The tuna had great quality while the bread and cheese were grilled to perfection. I love the crunchy softness. My friend ordered the French Dip Steak which was very good as well.  This place is well-worth coming back to if it was comp'd again! haha But I'd probably just stick to a cheaper cafe or grill if I were craving a sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Melt w/Mac salad

6XNBv69wmIqWiTdFEsBUgQ.text: I am sure there are greater things on the menu rather than what I had ordered my first time here. I got the mac and cheese... and I was not able to finish it from how greasy and mushy it was. Not the right balance but I can't give a bad review based on just trying one thing! My drink tasted great and staff was friendly and quick in the wee hours of the night. Hopefully I have a chance to be there again to try something different

CyCar-EjGW7Ivt7xyUaRSw.text: Worst service ever!! I we ordered and decided to eat there. The waitress came over and told us we couldn't eat there that we had to move yet we had just paid there for food. Extremely upsetting I'll never be back'

6zk1O7oG8XYKI793Yvx9ig.text: Best French Dip I have ever had! Sit at the bar if you can, Steve the bartender will make your experience 10x!

PlqxR2LuortiGAtGthXVOw.text: The hostess is so nice. I love the healthy Ginger snap smoothie drink and I love that I was able to get a fresh ceasar salad quickly to go. Convenient and open 24 hours with great friendly service at the counter.

hASXfb0NdDUtK3qjm0quNw.text: We wound up eating here more than we meant to because of its location in Mandalay Bay and because it is open all night long. During our trip we ate here three times, once for breakfast, once for lunch and once at 4am..don't even know what you call that meal-- drunkfest?   For lunch I had the turkey burger which was about $20. It was nothing special but not terrible either. The cocktails we had at lunch were pretty decent.   Breakfast we had waffles and eggs... its hard to screw those up.   At 4am I don't recall exactly what we were eating.. I think it was probably waffles and french fries. The point is, they were open at 4 am and serving the entire menu! We couldn't get room service at the Delano at that time so Citizens saved us.   In sum, this place isn't fancy or all that great food-wise. It's basically like a diner (just more expensive than your average diner). I wouldn't eat dinner here but for a casual breakfast or lunch its just dandy.

4nYCUrym88QmH_NYFOtkHQ.text: Service is terrible. Hostess was very unfriendly. She said they are closed for transition from breakfast to lunch but offered no solutions. Was very rude and dismissive.

BMCj_-n7Xc4HQ5wXSu3lFQ.text: Burger is dry and cold, no sauce and cheese wouldn't even melt. I had to drink two glasses of water to swallow a bite. It gets stuck in your throat. The worst burger I've ever eaten, especially for $20.  The nachos are okay and the spinach artichoke dip is average at best. It is drunk people food and the only choice at 3:00 am. Next time I'll go to bed hungry.

_qR92Qmh9h4E2kIhM3Uk7A.text: Maybe one of my worst experiences dining out. Terrible service from several ppl with the terrible attitudes.

zz-uEWXofcHKtXQZ9J0y_w.text: Overpriced even for Vegas.  Bland dull food and horrible service.  There is no reason to go here

GnqgEofEisg9AfK7XurMtA.text: AMAZING! We stay at Mandela bay and Delano quite frequently and this is our go to breakfast, lunch and late night food spot! The Nachos, potato skins and frisco burger are some of our menu favorites.. great food for a good price! Your not going to pay "Vegas" prices here! Ejay is the best bartender and makes you feel like friend as soon as you sit down. Totally recommend CITIZENS!!

---D6-P4MpS86LYldBfX7w.text: I don't know why this place only has 3 stars but it's been a lifesaver for me! If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay and Looking to eat semi-healthy, not spend too much money and not looking to travel far, this place is perfect. The cafe is open 24 hours and they offer salads, sandwiches, wraps and smoothies. A much better alternative to late night French fries or the $19 room service Cobb salad before service charge and gratuity. The staff was friendly except when I asked for some hot sauce to go, one chick said not a word to me and slammed a bottle of Tabasco sauce on the counter in front of me without giving me a Togo Ramekin. I was tempted to walk away with the bottle. But I didn't. My tuna salad wrap was $11 and some change and pretty hearty. I saved the other half for later.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PaleiXbqmIxPTBENI-Wgig.text: Great  food  went there with friends big portions but my only beef is they got my order wrong and i had towait for my food but other wish great food and good service

Fof_IHAZzWoH98fkEOI4bg.text: Citizen is a cute restaurant located in Mandalay Bay.  While the food was really fresh and definitely enough to share ( translation huge portions ) the service was less than stellar .. the server was friendly but I had to remind her three times to get a glass of wine , then our sandwiches for a four top too over 45 minutes to arrive - they did bring us an order of fries for the table to "hold us over " ... I will admit the food was very fresh and very delicious - I highly recommend the turkey and avocado-sandwich on walnut cranberry  bread ... and they serve breakfast all day which is always a hot in my book !  Worth it but don't go if you are in a hurry !

NAULg7LmMpciu6Z004c7cw.text: Grabbed lunch here and was very impressed.  Their roast beef and onion wrap was incredible.  It was actual perfectly sliced roast beef and not the typical deli meat you'd find elsewhere.  You get a huge sandwich with a very generous amount of meat, I honestly could only eat half  The service was fantastic, extremely quick and efficient even during a busy lunch.  The staff where accommodating and helpful and prices very reasonable --especially for Vegas.  Tons of seating inside and just outside the restaurant.   Really enjoyed it.   They have a huge variety of food, desserts, coffees, teas and more.  Such a cool place.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jWmcOmxJBESBc47GVdf5FA.text: On the Saturday before the Super Bowl, my family and I were walking around Mandalay Bay and got hungry. We decided to sit on the patio of Citizens Kitchen and tried a couple great sandwiches. I had he into Turkey avocado and my wife tried the French dip sandwich. Both were really good and decently priced for the strip. We ended the meal with a chocolate sprinkled cupcake and it was sooo good. The coolest part of the meal, was meeting and getting pics with Charles Barkley. He was in Vegas for the Super Bowl and he was nice enough to take a few pics. When in Mandalay, give this place a try for lunch/dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of Citizen&#39;s Kitchen with Mr. Barkley
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sir Charles

p3FF9IjVjSd-yHL2QqW7JQ.text: Our breakfast was delicious! Great portions and very filling. The service was on par, we were in and out- not a long wait at all. 4 stars because of how pricey it is! I'd come back more & more if it wasn't so expensive just for breakfast.

PyR-9q3IsguJs5m2HuevCQ.text: Went for a late-ish breakfast, almost right before they stopped serving breakfast. Bailey our waitress was wonderful and rolled with the added to people to our group really well. The rest of the staff was friendly and she did what she could to take sure everyone was happy.  I got the skillet hash of the biscuits and gravy, skipped the poached eggs. The gravy was nicely flavored and had a good consistency. The biscuits were hard on the bottom but the top was fluffy and went well with the gravy. The seasoning on the potatoes was good too. They were able to make my special request of a cherry Pepsi and a soy milk caramel latte without any hassle or fuss. If you're unsure of them having a drink you like just ask they were very accommodating for our group. Priced like most other restaurant in Vegas but a good breakfast spot.

1a6uojAW4w4FzHeDtIp3XA.text: The breakfast menu is nicely varied and the food comes fairly quickly. However, service in general is slow and drinks don't get refilled. Had to ask another server for coffee creamer. Smoothies were good, but the burrito was bland and the French toast looked far better than it tasted. Compared to quality, the food is extremely pricey.

Elg7uZux_TQ15uMe9_Er7g.text: I've ate here twice when I've stayed at the Mandalay. I like it because it's a casual drop in restaurant where I can find any dish for each of my teens to eat. The food is great, the prices are a bit high for burgers and fries but then again there's no other place at the Mandalay that cost any less. I ordered the potato skin appetizer which was a small plate and decided to order the nachos as a meal thinking it was also a small plate. To my surprise the size of the nachos was nothing like the size of my other appetizer. The nachos were huge for one person, yet they were very delicious. The rest of my family got sandwiches and burgers that they very much enjoyed as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Burger
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich

jU7VbTW01vldAoPlpbbBLg.text: Prices are high while quality is low.   Ate here twice, should've trusted my gut and not have come back a second time.   First went for dinner to try their Prime Rib, order came out really fast. Everything on the plate was HUGE, beef, potato and broccoli. Baked potato's topping weren't proportionate to the size of the potato. Beef came out cooked properly, but wasn't hot temperature wise. Had pretty good flavor, but could be better.   Went back to try their breakfast. Again high prices for something that's just above or at par with places like ihop/Denny's. Pancakes were huge and unevenly cooked.m, didn't have much of the fruit flavoring as when cooked they just throw in big chunks of the fruit, into the batter so you don't get the even flavor you'd expect from blueberry/banana pancakes with each bite

V-__91E37QdzA5ly1BYjtg.text: Pretty much the only cafe in Mandalay Bay open 24/7. At 5 am, lots of folks were ending their day, I was just starting mine, looking to get a bite to eat and do a little work. They have a limited "late night/early morning" menu; breakfast menu doesn't start until 6:15 am.  I tried the breakfast burrito. I'll admit I'm a bit spoiled w/ the breakfast burritos we get in San Diego, but this one was pretty mediocre, especially for $16.  Not much flavor, and instead of coming w/ a side of fruit or potatoes, had a few bland tortilla chips on the side. And the "salsa" was bizarre. Super watery, no flavor. Kind of tasted like watered down tomato juice. Ordered a hot tea -- $5 for a cup of hot water and a tea bag. All in all, nearly $27 for a breakfast burrito and tea, including tax and tip. Honestly, the pre-made yogurt parfait for $7 looked a lot better; next time, I'm likely to just go with that.

3b8jD5ZJz2wpt1MFYMD5jA.text: We had a great time watching football here.  Its got a lot of space and seating, but still gets very crowded and hard to navigate quickly.  Tons of TVs and a great local beer selection.

QVwrV9Pt_4PluhdOlx_1vw.text: I went here because I was looking for the Subway and I just couldn't find it.  I was tired, hot, and very, very, hungry and I finally just said screw it, I'll eat here.  I got seated right away, but then didn't have service for about 10 minutes.  I was almost about to decide to go somewhere else, but then my waiter came.  He did apologize for my wait, and was prompt with everything else.  He was also EXTREMELY knowledgeable about the menu and the alcohol/wine/beers.    I got the lasagna, and I'm glad I did, because guys, this was one of the BEST LASAGNAS I have EVER had in my entire life.  I saw other plates near the people near me, and everything really looked good.  I wasn't hungry enough for dessert, but my waiter did recommend a few good looking things.    I would come back here in the future to eat again.

Uv7JzGrxVfOsBM6rAGWEsQ.text: Went for late dinner on Friday night and they were under staffed but the restaurant wasn't even busy, took 20 minutes for our waiter to see us then another 10 to get our waters, I ordered a lemonade and never got it. The food was good, I had the nachos which were huge, the restaurant service was mediocre. Definitely not a priority.  I went to their to go bar to get a dessert on Saturday night, waited in line for 20 minutes for 2 customers ahead of me to be seen. There was one girl on one register and a line behind me. The display shows a bunch of parties and desserts and it looks like they are ready to go, this is deceiving! The lady in front of me ordered 2 tartlets and was told she would have to wait 10-15 mins for them to be made. I asked if the apple pie came with ice cream which i was told yes it does. Then charged and told I would have to wait 5 minutes only because they have to warm it up "in the kitchen". I paid and proceeded to wait 15 minutes watching all the staff on breaks and one girl working. I then asked where my pie was and she said oh that come from "the kitchen" so it takes a while, as if the kitchen were in a different building! It finally came, no ice cream, I asked and she said I hadn't paid for it, I was too tired to care, I grabbed the box and the pie wasn't even warm... waste of time if you ask me and really sub par customer service. Maybe you can get away with that because it's Vegas but I was pretty upset at the cost for such bad service.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos, remember to ask for no olives... dont know who ever thought olives belonged on nachos??!!

pXX-13hKOyckiZKeEyFUFA.text: Had family in town at Mandalay and we ended up eating dinner here around 6:30 on a Monday. We ordered a variety of things and no one had complaints. Of what I personally tried; The French onion soup is delicious. Cheesy, flavorful, and the serving was generous.  The French dip was also tasty. Toasted bread, tender prime rib, and another generous serving-this time of hot au jus.  The fish and chips is light, flaky, and with a touch of salt and tartar sauce has great flavor. The coleslaw was underwhelming.  I had a Citizen Collins with my meal and that was a great addition.   There were more orders on the table, I just didn't get a chance to eat them all! Everyone enjoyed their meals, including the 3 kiddos we had in tow. Our service was prompt and for the serving sizes I feel like the prices are fair.   I'll definitely drop back in if I'm hungry and on the prowl in Mandalay!

QUIcJRZzv-ffXrwLPrJItQ.text: Hungry and tired at the end of a very long business conference and with midnight approaching, I needed to slow down and have a good meal. Nothing fancy, no complications, just a good meal.  Well, thank you, Citizens Kitchen. You nailed it.   Highlighted by an exceptional server in Junior, this visit was a combination of quality food with terrific customer service. Open 24/7 and located within the Mandalay Bay Casino, Citizens sat me immediately and provided a nice setting to finish my day. They have seating inside and outside the restaurant, with a fence to stay separated from the lobby gladiators.  I enjoyed their hamburger with bacon and pepper, cooked perfectly and a large portion. The tasty fries, fresh and hot, served in a standing container and seasoned so well, was an added fringe benefit. Pepsi products here.   Junior (the server) was truly awesome, as I think he quickly picked up that I was a bit fatigued, had been working, and just needed a quiet, unrushed meal. Great recommendation on the menu choice, always there to make the dinner a good experience, but never intrusive and pleasant throughout. I'm thankful for his professionalism.  Thankful for the security staff at the Mandalay for their recommendation, as it was a very positive experience.

dnCR7ienXLQ1-chrvj1-Kg.text: Disappointing for sure.  We waited roughly an hour and a half for our food (party of four) and the food was not even hot!  It was just "OK" at best... probably won't go back with all the other places around!

iwbgFggokTnDFXBrN9tI0Q.text: If you are staying at Mandalay Bay, this is a great place to stop to grab a quick bite to eat.  We dined here a few times when we were crunched for time and I was never disappointed. Service was also friendly.

tR6QC71Ji3pP9BhujmfG-Q.text: They gave me a coupon for free cheesecake when I checked in with a signature meal but when I showed the waiter he has no idea what was going on. The food was amazing though. Very loud due to live band right outside of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seating

7rfDZHUk5H5hXQEyxsHkcg.text: In a place where food portions is either gluttony or famine (I know it's not as catchy as feast or famine, but it's more accurate) Citizens sits just on the inside of gluttony. LoL By that I mean, that their plates are big because their portions demand it. The cool thing is that the food is actually really good. They have a Mac and cheese that's a mini goblet of cheesy, gooey goodness! The fish and chips is a combination of steak fries and what looked like a piece of flank, it was so big. I'm actually not sure what fish it was, but it was bigger than the traditional red, plastic basket that carried it. The meat loaf was a solid brick of flavorful meat, set in amazing mash, topped with fried onion strips and green beans (ease the guilt of the heavy eating) and a mouth watering brown gravy. Really good! The ribs are a full rack that was taken from Babe, the Big Blue Ox and cooked to perfection. The meat was so easy to peel off the bone all you had to do was talk to it and it fell off. Everything we tried was well worth the price they asked for. If I may offer a suggestion: for something like the ribs. Order one plate for two and if you feel you need more, add a side like Mac and cheese (once again, so good and portioned so it could be its own entree). It'll take the sting off the bill and you'll have a great meal. And as much as I love to indulge my sweet tooth, the portions won out this time and I had no space left. But I'm sure they make something pretty amazing and hearty as well.  Definitely a place I'd suggest to try. Especially if you're staying at the Mandalay or the Delano.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6oXg2KAJuweOsgEY2N7U6A.text: Went to this place twice as it is open 24 hours. We ordered the nachos with chicken and an order of wings. The nachos were loaded and had plenty of chicken. It was plentiful. The wings were ok, not bad. There's plenty of dessert and pastries to choose from the front as well. Service was great. I'd definitely go back when staying at the Mandalay Bay. See pics.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded nachos with chicken

Gq0c_RNgs4ASIk0kre56CQ.text: Unremarkable experience, food is overpriced ($$-$$$, I know it's Vegas) and service wasn't great at all. Even though it wasn't that busy, the service was lacking and the guy seemed rushed and seemed more like we were in a diner.   They have few bottled craft beers and wines. Came here for a late night drink and snack. Got the cheese quesadilla which was alright. My friends got the potato skins and the fish tacos. Overall not a great initial experience, not sure if I'd come back here again.

Z_yf0BuEI3odPvha6UMfeA.text: Now what is it about Vegas that makes you feel like you're constantly looking at a rear-view mirror? "Objects in the mirror appear closer than they are." Everything's bigger when I'm there, including my appetite once Jamie W. and I settled into a comfortable junior suite at Mandalay Bay. After a long drive and just before Jamie arrived, I was feeling mighty peckish but recognized dining options at a pricey resort are not so inclusive of solitary cheapskates like me. As I strolled among the restaurants and the hostesses in their strapless gowns, I came upon Citizens which turned out to be a slightly upscale 24-hour diner and bar. It's about three years old, so I wasn't familiar with the place. I took a look at the menu and noticed it was all-American comfort food with Vegas prices.
