I have to say I was starving since I had not eaten since an early morning breakfast at SFO airport. The $15 Caesar sounded good to me, but I didn't want to use up room in my belly reserved for meat. The server offered a small version for $5, which was frankly quite abundant by itself with plenty of romaine drenched in a lemon garlic dressing topped with a Parmesan crisp (photo: bit.ly/21GGabO). It wasn't an artful plate but it certainly hit the spot. Now back to the size thing I was alluding to before. I decided to throw caution to the wind and ordered the $36 Citizens Prime Rib Dinner, oh yes, by far the most expensive thing on the menu. What came out was a sizable cut of beef on the rare side but slow roasted apparently for 18 hours. It was satisfying enough with a nice crust though not as juicy or laden with au jus as I was hoping. There was a bit of sour cream on the side though surprisingly no horseradish. I should have asked for it, but the place was starting to hop at that hour. It came with a loaded baked potato heavy with a molten cheddar though the spud itself was a tad on the lukewarm side, while the steamed broccoli turned out to be one chewy stalk that required a sawing motion to get it into digestible portions (photo: bit.ly/1pnnNuG). I couldn't finish the meat, so I took the rest back to the room where there was serious gnawing throughout the weekend. FOOD - 3 stars...hits the spot when you're hungry and portions are abundant (consider the prices) but nothing really transcended AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...spacious enough for a resort restaurant SERVICE - 3.5 stars...servers buzz around a lot but pay attention when it matters TOTAL - 3 stars...definitely a more reasonably priced option anytime you want it at Mandalay Bay

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Caesar Salad
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked goods in front
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

1vkt-4GKH962hGLgM0JJPg.text: All I wanted was a low carb late breakfast but they only gave me a piece of egg with some bacon and a ton of potatoes which is not low carb. Then when I requested the check...it took half and hour to receive it. So unprofessional and no care in the world! I would blast this review all over social media because despite that I mentioned what happen, the didn't care in the world.

Huk1i0dc-IAu2AIgMt8k7A.text: 7$ for extremely bitter orange juice concentrate. You can tell this spot is trying to cut corners in product quality all around with their food. Should have believed the ratings and skipped this.

eS06ZJLCJzKur0by--09OA.text: Great place to come in the 3am hour when you're locked out of your room over a misunderstood comment with your lover while gambling at the local greenways.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At Citizens Eatery, there not much bull going down...well maybe a little bit.

Dnkxh_g8qwCCtsgmPAi2UA.text: Easy location and fun ambiance but for the price, the food is just ok. I ended up going twice because I was staying in the hotel for a convention. Their coffee actually isn't bad and it's serve yourself. The bacon, egg cheddar sandwich was just ok and I didn't care for the side of potatoes at all. The 2nd time I got the corned beef hash and it was a bit bland and dry. I had to ask for more hollandaise sauce and hot sauce. Like I said, not bad but for the price, I'd expect more.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good corned beef hash skillet

viH4MtaK0blx-7uyShvEbA.text: A few of my co-workers decided to have some breakfast before our Zappos Company All Hands meeting and this was our choice.  None of us have ever been here and we love trying out new places to eat. Breakfast was on our minds and we were happy to have chosen this place.  I'll be honest, the food was amazing but I felt that it is just shy of being unique. The menu had some really great ideas but I feel like some items could be easily found in other restaurants. I think I may have to come back in the future and see if they've found their True character and add new items that would showcase the True essence of what this restaurant could be.  For that reason, I gave 4 stars.  But, let me share what I did love. The customer  experience. From the hostesses who greeted us and our waitress Jenna who was the most gracious host, was very attentive and made sure we were doing well throughout the whole time we were there.  The food was delicious. My cheesecake and creme brulee French toast was delicious. Huge in portion with fresh fruit and a nice orange creme was really good. I think to take this dish up a notch would be maybe add the brulee experience.   My coworkers ordered the Ham and eggs plate, bagels lox, & the crab cake Benedict (great idea).  The pastry counter wasn't really impressive, many of the items resemble pastries I could purchase at a commercial cafe chain.  The food and experience though, was just right for myself and my colleagues.  If you're looking for some breakfast, this could be your go to choice.   If Jenna is your waitress, you'll be in good hands!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance way
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastries
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance from inside of Mandalay Bay

tfuz4zu1CqOPYV3X5Q6Esg.text: Good spot! Planning our next trip with friends to Mandalay and everyone has said they want to come back to Citizens. We've always had good service and good food here. Everyone in our group enjoyed the fish and chips, fish portion was HUGE. Also very popular the Ultimate Mary, it's a yummy loaded Bloody Mary. On this trip we plan on checking out the breakfast options. See you soon Citizens!

jh2TZ-LiSnDAUE4sUagqPQ.text: I'm a bit saddened to be writing this review and scoring Citizens a 2. We've been coming to Citizens now for quite some time. We visit Vegas about 3-4 times per year, most times staying at Delano. We've sometimes had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here in a single day just because we know we could always get a super solid meal no matter the time of day or night, even late late night since it's 24 hours. A few weekends ago we were here and were so incredibly disappointed with the Ruben. It tasted like minced meat. Like as if we got the last of the. corned beef shavings. The fries were tasteless and cold. Last weekend when we were here in Vegas, we passed. We are back again this weekend and thought we'd give it a go HOPING it was a "one-off" a few weeks ago. Nope. We were sadly disappointed.  Tonight we had a tuna melt and fries along with chicken noodle soup. The sandwich was decent. The chicken noodle soup is $11! Yep. It's a lot right? But in the past...SO worth the $11!! Tonight I just couldn't do it. I couldn't eat it. I suggested to our server that I was given some sort of beef broth type soup. She insisted it was chicken noodle. There's NO way what was served was chicken and chicken noodle soup at that. She said it was dark meat. If it was it had a beefy taste and the broth tasted like beef and the broth was brown. I couldn't pay $11 to not eat it.   I guess we'll have to find a new fave. We're super sad about it. It's just too expensive for it not to be good.   So why a 1 star rating? Decent size portions - but only matters if the food is good. Nice atmosphere. Can hear the live music from the bar. And hubs does love the $25 Bloody Mary.

8yHjXlZGMsbqpZ98ogRAvg.text: Had lunch here today and was super happy with everything. Our server Nick made our experience enjoyable and was very knowledgeable! He suggested the fish tacos for myself and they were super good! Definitely will return and recommend to others.

gR1yNw_zxN6l1ENtY_FwQw.text: Sadly this is a bad experience , since Mandalay bay is my favorite casino. Poor service we sat at the bar , my friend order  a hamburger that came well done when we ask for medium. Krick the bartender give me my beer and no glass so I have to ask for a glass   Very poor service so sad that my favorite casino  has this service.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oOZY8XBgbvneaQRTuXk5aQ.text: We went to citizens for a late night meal, we were sat on the patio, alone,  even though there were many open seats inside. The patio area was very loud due to live music from the lounge across the way, so loud we couldn't hear each other speak. Our waiter never refilled our drinks and when he brought our check he told us multiple times that he told people we were VIP... I'm not sure why he'd say that.You don't ignore VIP clientel. We were very disappointed with our experience and will try our places on our next trip to Vegas.

N584zQ0BljP0jn9ugF9pDQ.text: Service was horrible!  We had a waiter named Jason who was very upset, was not pleasant at all towards our party.  I understand it's 2am however you have chosen to work here. In Vegas- as a waiter please be a little more understanding and smile a little!  Jason if you're reading this, be sure  you wait on your tables accordingly, you don't want your party to give you bad reviews. Nor make the company seem to have bad ratings!  Also as for the food!  The salad chicken was very dry, no water was given!  The pizza was 4 minutes as our waiter said to us it was!  So meaning it's from a freezer!  Also the drinks were never refilled!

cu_zLk1BydXGDWGp1WgxUg.text: If you don't have time to waste do go here. Service was slow and poor. However if you have some time to kill I would recommend it it for sure for the food. Food was amazing. Food it's 5 stars. Service gets 2.

89ErIzba3FS9EUvrPqkDXg.text: The food was fresh and vibrant, the service was attentive and the atmosphere was modern and whimsical.  I had the Greek omelette for breakfast and my man had the salmon omelette- both were fabulous and we are going back tomorrow.  Our server was Laura.  Thank you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

64bT672a1TifCoOHcb-npA.text: We kind of happened upon this place.  We only sat at the bar~ but it is one of the great memories of the trip.  We had the best bartender we have interacted with to date in Vegas. Personable and friendly and makes mean drinks!!! Cheers to you Eric!  Your the best. They are lucky to have you.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o9dMtCJaQ6EIbHTFittCMA.text: My wife and I consider this restaurant our favorite in Las Vegas. You may find it peculiar, however for $49 having prime rib that's like butter in your mouth is absolutely ridiculous. The deal also comes with a glass of wine a Caesar salad as well as great waitstaff. It is also of note the fish and chips or equally as awesome.  Every time we come into Las Vegas, we always ask for Bailey to serve our table. She is absolutely amazing and we highly recommend that you see her if you decide to go by this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c-R0f4nrGHInOurdtfSAlg.text: FOOD was good, we ordered nachos, for the price not enough cheese $18...IDIOT'S nachos are supposed to have plenty of cheese unless someone requests otherwise, we asked for unsweetened iced tea and our waiter brought us sweetened, when we asked was it sweetened iced tea he replied it supposed to be unsweetened,  he looked irritated like we were in charge of serving our own iced tea, it was DAMN we are paying for it,  its not like were asking for it to be free, LUXOR dont hire waiter's or waitresses that have ZERO customer service,  pay attention managers

3ZyfCXakTEvQzQa6u3gYYg.text: Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. Staff moves at turtle speed. I witnessed 6 perfect looking salads and 3 veggie cups be made and thrown in the trash right in front of customers. I saw the girl making my wrap push down on the cutting board making tummy wrap roll off the board, which she caught with her pants/shirt but continued to pack it into the to-go box anyways. Disgusting place, horrible service, completely wasteful. Would never come back. Would never recommend. There are way better places. Food was completely flavorless to top it off.

Jn8qwQB-meF3YkKPZ_wUrg.text: Not bad for breakfast after a night of gambling before checking out and heading to the airport. Pricey? A bit, but it's Vegas, people! You want cheap? Leave the hotel & run across the street to McDonalds. Great cocktails - the Bloody Mary came in more of a bucket than a glass, lol, and was perfect. The corned beef w/poached eggs & hollandaise was delicious and a huge portion, in addition to the chilaquiles. Good stuff!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7iYgDLZnmCOAF3NeY7yKZg.text: Had dinner here on my last visit to Vegas and it was just okay.  Honestly, I was travelling solo on business and it was the only resto in Mandalay Bay that had open tables so, I really didn't have a choice.  I ordered their French Onion Soup to start, which was pretty good.  It was definitely cheesy and baked to perfection but the broth wasn't as robust as I'd hope it would be, however, they sure didn't skimp on the onions!  Soup was $12.  For my entree, I had their Lobster Roll w/Pasta Salad.  I've had my taste of what a True Lobster Roll tastes like from a couple spots in the East Coast.  Unfortunately, this Lobster Roll had more pieces of celery than lobster; it was really disappointing, especially with a $23 price tag. The Pasta Salad also seemed like it was under cooked; the pasta that is.  Overall, there are FAR, FAR, FAR better spots to eat in Vegas, can't speak for the other restos in Mandalay Bay.  So, unless you're in a pinch like I was, I'd skip this place.

4acm_LM8ZYR7Bu1Tah60nA.text: Elevated comfort food like a rueben, grilled cheese, burger, etc. Great service. Had the Cesar salad and chicken noodle soup. The salad was a great size and the small soup went perfectly together. All of the soup ingredients were the exactly same size so you got all the groceries in each bite.  Felt great to eat after a long weekend of indulgence. Fantastic people watching if you sit on the patio. Will return with friends.

95v5lvXFQJxfqyWP1U8EEw.text: Loved their brunch! Crab cake Benedict was awesome. Tried the Lox and Bagels and really enjoyed it! Always have fabulous customer service as well!

cNR_A_6vdIyAW9WXkDeHDA.text: Yes, we went on their opening day but still, 2 hours for a lunch that consisted of a couple of sandwiches and a salad is completely unacceptable.  Since this place was Red, White and Blue like 5 minutes ago, I'm 99% sure they just re-branded the place and didn't replace their entire staff.  Of course, I could be completely wrong about that.  Even so, for a restaurant that was less than half full, they should have it together enough to throw some sandwiches on a plate.  On the bright side, our server was nice and always had our drinks refilled.  The food, once we got it, was decent.  My Greek salad was huge, although, I'm not sure it was Greek so much as an Italian chopped salad like the kind you'd get at your favorite pizza joint.  The salmon that I ordered with it was, despite being heavily over seasoned, cooked very well and pretty good.  The portions are huge but for the $32 I spent on a salad and an iced tea, I still think it's pretty steep, although probably on par with the rest of the hotel outlets.  It does look like they've put some thought and effort into their beverage program, which I appreciate.  I've been dying to try the new Bombay Sapphire East, which they have here and nowhere else that I've seen in the hotel.  They've also come up with a cocktail menu that looks like they've tried to put twists on some of what seem to be Vegas' most popular drinks.  If I hadn't been working, I would have given them a go.  Honestly, I probably won't ever come back for lunch because I will most likely be fired for being gone so long again.  Since I basically live at the Mandalay Bay for work, I'm sure I'll be back at some point.  Hopefully with a lot of time on my hands.

zjdJjHzzpKqAgmlT0IssPA.text: Typical Las Vegas hotel restaurant. Everything is an up charge. My boyfriend had the eggs Benedict while I had the waffle and that's all you get - the waffle. We paid extra for fruit and extra for a side of bacon (like $7 for 6 pieces!!!). This place is only worth if you're staying at the Mandalay Bay or maybe even The Luxor, otherwise I'd go elsewhere.

-h_Y53MzVO-Ud83JIV9lEA.text: Average food at best, slow service and overpriced. Ate there twice due to the location and an invite from a friend..........if not for the location, this place would be out of business.

lGE5QAz9GOyPlR3mhiZiUg.text: Went in for a quick lunch and sat at the bar.  Raquel I believe was the bartenders name, though it was a bit busy she was very quick to get my drink and food order! Loved her Great positive attitude! Marjorie  the manager was very nice as well. She Came by to check up on guest. Food was great. Overall awesome experience. Will definitely be coming back!

DMX3nEwU_85CrmLZuQK2_w.text: We stayed at the Mandalay Bay and ate at Citizens twice; one for a rather late dinner on the night of our arrival, and then again for a more reasonably timed dinner.  Yes, the prices are a bit high, but it's Vegas and compared to other places, this really wasn't so bad.  Plus, the portions are large, which always helps with the sticker shock.  In our visits we had the chicken club, turkey burger, tots, onion soup, calamari, and bacon burger.  Everything was good, no complaints.  The onion soup comes in a HUGE mug, so note that it's not really an appetizer type soup.  Thankfully I saw someone eating it otherwise I likely would have ordered way too much food!  The hours were great as it was the only food option that was open when we arrived.

2NmlwlDMioVwd9yZZL2OkA.text: Awful service. Rude server. Our family waited 20 minutes for our breakfast orders before we decided to walk out. Manager defended her slow kitchen and tried to justify why another family of five next to us who seat down after us got served before us. Overpriced too. Skip Citizen and to the buffet if at Mandelay.

ohtQLHgW0t67ZGFxO-0l8A.text: When you've been out having fun all night and its 4am, this is the place to go. I had a fantastic burger here, and the fries were hand cut and amazing. Definitely will return on my next trip to Vegas.

DrwVoEwvBgdTgCrJHN2t1g.text: We come to Vegas all the time and Citizens is one of our favorite places! Addison is a super friendly face that greets you at the host stand! Lotus served us and took great care of us! Food and drink are wonderful!

esU3rLhDUOqoKiuT4tCtWQ.text: Excellent food, great atmosphere. Emily the hostess was very sweet - not stuffy.  She was accommodating to me with my electric wheelchair and made sure i felt comfortable - Which is a big deal to hubby and I. Waiter Chris H. was outstanding - very attentive & made us feel like we were his only customers - my drink never ran low and he told us what to expect with our choices. Think french brasserie. No idea why this place is rated 3. Hubby and I enjoyed our food. I had a huge plate of fish and chips (best I've had) white fish was not fishy and breading was super light, flaky and out of this world. Hubby had prime rib special. Very large piece of meat and was tender - delicious. We will be back for sure. Pleasantly surprised. Eat here!

wd-KFk1tmDeowQgFDh6V3Q.text: Don't order any steaks but the breakfast food and ultimate Bloody Mary was awesome. I would recommend just visiting the bar and doing appetizers. Entrees weren't much to speak of.

h_XZQrmUe8DDv6AYSu_Odg.text: Lovely place..Came here 3 days in a row and never disappointed..Loved the way Glen and Chris served..Amazing food..Good quantity..do recommend

LsJFSsN_EpmD5NZLLmRywg.text: Food was OK but service was very, very slow :c After looking at my food and reading some of the reviews, I hope I don't get food poisoning.

8HNcNC5Ptskxmfk-LCu5fQ.text: Great for breafast, always a seat open at the bar with sports on for a quick bite. Its not too pricey and is easy to get in and out with some food and drinks.   Service: Our bartender/waitress was awesome, the food took awhile though...

sNfAM3A7bYMlPEihNowRZw.text: Cool little joint. When I am in town this place is a solid stop for breakfast and lunch.  RaqveL at the bar is awesome! Friendly and informative.  Made the visit worth it!

Ycwzgmt8R_K2quEQlYvC0g.text: My wife and I stopped in here after a night of fun, and arrived with a slight hangover...  At the suggestion of our waitress - I ordered their meatball sub. The meatballs were pretty flavorful and had a nice consistency. They proclaim on the menu that their sauce is a "12 hour" sauce, but I couldn't really tell because there wasn't enough of it on the sub... The best part though was definitely the sub bun, which was slightly toasted and had the perfect balance of crispy on the outside and soft on inside. My wife order the BBQ pork sandwich, which she enjoyed. Her only knock on it was that it was supposed to have jalapeno's incorporated into the BBQ pork, but she did not seem to taste them in her sandwich. Aside from that, the pork was good. Once again - the shining star of the sandwich was the bread. For our side, we both ordered the seasoned waffle fries, and they were excellent.

vhI1syQcfypLnyDIOMFgGg.text: Really overpriced food! I really wouldn't mind the prices if the food was worth it, but my Brick Chicken was too dry and seriously wasn't worth 24 dollars. The portion for that thing was too small.   Go somewhere else to get better food in Vegas. Even when the place was empty the food took forever to come out!

0R_mHzVJpVOJQJe7wio4JA.text: First, let's talk exterior because obviously this is the first thing you see. It looks like a "Home Decor" Pinterest fan's wet dream. Everything about it is cute, warm, and welcoming - definitely a step away from the chic, haute couture-esque vibes that other Light Group places like Yellowtail & Stack aim for.   This review is only for the beverage & such service, but I don't think it's going to be too far from home. I was meeting a girlfriend at the bar for some drinks after a long workweek and we settled on Citizens because neither of us had been.   The restaurant was pretty much empty save for the bartop, which was close to being full. Next to us were a group of what looked like A/V or production guys that were just out from a gig at the House of Blues. With no seats, my friend and I posted up at the bar, and were quickly provided bar stools by two observant servers. The bartender was nice but it was hard to get a hold of her when we needed the check.   I am usually a fan of Light Group venues for the most part, but this one just didn't quite seem to hit the mark. It seems like it could be something really great, but maybe it was just too much hype too soon?

ORNz7_bZZxGgbyGFuJyQ7A.text: We spent New Years Eve/20th anniversary at Mandalay this year. We ate 4 out of 6 meals here!! Wonderful food and service, whether it was 10:00 am or 3:00 am we totally enjoyed every bite!  We are both dying for the Crab Benedict and BEST prime rib in Vegas! Hats off to the whole team!

Fw6f7H0jgtQ5RbFOU1oagQ.text: I had the triple bacon burger which was a standard burger with 3 strips of bacon... There is something to be said about truth in advertising. I had the hamhock mac n cheese. The pasta was a bit over cooked for my taste. However, you do get the smokieness of the hamhock. If the pasta was bit less overdone, it would be one of my favorite mac n cheese plates. The burger is juicy with everything served on the side, mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles are on the side. You add whatever you want to add to it.

M3NS4ltZC4brnhTLmq8Org.text: This is the perfect late night spot. The food is actually pretty damn amazing. We had the French onion soup, the blue cheese burger and the mahi tacos. So glad we went. Would definitely go again.

AANwGzO471_QcB_NQMAsqw.text: I ended up here after the Mandalay's unknowledgeable staff said this was the only cafe in the hotel and I was deeply disappointed.  We ordered the prime rib and meatloaf and a couple of crappy signature drinks that escape me right now. The red flag should have been when the food arrived in less than 10 minutes, but I was hoping they were just ridiculously efficient. I tasted the meatloaf and that was OK, good even, but worth $25+? Absolutely not. The prime rib was $31 and served with 3 onion rings. It was cold, chewy, and tasteless. On a positive, service was attentive so no issues there. I, for sure won't be planning to come back, its WAAAYYYY overpriced and just not that great.

TovWn3Zsfm-XSgtO82PtqQ.text: I'm sorry but the cashier had a very bad attitude and literally made us stand aside and wait thru 20+ more customers when finally another gal who had originally taken our order realized we were STILL waiting! She gave the girl at the register a look as to WHY didn't you call out their order?? She ran and got the cake. In all we waited almost 30 minutes for 2 pieces of ALREADY made cake while people after us actually were getting HOT food!!!

_h16qIlbQlAqnbs_lwAhgw.text: Located in the Madalay Bay which was perfect after partying.  I had the Chicken Quesadilla which was really good.  My friend had the Turkey Burger which she loved and other friend had Potatoe Skins.  We all liked what we ordered.  Great spot to go to after hanging out in Madalay.

MGvzU5AwLmfmC-OlcqPFSA.text: I wish I had lower than a star for this restaurant. First, Price posted on a filet mignon was 37 while when seated, the menu showed it 39. The waiters were fine but the food was not a filet mignon but a steak. I ordered medium to well, which I always order like that but it came so dry. I wasted my money for sure. Juice 5 dollars a glass, refill is the same cost. There's apparently no restaurant manager ensuring that everyone is attended. You are on the mercy of waiters' attention.

AGB3iStdifpL6h88_IuEzg.text: - - FOOD POISON - - BAD SERVICE - - AWFUL MANAGEMENT - -  We stayed at Mandalay Bay for our Vegas trip and decided to get something to eat late night, unfortunately the only place open was Citizens Kitchen. We walked in and got seated, the server had problems taking our orders and since he thought he could remember everything without writing it down he then brought out some of the food wrong. It took them 30-35minutes to bring out the food. No one wants to wait that long for food at 2am. Five out of  six people ordered the same food and it was the Burger and let me tell you that the vacation ended right there! Every single person had the worst stomach pain and you can imagine the rest!  I asked for a refund  the following day,  the managers told me that I should send an email with my experience so they could look it over, Nick one of the managers actually tried to help and he told us that they were very embarrassed over this and would do anything to fix it so he asked for the receipt and that he would refund the money, until today I only received $45 out of almost $180, they couldn't even track our bill and refund the rest being that they have an advanced POS system. It took them 3 weeks to refund the $45 while I had to text and call everyday.  Two of the five  people that had food poisoning  actually went to the doctors the day after and were told that it was 100% food poisoning.  Save yourself some time  and pain, do not  go to this place. It has awful food and service. I will never go back to this place and will never ever recommended this place to anyone!  - - - FOOD POISONING IN VEGAS ON YOUR 1st DAY OF VACATION, HOW MUCH FUN IS THAT - - -    Manadalay Bay should seriously think about renting to this place since they are inside of this hotel and getting so many bad reviews...........

Ew7KoloO9h_oxhJqi18Nmg.text: The hostess seated us fairly quickly, and I like the outside tables. Our waiter was rude, and didn't really take care of us, but it's open 24-7. Important in VEGAS.

4yTYqYeqq56dTVoCoiKUww.text: We stopped in after seeing the Michael Jackson ONE show and everything was fantastic. The server was very attentive and the food off the charts good. I had a chicken Caesar salad and it was the best I've ever eaten. With a slight citrus spin, the salad was amazing.

J2ctzAmd74pzEx--V32awQ.text: Not sure what all the other hater comments are about but I liked this place so much I went twice during my stay at Mandalay Bay. The first time I was looking for some breakfast food in the hotel to bring back to the wife who was still sleeping in the room. This place was perfect!  They had a great breakfast menu that you can get to-go to include espresso drinks. The wait for the food isn't too bad. The price is reasonable considering you are at a Vegas resort. They have several smoothie options and their sandwiches are stuffed with lots of meat. Check this place out if you are staying at Mandalay Bay and don't feel like going to one of the pricier restaurants.

TNJ90M9jVKfiGu0okTrj-w.text: Delicious sandwiches! Great fresh juice selections. Convenient location for a quick bite.

vc0QBXt_V0DyDvwIdlkVEg.text: Chicken soup comes in a square bowl, large portion, 3.5 stars for the taste.  French dip was also 3.5 stars, an additional pickle spear would be nice... Fish and chips is served with tartar and cocktail sauce, 4 stars.

vdkJrCZ8jObsDdBopA_Y4A.text: French dip and shrimp cocktail were awesome. George Q. Was a great waiter. Ask for him if you get a chance. Coming back for sure!

cjVhsEGTPTLdXOP1YZpTWw.text: 1 = never go here; 5 = you must go here; that is what the stars mean to me. This is exactly why this place got 3 stars. I wouldn't put it in the never go here camp or the must visit. It's food is decent, ambiance is decent (loud at times) and service was nothing to rave about. I got the au jus sandwich which was not bad. If you can't make a decision on where to eat and your strolling through the Mandalay this place will work as it won't excite or disappoint you (at least too much).

AC5_cWn0NTIT3zjxOKzZZg.text: Stayed at the Mandalay and ate here for most meals. The food is delicious and most of the staff pleasant but I have to agree with another reviewer that the bartender was unpleasant, if the same one? I think she had a nose ring or some other facial piercing. Asked for a Diet Coke and she asked if Pepsi was ok and I said no thank you and she gave me a sour look. I don't like Pepsi, ok!? At any rate, the food is delicious, juices are also great (9 bucks a pop though, no surprise there for LV).

XOsrL8mpf1bi7MHG1xNJ7Q.text: Got appetizers here with my girlfriend at 1 in the morning after failing to find a 24 hour pizza joint. The kobe chili was excellent, and the calamari was good as well. The chorizo queso was too salty and had a weird texture.

XsFWYsbAW8iDin_njxGxeQ.text: Good restaurant with a great selection of items. Menu has items that are good at any time of the day, and they're also open late.

ShwVgy566_bPu_hmn1EyFg.text: Dakota is AMAZING!  Highly recommended! He did such a great job on recommending drinks and food. He also told us tips and fun things to do next. Super personable.

n6_qQogQKJ78B7y_pWsi3g.text: There's a billion people behind the counter and yet they can't seem to get an order correct or out in a timely fashion.

Fs6m-rxcL-SJuHbVNrtWnQ.text: There was a time Vegas was a cheap thrill now it is neither.  To my review in a word gastric upset.  Had the Bolognese tasted ok but oh boy get a few magazines.   It not being at serving temp should have clued me in.

irXhqRkqCdz2z9M-uNxOyA.text: This was just so so for me.  I would have expected it to be better since the look and feel of it is really nice.  The girl at the counter that helped us seemed to hate her job though.  She wasn't at all polite or interested, as if we were bother her.    I ordered soup and a sandwich to go.  As soon as I left I realized there wasn't a spoon for the soup in the bag so I went back.  When I asked for a spoon she told me I'd have to wait for her to get more from the box.  She then spent the next 10 minutes messing around with making someone else food.    In the end the "box" she needed was right next to her.  I waited until my soup was almost cold to get a spoon.  Seriously ?  This was by far the worst experience of my trip.  The food was good

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aside from the attitude of the cashier , place seems ok

DLcTljJNJsIivjwG9CSo4g.text: Spend your money elsewhere!!!! The music is RIDICULOUSLY loud. I don't know how anyone inside could have a conversation. We asked to be seated outside because we did not want to eat breakfast and have to yell at each other. The hostess said she'd tell her manager, but that didn't happen. We are still sitting here and it's blasting. Extremely inappropriate for a morning setting. We ordered coffee and water and received those pretty quickly. Not sure what is up with the water here, but it was disgusting. We also received them in skinny glasses without ice, while tables around us received them in bigger glasses with ice. The waitress took our order and it's easily been 20 minutes and we have not gotten our order. There is a couple that was seated about 10 minutes after us and they already received their food. Are you freaking serious?!?   (10 minutes later) ANOTHER table was given their food that came in 5 minutes ago. If I could give this place zero stars I would. Our waitress never checked on us to tell us why the food was taking so long. So we left. HORRID service. Now I see why they have such mixed reviews. I guess if you complain about the music they treat you like shit.

OvWj1VxjM5zc6HBqkmc7dg.text: Great place to grab breakfast and possibly lunch.  It is very casual so if you are rolling out of bed after a night of partying hard in Vegas this is your place.  I have to say if you like dark coffee you will love Citizens.  I do not like a dark brew but when you need coffee anything will do.  I like their yogurt parfaits and their bacon (maple) for a quick breakfast.  Hubby devoured their pancakes so they must have been yummy.    The decor kind of reminds me of a diner with a more upscale feel (subway tile and wine bottles).  There is a dinner menu but to me there are so many other places in Mandalay to eat that this is not where I would choose to go.

pssB383p5uVN0dKJiJaWvw.text: Had dinner here tonight before the Ellie Goulding concert. Ordered the nachos with chicken which were listed as $16 plus $6 for chicken.   Some how they changed the price to $22 plus $6 for the chicken so I paid $30 for nachos....I understand this is a hotel but $30 for a plate of regular nachos is just ridiculous.   Luckily we still made it to the concert on time and I could have stayed and complained about the $6 up charge but I just wanted to get to the concert on time.   So overall I won't be back unless someone talks me into returning. Waste of $30 plus $4 for a soda....

Diyng0MihCQrilBYfNcYng.text: Good, but not great. Large portions to make up for overpriced menu, but honestly I don't need extra food that I'm not going to eat anyway.   Best thing on the menu: Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos! These in themselves deserve 4.5 stars (the -.5 because it was served with large serving of salsa, sour cream, and guac when each taco was already topped with pico, lime creme sauce, and an avocado slice. waste of good guac unless you want to bring me out some chips). So so so good.  Most "meh" thing on the menu: Mac & Cheese. I'm a huge mac and cheese fan, and I didn't have any desire to finish this one. Cheese sauce was lacking a cheese flavor. Ham is a good idea, but lets focus on the fundamentals first.   Service was slow. Very nice people, but 80 minutes for lunch? I get it's busy but come on guys, get us out of there in a reasonable time.

-ZW6Cj5nNLdIqs_MrYGTsw.text: Great place to fuel up before you hit the clubs !!    Portions are huge and delicious, FISH & CHIPS BOMB. Steak was lovely and tasty. Food great

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Fish &amp; Chips I&#39;ve had in a long time. Fries were right on
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The angle doesn&#39;t justify the size of the plate !! Everything was delicious, great taste, great flavor and great portions

BLMGvhlL8nZHdPcaWzpUqg.text: Please do not go here. Worst food ever, and worse yet it is way overpriced. Paid 7.50 for frozen fries and another 11 for a soggy kale salad. Everything else on our table was horrible. Just do yourself a favor and go elsewhere or just go to sleep.

dfxdvWjYnaJ4VIh1ZSbTjA.text: Sandwiches are gross, it's expensive, and was a really long wait. It sucks it was the only place open late in MB. It sucked.

GLinMgeJ6mzW6C5yzUiccQ.text: I was surprised that this place had such negative reviews.  We had breakfast here and we all liked it. The food was good, the prices were decent and the atmosphere was nice. Our server Shanna was very nice, personable and accommodating. Megan the hostess had great customer service on the phone too!

lUDQggn4C5m1PNclj5Kl_Q.text: I enjoyed this place for lunch and breakfast (we came here twice during our trip to Vegas). It's located in Mandalay Bay, so it was close to us since we were staying at the Luxor.   The service here was good, and prices are pretty affordable for being on The Strip. It's a casual place that's not affiliated with a celebrity chef, so you'll never have to wait for a table.   Items we tried:  - French Onion Soup: HUGE portion. I think this is easily a two person starter. It was very flavorful, and had lots of cheese. The previous Yelp reviews on this did not disappoint.   - Kobe Chili Cheese Fries: I saw "Kobe" on the menu and knew I had to order it. Seasoned waffle fries came out with Kobe beef chili and a mini pitcher of nacho cheese. It was good, but it was very high in sodium (probably all chili cheese fries are). I would suggest trying this if you like chili cheese fries.   - 2 Eggs Any Style Breakfast: Yum! The tater tots were delicious! I ordered scrambled eggs and they were good. Not rubbery at all. If you order bacon as your meat, you will get three slices. It's breakfast, so it's hard to really mess this up.   Overall, I good casual spot for a quick meal if you're hungry and don't want to leave the area.

GxNdPBlHn_K9n8j3rTYJPA.text: Everything we ordered lacked flavor. Service was ok. Pricing was high for the quality of food.

9vvjUsKHnLmQpTtvD47FUg.text: Food was expensive, and extremely mediocre.  It was a convenient spot for dinner, considering I was staying at the Mandalay Bay and it's pretty much at the end of the strip.  I could tell that the waiter was trying really hard to provide good service, but overall, I wasn't too happy. The restaurant was relatively empty, but we still had to ask for simple things like water refills, bread, and condiments. (Bread was stale and toasted to warm, just sad.)  The food didn't make up for it either. If I am ever in the area again, I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese fries
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side salad

Fv6UuDmBb5nvrFfu-Bn9eA.text: Perfect for a sit down meal or grab and go! You can't beat the location smack dab in the middle Mandalay Bay!

08_GCfeM3-rwZZV_t7ab5w.text: BRUNCH TIME! Love the French Toast and Turkey Club! So chill, music playing, love the rustic old school style and service!  Thanks Tony!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey club

qp6XUr9eN_VR4ehSDYE8EQ.text: Lotus was a super waitress!  She didn't even write the order down and got our order perfect-- with six of us.  My mahi mahi tacos were excellent but I had to eat them with a fork because they were so stuffed full of food!  My husband had the meatloaf and it was the best I ever tasted.  Five stars!

rjilD4Kmi8JaaB3w_48Z6g.text: I was staying at Mandalay Bay for the first time this past weekend. A group of us wanted to get something quick and convenient. I ordered the Corn-beef Rueben, it was good  and goes perfectly well with the coleslaw I got. The price was decent comparing to other options in the hotel.   The Corn-beef Rueben was delicious, slightly on the heavy taste, but the flavor wise was good. I personally think it would have goes well with some mustard on the side just get a little kick to it. We also ordered chicken-noodle soup which is perfect for a hangover remedy. Last but not least, the nacho with chicken that comes in double size is not bad but it would have been better to have little bit more cheese and pico de gallo. Overall, I would come back to visit if I'm in the area.

_Juazz3vqtHldmXuYl4VpA.text: This place was just what we needed. Great food, great service from Tony, and great serving sizes. Fish tacos were unreal, and so was the French dip.

ZM688rc-FLMD0sPcCwIdjg.text: Had the Creme Brulee French Toast.  It was ok but not the best I've ever had.  It was tough and dry like it had been sitting for a while.  We had a table on the patio outside so the people watching was great!! The wait staff was a little slow, had to wait on refills for our coffee, which was annoying since they weren't very busy.  Convenient location when staying at Mandalay Bay but not a place I would go out of my way to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée French Toast.

4n1SMqH02CARwC0PZdPw3g.text: Excellent food. The baked chicken was perfectly cooked & tasty. I had the burger & fries. Without doubt the.best burger I've ever had. Also, the service was impeccable.

EE7jDxxsb1WyA4WiEB4Yig.text: Huge portions of classic comfort food that unfortunately fall way short. The focus here is on quantity and presentation rather than quality or taste. Ribs were tough and undercooked. Steak frites totally bland with too large fries. If you come here stick with hard to f up food like the burger. Service is good if a little tired.

uiWMxwwhTizeHVeMfJr0ew.text: The prices are pretty comparable to most places in Vegas. The employees are fairly nice. I ordered their caramel macchiato and a chocolate muffin. The macchiato is probably the worst I've ever had and the muffin didn't really taste like anything. I wouldn't suggest stopping in for a quick breakfast here. Go to the Starbucks around the corner.

S4PDfhZjV67hPQgPk1SgiQ.text: Good and bad...this would be a 4/5 star because the quality of the food and flavor was really good......but my experience was annoying. I called them at 5 AM asking about the menu options at that hour and they said that the to go part was open and what I wanted to order was available when I told her. Once I got there and made my order(Turkey avocado sandwich), they said they were out of the cranberry walnut bread it's normally served on, which is part of why I wanted to go there to try it and they should've told me that on the phone. Whatever, I got it on sourdough instead. Then I ordered a chicken Caesar salad, the chicken soup and the green mean juice shake. They said that they wouldn't serve me the soup because it had been sitting there all day..... Ok then why have it on a late night menu if you're not going to serve it?   Once I got home I realize there was no avocado in my turkey avocado sandwich...again annoying...to pay for something I didn't get and not wanting to drive all the way back for it. Anyways, the food still tasted good and I could tell was fresh.   My bill was $35 for a salad, sandwich and drink.....pretty pricy but I don't mind paying to bad because the quality was good. I will definitely come back here to try it again. Hopefully this next time I'll have a better experience and can give it more stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey avocado sandwich to go, really good actually but where is my avocado??

vMmn4pXIjyuUhm-qVTw0dg.text: Great grilled mahi mahi tacos.   Available to sit at bar even at busy time    Bartender was very helpful and informative.  Nice atmosphere in Mandalay Bay very relaxed vibe

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X7Ow1TkJ6ZF65gS_mFBEoQ.text: The food was amazing. It was the best quesadilla I'd ever had.  The wait staff was good. However it was all together a little slow, maybe the kitchen was slammed or something.

01zIqT1utzegZJUxg7Aj1g.text: For our last night in Vegas, we traditionally find a steakhouse where we dine on some steak and crab. This time we had eaten a large late breakfast and missed lunch so we decided to grab an early dinner but looked for somewhere inside the Delano/Mandalay Bay complex where we were staying. We had never tried Citizens before and were also on a tighter budget and their prices fit our hotel credit balance better. Yeah, talk about cheap! Anyway, we decided we could live without steak and crab this time around. Perhaps it was because of our timing, no apparent conventions in town, there was a marathon actually happening at that same time out on Las Vegas Blvd, and it was an early dinner but we got the best service anyone could ever expect. Erick "with a C-K" was funny, courteous, recommended his faves and left me thinking "I'll come back here to eat again the next time we stay at the Delano" unlike some of the other restaurants there. The food: I started with French onion soup and had a French dip sandwich. Way too much delicious food. I couldn't finish it. Erick and I agreed we both like KFC coleslaw and he said Citizens was as good if not better and I had to agree. My GF had fish tacos in the lettuce wraps option instead of the normal tortillas and despite having some spice to it which she usually doesn't care for, she finished it all and kept saying how good it was.  We'll be back Erick "with a C-K"! Hmm, the prime rib or full rack of ribs?

mjHACE5n5ebxhr8Azvy01g.text: Saw a long line at this place and assumed that it would be good. However, we were tricked since those people in line are business people here for conference and they were just grabbing quick lunch.  It's Vegas price, not Vegas quality. I got Chicken Cesar salad, the meat was very plain, and they forgot to give me dressing.  There is a Starbucks next to the corner - even Starbucks would have been a much better choice.

hzU_OwnF4NtZbSfwblzEGQ.text: This is one of the more affordable places to eat at in Mandalay Bay.  I think the food here is really better than 3, more 3.5, but I rounded down because while our server was friendly and French (which for some reason always makes it feel more special), we had to flag him down a few times to get something and even to get our check.   We went in during an odd time and ordered calamari, wings, and meatball appetizers.  The first two was good, but not very memorable except for how big the servings were.  The meatball however, was gigantic and quite tasty!  I wanted to just have that the entire time I was in Vegas.

MXPpCT4Tv2YtP3RdWqUE4Q.text: Worst service and rudest people I've come into contact with in Vegas. Ordered a breakfast sandwich to go. The girl said it would be out in 5-10 minutes. At 17 minutes I tried to get anyone's attention. Finally I asked someone to check on my order and her response was. I hen it's ready we bring it out.

om3um-t12UBIUKiuJCAfSg.text: Nothing here stands out and makes me want to go again.   It wasn't that far out of what Red, White, and Blue had to offer.   This place is NOT vegetarian friendly. The chef was nice enough to make our party specialty items (off menu) to satisfy.   I ordered a flat iron steak. It wasn't bad, but this also isn't a steak house - it's like an upscale cafe....maybe.   I did really like the beer selection! Although no beers are on tap, all bottled.

xD6luq0HMnGIhV6uFi5WkQ.text: Stopped by the cafe part of Citizens to get sandwiches for lunch after DAYLIGHT and could not have been more grateful! The sandwiches were absolutely delicious and pretty inexpensive for how large they are! Definitely a clutch spot to hit after the pool or for a quick lunch!

lSLN4A6UVJ_SItLhwGfynA.text: We stopped in for a quick dessert and cup of coffee and it was anything but quick. The staff was not very friendly and the wait was simply unacceptable. 20 minutes for a piece of mediocre chocolate cake. I am willing to wait in a long line and pay extra for good service and great food, but not this. Don't waste your time and money!

14ais6ah0tZh8x5HrBedBg.text: Two stars for the server but this place is way overpriced. I don't even get why it's so expensive. I know Mandalay Bay is a really nice hotel but still, this place has ridiculously priced items on their menu. My boyfriend and I just wanted a quick bite and since this was the only place open at 12:30am, we tried it. We got the quesadilla with steak. It was alright. Not bad but not great either. $35 for a cocktail and Taco Bell Style quesadilla is just dumb. I might go back if it comes to that again, but it's not on my list of places to rush back to!

PEgz6Ird6USBqjjDb6Q8hA.text: Two breakfasts, two utter disappointments. Breakfast burrito was basically potatoes in a tortilla. A smattering of eggs and sausage, but mostly just potatoes. Fool that I am, I went back out of convenience and had the single worst "basic, 2-egg breakfast" I've ever had. The potatoes, eggs and toast were colder than room temperature. (I'm not sure how that was accomplished without a refrigerator.) Given the expense of a Vegas restaurant, one would expect--well, hope for--something better. On the outside, Citizens has the look of a Vegas take on a classic brasserie. On the inside, it's not even a greasy-spoon.

768iGf-OZbUBVCNc5NW_LQ.text: GARBAGE!!!! what they serve here is not real food.....it's all frozen crap they microwave or fry then expect you to eat and pay for.

dnwhHiqh40XGoc1nI_glUw.text: I can't even BEGIN to write a review that expresses how tickled I am to have found Citizen's Kitchen! It all started with coffee...good coffee that's reasonably priced (in Vegas!) and with free refills! As I was at the Mandalay for business, refills are a wonderful thing. Next, I tried a salad-- it was HUGE and FRESH and delicious! The following day I had a sandwich which, again, was HUGE and freshly made and delicious! The sandwiches actually lasted me for 2 meals...two delicious, hearty meals! I wish there was a clone of Citizen's Kitchen where I'm from...but if ever I cam back, I'll come back! tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

GD8f3hCRftrzTDg7y8sajg.text: You don't go to the bar for the drinks, you go for the bartender ! Rocky was amazing ! Very friendly, knowledgeable & fun. I ordered the Mule with Wings, a traditional mule with tropical redbull, it was amazing. This experience gave me wings! Do yourself a favor and stop by !!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tools of the trade, our bartender had some awesome gear.

udnxe17lQOzuDaFn7hccUw.text: Honestly, how do you screw up breakfast.... Food was horrid.. Cold no taste..  Had a conversation with Manger Keith he was receptive & accommodating.   After, the bad food the the server screwed up our bill.  Took another 10-15 to complete task to get the Hell out of there.  Pass on this place... Spent almost two hours in Citzens.. Two hours of my life I'll never get back. :((

ieAkV6pyMKpzxRZme_6VtQ.text: Just had a fantastic breakfast!!! Our waiter Tony was one of the nicest, most professional waiters I've seen in an early morning restaurant!!! Great experience...not to mention a great steak and eggs!!!

GX-nTkirKEJeQy_YDy9nAg.text: Decor: Loved the inside Decor, it had a clean slick modern feel. With a twist of sweet home Alabama meets Downtown Boston feel to it. (I've been feeling a little theatrically lately #SorryNotSorry)   Beer: It was a hot day so I decided to have the All American comfort meal & what better way than to top it off with a nice summer Ale. Since I was in Nevada I thought the Sierra Nevada Kellerweis was my best bet. This was the best part of my meal. Served bottled with an empty tall glass that tasted like Beer on tap. Super crisp and refreshing exactly what I wanted. It tasted like a cool summer day.  Lunch: My All American comfort meal the Blue Beat, included Blue Cheese, Red Wine Mushrooms & Cherry Peppers. Although the burger was cooked to perfect (medium rare). I felt this burger lacked sauce, it was very dry and hard to eat. The mushrooms were barely sauteed almost raw. I felt like something was missing. The fries were delicious, fluffy almost like truffle fries. They were served in this cute basket.   Overall I'd come back for the beer & fries. It's not at the top of my list but if I was starving I wouldn't mind coming back.

Uj1R1FMHzXOnv6ytiDdVzA.text: No bad for breakfast. But like most restaurants at these so called resorts, the prices were marked up at least 50-60% from normal. Food and service were good. Prices keep me from giving 4 stars

2MhqgAzvC9oM3zKpOvwAOw.text: Excellent brunch option in the Mandalay Bay, however, the service is hit or miss.  On one weekend we had fantastic service followed by invisible service the next day.   The food was great on our first visit and the server accommodating to dietary needs and requests making us fall in love with the place.   The second visit, our server was totally slammed and he was very much absent minded, leaving us to wait over 20 minutes for a Mimosa from the clearly empty bar next to us.   He also wasn't really down with the hospitality and wouldn't let my guest order the exact same thing she enjoyed the day before which struck me as a little odd.   Had we not been in a hurry, we would have probably asked to see a Manager but it was so busy we just sucked up and left.   What a difference a day makes......

vKCkV_bNTHReUAmDdbJypw.text: Went in for dinner. Greg was our waiter. My friend wanted spaghetti and a salad. He told her she didn't want salad the pasta dish was enough. REALLY! We were both drinking alcohol. Was not asked if we wanted another drink. Brought check to table before plates were removed. REACHED OVER ME to grab my wine glass without asking if I was done or wanted another glass. His service and attitude were so bad I can't even remember what the food tasted like.

N_jJaIzhaxOuxbmhn-wMDA.text: Ate here every am for breakfast for 5 days- awesome breakfast.  After first meal my hubby and I shared all others cause much food- hot- Delish and great service most days.  Bar is best!  Decent drinks but save $ for pool drinks.  Can't wait to come back!

e2DOA-ht35VJUcEQ1Qt63w.text: Excellent service at the bar for breakfast. Went there to avoid conference breakfast food and was greeted by friendly staff, smiles, eye contact, and great food. Try the omelets,  granola and yogurt, or oatmeal. Or have all 3 together for a great start.

yASIMLdriuChncisVbndug.text: First time here. As a Vegas local, I usually try to avoid the Strip places, as from what I've seen they're usually overpriced tourist traps. I'm glad to say I was pleasantly surprised by Citizens. I had been considering Citizens as an after-concert choice (Neil Diamond!), since it's open 24 hours. We arrived at Mandalay Bay early and had an hour and a half to kill, so we decided to eat before the show instead.  After checking out the menu board outside and getting on the list, we waited about 3 minutes and we were seated in the outer "patio" area. Our server, Nick, greeted us very shortly thereafter and brought us our drinks, offering to answer any questions we had about the menu sections. I decided against spending $40 on a 14 oz NY sirloin steak and went with the bacon burger (medium done, add cheese, hold the onions) & fries. My wife chose the NY-style pastrami sandwich. Being that it was 5:45 pm, I expected to wait a bit for my order to come out. After 15 minutes or so Nick came back to the table and apologized for the wait, explaining that they were very busy and that he would see to our orders ASAP. I thought that was really cool of him, because I cannot tell how many times I have been sitting in a restaurant, getting aggravated looking at my watch over and over, while the wait staff hangs around chatting or walks by us over and over like we haven't been sitting there sipping our drinks for over a half hour. The food arrived a few minutes later and it was time to dig in.  My burger platter, served on what looked like a cookie sheet, was the perfect size for the $20 price tag: a good-size, nicely stacked burger with tomato and shredded lettuce, cooked and prepared exactly as I had requested and skewered through the top bun with a large pepperoncini that would make Papa John cry, a decently-sized "bucket" of shoestring fries and a half pickle slice. My wife's equally-priced sandwich was huge (the half she couldn't finish wound up in the car in a to-go box before we went to the show), stuffed with perfectly lean pastrami, along with a side bowl of potato salad (or fries or cole slaw) and also sporting that pepperoncini and pickle slice. Both orders were delicious and appropriately priced for the portions we received. When it came time to settle the bill, I jokingly asked if they do employee discounts for fellow MGM employees, to which Nick said he would go check. He returned a couple of minutes later with, to my surprise, a new bill reflecting a 20% discount (which I kicked back to Nick on top of the original tip for his great service) - a definite high-five to Citizens for that!  All in all, I still generally think Strip dining establishments are tourist traps, but I also think they have not yet seen the last of me at Citizens - it seemed to be, at least to me, one of the few exceptions to the rule.

XDWNZxlr1Yz60YCJYJacag.text: Great food and our server Lotus was wonderful.   Would highly recommend this place.  Everyone at our table loved their food

0PS6bN0lE3fW-Cut8APi3w.text: This place was conveniently located at Mandalay bay . We ordered the Kobe beef fries which were fine, and the grilled Ruben sandwich: wasn't too impressed . Pretty standard . Nothing bad. But I think I expect a little more out food In Las Vegas ....

bxqIMJLiU11eIqf3SVm7QQ.text: Frank the server was very inappropriate in his attitude. We ate a quick breakfast here and paid with a credit card. The others in the group were paying the tip with cash. They quickly left for a conference and forgot to place the tip on the table. The server Frank came outside of the restaurant and chased us down. He then proceeded to scold us in public saying that he lost $6 on our table (although our bill was more than $100 and we would have tipped at least $15). He yelled at us "Is this how to do this" as if we purposely and routinely  dine without tipping. Very tacky and humiliating ....

r2TXkusBlDcEkC1nTx8FPw.text: All of us enjoyed burgers and fries.  Great food, prepared and delivered as ordered.  Was actually our 2nd time eating there on this trip.  Open 24 hours so we will probably dine there again.

9jK2uiMJlO6ZSiDCJZOdbw.text: This place is awesome. I have been here a few times with a group and the food is always wonderful. I have had the doughnut breakfast sandwich twice now and it's so amazing. You must try it!! Tuna sandwich, quesadilla, and BLT was great as well!

CP5sl6yxS16nOaFTgeqvrg.text: I was looking around for some place to have lunch before going to the Shark reef Aquarium and I just happened to pass this place. They had their menu on the outside and I saw they had a lobster roll. That is all I needed. So I went to the hostess and got seated. I was told a server would be by shortly. Um not what happened. Now the place was virtually empty and I noticed my server had looked over and saw me sitting there waiting but he never came up and offered me a drink or anything. He just kept staring at me and carried on conversations with his co workers. It made me very uncomfortable. Then he finally comes up and asks me if I am ready. He offers no apology for the wait or the fact that he saw me sitting there and did nothing. He did not ask me if I wanted a drink or anything like servers normally ask first he just asked me if I was ready and had a huge attitude when he asked. The annoying tone in his voice was like I had kept him waiting while I stared at the menu forever or something like that. His attitude surprised me considering I knew what I wanted from the second I walked in and I was the one who was kept waiting but ok. I also wanted to get to the Shark Reef aquarium before I started collecting my social security so if anyone should've been annoyed it should have been me. I ordered my food and guess what more waiting. Again he was too busy doing his own thing to go check on my food. It took almost 30 minutes to get my food. I know it was not the kitchen for one thing the lobster is served cold so is not like they have to cook the lobster and heat it up or anything and my side was coleslaw. How long does that take? I had already thought it was a mistake coming there because my server acted like a complete asshole but it was even worse after I tried this pitiful excuse for a lobster roll. It was disgusting. After I picked through my food I waited and waited for the server to bring me my check. I had to flag him down at some point because if not I would have sat there forever. Well wanting my check must have been a problem because Mr. Attitude acted even more stuck up when I flagged him down and asked for my check. Needless to say after $23 for that lunch I felt leaving unsatisfied and downright stupid for wasting my time and money there. The food was shitty and the customer service was even shittier. others many have a better experience but personally for me I will not ever waste my time and energy here again. Mandalay Bay and Vegas itself has WAY too many superior options for dining for me to waste me time where I am clearly not wanted.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

KF10F1qhFb_hjYtl31jPKA.text: Worst service I've ever had. Inside was completely empty but they wouldn't let me sit inside to watch the games when I ordered food because it's for sit down guests only. Tried asking for a water from the waiter to be redirected 3 times until the manager finally came around. This place sucks.

YbYJ_cunf5zRCPktVS_kEw.text: This was the perfect venue for my meetings during the Black Hat conference.  I received outstanding service from my waitress, Chelsea, and I will definitely keep this place in mind next year.

IHhiTdVo9hMVfjjXpl44sQ.text: Didn't get greeted on our way in. When she led us to our table, pulled the chair out in front of me. Left for another spot.

mV9Pa_oqQsM-eBI1vX7bXQ.text: Omelet and egg burrito were good.  But service was poor.    Found server not to happy to be working.   Simple request became issue.   Ashamed since food was good

phRj2PWD-Aeq62FZHafobA.text: Conveniently located in Mandalay Bay, always a warm welcome from the staff. Raika was the hostess at the front as I observed the menu from outside, she sold me with a simple welcome and smile. When I'm hungry I don't like the process of going somewhere and sitting down for an hour before I get my food. Citizens is an excellent "fast food" choice with quality food and several healthy options. Open 24 hours have a seat or grab a sandwich to go. Competitive prices and outstanding good an staff. I just may take a ride down there now.

idMbuBAt5on1jrz4aR7Ysg.text: Terrible service, terrible food , terrible music... The food did't have any flavor, the meat was all fat, the quinoa wrap had no dressing or flavor.. The server didn'pay ANY attention to us.. What a bad experience!

Fwjua4g05v2gf9G1ktYAQg.text: It's 2 am after standing around in the club for hours you're telling me I have to wait 15 mins to be seated for a restaurant that is empty ??? Someone please explain to me why. Food took forever. The waiter spilled water on me and didn't even know it. Was he high or something cause he was messing up all night from spilling beers and I overheard him apologizing to another table. Luckily the chicken club was good or maybe I was just hungry.

n2C-Q-dV0YjeeBVV-yaeZg.text: Rude, slow, food is bland.  You could get a better meal faster by getting in your car and driving.

V2-Hmd2DTSUUeYbxgRsgDg.text: Came in for appetizers in the afternoon. We ordered the calamari and meatball appetizers and they were so good it was totally worth it! Both dishes were big enough for three of us to share. Would definitely come back for these!!

RbyeLqQiOCd9dPvSWukQqA.text: What a great place to eat and its 24 hours Ever wanna check out Light Nightclub first nightclub inspired by cirque du SOLEI Let me know and I will take care of you 702.809.9045

fJ8jRwD0LFx6Kdk1qrYieg.text: Their plain cheeseburger was delicious soda was flat are here two time got same thing never waited food was quickly served and in my and girlfriends opinion awesome time is limited in Vegas

Ejgxx-1cfEpIpF4CRWlbsA.text: omg lets start off by saying I actually love this place whenever I'm in town I stop by more than once , I must say COURTNEY are waitress  was the worst knowing you deal with a many people everyday all day , you should be having the Best customer service EVER , I just might never come back again

f0_SXFSoW-QGbOtVeju-IQ.text: The food here is awesome!!!! We got the meatball app, the mahi mahi tacos, and the balboa steak sandwich. They were all amazing! I can't rave enough about the fish tacos!!! They were on point! Our waiter, Robert, was very kind and very helpful! He gave us a ton of suggestions, all of which were great! We will go back for sure!

x8dacP9MPwzZGVk7sfyyWQ.text: Staying at the Mandalay Bay for the weekend and have already been here twice! A lot to choose from for breakfast as well as lunch/ dinner. We did not have the chance to dine in but still received great service from the to go side. For breakfast we tried the steak and eggs as well as the creme brulee French toast. Also tried the green and mean juice- kale, spinach, avocado, banana, and apple. For dinner we tried the bacon burger and cheese quesadilla, both were great! Wouldn't mind eating here again

kn1TKXEHujvLZIAWWJyQJg.text: Food was excellent, drinks are excellent, Service was excellent. My husband liked the ACME Pale Ale beer. Had the turkey burger and chips and queso. Both were good. :)

oBkCgH0jjy8mlJpiNSE8Tg.text: Just tried to get coffee and desserts and they wouldn't let us sit in the dining room. I found them very rude and unaccommodating. Not impressed.

XQFa8a0fIhLQbaLRsUNt3A.text: Slow as molasses in an igloo. A line of ten deep took 25 minutes to go through. Also severely overpriced. $25 for a pre-made panini, two croissants and a bottle of water ($5!) yikes.

xO6ir7kj8A_IYVhLd_Vshg.text: Once you get past the cold, unfriendly hostesses (and sole reason for the 2 stars) the food is delicious and the wait staff is fantastic. If you hate your job, especially if you are the first person a potential client interacts with at an establishment, pretend to love it. We went there twice and after dealing with those girls, we avoided it the rest of our stay, and cant say we would ever go back because we aren't into feeling like we are a bother when we pay a good amount of money to eat somewhere.

YpdT_XQCISteScfciuV2gg.text: I had a string of business meetings at the Black Hat conference this week, and received outstanding service from the staff, particularly two waiters: Chelsea and Kevin. Management was very understanding of my two days' worth of meetings there, and has been extraordinarily accommodating. I will be sure to come back for next year's conference!

9wtej3hKy63Dy9zJjeIUBA.text: The eggs Benedict are very good.  Neat atmosphere sitting on the "patio" inside the hotel/casino.  Service is good and staff is polite.  Great breakfast joint to get you going in the morning.

Ibt0OKWwMOKQk2vfT73mWw.text: Service is poor. Very slow. I sat for 10 minutes and restaurant was empty. Other people that were seated after me were waited on before me. I asked hostess if they had gluten free options and they told me my server would be educated. Not the case. He had no clue and he couldn't even lie well. His explanation was its got cheese. They don't make anything there home made. Management needs to give a PK on good service.

jot5RwGayJ56ZsV3MAtCcA.text: So when we landed and checked in were starving.  There aren't that's y choices to eat and this place looked decent.  I ordered the turkey avocado sandwich.  I felt a bit deceived because I thought I'd have pieces of avocado in my sandwich... But nope it's smushed in with the spread/sauce.  For $14 I guess I was expecting a piece of avocado.  Don't think I would go back for sandwich unless I'm desperate again like we were when we first landed.

p40-VVKQmSix7TBkEf49qA.text: i made the mistake of ordering the pasta prosuttio. took 3 bites the( pasta over cooked the meat undercooked and the sauce watery thin not thick like is should be) and asked for the check . asked for the mgr on duty  waitrer says he isn't in right now he is out of the restaurant. the waiter never even offered a replacement. 0 for 3 come on- its sad when the highlight is I got the faster drink refill ever

Udllq6_CY5AM23OzqegpIA.text: Solid for breakfast.  Basic but well executed menu.  Eggs Benedict with eggs done perfectly, but bland sauce.  Pancakes fluffy and cooked right.  Pricey for breakfast, but hey . . . it's Vegas.

pn_o_yBKu9ICUVC_pz28mw.text: The wait was a bit long but it was after a music event so it is to be expected. The staff were super nice and the food was surprisingly delicious for such a late night eat! We got the Mac and cheese which was excellent, the French onion soup w 3 cheeses which is pretty big portions and the chicken quesadilla. All were great! Highly recommend this place! Outside seating is perfect for people watching! :)

jf2ayETFxWFbKozPIMdTwQ.text: After a very long flight it was suggested we check out Citizens for a late dinner. We asked to be seated inside because the band playing in the bar outside was SO loud. It didn't make a difference. Our server greeted  us quickly and was very enthusiastic. We ordered the fish & chips and the tuna melt plus waters. Food presentation was beautiful.  unfortunately the fish was over cooked and the potato salad, al though made in house, lacked flavor. In the end our bill was $50 for a mediocre meal. The fish and chips was definitely over priced, $26!

mcfz4Txt8ekz-tHQCM_a2w.text: The cafe has the worst customer service ever including a not so friendly staff. We ordered a grilled cheese and a shake. After waiting for 15 minutes (mind you the place was dead), the girl brings our shake to us stating that she forgot about it. No mention of the grilled cheese, we walked up to the counter and asked the status on that order. The girl look puzzled and stated that she burned our sandwich and would make a new one. The panini press is in plain site, and no sandwich was ever made to be "burned". The manager was on the side of the cafe making a drink, then brought it out to a girl outside of the establishment. We highly don't recommend this place, unless you like waiting for your food that will never come, and like to experience some of the worst customer service.

D_BnoprBMG_gsuXZgW6Obg.text: Food was great. But service not so much. Also when it came time to paying our bill the prices were a few bucks higher on the bill than the prices listed on the menu. Took forever to get checks adjusted and it was honestly a waste of 30 minutes. Don't come here.

KUbuk5tcGwd0YFXF3ulQXg.text: Went to Citizens the other day for breakfast/brunch with some colleagues. I've been here before and it was great the last time. They took great care of us! Tony was our server and he did great! Memorized everyone's order without writing anything! Normally, that bothers me, but he got it right! Everyone's orders came out exactly as desired. Drink glasses never dropped below half the entire meal!  The Crab Cake Benedict was a hit! That was a unique meal with a great taste! Very well cooked and the crab was actually crab! The breakfast burrito, banana waffle and the California omelet were stated to be delightful! However, the plate that matched the Crab Cake Benedict was the Brioche French Toast in a mixed berry syrup! Little on the sweet side, but delicious! I highly recommend this place for a good meal!

CDkyw-_Cpnv7YH1dlGTsAA.text: This place is amazing!!! The bartender, Lizzy, is my fav! She had some wonderful menu & drink recommendations. I had the turkey avocado sandwich and the raging bull cocktail...both to die for.   Also, to my girls and gays--there is a ton of gorgeous eye candy...you won't be disappointed!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raging Bull! Yum!!

D4Rn0TRCl4DxBN_XIrGrdQ.text: Came here a couple days ago for breakfast. We loved the atmosphere. The food was alright but we kind of had higher expectations. We sat at the bar and the bartender wasn't friendly at all. Kinda ruined the experience for me.

boOYUk4QkUhu24tkUUXsMg.text: Such a great dinning experience here! Food and service was a 9 out of 10. We were greeted by the hostess as soon as we arrived. We decided to sit at the bar. The Bloody Mary had the perfect amount of spice for someone who doesn't like to burn their pallet while they sip. We had to ask the bartender if we could order, but she was very friendly and efficient. We split the meal very easily; the bartender took the extra step to have it served on two separate plates. When our plates reached us the food was still hot and flavorful.We had to ask for our bill. This restaurant is very clean and organized; everything always comes out correctly and tasty.
