Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crab cake Benedict.

ebj2KFVX-B8bBWjydeJFtQ.text: Big Bloody Mary looks great, tastes ok.  Crab was NASTY in bloodyMary.  Fruit not good,choose else where if you can

h4Qjz96gEj7IFvHuKfZuhA.text: Food was pretty good, but nothing special. I think it's a bit overpriced, but it's Vegas. Great place for a late night snack or meal. Only restaurant in Mandalay Bay that's open late.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Salad with added chicken.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Salad with added chicken.

lQyJOO4UA72zMnlTpfarWA.text: What a treat this place was!  HIdden in the pancreas of the Mandalay Bay.  A great place for breakfast, lunch or a snack between drinks at 5 AM and dinner at 6 PM.  The chili was to DIE for.  Very mild with chunks of premium beef.  Tasted devine with sour cream.  The waffle cut fries were delicious and arrived in this cute little basket thing.  Which actually seem to be like the thing to do in Vegas now.  Must be a hipster chef thing.  The chicken wings were WAY spicy but my husband enjoyed them.  I really like this place for a quick treat.  Staff was great.  Be sure to take home a candy apple to eat while you watch a movie.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings. Super spicy. BEWARE!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili with waffle fries. I highly recommend. Very mild and chunky.

jL2bSEQgO9AraX7sIbm4dQ.text: Awesome food..Great place. Great service. Shanna is the best. Super nice and very attentive. Will definitely come back...

yBmURJiGs_pCesbKNgM9pg.text: Yesterday stopped by for quick light dinner.  Ordered turkey sandwich with  avocado, tomato, and greens.  Also ordered kale salad that include goat cheese and grains mixed in.  Sandwich was dry hard and salty so it was hard to consume.  The salad was hard and flavorless.  Sad...paid $49 for these food and didn't really the food.

2CO5rXVIlhWt-cgNiJ-rXQ.text: This is a place for some comfort food. I had the meatloaf and mashed potatoes which were both on point and my husband had the prime rib with onion rings and a side of mash potatoes. It was all good but DAMN...too expensive. Cost us $85 and change.   The only thing other than the cost that I didn't like was the waiter picking up our receipt while we were still sitting at the table. All waiters and waitresses know that this is a NO, NO!  The seats were a little uncomfortable too.

1MGzWc3g0Yh0U36KYczEWw.text: 5 stars on the food, 3 stars on service leads to an outcome of 4 stars. I can't say enough about the food here. We come here often because we can't get enough of the calamari and bloody Mary's.  My girl sticks to the fish tacos, (mahi or Ono) can't remember. But they were delicious. I'm not crazy about fish tacos but they're fantastic here. For me, the calamari really hits the spot. The breading isn't too much and the calamari inside is perfectly chewy and firm. For dinner, I got the burger. Which was solid, classic American.   Don't miss this spot, drinks/calamari appetizer/Tacos/burger, won't disappoint!!

fyDlJHi0Xfg7EywNBoR8Cg.text: Definitely one of the better (and slightly more affordable) restaurants in Mandalay!  I shared the Tarragon Chicken Salad Sandwich (with a side of potato salad) and the Kobe Beef Fries with a friend. The sandwich was really good! It comes on toasted bread which works well with the texture of the chicken salad. It's a good size too. The potato salad was ok, but nothing special.   The fries were actually really good, but I don't know if they are worth the price. I think you lose some of the kobe flavor when you mix it with chili. Still, really tasty!  Service was really great too. Our waiter was on top of his stuff, and he was straightforward about everything in the menu and his suggestions (which I have grown to appreciate in a waiter).

5xG8aJYqQpyVEnWtYQq7JQ.text: "Meh" sums it up....I felt that way about Red, White and Blue and Citizens is no different. Honestly, it feels like casino management said "hey, let's change the sign on this joint..but we're totally cool with the slow, indifferent service and so/so, overpriced food".  You can do better, and you probably should.

6iSOKOZbnzerbb109Ef2eg.text: We got 4 sandwiches and one salad, most were pretty good except for the roast beef sandwich, which was more fat than meat.  Completely gross.  I can't believe they actually thought it was okay to serve.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast beef (fat) sandwich

aQh-lqEaxUDNG_bHbPWMZg.text: It's a good place to go for quick food early morning and late night for sure.   But I have to say the best part was meeting Chris Stanton.  He is a phenomenal server that our server from last night to shame. Mind you last night we went to Prime Steak house and had almost a thousand dollar bill.  Chris is the man.

X-azU3Grb5dwvpz_w4fSuw.text: Food was good and the service was even better on the night shift with Steven.  He makes the experience  worth the visit and the blonde handlebar mustache is a must see.   He is amazing, accommodating, personable, and charismatic.  Truly a pleasure spending your evening dining with Steven.  Nichelle and Monica, New Jersey and Maryland

8ow9qUjtSt8rCELflj9DEA.text: I have been here multiples times and I've become more and more disappointed every time I decide to come here.  I always order over the phone so that the food would be ready. Over the phone would be great if they answered their phones.  I've tried three times to place phone orders, the first time after 43 min of calling and getting the hotel involved they would not answer their phone, I ended up driving down there to place my order.  Second time I came here I decided to try calling again. Yayyyy they picked up the phone...then put me on hold... an hour and 38 min later I drove down still being on hold to show them that no one is answering and that I was on hold for an hour and 38 min.  I spoke with the manager (Shawn) and  he apologized and said there must be something wrong with the phones.  I called as he was standing there and voila they worked fine.  Weird.  Today a month later, I decided to try my luck one more time.  Driving past state line I called and someone answered the phone yayyyyy... NOPE. Again placed on hold and drove all the way to the Mandalay again to show the same manager that I've been on hold 38 min.    He apologized and again gave me there must be something wrong with the phone schpeal.  Tried calling while standing there and holy cow the phones worked.   When I was on hold all of these times I tried calling on three way to see if they would pick up and the phone just rang and rang.   Back to today, I placed my order to be told they are all out of the bread that my 5 sandwiches come on..  I asked for a croissant instead and a girl named  Heather said you need to pay extra for that.  Super condescending and rude.  The only one that handled this professionally was Sarah.  Jessica decided to come to me and directly  say you need to move your bags(the food) they just brought out to me off the counter.  She argued in front of the customers and two other customers stated that the customer service is horrible.  Was this girl for real??? After everything I've been put through she is raising her voice in front of other guest and telling me to move my food bags in a condescending voice.  Ughhh.  So sad the food is really good here but they need to clean house and hire staff that knows how to work with guests.  Thanks Sarah for your help!   Shawn the manager just kind of looked at me glossy eyed  both times I spoke to him so I'm not sure he's going to address the issues at hand.  Some how the staff acted as if I was in the wrong here.  Please citizens get it together. Mandalay is an amazing place this restaurant should be ran with the same customer service as the place it's in.   So sad

xKPO0NYI5viBGqNlcBjgNA.text: Fantastic breakfast experience.   We had the best waitress ever. (Shanna) my friend and I were not easy customers because we didn't order anything off the regular menu.  She was so accommodating and served our "multiple sides" to complete our meal without making us feel like pains in the you know what.  She went above and beyond with a smile on her face.  Also the coffee was great! :)

Efil2apyrQtIV7LhlmxUYA.text: This place would be so much better if they could just fix their ridiculously slow service.  I went to the take out counter twice during my most recent Vegas stay. Both times the food took forever for what was a simple order.  The second visit was ridiculous. There was one person ahead of me who got her parfait and was on her way. We order a parfait, donut, hot tea, and fresh juice. Everything except for the juice was grabbed from the counter. The juice took over 15 minutes. Everything was already pre-cut in a cup, all the person had to do was add orange juice and blend.  They were clearly understaffed, and for the prices they charge there is no excuse.  Also, when I was paying the second day the girl working the register asked if I needed a receipt. When I said yes, she handed me the itemized receipt. I asked her where the credit card receipt was and she said she threw it away. I told her I needed it because this was a work expense. She then proceeded to dig through the garbage until she produced my crumpled receipt. That is not okay, if someone says they want a receipt they should be given both receipts, or at the bare minimum the credit card receipt.  This place would be good if they could just get their ish together!

QSSxFRFkYXzgpULQ9Foe0Q.text: The "Ulitmate Mary" was unbelievable! Wow - what a cocktail. We had the organic granola & fruit parfait and the citizens famous bacon egg & cheese. The potatoes we dry and odd flavoring though.  Other than that good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Ultimate Mary&#34;!

IDW7iDiK0NcMBXKr-XyV2A.text: We got there right before lunch so we avoided a wait time but on our way out the line looked quite long. Not bad for the price! The food itself was nothing remarkable. The drinks were great!  I must say, I was a big fan of the decor as well.

u-qhr3QsAPWfdLYn23UrwQ.text: The restaurant was very cute and pleasing to the eye. The service was good but the food was subpar. For how expensive it was, it was not worth the money. There was also live music next door while we ate which was obnoxiously loud and annoying.

j-kobcIL9VyaqQ8kXzo3eg.text: Great food, huge portions, weird servers.  The disco fries are worth trying. The nachos, fish and chips and sandwiches are all enormous but actually very good. Love the steak fries with the fish and chips.  Our server was a little strange and touchy...made some people feel uncomfortable.

ZkVxXJWciBb66cwTnzn9Dw.text: This was the recommended restaurant for breakfast business meeting among the restaurant row in the MGM hotel.   I was told that we should get there before 7 am to ensure that we get a table - and we did.   It was not crowded at 6:45 am.     I was there for 2 consecutive mornings for my breakfast business meetings and my server remembered me on the 2nd day.   Perhaps my tipping made an impression?  (Not sure if that was good or bad).   The service was okay but my second serving of cappuccino took over 10 mins to get to me.  I had my custom omelette both mornings but due my focus on the business interactions, I actually didn't remember if the food were good or bad!   :-).     I like the casual setting and the atmosphere that could facilitate a discussion.

7YWtG0d0-sMiMvkv1XbECQ.text: Possibly the worst food I have had, I couldn't even finish my dinner. It was overpriced as well.

l77TXUUtMkDtZc_5PN4Xaw.text: The food was great, the service was great, and the prices were not bad. The place can get a little noisy and the tables are close together.  So we choose to sit at the bar. Great idea...Loved our bartender. She made us really yummy Bloody mary's with infused in house Jalapeno vodka and she was very attentive even though she was super busy making drinks for the tables.   I did realized menu is more comfort food than anything but we were craving salads so we both opted for two of the salads and we both shared.   1. Kale and brown rice salad with grilled chicken 2. Quinoa vegetable Salad with grilled Salmon  Yummy....Huge portion, tasty and fresh. I was fully satisfied with our selections.   It's open 24 hours!! It's pretty awesome when your in Vegas knowing you'll be up all night and hungry at any time. You can either sit and be served or order and pick up...but if you order and pick up, you must eat out on the patio of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Infused jalapeño vodka martini
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bartender Raquel
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale and brown rice with grilled chicken

NwGuiReHZe3FmTi82_Rjug.text: If not for the friendliness of the help, I'd give one star. The line was long and moved terribly slow. Seemed sufficiently staffed, although staff wasn't very organized or efficient. Food represented at the counter isn't necessarily available. Food is also pretty over-priced for what you're getting. Seems like a lot of it is pre-fab, like employees are opening a plastic case and serving to you. My daughter's $6 cupcake was gross, tons of preservatives.   The only positive is that the staff was nice. We won't be back though. For over-priced, pre-fab food, even Starbucks is a better option.

uNxtXsUPrpVUm1OeWtG1gw.text: Citizens is another solid spot by the Light Group. It's an upscale diner serving comfort food 24 hours a day in Mandalay Bay. Brunch might be the best time to go if you want to pig out on plenty of sweet and savory offerings like I did. The massive stack of red velvet pancakes may be one of the better versions in town. Just bring family or friends to make a dent in it. The creme brulee French toast is another exceptional rendition on a classic with bread dense enough to soak up and retain plenty of custard and a well crusted exterior that provides plenty of crunch.   For savory options the kobe chili cheese fries were good -- particularly the light, crispy waffle fries that held up well under the meaty chili. They don't skimp with portion sizes on that dish or the big meatball parm, which is a single baseball sized hunk of beef and pork topped with a dollop of ricotta and sitting in a pool of sauce. A less than stellar dish is their ultimate tots -- standard tater tots covered in cheese and gravy. The chicken and waffles also proved to be decent, but far less memorable than the other dishes we tried.  Ending the meal was an excellent house-made carrot cake. It's moist and dense spice cake foundation with subtle hints of carrot were complimented by plenty of sweetness from a smooth and creamy cream cheese icing.   It's clear that the Light Group knows who their target audience is and how to satisfy them. With Citizens, they deliver comfort food fit for a casual meal any time of day

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic carrot cake ($9) - cream cheese frosting
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée french toast ($16) - mixed berries, orange whipped cream
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes ($15) - whipped cream cheese

j9ugpXN8GzZVn20oXqajkw.text: Such a delicious turkey avocado sandwich with cranberry+seed bread! Unfortunately the cashier missed half our order and left out our kale salad. He also didn't inform us that there were two options of the kitchen menu and the cold sandwich menu, which differs in one thing: toasted vs untoasted bread. $20 for a toasted sandwich, $13 for untoasted. Bottle of Fiji water is $9, service is inattentive, and getting the food was also very frustrating.

2lWX4q1M4qsMXbJbAdgVOQ.text: Yelpers have rated Citizens at 3 out of 5 stars.  When that's the aggregate rating out of hundreds of reviews, for me personally I begin to think the establishment might be shitty.   Especially when there is a sprinkling of reviews that are at 1 star with all kinds of jacked up things being written.  "3" may be "A-OK" according to Yelp, to me it means the place is questionable.    So if you don't want to fuck around with Citizens and risk disappointment, here's my advice:  Go to the the takeout counter and order either the Reuben or else the turkey avocado sandwich.  Simple as that.      These sandwiches are so good.   The ingredients, the breads, the thinly-sliced soft and moist deli meat... Adds up to an amazing sandwich that I go out of my way for.   Trust me.     Yes, these sandwiches are expensive.   Around $15 for one sandwich to give you some idea.    But damn worth it, and I keep going back for it.  For the times I drive in to Vegas from So Cal, I typically order extra sandwiches to go as a snack later on.     But if the price still seems completely outrageous to you, I won't fault you.  Just do it if you're comfortable.   However, to put it in perspective, what did cost you to get a bottle of Grey Goose last night at Hakkasan?   Or even one cocktail at Light... How much did that cost?  How much money did you put out in the casino?   What did you spend on the stripper with your buddies?  Exactly.      So shut the hell up and get one of the best sandwiches you'll ever eat!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I absolutely love the sandwiches here!  Turkey or else turkey and ham!

ry5cJinM5O2yByFJjBKKCg.text: Lotus is best waitress in Mandalay Bay - efficient, personable and served great food to our party! Best meal today.

4c7yC-fGNHf2kvVLj6dISw.text: Items Selected: Lavazza Coffee Ultimate Tots Smothered & Covered - Cheddar, Chicken Gravy The Big Meatball Parm - Beef, Pork, Grandma's Gravy, Ricotta Kobe Chili Cheese Fries - Kobe Sirloin, Cheese Sauce, Waffle Fries Chicken & Waffles - Bacon and Cheddar Waffle, Fried Chicken, Jalapeno Maple Syrup Creme Brulee French Toast - Strawberries, Custard, Whipped Cream Red Velvet Pancakes - Whipped Cream Cheese Classic Carrot Cake - Cream Cheese Frosting Reese's Peanut Butter Cookie Chocolate Chip Cookie  Perfectly fine with French food and well experienced with 'modernist' cuisine, both at local spots as well as internationally revered recipients of three Michelin Stars, but born in the Midwest and raised on anything but foie gras or liquid nitrogen cocktails suffice it to say that I'm a fan of the whole "upscale American" movement - the sort of food that takes the shake n' bake that mother used to make and turns it into something worth leaving the house for, the sort of food that critics love to critique even though they likely cannot make it as well themselves...the sort of food being served at Citizens Kitchen and Bar in Mandalay Bay.  Open 24/7, and still operated by Light Group despite the recent Hakkasan acquisition, it was just after 11am that a friend and I arrived at the Citizen hostess podium and dining as guests of the manager it was mere moments before we were led to a large four-top at the restaurant's back corner - the low-slung leather banquets of soft leather so comfortable that one might want to take a nap in them, particularly with the sounds of Dylan, Zeppelin, and Pink Floyd playing from the speaker system above.  Obviously a restaurant of dual personalities, the weekend brunch a casual and laid back affair while late nights are said to be a raucous mess of patrons exiting nearby Light Nightclub, it was under the watchful eye of a British gentleman named Tim that our meal took place and whether an effect of being known to the chef or simply the young man's mannerisms the service could not have been better - easily the best I've experienced in Mandalay Bay with plenty of whit and knowledge to compliment an eight plate feast with enough food that it could have fed two-to-three more.  Noting up front that the 'grab n' go' section is mostly devoid of housemade options, instead outsourcing all but the cookies and a few cakes due to kitchen constraints, it was with four savory dishes that the meal began and with plenty of par-for-the-course Lavazza to wash it all down the first round was a bit of a mixed bag - the chicken and waffles excessively priced at $24 with both items less crunchy than would be ideal, though the tots and waffle fries each proved crisp and quite capable of holding up to cheese and meats with substantial depth of flavor, an adult-fist of a meatball also standing out with impressive tenderness beneath a good sear in a bath of bright tomato sauce with grated cheese adding just enough salinity to make it all shine.  Moving next to a duo of sweets, it was somewhat surprising that the Red Velvet Pancakes were not to be found on the weekend menu, but with a simple request a substantial stack of three Frisbee-sized discs was produced with each proving exceptionally fluffy and loaded with cocoa beneath a checkerboard of cream cheese frosting, the neighboring French Toast another hefty option with a crunchy topcoat overlying four supple-centered slices dripping with custard as fresh cream and strawberries completed the picture - both plates on par with the best in the city, and the former amongst the best nationwide.  Unwilling to forgo desserts, and as such requesting the rest of the pancakes be packed up, it was with little hesitation that a slice of carrot cake was ordered and clocking in at probably 12-ounces the four layer slice would prove not only enormous but also outstanding, the moist base bespeckled with carrots, raisins, and nuts amidst a bold spice heavy in cinnamon and nutmeg - a pair of freshly made cookies proving equally delicious and thus leaving one to wonder just how much better Citizens could be if it brought the whole pastry department in house.

PpK9ugYAExT131E_QNaRGA.text: Their bbq chicken salad was the best salad ive ever had in my life!! The servers were really nice, too. Also we asked for plates to share and they gave us separate dishes!! How smart was that. However, their spaghetti bolonese was below average considering the price. ($25) i think i can cook better spaghetti at home

GNaQrgp144Vd4OH0ahSSnA.text: Love the bartender Steven! The Blt and French onion soup are amazing and so are the drinks!! Love the atmosphere too!!

B_wA_zdNcQ7K0X_7mSx-Ug.text: This places wasn't on our agenda, but my fiance and I were hungry so before we got that cranky feeling, we decided to find food FAST!   There was no wait so we were immediately seated. The waitress was nice at first. She tended to us, answered all our questions, and took our order. It took a long while to get our food, but we didn't want to make a big deal because the Olympian Soccer player, Mia Hamm was sitting right next to us.   I ordered the Mac and Cheese which the cheese was so runny, it looked like clam chowder. The cheese wasn't orange, but it was white. I also had the Smothered Tator Tots which was good. My fiance had the Tuna Melt and Corn on the Cob, He enjoyed the corn, but said he had better Tuna Melts.   After we got our food, we noticed the waitress so involved with Mia Hamm and her guest. We finally made eye contact and asked for our bill. When I gave her my credit card, the waitress came back with my reciepts to be signed. I was writing a tip and calculating my total when the waitress came back. She apologized and said she accidentally put Mia Hamm's table on my credit card. She said, since they didn't close the bill, my credit card will not be charged. WRONG! I went on my bank statement that day and I seen two charges for Citizen's. One charge finally dropped off two days later.   I wouldn't come back again. There food is ridicously over priced for what it is. There are a ton of other great restaurants in Vegas.

2zYThs1lyIVOx4Eqkr6quQ.text: Took my children to Citizen's to have a Christmas Eve breakfast. Dion was our server and he was great! He was very helpful and attentive with a great attitude. We love Citizen's for their great service and awesome foodThx again!

i2-gM07RmFweT4Qwv7SzvQ.text: The decor and signage is quite inviting.  I was about exhausted when we stumbled in around 11p and didn't really care where we ate, I had a $40 per diem to use and hadn't eaten since lunch.  The menu looked good enough, there was immediate seating and it was easy access to the elevators....Sold!  I ordered the Lobster roll with potato salad and if I could go back in time I might choose differently.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't what I expected either.  The roll is more like a piece of bread with a slit in the middle to stuff the lobster mix into.  Good flavor on the bread and plenty of lobster but that is no roll.  Now the potato salad must not be their claim to fame, it was boring and limited in quantity.  I mean, I get it, it's potato salad but come on let's make it taste good.  This was chunks of potato with mayo, and if it wasn't that is what it tasted like.  Good thing is there is a ton of stuff on the menu, they are open 24 hours, (I think) and it's super convenient if you're staying at the bay.

pBSXhpSePFswVrK-aOHJ8Q.text: Waiter was really nice, it is convenient because it is opened 24 hours. Ordered fish and chips, it was a HUGE portion the fries were good and the fish was decent. The prices are a little on the pricey side but that is expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N8KQmbbcxTC_dnLD78AcFA.text: We didn't even get to eat here becuase the host staff was so dismissive and rude when we went to eat breakfast. We arrived at 11 am and were militantly told breakfast ended at 10:45 by two people who were standing side by side reapeating everything each other were saying. I am not a dense person, I don't need two people telling me the same thing over and over again and then walking away from me before I can even take a look at the lunch menu. Do not come here asking for breakfast any later than 10:45 or you'll get ganged up on. Will not ever try to go here again. We ended up at Seabreeze Cafe, it was amazing so everything worked out for the best.

Bb9wubgnAFsusMIbQsliUw.text: The food is very bland. Very very bland. It's all fresh, but not a whole lot of flavor. I added some salt and thought that is maybe what was missing. Then it was just salty and bland. Sat at the bar this most recent time. A friend joined me about halfway through. I finished eating and was given my check so I paid it. That must have meant "beat it" because then I was ignored when I asked for a refill on my coffee and a refill on my water. Given the breakfast options that were available, this seemed like a good idea, and it still may be the only decent option.

PePIGI32nb5nalAW922lBQ.text: I always have an amazing meal when I come here! The food is delicious the staff is friendly and fun and very attentive! Today I went for their delicious brunch and had an amazing server named Tim! Not only was my eggs Benedict to die for! But he made sure we were constantly okay and restocked fresh coffee, water and drinks without us having to ask! It is always a good time there! I recommend brunch and Tim for sure! :) cheers!

DYSohnmAcEngqYOwXpIzmA.text: This place rocks! Awesome staff and totally worth a 10 minute wait to get food at 1:30 in the morning!

W3TQM6Syag1bOE6N3EWngA.text: Ordered the muffalata, bread was hard as a rock, had no flavor, which is amazing for something literally covered in marinated,chopped up olives. Boyfriend ordered the burger, it was burnt on one side. He ordered it medium rare....This place has got to go. Based on the other reviews, I think it should close down and be replaced.

y045FeUaNiqLR7prlAtRnA.text: Very casual place very unassuming. The portions are huge but everything is made with lots of flavor and taste. Excellent causal dinning if in vegas. Moderate prices but it's all worth it

7E5OrFoAuftkvvLGwBEjEw.text: Mediocre at best.  The salad was generously sized but boring. My friend had a decent burger with OK fries. Two of us got a $15 glass of wine that was minuscule. They should cut back on the portions of their bland food and pour an average glass of wine.

dNr7DWdgut_kHPdbYa11wQ.text: I was attracted by the idea of comfort food in a casino 24 hrs a day. The staff were very friendly and greeted me upon walking in. The atmosphere was nice and the decor was just right. Portion size was large enough to eat family style following the spinach artichoke app which was very good. The Mac and cheese was solid and the skinny fries had great flavor. I also added a grilled cheese just to try it which was solid. I didn't try the pastries but they looked very tasty. The hangover brunch with bottomless mimosas for $25 was a nice touch. Def check it out if you're in Mandalay Bay.

fn9sG1Q7Q4BIa-030QXFQg.text: Just had lunch at Citizens.  We had the mahi mahi fish tacos and the chicken quesadilla - both were very good.  The tacos has big filets of fish , rather than the usual chunks.  Fish was delicious as well as the entire taco.  Bustling, but relaxed atmosphere, good service even though the place was busy.  I also tried the Ginger Snap juice smoothie - was very good.  There was a choice of 6-8 juice smoothies.  This place offers comfort food, but plenty of healthy options too.  We saw a few burgers come past - they looked great.

n0RjFz7yFyV4a_p6kETVIw.text: My husband and I went here to grab a late dinner after a concert. First the good... the mahi mahi fish tacos were amazing! The bad, which FAR outweighed the good... we went at 11pm and about two-thousand people were waiting directly in front to get into the club. Basically we just sat and ate while trying to avoid seeing women wearing dresses so short we could literally see butt cheeks! Also, the club is SO LOUD that we couldn't even talk during our meal. This place is probably great during the day when the area isn't full of BOOMING music and people trying too hard to look umm... not sure how to be P.C here. I'd be willing to go here again but only before the sun goes down!

VRXHJMp7mNmzCftzpWkyow.text: Husband and I went there for brunch I ordered the benedict with salmon and my husband got the chicken and waffles. We waited at least 30 min for our food and while my husbands food was nice and hot mine was not and my eggs were hard boiled. When the waiter came by and asked us about our food I told him I was not very happy with getting hard boiled eggs. He offered to get me more eggs but I declined he also said that he would talk to the manager. My husband loved his chicken and waffles and I thought my food was not good but at least the manager apologized for the wait and the eggs so we got the meal for free.

o0FNo-0MdSW2wg-EyzylCg.text: Excellent service and food! If you're  in Vegas and looking for a great meal that is also a good value (very rare in Vegas), you will find that at Citizens.

HFi_UFrtuZTlZavD3fxV1g.text: The food was okay. The service was slow, definitely do not go if you are in a hurry. For the prices and the lack of speed I was expecting something a little bit better. The food did it's job though. The restaurant is cute and we had a good time.

2WBNmgb5akl8Na7qfmfBcA.text: Great food other than salads. Huge portions and good staff ate 3 meals there during our trip to Mandalay bay. Bacon cheeseburger is amazing!

z0bZxkyfoGZ7oQAlXoEM4w.text: Lovvvvvvve citizens!!! The sweet chili Thai wings, smothered tots, and their specialty cocktails are to die for! The atmosphere is amazing with a contemporary spin on American food.  Most importantly, the customer service is above par! Joe, my waiter provided a very awesome experience for me! u4MDqzz12DB_84932ei9WA.text: Best spot for a latte in Mandalay bay. Great sandwiches, French fries, etc. always a friendly staff. I recommend giving this a try if you're near by!!

Hsfdt8nsJQU3UBauDWUoLQ.text: This place has been by far the best experience since I've been in Las Vegas. Thank you again Jeanine for your warm and friendly service.

C-9QmEAitL-_tZ89o2puNQ.text: Went there  for lunch, sat at the bar had the best experience Raquel was awesome very good bartender clean and very attentive with our drinks great customer service excellent management  also very attentive  thank you..

ThCeaZNlHCDy7Xu3uRFnOQ.text: Las Vegas home of great service, NOT this place was a kick in the teeth for the MGM group, service was terrible server number 1 said we can't sit our selfs and to wait for the hostess (who was not there) then I asked to sit on a certain side and she said NO we are closed that side ( there was 3 family's sat over there eating) then our server shows up instantly hears my accent, thinks we are tourists so thinks I don't know how to tip ( so he didn't give a shit) little did he know we are Las Vegas residents!!! My wife got served a beer is a dirty glass, nothing got recommended, we did not get checked back up on ( servers who can't handle 3 tables need to get out of the game and move states) the food was ok but services from step 1 was the worst ever so would not go back and will be making sure I let every1 know this!!! O and I tried to contact the manger 3 times to give her some feedback  but she hung up my call 3 times and left a VM but nothing, I hope the owner of the company reads this and really thinks about the staff he has working for them!!!

gJtzqJrh8ZLm3wvuCs1LPg.text: Ate here while staying at TheHotel @ Mandalay Bay.  Our meal was very simple: Cobb salad, patty melt, 2 beers.  The burger was indulgent- it's basically 2 grilled cheese sandwiches (very thin bread) with a burger in the middle.  Came with fries and was pretty good, but nothing special by any means.  Given that it's Vegas, I forgive the $20/entree, but the food was just alright.  Next time I'll make the short walk to the burger bar.

iHaQ1AM5HXe_rqaTla1nSw.text: Great if you want a quick bite and coffee. There's however a price for the convenience: Our two mediocre sandwich and lousy coffees cost almost $40!  I'll go to the Starbucks around the corner next time for food and coffee..! To top it off, the cashier was not that nice and friendly, as she was annoyed at customers in her presence. OK, moving on....

JmBPXsmXyGgtoTYYupbamw.text: Great breakfast!  The banana pancakes were delicious and the coffee cups are cappuchino sized.  I would definitely return.

2j40eVTHGKkEv9ZL4DOJ_g.text: My best friend Megan and I ate at the bar area. Steven was our bartender and server. He catered to us based on his very accurate observations. He was an excellent server and bartender, he had amazing advice, and was really easy and fun to get along with. Because of him, my friend and I will both suggest the exceptional service and quality of food and drink that we received. It's not overally common to get such tailored service that we did, but we both really appreciate it, and highly highly recommend this place, for both hominess, quality, and experience. This is a really cool place :)

tz4lcPN2rdIg-ZvG5r34Pg.text: I was in town for a few days for a conference and wandered in to Citizens for lunch on the first day.  The food was pretty good, had the cobb salad, which isn't going to be a mind blowing experience no matter where you go, lol.  But because the bartender - Raquel - was super cool, I actually ended up going back two more times the following days.  I got the mahi tacos - bomb - and the chicken wings - good chicken, but a tad over sauced.    I give this place a solid 5 just because I like chatting with Raquel.  But the mahi tacos are definitely worth it too.    if you are looking for some decent food and cool people, definitely give this place try.

q23lsBJZPABdd-6f8pSeuw.text: The food was great I had meatloaf it was some of the best meatloaf I've had in years. The portions are huge the service was terrific our server, lotus, took our orders without writing them down and made no mistakes. We would come back here in a heart beat

SBEqQZa5b0uygWGE0KqujA.text: Had the apple tart and fruit. Food was fine. Service was terrible. The line seemed weird when we walked in and I couldn't figure out where to go. I started in line, placed my order and then couldn't get back to pay. Had to wait as others ordered and then they got upset that I was in the way. The person helping us pulled our food and then left it on the counter and walked away.  Next time, I'm bringing my own pastries and skipping this place unless they move the register to the left of the glass case where it needs to be.

rEgdkRDeoJ2piVPLQ9hHmA.text: Good food, cool place to hang out and chill after losing your ass at the tables.  I would give this place 4 Stars but the service sucks.

WAB3_9fuCBOqW_7ROs-tXg.text: Came here because it was one of the few restaurants open late at night. Food was excellent,  a little pricey, but it's Vegas, so no big deal. Service was okay. There were 4 waiters, 3 food runners, a bartender,  hostess and manager. We had to wait a bit for our check and they gave me a dirty spoon with food stuck on it yet, but other than that it was good. Nice atmosphere and drunk people are always entertaining.

_SK4nUaVsL_PsBHLzgEqag.text: Have to say Raquel was awesome, was helpful courtesy and definitely fun to be around. We really appreciate the time and service not to mention the foid was outstanding .Will definitely be coming back!

39aZLRXM6XSW7ktlIOp_uQ.text: Quick seating.  Great food.  My husband is a wing man; he loved the buffalo wings.  The BBQ ribs were great as well, but my favorite were the onion rings that came with the ribs.  Finished the meal off with a nice piece of cheesecake, which was excellent. I will definitely be back.

Rk-ZmyOf0kihglaUr_3vLg.text: Great play to stop by and eat. We went around lunch time. We ordered the artichoke spinach dip which was amazing! Definitely recommend trying! Also tried the balboa steak sandwich , fancy for a French dip. Very good! Service was great too.  Overall an enjoyable place to sit and eat good food.

WdfCuNB1SAyPa5CjP-OHXQ.text: Ejay was the definition of welcoming. New exactly how to treat a table with assistance and space. Food was yummy and decent prices for the areas. Got the burrito and satisfied and the perfect poached eggs on the biscuits and gravy.

afTMABhyrUKx2JtZFQPABg.text: The ultimate Bloody Mary could easily be a meal in itself ! The chicken noodle soup and buttered crackers hit the spot . The service was a tad bit slow.

QTe1xXjrFNfdSjhiQdDCPw.text: I got the breakfast burrito. It was good and very filling.  The guacamole tasted fresh. The salsa was warm,  and I prefer mine cold; however, it did have a nice bite to it.  The service was friendly and attentive.

8p8sQDGKvsDEHHfbxFy79Q.text: Vegetarian and gluten-free with a penchant for light, fresh, healthy fare makes for tough dining in Vegas.  The to-go counter saved me with their kale salad, it was fresh and delicious. Too much dressing - really wish they could have the salads w/dressing on the side or ease up! But yummy anyway. Also nabbed the crudite veggies and tossed the ranch dressing. Pricey, but I was happy for some fresh veggies! The sit-down side got me through breakfast with a tasty CA omelette. I got the eggs fried (and requested them cooked in butter not oil) with avocado, sour cream and pico de gallo on top. A little pile of tatertot hash came with. Was it mind blowing? No. Was it tasty, fresh and satisfying? You bet. The hash was "meh" but I could see folks liking it for that salty kick back to grade school.  Coffee (iced americano w/soy) was quite good.  Service was attentive and friendly, no complaints.  All in all I am grateful this place is here and will gladly come back knowing I can get a fresh tasty meal. Expensive? No more so than the rest of Vegas. Thanks, Citizens! (I'd actually give them 3.5 stars, 4 if the menu were a little more inspired, but all in all the food is reliable, good, and fresh.)

MkHyg_9u14d6V9tenpep_Q.text: Citizens is very convenient if you are staying at The Mandalay Bay.  Two of the best dishes are the  Chicken Noodle Soup and the Fish Tacos.

7NlBGvw0RpoT1uYtI79TuQ.text: YUM! my first time trying this place out! my colleague and i had a long day of working at the trade show and didn't have anything to eat except for mini appetizers and lots of drinks. we ended up eating here at 9:30/10PM.   we were seated right away even though they were really busy. we sat on the outside of the restaurant. I kind of wish we sat somewhere quiet because we were shouting at each other when were were talking.   i got the mahi mahi fish tacos. and i highly recommend that! it comes with 3 crunchy tacos. sauce was good.   service was great. our water and wine glass was always filled.   i like how we can charge the bill to our rooms!

ZL1Ckbx3bdVJGWaC3E049A.text: Best French Dip I've ever had! Totally worth the $20. Can't believe we stumbled upon this gem after looking for a place to eat at 2am. This place is 24/7 and if you're in the Mandalay looking for a late night spot to eat look no further.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sammich Spot

z-NohJuezTznw57ycMwiFw.text: I had family in town and we decided to meet for dinner at Citizens because we love Mandalay Bay. Bad idea. Once we'd looked at the menus and the server came to take our order, we were told that what three of us were ordering wasn't available that night (one being fish and chips, if you can believe it). It didn't get better from there. Food is mediocre at best and the service is spotty. Took forever to get our check so we could get the heck out of there. There are better options than Citizens.

Zspr3M6B2udn7EpkjgrfNw.text: I had breakfast 2 days in a row here at Citizens during my work trade show at Mandalay Bay. My food was good, and I was able to order a special omelette with spinach. Our waitress was super nice and we even saw her the next day. They also have a nice outdoor dining as well as pastries and coffee to go.   Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

EYyBxwDzOphjZvb6YWc2gw.text: I was hesitant to try this place because of the 3-star reviews, however, I am so glad I did. I ate breakfast here pretty much every morning and the food was always really good. My favorite breakfast was the egg, ham and cheese croissant with potatoes. The croissant sandwich was huge and the potatoes were amazing. The parfaits are quite possibly the best ever. Lots of muffins and breakfast bread and pastry options. I would absolutely recommend this place.

LcTT1Ny-Ao9jMjB8-V0h7w.text: Stale stale awful French toast. Waiter didn't even tell me they were out of the orange whip cream. I had to ask why it was missing. Awful restaurant and experience!!

0_cxHOP5Gx79nn0Ef6ojAw.text: 45 minutes for a to go order.  Don't come here after midnight, unless you're willing to wait an awfully long time for subpar food.

SvMjoP6gs9MucxnJtw_ApA.text: Came during the breakfast rush. Waited a short 15 mins to be seated. We ordered the corned beef (4/5 stars), crab Benedict (4/5 stars) potatoes were bomb! Creme brulee French toast (1/5 stars). Everything was great except the French toast. It tasted like regular French toast with an orange cool whip topped with greasy berries. Our server was awesome, super friendly and sweet!

Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mlbgqR4r-8jzUhIOj81JmQ.text: What a confusing set up and a ridiculous restaurant to have in an upscale hotel like Mandalay Bay.  If you want a sweet dessert and coffee don't come here, you aren't welcome.  I came in just to relax after a travel day.  The restaurant looks inviting, but they have a to-go area.  I just said I wanted a coffee and a treat and a place to wind down.  They directed me to the hostess to be seated.  We were seated and when I told the waitress that we just wanted some teas, coffees and some pastries she told me that I could take my stuff to go in a paper bag and to sit outside of the restaurant.  I was only allowed to sit in there if I was to have FULL service.  What does that mean?  It's 2:30 in the afternoon.  What a rude waitress.  She promptly took away the menus and didn't even give a chance look.  She even told the 3 of us, maybe you can drag some tables together out in the promenade so we could all sit down.  Never again.  I worst service ever.  I'm glad I didn't even get a chance to waste my money here.  If I could give zero stars I would.  After reading all the other reviews I'm glad I didn't spend my money on some thawed from frozen desserts.  Go to Starbucks instead probably more consistent.

zcNTSGiP-L0jy991O71-WA.text: We ate breakfast here on a Monday morning, 7am.  Eggs, bacon, pancakes, toast & hash browns.   We divided the meal between the two of us.  Eggs were not tasty.  Bacon ok.   Pancakes...not fluffy.  They were just flat. We asked for more butter.  Left 20 minutes no later, no extra butter. A guy by us came in, waited, got no service and left.  Our bill was $40.  We ate at Seabreeze Cafe 2 other mornings for less cost and better food.

_wWowPMhbOsHzugHWBlKZg.text: Every time I stay at Mandalay, Citizens will forever be my go to spot! Not only is it open 24/7 but it basically has your breakfast lunch or dinner. This time we ordered the tuna melt, frisco melt & a tuna sandwhich that all came with fries! Again everything was on point. Easy, fast & casual. Check in on Yelp for your free cheesecake! The donuts we took to go were delicious!   Our waiter was very helpful with the menu for the first timers so thank you for that! Very fast, helpful & attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZxC10crbh2MOg74NJ8phfA.text: Boyfriend and I are staying at Mandalay Bay for the weekend and we decided to stop here for a quick bite after we checked into our rooms. We ordered a Caesar salad ($16) and a turkey avocado sandwich ($10ish). First of all, you think you can't mess up a salad. Especially a Caesar salad that's $16, right? Wrong. This was the worst salad I've ever tried. The croutons were extremely soggy and chewy (probably from the moisture)- all their salads are pre-made and sitting in refrigerators. The chicken breast was also extremely dry and inedible.   The sandwich that we ordered was okay, but the "avocado" was NOT real/fresh cut avocados. It was some kind of green, mixed with things avocado paste, a poor excuse for avocado.  There are better options if you keep walking thru the casino (I.e. burger bar). Avoid this place if you can.

Vtxi1DAp7xcKRECiewpapA.text: The french toast was okay. There are better food options in this hotel and it's not like this is so much cheaper to warrant the okay food when there are so many better options.

OK7-bk6bbCaY0h8_--vlKQ.text: Great service and excellent portions... will definitely visit again.. Steak was delicious and drinks were just right.

030eq0T46ydNMeyReJae_A.text: I love this place because it open late.  The food is not good though.  It's just enough when you're drunk to make you est but sober you would think twice.  The pretzel bites are fried for some reason.  The chips and salsa tastes store bought.  The quesadilla wasn't even satisfying.  If you need a quick bite it's great but dont expect to sit there and think "man I want to come back here tomorrow!"

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xF92pFvuBT16rdUjgKQyXw.text: We had a late night craving for dessert during our staycation at the Mandalay Bay & found this place.  They're open 24/7 and serve up American cuisine.  It was very crowded but there was room at the bar & we took advantage of it. The bartender was very professional & fast on top of his game. We decided on the 7 Layer Chocolate cake a/k/a (BIG CAKE) !! It was huge & sinfully delicious- this could result in death by chocolate had I not shared it with my guy   The coffee was fresh brewed & great with the cake!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sinfully delicious
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t let the picture fool you! It&#39;s a BIG piece of cake!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 7 Layer Chocolate Cake!

zgEQdDqELbOJWWBKh_1fjA.text: Always get great fresh food here...late nite or for dinner.Chicken noodle soup is excellent,yet the MEATLOAF was the best Ive ever had.Good service,clean restaurant.

cE7rkQV1JPpA6dyLqerMWQ.text: Fun& inviting place to meet friends while attending a convention or before going out for the evening. The cobb salad was very generous & tasty. The rueben sandwich with cole slaw was delicious and filling. The cole slaw was just the right amount of creaminess & flavorful. I had a glass of chardonnay with my meal and was surprised that I actually got a full sized glass. It had a busy but inviting atmosphere. The service was fast and friendly. I will definitely be back!

G2eHOIzOgAldR8cA1Zq_Og.text: I love everything that they make here. I'm not being biased just because my beau Works there. It's just a really great food. And I believe it's like one of the only restaurant open 24 hours in Vegas

i4r0fMALPsxTsrGJWqRFrA.text: My friend and I were staying at the Delano and by night three of the trip, we were exhausted from all of our fun. It was around 9pm and we hadn't had dinner so we decided on Citizens because it was close and easy. It was by far the worst meal we had all weekend.  Pros: The service was excellent. Our waitress was really friendly and checked in throughout the meal. The food was brought out quickly. We split a salad and they were nice enough to portion it onto two plates in the kitchen.  Cons: The food was bad and expensive. The mixed greens salad was as described on the menu, lettuce with carrots, cucumbers and tomatoes, but like 95% lettuce. To be fair, it was a very large portion. The dressing could've been better. The Teriyaki Bowl was literally a bowl of brown rice with maybe a half a cup of vegetables on top, for $22. It felt like something a student would make to save money. The nachos were the worst. They were basically inedible, but again, huge portion. How do you mess up nachos?? I think most of it came from using cheese sauce rather than real cheese.  Overall, I was let down by the quality. Our bill came to around $100 for two (2 glasses of wine, 1 salad, 2 mains + tip) We ate next door at Lupo the night before for about the same amount and the food was SO much better. I would suggest going there instead.

DJr9Mgi9pyuHyDC0iQHq8Q.text: theyre open 24 hours so its super convenient. ate here on a late night wasn't really impressed with the menu but it does change throughout the day. so during the day maybe its much better. tried a few things on their sit down menu and it was okay. i wasn't wowed by it or anything. Not a place I would come back for a sit down breakfast/lunch/dinner. Only went there because it was the only thing open. BUT they are getting some stars because of their to go line. Not the most friendly people in the world but its quick and easy. And I must say that their chocolate cake is the BEST ever. its huge but sooo good! i always come back here for their cake (to go line). if youre a chocolate lover, get the cake!

yNR8aYQ-odH_XJRLAlkX5w.text: This place is a great place for a midnight snack. They are open 24/7 and have both cafe and patio seating. Offering both hot food and cafe treats, it is a place for you to shake off your munchies.   The appearance is up to par with a Vegas casino restaurant, open yet individual, not appearing like a hawker Stall. The restaurant is divided. One side has a French style cafe with a pastry counter. The sweets look terrific. On the other, is a bar with tables. It is very neat, yet casual. Perfect for a quick in and out.   The service was slow, and honestly very incompetent. Our waiter took 20 minutes to bring water and tea, there were only three parties there, two of which were being served by other employees. I asked for some Splenda, and he ran off and forgot. The orders were not written down, and subsequently did not arrive in the descriptor form. This is the fault of the service.   Food came out at a reasonable time, as when the cooks got the order, it came out hot and fresh. The food was cooked to order, which is rare for a casino pub.   The food was very salty, probably a bait for ppl to order more alcohol that is jacked up to state maximum prices. One salad and one order of pretzels was around 50 dollars. Vegas prices? I think not. Over all, if you are drunk or don't care for anything but filling your stomach and having a good time, this is the place to go. I would not come back to intentionally dine. It would be a spontaneous thing if I were to return.

yXTcidV5EdhefXvL8SBXTw.text: Considering you're in a hotel of course it's pricey. But we did get a good amount of food. We went for a breakfast/brunch. The Belgian waffle that was a good size with syrup and bananas. The other enteee we decided was the breakfast burrito. The waitress was kind enough to split them for us which ended up giving us each a large quantity of guacamole and their salsa. Both of which were great.  The waitress was kind and was on it with filling up our coffee cups. They had a full bar and their cocktails looked delicious but we opted out on booze for the morning!  The restaurant itself was cute and there is an option to grab stuff from a coffee bar with some snacks, salads and sandwiches.  Not too bad would go again if I were staying at the Mandalay Bay

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Forf-HiI5UobKpQo0FCo0w.text: This place was so good! We had breakfast here one day and then came back for lunch another. The iced tea wasn't good but the rest was pretty dang delicious. The biggest issue was it was SO LOUD...I had to leave during lunchtime because it literally was too loud to even hear my boyfriend at the same table.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmmmm breakfast

2oqK0HHeO6ZJE1p0WXQ9XQ.text: My favorite late night spot. The Ultimate Nachos as just that, huge portion. Bring a friend to eat here. A lot of items are big enough to share. Also, get the Carrot Cake, it's 4 big layers and requires 2 frienda to help you eat it. Mmm. If you decide to try this place, tell them BATMAN sent you. I have to put an alias, since I don't like being called Michael. Lol. My name is always mispronounced.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uGBjimBu5eBIldlckbPXFA.text: Tonight was our first time here. We liked it.   I had the Beef Short Rib Lasagna. It was huge!  It came with 2 slices of garlic bread. The whole meal was great. I think the cost was $29.   My wife had the Fish Tacos. She said they were just okay.   With a Yelp check-in, we scored a complimentary slice of cheesecake. Nice.   We were here ahead of seeing the Micah Jackson One performance, so Citizens was real convenient.   We'd eat here again.

yN9GtFFeHQw0tBm9l0nDiQ.text: Food was mediocre and the bartender was a dick to one of our kids. She asked for a pen and scolded her and told her to go away because she wasn't 21. She asked for a pen not a cocktail.

4_nIag9Q00q6ZMegTjWpFA.text: The food was good. The female bartender was a real biatch! My son and his wife come here every visit... it is their go to place. One item, is a signature Bloody Mary. My Daughter in law tried to order one and she basically refused her as it would take too long.... "and it is a lot of work" .... really... she was making two in front of her at the time.... she finally relented and ordered something else. My son went back about 15 minutes later and was strongly dissuaded again about ordering one... again, she basically nearly refused again...  very unprofessional!!! By the way way the restaurant was half empty and it was at 2:30 on a Friday afternoon; again this is their "signature" cocktail at $25! Did speak with the manager but only received minimal love....

Pzm7sqj-k3cnTYCY_Tye2A.text: First, yes, it is little on the pricey side but well worth it if you value being seated quickly, not having to wait in a long buffet line, and getting fresh, hot coffee within minutes of being seated.   My wife had the lox and bagel, which were prepared textbook except for the bagel, which needed to be toasted a little more.  Our server quickly fixed it.  I tried the chicken aguachiles, which was their (breakfast) take on the Mexican classic.  It was off the chain!!  I substituted medium poached eggs for over-easy.    If you're looking for a quality breakfast, minimum wait, and don't really need a buffet, Citizens is a solid option.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken aguachiles with poached eggs

_vepmBBanO6rt43v8A9ojw.text: Food was decent.  Service definitely need improvement.  Any place you need to flag down a manager to even get some water is a red flag.

ZIdJa0I1TOwDdOP2sD4RuQ.text: We spent over $100 on 4 breakfast items, a coffee, and a juice. Vegas food is expected to be overpriced. But it's extra frustrating when you're paying more AND they get your order wrong.  The breakfast burrito was good, but came with a side of 6 tortilla chips... we also ordered the two egg breakfast with bacon, and the bacon was missing. The crab cake "benedict"was two soggy crab cake patties with poached eggs and a handful of breakfast potatoes, no english muffins. Kind of odd. And disappointing overall.

_lY9uhMVqb8OHX9oA_DQBA.text: Best place to pop in and grab a bite without being stuck around pretentious people or drunk frat boys  Erick is THE BEST server/bartender - try to sit in his section!  Ambiance is laid back and welcoming - kids are welcome  Well done Citizens!

IJeDARLf6GmOskGtyxFYyw.text: I come here every time I stay at the Mandalay Bay or Delano hotel.  Their prices aren't bad but at least here you get 2 things very consistent every time which is great service and great food. I have had a ton of things off their menu but I really have 2 stand outs. First is the brick chicken...which is so delicious. Always moist, always juicy and full of great flavors. The second is the BLTA sandwich...the funny part is most BLT's lack a lot of bacon. One time here I ordered and asked for extra bacon and the waitress said " I tell you what if there's not bacon let me know and I will bring you some"? At first I thought why wouldn't you want a little extra money on the bill till the sandwich came out and literally had 1.5-2" of bacon. This sandwich has the perfect bread to protein ratio with thick sliced tomatoes served on sourdough bread. At least 1 time during every trip I get this sandwich it is so good. Doesn't have to be complicated to be great.   Bottom line breakfast, lunch or dinner the Citizen is a great spot located in the Mandalay Bay Casino. Even if your note tying here well worth trying and in a hurry they have another whole side to their restaurant catered to quick on the go food.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick chicken this is so good
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey club

2NccrRak4AkTgI_IfsFThw.text: The food was delicious, the service was great, the atmosphere is comfortable and not incredibly smokey.   They use paper straws! And don't forget your free cheesecake for checking in on here.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d8mfeu9dgOZ3afsiyzFp4g.text: Want to be judged for what you wear? Better yet, want to be judged for your ethnicity?? (And possibly judged for what you order?) COME TO CITIZENS IF YOU WANT TO BE TREATED LIKE SHIT! Lovely servers and managers who are racist and don't care if they give good customer service or not are employed and thrive here, it's great.  PS didn't stay long enough to even get my entree to know if the food is good or not

OCQBpHG7M1GWOP0B8QLNBQ.text: Service was very slow and our food was cold. The pancakes tasted like round sponge bread with no flavor. Usual Vegas pricing. After waiting for quite a while my order also ended up being wrong. The server was great about fixing everything, we just didn't see her for quite a while to let her know about the mistake. We had to flag somebody down a couple times to refill our coffee as well, but it was odd since it  really didn't look that busy. I might go to the walk up counter to order some grab-and-go thing, like their smoothies, but I would not visit the restaurant again.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate breakfast!

SSwyp7JnA6MbELyHvKOF9w.text: Great place. Conveniently open 25/7 in Mandalay Bay so close to Light. Was in Vegas for 2 days and founds myself here four times. Twice for breakfast and two times for  late night bites. Each experience was different, which was kind of frustrating. My first time for breakfast there I had an incredible server and great create your own omelette. The second time the service wasn't great and I order the same omelette and it wasn't nearly as good as the day before. Late night hits were alway great and service was wonderful at night as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yR64RDpDiEzEmJBR4UlCGA.text: We were attending a conference in Mandalay Bay, and Citizens is not only located in Mandalay, but it is conveniently open 24 hrs.  We had just gotten off the plane and we were starving for breakfast.  We were able to be sat immediately.  That is where the speediness of the morning ended.  The restaurant was not even half full when we were sat, yet we waited for far too long just to place our drink order.  Then we waited what felt like a lifetime for those drinks to actually arrive at our table.  We placed our food order and I bet you can guess it.  Yup, that is right, it took what felt like another lifetime.  It was beyond our comprehension why everything was taking so long, because again, the restaurant was not even busy.  By the time our food did arrive we scarfed it down, we were starving.  We tired to pay our tab quickly, but we were completely unsuccessful.  We definitely waited over 15 min just to cash out.  What I would say is that the food is completely edible, but only if you have ample amounts of time to wait for it at Citizens.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chilaquiles
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and Gravy without the eggs
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito

lgQqZiMqSTHEJno3ofva_g.text: PSA~ Citizens of Vegas, skip Citizens Kitchen.  Everything about my dining experience here was underwhelming.  For one, our waiter was at our table as little as possible.  He took our order and then played on his phone for the rest of the time.  Well until it was time to pay.  He seemed very uninterested in doing his job that day.  It's kind of embarrassing when you bring out of town guests.  For my meal I ordered the Mahi Mahi tacos.  There was a very distinct fish taste like it was almost going bad.  Luckily I did not get sick but I didn't really want to finish them.  These were grilled fish tacos with guac, slaw and chipotle aioli.  I did not taste the chipotle aioli one bit.  They definitely needed some help in the flavor department.    A bit of a mishap when our food was delivered as one of the drinks was spilled.  They brought out complimentary cheesecake to atone for the mistake.  Well, it was certainly a nice gesture but the cheesecake was very dry.  It almost all crumbled which was a disappointment.    For such a prime spot in Mandalay, I expected much more.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos

gc2knOX9Xfe6aaHeuQ3v9A.text: This was a quick and convenient option before seeing a show in Mandalay Bay. Unfortunately, the food and service were not great.  I like to start with the good. The restaurant is one of the first restaurants when coming from the parking garage. That made it easy to find and convenient. Our orders came out quickly so we weren't pressed for time getting to our show. This is probably the least expensive sit down restaurant on property. It is still overpriced for what you are actually getting though.  For dinner I ordered the Fish Tacos and could only eat about half of them. The flavor was lacking. I'm not sure which item it was, but something tasted funny to me. I get nervous about an odd taste in a dish with fish so I didn't finish eating. Nobody in our group that ordered tacos did end up sick so thankfully it wasn't the fish.   Dessert was cheesecake. This was okay at best. The crust was completely flavorless. The cheesecake filling was okay. It was topped with canned cherries that oddly saved it a bit.  The service was okay. Our waiter seemed distracted and maybe a little irritated. Maybe something else was going on because nobody in our group was being demanding or rude to warrant that.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos

KbJ0n_7SezwEsKfMDI0D8w.text: Lasagna - $29 -- was not good! the cheese was very oily and it was really hard to chew. The meat was greasy and did not look or taste good. Pricy and not delicious. The location was very clean which is why I'm giving it 2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
