AOkwNFgEtenMiqoHssuopg.text: Just stopped here for banana, coffee and a donut.  Banana was good, as was donut.  Coffee tasted a little burnt.  At least it wasn't too expensive.

hEc773P8yZ1j2hHPicvUwA.text: Best part of citizen's in Mandalay Bay was our waiter Jason!!  Made great suggestions on the menu.  Dinner was great! We will defiantly be back.

eQsmzRuJi0nOSZwJYCHazg.text: $22 mediocre roastbeef sandwich $18 slightly above average burger $4 gatorade!!! $4 mountain dew!!! 21 minute wait for to-go order  Shoulda gone with the Johnny rockets down the corridor.  A perfect storm of hunger, procrastination  and indecisiveness led us to settle for this 3 star joint on our way back through the hotel after visiting the shark reef.  Yelp don't lie.  Trust what you read and dine elsewhere.

RmHGD5QLgHrtgJ-wEabriQ.text: OK so I'm a sucker for good shrimp cocktail. I may have had the best shrimp cocktail I have had in about five years. I recommend great service and everybody smiling my fatness beer. Clean good for families good for fun

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me and my buddy Renato

uWs_93KW5AcEllw4WEWh-w.text: Came here late night with my best friend and her co worker! It was literally not the first choice of dining but at 3:30-4 AM there isn't much of a choice in Mandalay Bay. The menu of course is going to be expensive because it's a hotel chain restaurant/deli or whatever. The down fall is that with it being so late they have a very selective menu to choose from so you don't really have many options! Our waiter was an airhead and we had to keep asking him for the necessary things that should've already came automatically such as napkins and water.. After spending over $60 for some basic ass meal I was completely over it because there's no way no breakfast burrito that small should've costed $13 and then the potatoes were basic with no seasoning.. My bf liked the food probably only because he was drunk but other than that I can't see myself eating here again unless I had a food and beverage credit from the hotel, but wait even then idk I would probably choose somewhere else...

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute Sign
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Sandwhich

nzV-h-vcMKmTHn-hd8l0Pw.text: food and service were amazing! a little pricey but everything on the strip is.. just comes with the territory. i ordered the eggs benedict with their signature breakfast potatoes and i've been full for hours! super satisfied with this restaurant and definitely recommend

2yHrVbqGXqleG95Em3N-Hg.text: Tony our waiter was quick friendly and his knowledge of the food was superb.  He took a great photo of the group next to us without hesitation!   The French Onion Soup we split was excellent, very cheesy, and large portions...even split between the two of us.  I had a Tommykbocker Butthead Boch, and my GF had the Midori sour, both excellent even if the sour is a bit overpriced.  We then split the NY steak and it was very juicy, and well cooked to our medium order.  Came with fries on the plate, and if it wasn't juicy enough, the A-1 butter was really good.  A really good meal on the Strip for a high-priced seventy bucks, given the atmosphere, but not as pricy as other places in the Mandalay Bay. Well recommended, and we split on whether we would come back again.  We like variety, after all....

zpsKtMlyz_agaBx1I8SWcQ.text: Since we are locals, we rarely go to the strip; however we had guests visiting so we had to be polite and take one for the team.  We stopped at Citizens for a quick meal, hoping I would be able to find something that would fit my odd dietary needs.   I hate asking the servers for guidance; mostly because it's never a simple process and it's frustrating.  We were fortunate to have Robert M. as our server. He was happy to help me navigate the menu and steer me away from the ingredients I avoid. Robert M. also made sure I didn't feel like it was too much trouble to ask and was quick to joke with us.  He also helped choose wine to go with my companions meals; I don't drink but they were very happy by the time we left!

1vMyj2BM7bL_xfbhqvosIA.text: I got the chunky monkey shake and it had no flavor at all.. very disappointed & over priced think they forgot to put the banana inside.

sEU9l16Z8HhNYsYTuwUHUQ.text: Raquel the bartender is awesome!!!! great food, great service. Great management, Marjorie always has made me feel welcome !!!

HBLvKMPeih5_6ktRAIa0ow.text: Mediocre food at best. My friends and I were desperately trying to find a restaurant in Mandalay Bay to eat at before we headed to Daylight. So we just settled for this place.   Food: I asked the server for recommendations and he recommended the corn beef hash skillet. Since he said it was one of the popular dishes, I took his word for it and I was so disappointed when I got it. It was lukewarm and just not good, wasted my $16 on a dish I didn't even finish.   Service: Our server was nice and came promptly to take our orders and refill our waters throughout the time we were there. However, there was a situation that happened when we were paying. We asked for the server to split our bill by entrees and when he return with our change. My friend didn't her change back. We are generous but we weren't going to tip you $10 alright.  Definitely not a memorable dining experience for me in Vegas!

6YIBNoR6oW4cqnU-XXzkKA.text: We received great service on both visits.  He first was at 3:00a.m!   Food was fresh as well.  We would definitely go back for the rice crispy treats, fruit cups, and drinks

zlcby7K1ik3AjOMYsPYplA.text: Althought the chicken soup wsa seriously amazing...that is all I can really say I liked about this place  Pros: 1) Great Chicken soup 2) Good bread (if you ask for it)  Cons: 1) Right next to a live band that is CRAZY LOUD...you cannot talk with a friend, or hear even your self think. I had to ask for my food to be wrapped up  to go eat in my room, as it gave me a headache 2) Stiff, not terribly friendly and inattentive service. 3) You should not have to ask for bread and butter when sitting down for dinner 4) A spoon and napkin should probably be included when you order your soup to go 5) Did I mention that the service was stiff, unfriendly and attentive? When my bill came, she dropped it ...literally...on my table, without eye contact or even a 'thanks'. There was only one other table with people in the whole restaurant...so it isn't like she was busy, either

t1XkFjSdN5pqUCSDC_8n8w.text: The French Onion soup is deep with tasty cheese.  The lasagna is huge. But the main reason for the review is the bartender, Steven (dude with the handlebar mustache).  He's friendly, and had a lot of knowledge about the food.  He convinced me to have the pup and lasagna,  and both were great.  Props to the gent for helping making this a great dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna and Riesling

Ee7wRhnIXRqLDjFlWGCTvQ.text: I give it a poor two due to the expense. There are tons of other options nearby so I will explore to try and find a more reasonable place.   I had a ham and egg croissant and a small coffee and a yogurt and the cost was 29.59. And you wonder why I could not afford a tip (it was a to go order at the cashier).  The croissant was terrific. The "hash browns" came right out of the ore Ida bag in the freezer and were undercooked. Coffee was fine.   Vegas is weird and the Madalay Bay is like having a captive audience for which you can be charged three times what you should be charged. I am the dummy that did it.

_xYobFeQ9KtR0ezoiLKVDQ.text: Horrible service, and we got food poisoning from here so will definitely not be back in the future. We came in around 9pm and the place was pretty much empty, but the staff (two females) wasn't very friendly, and it didn't seem like they wanted to take our order. My friend decided she wanted the Steak & Cheese Panini ($12, yelp.com/biz_photos/citi...), which was ready in 5-10 minutes. We tried to sit at the tables inside, but the staff said that area was closed, and forced us to side outside in the "patio" area, where the seats were not very comfortable, and where it was colder (even though we were still inside the casino). Some of the meat in the panini was still cold when we got it, since it wasn't heated evenly. However, since it looked like pre-cooked meat, we figured it would be ok, which was a terrible mistake since we all got food poisoning the next day. DO NOT EAT HERE if you can avoid it. If it's the only place that's open, make sure that your food is cooked thoroughly. However, if you see two females behind the counter, expect some crappy service.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Cheese Panini ($12)

0LfKqBhP2pAN8z9FN9ObLA.text: I came in for breakfast and sat a the bar. The food was good  HOWEVER,  my bartender/waitress Raquel's customer service was horrible... borderline racist! Good news...she had no idea who she was serving. She soon found out!

k5ZzZiQFndAnmea_f-MLIA.text: Great food and the apps are amazing. Good beer selection as well. Jamie our waitress was super fast and nice. When we arrived we didn't see the hostess stand, so walked in and sat down. Robert, a waiter was a complete jerk and told us we needed to go and wait in line for a table. There was no line. We walked back up to hostess, she sat us immediately. Robert needs some help on how to treat customers.

CuK4vMDcw-EPKGfAOPYl2g.text: The food was good but a little expensive for breakfast. It is conveniently located inside the casino so we were able to grab breakfast upon our earlier arrival. We were on a time crunch and the service was pretty slow.

T0CgYkLCEicoy3SFHR-ljA.text: I normally don't review many things but I have to say the food was great!  However, the bartender was extremely unpleasant and even expressed her "unpleasantness" to her fellow co-workers in front of her guests.   What should have been a great meal and experience was ruined by a sour attitude. Maybe she was having a bad day???

qoKkE0w6SiDkilc6LFsfeg.text: Citizens Kitchen & Bar has been probably one of the WORST Vegas dine-in experiences that I have ever had off the strip. Not only was the food sub par, but the service was god awful atrocious. It took me 20 minutes to get a refill of water, and 30 minutes to put in a drink order. To make matters even worse, my credit card was charged 4 times the value of the food, and wasn't even voided. When I've tried to get a call back from the staff to rectify the situation, they just tell me they'd call me back but never do. Horrible restaurant, horrible service, horrible rating. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT from the Light Group.

Sg9IC3c2p_FPD0s0y54CYg.text: Best place to eat at Mandalay! Split a meal with someone. Served in two separate plates and plenty of food! Fresh and delicious! We always eat here when in Vegas. Chicken club sandwich is a favorite for lunch or dinner. Ultimate breakfast was great too! Both were plenty share with my husband! Try it. You won't be disappointed!

-DmQGhmHWk0hE500zk40IQ.text: I had a late night snack with some friends here. The chili cheese fries were good. It's not put together. They have the chili cheese in a bowl and you dip your fries in. Yummy! I had their turkey burger and it was pretty decent. The fries are a must.

cdOOuVOFLRG6tf7ZtqqxeQ.text: Horrible over priced food - poor quality, poor service and unprofessional management! Food that makes you sick is unacceptable. Avoid this place, much better options just steps away.

srx9f5IZu7winKfIyQOMyQ.text: Awesome food! Try the fish and chips. We took Naomi's suggestions for meal and drinks and she was spot on! Great service and fun atmosphere. We will definitely visit again and request Naomi.

r-rmNU4wLpxpwQrxKOF5rQ.text: We really enjoyed breakfast here. The coffee was good (smooth), hashbrowns were nice and crunchy, corn beef hash was really nice, my omelette was delicious! Will be back tomorrow.

skfMdCIGxiI3vfeG3prvfQ.text: Normally I receive great service here. But not today. Ingrid is too young (or acts too immature) for the position behind the register. I walked up, no one else in line and Ingrid and her co-worker didn't say one word at first. Not a "hello" or "welcome", just glared at me. Then after she finally decided to ask if I needed anything, I said "I just have a question, do you have chicken fingers?"  She seemed so bothered that she had to help me. This girl had no personality whatsoever. So I ordered two more things, and I was done with my order. I explained that I worked at Mandalay, to get my discount and she seemed even more annoyed about that. My tab was super cheap, and I asked if she got my order right, as I always spend at least $20 or more, because it was only $10. I was happy about the price, but wanted to make sure it was correct, because I had no faith in this person because of the lack of service to begin with.  So I had her repeat what I ordered, she seemed annoyed.  Wow, I can't believe that it's so inexpensive, I told her. I also told I always spend a lot more. She just didn't get it, didn't get that I was being friendly and making small talk. She said "I gave you your discount, it's $2". I got that I explained and was just surprised it was so cheap. She said "I'm sorry ..."   Why is she sorry?  No idea. It was a weird experience. I was excited about the price and that it was much lower. "Well, it is from the kids menu". Oh okay, got it.   Lmao. Get a personality Ingrid. And then don't continue to stair at people as they wait for their food. Then a manager with blonde hair came out and he stared at me. Did they think I was a celebrity or were they really just assholes?  Lol. Bad customer service no matter how you slice it    The food here is good, but the chicken fingers tasted either like dish soap or freezer burn. Don't get them, even for your kids. The chicken noodle is amazing.

DUumIveZXlnzxQnL7OZYLg.text: RECOMMEND toffee crunch blondie and mocha latte to go!  Sit at Kumi in the morning before it's open in their great lounge area and enjoy!

wVSPYFDkTQAvWPvEwkZ4ug.text: I've been staying in Mandalay Bay for 4 years and up until this year, my choice for late night eats has been Citizens Kitchen and Bar.    This past Friday night though, I encountered treatment by the staff that has caused me to swear off of spending another dollar in this place.  Honestly the food is good.  the menu is not as diverse as one would hope...but that's okay because at 3 in the morning what do you expect.    What you don't expect is a counter woman who barks at you that she's not ready to take your order.  And a manager who instead of apologizing for his staff's treatment, doubles down with rude treatment of his own.    I complained to Mandalay Bay management and they comp'd my meal along with a previous one in that establishment.  That was fine.  At least Mandalay Bay knows how to treat paying customers.    Citizens Kitchen and Bar does not.  And I would just as soon pay a cab to take me someplace NOT run by The Light Group before I spent another dime in this place.    My summary.  The food was fine.  But the staff, from the manager on down, in the 24 hour take out eatery was disgustingly inept at processing customer flow and orders and took out their frustrations on the customers, probably because they are the only 24 hour eatery in Mandalay Bay and knew that they could get away with it.

Gd0RGNrsDIn2hu70hA_PUQ.text: Great food and service. A wee bit expensive. I had spinach and artichoke dip and lobster roll and it was great!

HrBVA6_8rz6hJK4EzhrLGw.text: Food was disgusting and way overpriced. And the interior is very bland and ugly. Very uncomfortable seating. Diner style feel with shitty food. $40 for unflavored chicken. Blahh!!'

UR6cbqrpdd5SEPWC2omAQw.text: Don't get me wrong amazing food, but service was awful. We had to get another waiter to take our order and even bring us water. And then manager didn't even care when we complained. So I would take everything to go.

XGRhejG4AbPVd6jCussNXQ.text: Arrived mid-afternoon and not willing to brave the heat of the Strip quite yet. A lot of the restaurants were closed, so we went with this one being open 24 hours. Pricey, but it's Vegas (thus the 4 stars).  Was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was. Sandwiches & fries done perfectly~ hot, crispy, good flavor. Had the Frisco Melt, a Reuben, Open faced roast beef with mashed potatoes. Gravy on the potatoes was a tad too salty, but the bun was garlicky delish, meats were tender & yummy. Went a couple times during our stay, and probably because of the off-hour it wasn't busy, and service was fine and attentive. Not impressed with the spinach dip & (abundance of) chips. I'd stick to the sandwiches.

a_RLJHDqjyB8F2HKK3CcnA.text: Great food affordabke for Vegas most try onion soup giantnormous.

lq6tNljbZjCbPo7s0a7WHw.text: Ehhh....it was ok.  We had the eggs benedict and bacon and eggs for breakfast.  Service was pretty good.  The only thing was that the caramel macchiato was waaaay too sweet and the tatertot hash was a bit salty.  I would still go back and give it another try.  Update: Came back again...they were much busier and totally unprepared for the rush. It took 10 mins to get my coffee, 20 mins to get the first plate of food, and another 10 to get my breakfast.  I asked to speak to the manager and he took care of us. Our server tried her best as well.  Oh and the tatertot hash was much better today.

wHkeEb0wCs3az2MSNXCrUQ.text: Stopped in for some hot chocolate, it came out warm not hot and our server was very apathetic. We were there for maybe 30 minutes and he never checked on us once. No plans to ever return.

3HE9AWKhWIq3Zg12hGgF0Q.text: Had a nice time being served in the bar by Steven S.  Great food and drink on 6/4/16 before the Heart concert!

TnJXkJ6fxOPOFvP7bR8CNQ.text: I'm SO angry that they removed the lobster roll from their menu! Thanks, Hakkasan, for buying them out, and ruining the menu, WTF. Every time my friends and I are in Vegas, we come to Citizens just for the lobster roll and mac & cheese. I got all my friends into the lobster roll, and we all couldn't wait to come back and get it.  I was having such a horrible weekend, and on the day I was leaving, I went to Citizens to try and make the weekend up with an amazing lobster roll, and mac & cheese. I was so excited, and was anticipating it all weekend. I looked at the menu and boom, NO lobster roll. I asked the waitress, and she said they removed it. So I left. She didn't think I was serious when I said I was leaving, lol. I'm not interested in any other dishes on the menu. You lost a very loyal customer!

vTDPy5AGGsumQ0vo4sXM0g.text: Citizen in Mandalay bay is my favorite lunch spot. So many options. You can grab a bite from the counter and take it to go in under minutes or you can choose to sit down at the bar/dinning room. Super friendly staff. I had a shaved steak sand which  served with fries on the side. Very delicious and the fries come in a super cute mini fryer basket. So much food to try here that I will def be back. This is my favorite lunch spot on the strip.

TuMy1GHRuH6l-z4kGerY8Q.text: Great place to get a good burger. Chicken sandwich or Wings.  The mashed potatoes are great.  I have ate here a few times and have never been disappointed.  Everything that comes out of the kitchen has been delicious!!   Highly recommend it to everyone!!

Ti2HGfj3jiYqTMQFt4U8Rg.text: Citizens is located within Mandalay Bay and is a great place for a low key lunch or laid back dinner. The concept is open with indoor and "outdoor" (walking area of hotel)seating as well as to-go options. Aesthetics could be described as a classy American diner.  When my coworker and I landed at night, we were starving and quickly decided on Citizens. I went for the French Onion Soup and a side of the Mac and Cheese. Be warned! The French Onion Soup is not meant to be an appetizer. It comes in a very large bowl and was a meal in and of itself-I'm sad to say much of it was wasted, as delicious as it was. The mac and cheese was also quite good. I also had a glass of red wine-which also came in a huge glass. Ok wine, but not worth the price tag.   Days later, when my husband and I were enjoying the pool, we were looking for food options and decided on Citizens for take out by the pool. We opted for the chicken and cheese quesadillas which came with sides of guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo. The portions were large once again and the quesadillas were excellent!   If you're staying within Mandalay or an MGM resort, you may charge it to your room, along with any other restaurants.

iRwqGi2csnDs7u88XDz6_g.text: I was in Vegas for a short vacation and came across Citizens with my girlfriend, so we decided to stop in. We were greeted promptly at the hostess stand and were offered the choice of inside or patio seating. We love people watching, so we took a seat on the patio. We were quickly greeted by our server, Art, who was kind enough to take our beer and mixed drink order, brought us some waters and recommended a few appetizers.  We decided on the Spinach Dip. It arrived quickly and piping hot.  There were multiple different cheeses, an abundance of fresh tasting spinach and they had enough chips where we didn't have to worry about running out of chips with a lot of dip left (a huge pet peeve of ours). We would go out of our way to order this again.  Our dinner entrees were delicious and promptly served after our appetizer was completed. Everything was hot and tasted fresh. The manager, Andrea, even stopped by and not only asked about how our meal was, but asked us about how we were enjoying our time in Vegas and gave us a couple additional ideas of things to do. That was a nice touch. Great food, great service, we will definitely go there again next time we are in town.

anr1jggALyLLHqYuX3G87w.text: Turkey Ruben is sooooo bomb, I'm drooling just thinking about it! Service was quick and attentive and menu selection is perfect for cheese lovers like myself. Its a bit dark in there but...eh...ambiance I guess. Would definitely go back to try something else!

eQIMTIpFCKbpdEZ2pBgCzQ.text: Great place to grab a drink or a bite to eat before you hit the casino. Raquel the bartender is one of the best in the business. She always remember your drink orders from previous visits and really makes you feel at home!!

89pLIs3lVDMcqQpBc1hcjw.text: If rude hostess, and mediocre overpriced food is your thing then go here. Otherwise save your money and your time and go somewhere else. I've been here twice, had 2 bad meals and won't be back.

8zFmO5bGPbJFGpap6kU_8g.text: Love that it is 24 hours and it's not fast food. Cool atmosphere. Mahi tacos were good. My husbands grilled shrimp was fantastic! If you are looking for a light option go with that, you won't be disappointed.

WhBptO8uT-7reRN6ts-76w.text: I'll just share my experience. Although service was good, the food was not worth the price. Appetizer (chili fries), 1 salad (Caesar), 1 entree (penne no chicken), soda and tea was $92!!!  Dakota was attentive and was on his 7th day of training.  I can't give this more than 1 star because I expect the whole package. Especially for $92!!!

VMLBZeFl34XJc5jcpp8Ojg.text: Service was horrible. Plenty if tables open yet they made us wait to sit down. Right side of restaurant is so loud you can't hsve a conversation. Different menus for self service and the sit down restaurant. Very confusing. Michael seemed to be the only person with any sense of customer service. Sandwich didn't live up to its price.

FMlD7Loai-7gkWGaexE3lw.text: We were the very first customers.  We're willing to cut them some slack because of that but everything was excellent.  We had blueberry waffles, crispy bacon, Denver omelette & tater tots.  The tots were Incredible and the food & service was top notch.  Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tater Tots rocked!!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry waffle was out the pocket!!

_qMj-a3oIPZfSO_ILGYs_A.text: Great. Tried fish tacos, their specialty, and they were awesome. Since I'm new to fish tacos I have no baseline but I do know a new fave. Others in my party ordered anything from fish and chips to quinoa salad. All were equally fantastic.  Service friendly and a nice touch is the manager comes around to ask how everything was.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JYpAephaQMbUwFdnKacceQ.text: Meh. Food was okay and this is a convenient location for being near the Mandalay Bay convention center; but, the eggs Benedict was severely lacking hollandaise sauce and the egg was over cooked. Hot cocoa not hot. Wouldn't mind so much if it hadn't been as pricey as it was for what I got.

ThVMeR1fz94tmZACzPiKrw.text: Fantastic place to eat. We've been here a few times now and it's always been enjoyable. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable. Food is excellent, especially the brick  chicken and French onion soup. Breakfast is a good bet also with a wide range of offerings. Beer selection is very good as well.

yzR-EFabQ4G2-SrmXKNZnw.text: WARNING: do not come here!! This place sucks. My bf and I went to the food court and saw that we had just missed the last call for food there. So we were walking back to our room to leave for MGM when we saw Citizens had sandwiches for sell.   We went to order at the counter. The chick at the register is super rude. I don't know what she was doing, but it didn't look like anything except looking down at something. So we waited there for her to take our order, she didn't say "Please hold on" or anything. She just continued looking down for 5 minutes and then finally came up and said "What do you want?" I asked her what's the difference between their two menus - one is an a la carte sandwich menu, and the other includes a side. I didn't feel too hungry, so I got an a la carte wich, but my bf got a sandwich plate and a side. I don't know if the girl has a hearing problem or what, but she couldn't get my bf's order right even though he didn't get anything super special or altered. Finally the meals come out, we were sitting indoors and they said we can't sit there because it's full service for people who got something with a side. Excuse me!...my bf ordered something with a side so let us sit there already. We were already exhausted from being treated so rudely by the gal taking our order, now they're saying we can't sit where we rightfully have permission to. We then asked for everything to get packaged to go so we could sit outside as they demanded.   The sandwiches themselves are decently sized but nothing special at all. Does it warrant a $13 price tag? HELL NO! I wish I could ask for our money back because this place left such a sour taste in our mouths. I got the Turkey, avocado, and sprouts sandwich. The ingredients are fresh seeming enough, but seriously nothing to write home about. My bf got the Reuben, which poorly assembled and just messy. This was the worst spent $40 of our lives. I don't know how anyone else gives this place more than 3 stars (and even that is too generous). We are paying customers, we should be treated with respect, not whatever they say is passing for service here.

DGPVr7BD0cnmeIP4Kf3jKg.text: We ate here a few times during our last visit to the Mandalay property and as always the food was great. Most of the portions are large enough to split, so keep that in mind and ask your server if you are unsure. The sandwiches are tasty, we usually stop in and grab something to go to take to the pool but Thursday after we checked in we decided to eat at the restaurant. Honestly we've had way better service and the waitress had a bit of an attitude but I think she may have been a little overwhelmed with the amount of tables she was waiting on. Plus she had to deal with a few people who purchased food at the take out counter then decided it was ok to sit in the restaurant - I blame the hostess for this, neither seemed to know what they were doing. I can't remember what sandwich we ordered but we asked to split it and we each got our own fries - no split there! We also ordered the mixed green salad and the white balsamic dressing was fantastic. With the sandwich, salad and two drinks I think our bill was a little over $20. We also stopped in for breakfast one morning, the omelet was a disappointment so just skip that all together. No flavor, weird texture, not worth the $$$. My husband ordered the French Toast and that was amazing, it came with an orange flavored whip cream that was light, citrusy and paired well with the French Toast and berries.   To sum this up: 1. make the walk back from the pool and get take out. trust me you'll be happier with this then ordering food from the pool.  2. Most items can be split 3. Skip the omelet, order the French Toast

_lgo6apup_UhoVuCrz5SfQ.text: If you're in Vegas and looking for a healthy non Buffett or crazy fancy this is the place. I'd go here over a lot of places in Vegas. It's fresh and the atmosphere is great. Their fresh juices are AMAZING

bVtYqy8lrSGLKSIoeCI9dQ.text: Exceptionally slow service even when half the tables were empty.  28 minutes and counting to get a chicken sandwich.

RflqlS9IvWwpIv_9WbwSTw.text: I don't normally give 1 star reviews unless the customer service experience was horrible, which was not the case here.  The wait staff was mediocre, nothing special, nothing bad though.  I did however get a bad case of food poisoning though from my meal, which had their salmon in it.  I did not finish the meal entirely, and the food was also mediocre (3 star food at best), but the food poisoning did it for me.  C'mon guys, make sure that kitchen is clean and the food is cooked!

k94KkyajkROeBgjOcEtBaA.text: Dinner was great. I had the Cobb Salad, wife had the BBQ Chicken Salad. Next morning, breakfast was less thrilling. I had the Ultimate Breakfast, the potatoes looked warmed for too long...like they were from the day prior. I'd eat there again, but iHop does a better, cheaper big breakfast...NOT trying to slam Citizen, but I was hoping for a little more.

aACSZThnw8zyGF66vPXrCg.text: We had Gebriel as a server and he was so much fun! Great service, great food. We had the fish and chips, fish tacos, and chicken at his suggestion and all were delicious. Great flavor and good portion sizes given the price.

NnLYWgD918ecm7LMShHb1g.text: I really like Citizens at Mandalay Bay Hotel!    We ordered the following for a light lunch:  - Grilled Vege Sandwich - Really delicious - lots of thinly sliced grilled vege with intermittent mozarella cheese (boconcini) and a wonderful extra virgin oilve oil based dressing - I loved it and will come back for more! - Chicken Noodle Soup - very tasty chicken noodle soup for a light lunch - comes with  crackers with a wad of butter between the 2 crackers - neat! - Ruben Sandwich - very scrumptious with lots of meat and sauerkraut - Spring Mix Salad - fresh greens salad  Restaurant is open 24/7.  Wait service was prompt and quick and served with a smile.  :o)

ekVQy1Hd2z2UoP_EkfiCkA.text: Wish there was 0 starts for this place. It's utterly disgusting!!! I think people just eat here because it's the only place that serves food after a certain time.

K4PRS_i77dGFZ5UhC3JDiw.text: The pricing is high but they give you portions that could feed an entire tribe so it's not that pricey if you buy one plate of something and split it 3 ways.  But this is only helpful if the staff tells you that, which they don't, so...you heard it from me.  Unless you're a sumo wrestler or you typically eat 4000 calories in one sitting, split the plates two or three ways.  Food is ok, it's not bad, it's not stellar, especially by Vegas food standards, but it's ok/good & it definitely handles the job if you're hungry and hanging around the Mandalay Bay.

fh2knSxKaui851ajrlwB_w.text: CLEAN AS A WHISTLE!!!    Firstly, a lot of what I loved most was the service I received at the Bar.  I believe the friendly bartenders' name was Erick.  He is very knowledgeable about the menu and very patient in terms of not making guests feel rushed to order.  He was very attentive and made me feel like a valued customer.    But it gets even better!  I was blown away at the attention to cleaning and sanitary work spaces as demonstrated by Erick and the Managers.  They used ph test strips on the dishwasher, and they made sure that the surfaces were all clean and neat.  I saw that they spent a good 15 minutes inspecting for a clean and sanitized bar.  That is something I haven't seen before and made me feel comfortable eating here often.  Finally, the food was delicious!  I highly recommend the cornbread and the macaroni and cheese.  I will be back often!  Erick even asked me to come back later for dessert.  Such a kind employee and a wonderful experience!

SRV_J3EYydBVpI5N1vLUzQ.text: Great service, the food was tasty too! Had the blat with macaroni salad and side caesar. Even our picky kid liked the food! Casual and nice selection of beverages.

Q7dBNjeuSIRfi_rOaMpV4w.text: Where else do u go when it's 4 a.m. in da morning?!?! Potato skins are not bad either are their buffalo wings at this time in the a.m.

SfbyaG-Gx_1JQIDKQUiKjw.text: This place is inside Mandalay Bay. Came here for dinner last night with a couple of work colleagues. I was a little unsure when we walked in because I couldn't tell the style of food based on the look, but I was pleasantly surprised. I had a Frisco melt style burger with fries and a cocktail. All tasted very good. The prices are typical of Vegas strip. They had a bakery style establishment next door connected that had pastry, cheesecake, etc which looked good. I would go back!

1YR1xoQUj23ySTErXAC35A.text: This is one of the better burgers I have had in recent memory!  Citizen's is located in the restaurant area near Mandalay Bay and is open all day.  They have a pretty extensive menu, but I came here famished and looking to try their burger.  It was pretty expensive at $18, but for Vegas I realize that is completely in line with other places. The burger itself was wonderful.  The meat was flavorful and juicy with just the right amount of spice to it.   I am not sure if they add peppers or something but it had a nice kick.  The bun was soft and pillowy - the perfect complement to the rich burger.  I usually take off the wilted lettuce and unripe tomato, but both were fresh and delicious here!  The ketchup even tasted homemade!  I really enjoyed the fries and left the restaurant a happy camper! This is a great bet if you crave top notch burger or are looking for a more casual meal on The Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger

KHp2YSaMA_UxTKp0zBvvwg.text: Fantastic service, cool atmosphere especially with all the people watching at the casino. We got the fish and chips and the fish was to die for so fresh and perfectly cooked, yum!

SregQGlukqAbsmNh_yzP7g.text: A good place for breakfast. I came here a few times during my stay at the Luxor and the food here is pretty good for a reasonable price. They have a decent selection of breakfast items if you dine in such as omelets, oatmeal, pancakes, and waffles. Or if you choose to take out they have quick sandwiches/ wraps.   My first day here I got a kale salad to go. For $10 I got a huge salad that was enough for two meals. The kale was fresh and the pecans/ cranberries were good as well. The sweet citrus dressing a bit heavy.  The next day we dined in and I ordered the bodybuilder omelet (grilled chicken/veggie) made with egg whites. The omelet was a decent size and it came with a small serving of home fries. I also ordered the steel cut oats served with fresh fruit and brown sugar. Overall the meal was average and it's what you expect for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-14wsglsNI1_EidqlPiC7Q.text: Had a late dinner tonight and server suggested Teriyaki Chicken and must say I was very disappointed. May have been the saltiest meal I have ever eaten. Could not finish the meal. Eaten there once before and it was fairly decent but not this time. Service was good is the only positive thing about my meal.

1ViEOrKXAcYqIFAryLuiFw.text: We went to eat there after visiting the shark reef and the only pleasant thing about the restaurant was the hostess. The waiter had a weird attitude and the food had its issues. My whole family got food poisoning and are still dealing with the effects two days later.

qPi3acZaLDexHXmUOaa3nw.text: Awful service wasn't even busy almost 10 PM at night been seated for approximately seven minutes and still never even asked if we needed a beverage or if we were ready to order didn't even  acknowledge the fact we were there !!never again. Trash!

U70cf3oCYpFFHDmcJSV6Gg.text: Great food. Loved the club sandwich and the bbq chicken salad! Kinda spendy, but what isn't in Vegas.  Wonderful service, super fast!

y9quCLYjGTPfvu8SxKlISA.text: Very poor customer service!! Came her to get a hot chocolate, but waited 15mins just for a hot chocolate and after waiting we ended up getting a warm and watery hot chocolate, the muffins are so dry too. 4 staffs in the register and 2 staffs are just chatting and doing nothing.

r6znhalGwjyYKOVTt-UuQw.text: We came here on a Friday night at roughly midnight and were seated immediately even though the restaurant was pretty packed. My husband ordered the nachos and they were giant! I ordered a Rueben with Macaroni Salad and loved every bite!! It's not necessarily cheap for a midnight snack but the food and service is good.

Fanu3U_9YhJZ-OUCG4o5mA.text: Got to eat here with my coworkers after we finished walking about MAGIC.  We got seated in about 15mins. Thought that was quite fast. We all ordered appetizers since we werent super hungry. We ordered the waffle fries that came with gravy and bacon bits...yea If you plan to order it, dont... Why? Wholly cow, it is heavy on the sodium. So the ones that got soaked in the gravy is not edible :(. The other items we ordered were pretty generic, chicken fingers (basically just fried chicken strips) and a cup or veggies (you know the ones you get in the frozen aisle in the market?)  If we were crying over the appetizers already, imagine the main course!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle fries

i3tpwCwoJRcJnGA8DS56jQ.text: I visited during a recent trip to Vegas. Food was soo good. I got the white rice with teriyaki sauce, side of steamed veggies. And for dessert an apple pie with ice cream. The pie was simply delicious!! I also enjoyed a pear beer at the bar while I waited for my food. Service was quick and the staff was very friendly. I love the ambiance of the place and overall I could definitely see myself eating here all the time!

RWVqJ_ICcyADxxmrbjj0Hg.text: 03/02/18  5pm-ish- We like to try new areas we haven't been to so it was time to check out Mandalay Bay.  Beautiful! (of what we saw)  We went from the self-park garage followed the casino signs and ended up in a large beautiful foyer and restaurant row.  Started to check out some of the menus that they post outside the restaurants.  While we were reading, two young girl hostesses were obviously making fun of people as they people watched from their podium.  They spotted me catching them, turned their backs,  then I WAS THEIR VICTIM! Really girls!! Don't be so obvious.  Well it should go without saying we didn't end up eating there.    They must not teach hospitality anymore, you just need to be young and pretty.   Sad.

fpmAzA4eNG-Xr5vVPKu2_w.text: Great to see Raquel again!  Always ask for the awesome bartender when visiting Citizens.  She always recommends the best and helps you with your hangover.

qHdEZsDbSn0D0KjGbnwAPw.text: Ive been here before, days when i wasnt yelping, and i remember food was good.  Family and I needed to come down this way to check into Cisco Live and decided to stop by and eat lunch.  This place also has a nice bakery and a full bar.  So you can have a nice dinner with cocktails or beer, then head up to the bakery for dessert! I was really disappointed this time.  I ordered the tuna melt and wife ordered the chili.  The tuna melt was dry and the rye bread didnt mix well with the tuna.  The chili had no sauce.  It looked and tasted like a chunk of meat. I dont know....maybe ill try breakfast here and see how it compares with lunch, but do i want to spend another 100 bucks to get a bleh meal???  I guess you will have to follow me to find out!  Im here in vegas till July 15, so we'll see.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna melt

uumHdNP5a_9qnHvLB2XyxA.text: This eatery is located at the Mandalay Bay and is open 24 hours. Fortunately, this establishment is not high priced and serves well above average food.  At our last two visits my wife and I sat at the bar and had exemplary service (thanks Erick).  One of the best items on the menu is their homemade chicken soup, which is one of the best I have had.  Everything here is freshly made and the restaurant is spit spot clean.  They also have a great breakfast menu and takeout.  For a casual late night, early morning meal, this is the place! Nuff Said!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0aRiRT6kftMXMicTnHJmAw.text: Visited Citizens after watching One- Michael Jackson Cirque Show ... only because it was open until 10p and the other restaurants were too expensive. Citizens is reasonably priced for the portion that you receive, I mean let's be real - it's still a pricey spot for a freakin' cheeseburger ... $20 (& that's including the $2 up-charge fee for freakin' cheese!) Great thing is that we were seated right away... our server Robert was decent, didn't really check in on us, but also didn't ignore us. He was attentive but that's about it.   I tried the Mahi-Mahi tacos, which were good...but it wouldn't have been my first choice. Per Robert, these were the best mahi mahi Tacos, & they weren't to me... I should have stuck to my guns and ordered the SHORT RIB lasagna! Next time. While the tacos were tasty, crunchy and loaded with toppings like pico, shredded cabbage, etc.. they weren't the best..  My mom's classical cheeseBURGER was okay, over cooked..  My dad's spaghetti was salty.   Would I eat here again? Probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Hamburger (+2 for cheese) $20
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi mahi Fish Tacos (just Tacos and side salsas, $24)

EjJVGFa4kB88iy_ZoGTZoA.text: I went to Citizens for lunch on both a Tuesday and a Wednesday during a convention at Mandalay. Despite their being a convention and normal hotel activities ongoing, in both cases we were seated immediately (I came both times with a party of 4).   We got a variety of foods during both of our visits which included artichoke dip, chicken nachos, and a the patty melt. The portions were quite large - in most cases we were unable to finish what we ordered because the portions were so large. Everything we had was really good - the artichoke dip was definitely a highlight and it was so good we got it twice!  The service was good - while the restaurant was busy the servers were generally attentive and the food came pretty quickly. Overall would recommend Citizens if you are visiting Mandalay Bay!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patty Melt
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Lasagna
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke dip

aEFF3ivh6_PC2zryeJN5lQ.text: Citizens is a bogus place in Mandalay Bay. Everything as expected is extremely overpriced. This claims to be a kitchen and restaurant. It looks more like a cafeteria. There's no reason to eat here if not staying.   I can say a lot of bad things about Mandalay Bay. I will limit myself to talking about Citizens. This is an example of taking advantage of people staying in the hotel because of the convenience factor. It's a pain in the ass to leave the resort to get something to eat. Therefore you're stuck with something like this. It's also one of the few dining options in the resort that stays open late, so you don't have that many choices. The food is mostly all premade. It's in a display case. There's nothing here that isn't overpriced. It's crazy. It's $10 for a simple peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Ridiculous but True.   It does have tables where you can actually sit and order off a menu. Just know that most of the food is still premade. The desserts come in frozen and they put them out and charge you like they make them.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastries

S3ov1jS4oWYyA0-mjGh6Dg.text: This "fast food" late night restaurant is pretty mediocre considering it's inside of a gorgeous, luxury resort. Due to the time change, we were out of sleep at 3am. My boyfriend I decided to go downstairs and grab a midnight snack from this place (Keep in mind that it's the only restaurant open till late).   I had a spinach dip and tasted awful - no cheese at all, just mushed spinach. I ordered a hot chocolate and was completely watered down to a point that it was disgusting.   On another note, it's very expensive for the quality of food provided. I'm aware it's Las Vegas but prices shouldn't be so expensive for mediocre food.   Skip this place, not worth it!

uDuWLsrqO7ZTncIHgkWBOg.text: We were seated right away.  The spinach artichoke dip was amazing and still sizzling when they brought it out.  The teriyaki bowl was more than enough and the cheese burger was scrumptious.  The fries were cooked perfectly.  Our waitress was amazing!!!!!! A great option if you aren't wanting superbfine dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach artichoke dip

JiFzraVRAtb4ilMPEwGTFw.text: The customer service was great, but the food not so much. I went with a group of 12 and although our waitress was friendly and prompt that's the only thing good I can say. I would say the food was borderline inedible. I got the french toast and a side of bacon. The bacon is noted on the menu as being "crispy" and my bacon was limp and soft. The french toast was like a brick...beyond stale. And everyone else didn't have high remarks to say about their food either. I would skip Citizens if I were you.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The French toast I didn&#39;t eat

zPpYnGqC5R8GEVLG3wbOFA.text: 3/5 for the food, 1/5 for the service. I came here late night with some girlfriends and was treated very poorly by the cashier and other servers.   We ordered our food and went to sit at a nearby table waiting for our food to come out. The cashier had told me that once I get my food I need to leave because the indoor seating area is closed, then a minute after waiting another server came and told us the same thing. There were other people in line and none of them were told to leave once their food arrived, and there were even people ordering and finding a table inside. When we asked the server why we were being asked to leave we were quickly dismissed and sent off with our food with no explanation besides, "were closed you need to leave."  We ended up sitting right outside of the doors where there were some tables available and watched as the employees served and waited on other customers who they allowed to sit inside. Very upsetting of the unprofessionalism and discrimination of the staff.  As for the food, I ordered the "meat lovers" pizza and it was average. It tasted like a quick bite with various packaged meats thrown together and heated up, nothing very high quality. There were even a few pieces of sliced deli meats on top, won't be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OZ5yGsQm4yuo8EGd297UJA.text: EDIT FROM THE NEXT MORNING:  I woke up around 5am with a horrible stomach ache. I now have food poisoning :) 1 Star now  ~~~~~~~~~~  Think of it like denny's. Menu options are pretty simple, comfort foods. Open 24/7 but with a bar and pretty fabulous smoothies.  The chunky monkey tastes like a delicious chocolate banana shake. And the French onion soup was fabulous. Usually when I get French onion there's never enough cheese...but not at this place!!!  Definitely not fine dining. Service is on par with Denny's. Definitely the place to go when you've had a bit too much to drink and you wanna sit and scarf down a plate of chicken tenders.

Daz2Wcvcs8XD_1qUqlEDnw.text: It was decent food for 11:30pm and a little drunk lol. Chicken salad sandwich was very bland but it did the job!

tAc38FBxz_nXyhnNP8m6rQ.text: I ordered an everything bagel with smoked salmon. But they ran out of everything bagel and gave me a plain one. I was disappointed at it was only 10:45am and surprised that it ran it already. Smoked salmon was good with the capers and red onions.

JWT2KoYjrG8fcRtvETLLMg.text: Eh. The host staff didn't want to make room for my stroller at first, but eventually they did. My son was asleep in so I wasn't about to wake him up and put him in a high chair when I knew the stroller would fit.   The food was just ok. Several members of my party had the prime rib. They said it was ok but it wasn't their favorite. Two of us has a rice bowl, but it was really dry for the amount of rice to beef ratio and we had to ask for more sauce.   If you're staying in Mandalay, this is an ok restaurant, but next time I'd go somewhere else.

TfTj28tEtEqz-nMG-GWm6w.text: I came in to the restaurant wanting French toast but holy moly my eyes could not be diverted from the Bloody Mary. It's the most glorious Bloody Mary that has ever graced the earth. Probably should be shared but they will give you a to go cup. Hey it's vegas ! Why not walk around with a $25 Bloody Mary in a sippy cup! You won't be able to eat much food while consuming this massive beverage so I choked down on a cinnamon raisin bagel. (I didn't take a picture. We all know what a bagel looks like)  The menu looks great so I'm sure you'll find something you'll like.   They are also open 24 hours. It's easy to find in Mandalay Bay. Check it out when you're in Vegas.

Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glorious breakfast

KDh1g4d71S7TFuMEayaTNg.text: Came here for a quick bite. I was seated right away with the option to sit inside or outside. I ordered the quinoa salad. The lemon dressing is very light and extremely flavorful and goes well with the arugula. There are 4 cherry tomatoes, which are peeled and cold. The quinoa and seasonal vegetables (red bell pepper, peas, corn, zucchini) are all warm. It was a decent dish but nothing I would need to eat again.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quinoa Salad

V7ABhyhnbbBrfz9xXhQoqA.text: We often visit Las Vegas around the Christmas Holidays but before the New Year to take advantage of low hotel rates.  At Mandalay Bay, this benefit is offset by the fact that their upscale restaurants are closed from December 16-26.  The only restaurants open were a gastro pub, the steak house, and this - the most casual eatery that is currently called Citizen's.  We picked it because it had macaroni and cheese and was the least expensive, in a solid parent move.   I originally planned on ordering the fish and chips but a deep fryer malfunction foiled those plans. Instead, we ordered the mac and cheese side as a entree for our 4 y.o. instead of from the children's menu.  It was the first item that came out and it was a solid first impression, creamy sauce, bits of bacon, and good seasoning.    Then, my brick chicken arrived and it went downhill from there. The gravy was suspiciously brown, cafeteria style and inedibly salty.  I avoided it the whole meal which was hard to do since there was so much.  The half chicken was also quite salty on the exterior even it was prepared decently well. I appreciated the large portion of steamed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes. Generous portions are a plus.    The other entree was a very unimpressive turkey burger, with a dry patty and a lack of sauce or spread to moisten the burger. The accompanying fat fries, however, were excellently cooked, crisp with a tender inside and makes me regretful that their fish deep fryer was down.  I didn't intend to dine here and it was a mixed bag of food. Had things not been so salty, it would have been forgetably fine rather than seared in our memories for the wrong reasons.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger, fat fries
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brick chicken, mashed potatoes, steamed broccoli

4ivCMKc7cczQTN_qEPKahw.text: Came here with a group of girls for dinner the other night. While it was perfect for what we were looking for (24/7 dining, bar/comfort food), the food wasn't that great. Pizza was soggy, and the nachos had burnt cheese. The fries were actually amazing though...I'd give those 5 stars. Service was sub-par, and dishes/glasses were dirty. Cool aesthetic though and convenient location.

HMH3gdYjOiTp63hOs94NGw.text: This was my go-to place for a smoothie/snack/dessert while at Mandalay. Open 24/7, solid breakfast sandwiches to go, and lunch was also good. Quick and friendly service, this place is really necessary for the casino.

Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French dip with fries and au jus.

oPWzmjoUY-bw_ELIClBFqw.text: I LOVE this restaurant! Food is excellent and I am a return customer and guest. The menu has something for everyone! Love the chicken and chili is awesome using fresh meat. Chili has real sirloin steak!  This last visit was a bit of a bummer in the beginning. I was greeted by a indifferent hostess, who tried to make me go to the take out and rolled her eyes when I asked to be seated. She acted like I was interrupting her yet the restaurant was partially empty @ 2:30-3:00 pm.  Now CHRIS the waiter was excellent and so friendly! He was attentive and stopped several times to ask if we were ok and needing anything. I highly recommend him for a raise or more hours as he represents the hotel and restaurant come well. It is necessary though to train the hostess. She is rude and immature. Thank you

eho7EtNFPRzIVwBUHQarjA.text: Wow the food was amazing but the service was very slow. We were sat and waited on 20 min later the server came and asked if we wanted something to drink.  ... then food came 20 min after. the server was very sweet but one server for a whole section. You should have more people available. Food was delish and recommend it. But the service was slow. Thank you to our server did the best she could since it was hard she was serving over 10 tables. When people come in to be sat at a table they expect to be greeted kindly and promptly. A hello I will be right with you would have been great. I love it at citizens my place to go eat when I'm in Vegas Ands my first time with slow service experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate breakfast

C-FofYEzrHp0QyBMtVfarg.text: Good food only place really open late night at the hotel ....staff is nice food is fresh just a menu is small

hrHx_yrMeuEOL9tQCJkAVQ.text: 7/9: Located inside of Mandalay Bay casino. I'd rate the food a 3; good, but a bit pricey if paying without comps. The awesome service made up for it!   I had the Baconator Beef Burger and some of the Turkey Burger.   My beautiful waitress Miranda was top notch, even though the place was a bit busy for a Tuesday evening. Refills kept coming. Management had an issue with my poker room comp (I guess because Citizens is a new addition to the places that allow usage of comps). She kept checking up on the issue. While they couldn't really get it resolved, she kindly offered to take a discount off for the time being, and said that they would entirely fix the issue before closing time. A class act. THIS is customer service at its finest. Thank you Miranda! Just for the amazing service, I would definitely come back!

33uXwF0XG3Bz8M7dr04A_w.text: Wow terrible food. We were in a rush to grab a bite to eat before a show. So we stopped by to grab a bite.  The food came fast however, the sandwiches we ordered were terrible. I ordered a simple BLT and the bacon was super salty stale and over cooked. It was like chewing glass. Maybe if I was part of circus sideshow then I might have found it enjoyable.  And my friend got a Ruben that made them sick. And it's overpriced as well. You're better off with fast food. Heck White Castle is better than this place.  Should be called Communism instead.

msiTZCLTSEnaXldhK8RwpQ.text: Omg so damn delicious ... awesome beer and Art our server was perfection! The atmosphere is great and eye candy too.... you have to try it you won't be disappointed!

cyxzR_LXkINhhWu8SsT9Mw.text: Service was phenomenal, first night we had a server named Kevin, who described the whole menu to us being newbies. Every time I turned around my drink was re filled, even got a to go cup of water. Went back in the morning for breakfast and phenomenal service again. Our waiter was Jeff who also explained meals into detail. Breakfast was a huge portion and well worth the money. Deffinetly   will be back again before leaving.

tOZqiKoa17zSVsym7D68Og.text: Keep coming back. Great dinner, great late night food and drinks. Emily the Hostess remembered us when we came back. Lotus our waitress is friendly and happy. Definitely recommend for low key, not super fancy default spot.

1M1BAzGg9roowkixIxZsMw.text: Thumbs up the food is Delicious I'm here for breakfast I had the Biscuits and Gravy with a side of sasauge and bacon.. Yummy lol

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and Gravy skillet

k5t1E_Rwm9ZCjfY63WudkQ.text: Just got done eating here...service was horrible.  I have a lot of food allergies and sensitivities which makes eating out difficult. Most of the time I pack my own food when we go out to eat but we are on vacation and I don't have that option.  I explained to the waitress that I had a lot of restrictions and asked about the menu. She told me the turkey burger was not marinated in anything and I told her to only have them season it with salt and pepper. So I literally ordered a turkey burger on lettuce with an avocado. It took at least 20 min just to get out our  "appetizer" which was a small fruit bowl.  After waiting a long time we finally got our meal. No avocado...and the steamed veggies which she told me were carrots, broccoli and snap peas were half filled with zucchini which I can't have.  So I picked it all out and I started to eat the turkey burger and there was a cracked egg shell in there, I opened up the burger and there was clearly other seasonings in there as well. I told her about it and she said she would get her manager. The manager confirmed that it is premartinated and also has flour in it...which I can't have.  He offered to make me something else but with all their meat being pre-marinated I couldn't have anything. Not only that, but I was so done after waiting over an hour for this and having to get to a show we were headed to I didn't have time to wait. Will never eat here again.

lqe0e5tE41Dc_lkrXv8mQw.text: Ordered a breakfast burrito at 3:03am. No one around. $16. Insane already. Waited until 3:25am. Checked in and the manager was rude about the "kitchen being backed up." Asked to cancel the order. As they were refunding the charge at 3:28am, the burrito came out. They asked if I still wanted a refund. I did. No apology. Told kitchen to take burrito back. Insane. Learn customer service.

2c1tq7PZ2WauIMYQ577GAA.text: Great service! Great food! The servers are very nice.  They have many good juices to try.  The tots were out of this world. Worth a try. I loved them. Coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2style eggs with ham and tots

szDErv_jDQs7HIxQWuHQjA.text: Probably the best value for the price of the places I ate in Las Vegas. Huge portions for comfort food in a clean and friendly atmosphere. I ended up eating here twice. The first time, got the French Onion Soup which literally was in a "cup" the size of my head. Really great flavors and hit the spot for something light, yet filling for lunch. The second time, I had the potato skins. The pico de gallo as a topping choice was great. You are still paying the Vegas premium prices, but not to the extent of other places when it comes to a hearty and filling lunch, particularly when you don't want to go to a food court.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french onion soup

UkCs0i-dmV60unA8bUGAKA.text: I am writing this review factoring cost out; food in Vegas is really expensive if you are in or near the strip. Expect to pay $17 for an omelette consisting of chicken and egg whites. With that being said, the service and food here is pretty good and is one of the better places to dine if you are in Mandalay Bay attending a conference, a conference where apples were sold for $5 each. The seating inside is ample and service here is friendly. They have a variety of options and their coffee is pretty good. You can check in to get a free cheesecake. We checked in one day, and redeemed our cheesecake to go as a side along with our breakfast (we are savages). I recommend the omelettes here or the skillets.

e1QOyQS_lzLqUMDvWDkuiw.text: Eh, it's okay. It's a hit or miss.  When you're staying at the Mandalay Bay, it's late night and there's nothing else to eat, this is the only option (besides room service but I honestly think room service and this place are one in the same.)  The 3 times I had to eat here was all different, experience wise and food wise. I only utilized the take out counter, thinking that this would be the "faster" route but it's not necessarily.  Price wise it's all going to be pricey because you're at the Mandalay/on the strip, but again if you haven't eaten all day and you have not other options, a $16 sandwich is suddenly doable and you're at the mercy of their service. I'll sum up my review in my visits:  1st visit - Was 10pm, went in to grab a quick snack of fruit and a muffin. Really wanted ice cream but they don't serve that. Was expensive but at least service as quick as nothing needed to be prepped and there wasn't much of a line. Muffin was good, too.   2nd visit - Was about 1pm, hubby ran in to grab a reuben sandwich, not sure how long his wait was but that reuben was way too salty! Could only handle 2 bites, not a fan...  3rd visit - It was 11pm and I have no idea what was happening but it took them 20 minutes to even acknowledge my husband standing there at the take out counter! My husband has the patience of a saint and saw that they were extremely understaffed but why the hell does it take the manager 15 minutes to make one espresso? The poor dude who ordered the espresso just seemed amazed at the whole process too, but you can't badger someone who's touching your food, ya know? There was people just standing there waiting to pay for a canned soda and the one of only two employees behind the counter just said, "take it" and waived them off.  The more annoying thing? That there was other workers in that restaurant meandering around the take out area! Come on now, help them out!   Anyways, I was ready to leave after the first 20 mins but my husband was really hungry and again, we're at the mercy of being out in BFE Mandalay at midnight. After being in there for over 30 minutes and not even having anything to show for it, I forced my husband to leave and bought him a banana and some Dibs ice cream in the sundries store to quiet his stomach until we could get a proper meal in the morning.   Thank goodness we were checking out the next day as well.

IH2aLRN2Cr6GqVsiPkTHAw.text: Me:" do you serve breakfast food?" Rude hostesses:"no it's brunch, look at this menu" ** hands me a menu of ONLY breakfast food items** I know that brunch is a combination of lunch and breakfast but if I'm asking if you serve breakfast food just say "yes" and don't make me feel like an idiot for your lack of social skills and common sense to understand what I'm literally asking. I had a party of 4 and we all were confused and put off by this weird altercation that it actually made us laugh for 15 minutes. Oh and my eggs Benedict was $18 which I thought was also hilarious.

6hTYYGHOiFfoGXSu_gEMIA.text: I just ate here with a friend and our server, Erick, was phenomenal! Best customer service and very attentive! Erick is the perfect example of Vegas hospitality. I'll definitely be returning to sit in his section. Thanks again for a wonderful meal, Erick!

Q7BmT8P6W6BEYs3mCOa-CA.text: Stopped in for a quick dinner before my flight after a long week in Vegas. Glen made the perfect drink and good conversation! Will stop in next time!

9mImiG9hm9uj9Z1zgt611A.text: Over all good.  Pro: We took 2 Ultimate Breakfast which comes with, 3 pancakes, 2eggs, sausage and potato, and 3 lemonade.  Slightly Pricy for Breakfast $70, but does have a Good Portion, Tasty and Filling.    Con: I also took One Single Order - Over Easy Egg, and was charged $4 for 1 egg.  What??? Do not order additional items, go with an extra regular breakfast item on the menu.

aBtj0J8-tUtCb6Myvd9DQw.text: I honestly don't know how this place place only has a couple of stars! Over May 19th, me and a big group of woman went to vegas for my soon to be sister in laws bachelorette weekend.   It was Saturday night and they needed to be somewhere by 11pm at the latest. Having 12 women, getting a table ANYWHERE was nearly impossible without AT LEAST an hour wait. We were just walking around trying to find a place to take us and we asked the hostess for a menu and asked her the wait time for 12. Just then the manager, Matt, walked up and told us politely it would probably be about an hour wait. With the group not wanting to wait that long, we said thank you and started to give our menus back.   Just then he looked over at the "closed" lunch side of Citizen, and stopped us. He says "You know what ladies, let me set up a table for you guys! Dont go anywhere"   So we watched him go over to the "closed" side and set a table of 12 JUST FOR US!! We had a great server (and i feel horrible that I cant remember her name)   She was attentive and took care of us! EVERYONE was extremely happy with their food. It may seem like steep pricing but the portions are pretty awesome!   To make things better, he was constantly checking in on us to make sure we were being taken care of and happy with our food. He even brought to HUGE pieces of cake and ice cream for the bride to be (and the other half of the table too :) )   Thank you Matt for making our visit to your restaurant memorable and being SO accommodating!   I cant wait to eat there again on my next visit to Vegas!

KI5guwU4HewarbQDyDA--w.text: We had a surprisingly delicious brunch on our last day in Vegas here. We ordered the Benedict and it was flawless! Perfect toasted English muffin, ham, and seriously great poached eggs topped with hollandaise. The potatoes that came with it were hot and delicious. This was one of our favorite breakfasts that we had all week! We were guests of the hotel and I wish we would have known how good everything was here, we would have come more often!

QZYjPNz_GUcDCwR-bleWLg.text: Ordered the ultimate breakfast and it was more like the mediocre breakfast. I guess thats Vegas though. It was pricey and just ok. Service was great!

ub10-URLesUiIJVfG7BBfA.text: Erick gave us amazing service during a busy time!! He is an intelligent man that knows his business!!!  We ate dinner and enjoyed a cocktail.  Thank you, we will be back!!!

CXaVycGE8JUZWSgX67IbWA.text: Giving it two stars because the food is good. The service is terrible.  Staying at Hotel been here twice already. Same problems both times.  Stood there while three different employees walked past without acknowledgment. Had to flag someone down to get a seat. Coffee delivered without a spoon. Stir with a fork is not the best option. Food delivered. Asked for tobasco and watched the guy walk to the back and just start doing something else. Literally forgot to get it for me in seconds. General uncaring atmosphere.

_e9Y_sVn1SFHeP_KKeE3nw.text: Ordered nachos no chicken, they added chicken and charged us. The toppings were jusr dumped in areas instead of being spread out. The black beans were not drained enough.

9XLhic0AOAFYMv95UkcVyQ.text: On a whim my wife and I visited Citizens.  It was.. well... just okay.  It was also vastly overpriced.  My wife very much enjoyed her turkey avocado sandwich.  She said it was quite tasty and really loved the bread, sprouts, and muenster cheese.  She's not normally a potato salad person, but she even liked that.  The only thing she didn't like was the price.  It was $17.  Were it $11-14, that would have been better.  As for me... I wasn't much of a fan of my moco loco.  In fact, it might be the worst I've ever had.  The burger patty had no personality to it.  The rice was undercooked.  The gravy wasn't plentiful enough.  Also, it was $17.  Should have been closer to $11.  At least the over-easy egg was nice.  Overall, wouldn't go back unless it were in a pinch.

sALigcJc-MQ09jEzic6b8g.text: Best fish and chips we've ever had! Glen, our waiter and Steven, the bartender, were fantastic. They made our evening!!  Nice to have a 24 hour restaurant available in Vegas. We will be back!

0WHXOsQrMGV-YLQx1qdhdQ.text: Very bad customer service and then the management comes over and tries to explain and fix the problem but he only makes the problem worse I literally said outside watch or older guy gets seated very fast straight to a table I then proceeded to watch everything and see what's going on and then management comes over to me and tells us that we can't sit there because the table hasn't been cleaned but the service attended who was there at the front desk was very rude nasty attitude will never come here again and I eat everywhere all over the world

4ttWaJKRLyQrB4FVJ7_rrg.text: Kevin, our server was very helpful, friendly and attentive.  Emily, and Jessica both were very accommodating and sat us on the outer section where we could watch passers by.  The appetizer was very good and filling.  The entree of the fish and chips were bountiful and delicious, and teriyaki rice bowl with chicken was very, very good.

IglwW6lpojRfnwHz9ciSpg.text: Good and filling food at a reasonable Las Vegas price. Service was friendly and delivered food in a reasonable amount of time. Sufficient enough choices to meet almost any taste buds.   I recommend you sit outside and eat as that will allow you the entertainment of people watching as you enjoy your food.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and French Toast Creme Brûlée

tCY5O9k3cGv4PekEg1GrBQ.text: Excellent mahi mahi tacos.  Maybe the best that I've had anywhere.  All the food looked really good.  Pricey, but in line with casino/resort pricing.  Good, friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jXvyxEWPYULqIqujI4xRWg.text: Attracted by the idea of comfort food done upscale brought us to Citizens hoping to find food akin to some of the similar concepts around town.  Although the decor is actually quite nice and the pastries do look tasty (we didn't sample them) we were utterly underwhelmed by the delivery.    Our server was friendly and honest( very much appreciated) and responded to our requests for suggestions very well but we got the impression our server had sampled all the offerings and was having a real struggle recommending anything to us.    I started off with a drink called American Pie (you guessed it, apple flavored) which was the best thing I had all night, right down to the ring of cinnamon around the martini glass.  We shared a spinach artichoke dip which had a sprinkle of parmesan on top.  The chips were a mixed bag of tortilla chips and pita chips.  The problem were some chips were soggy and stale tasting and some were crisp and fresh. The pita was mostly hard with a few soft bites.  The dip itself was lacking in flavor but tasted ok.    For our meal, at the server's suggestion we split an entree due to large portion size.   To our delight, the split entree was brought on two separate plates.  Some establishments do not separate it for you and I thought that was a nice touch.  However the blue cheese burger was quite disappointing.  The bun was boring, the burger dry and over cooked, and the blue cheese had no distinguishable flavor from a goat cheese.   The mac and cheese with hamhock also lacked any identifiable cheese flavor with only a light hint of a mild cheddar.  The side of fries were soggy matchstick size fries.  I expected more from an establishment in the Mandalay Bay.  There are a few interesting menu items but when we asked about them, the server hesitated to recommend them.  They do have a hangover brunch with $25 bottomless mimosas. They also have a 24 burgers in 24 minutes challenge for $40.00 unless you eat them all and then it is free.    I can't imagine I will be back unless it is just to sample a dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke dip
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American pie

oR_1gJUiBQE4yWVbTMHLUg.text: Got a burger to go, medium rare.  One of the worst overpriced burgers I've ever had.  Dry, no flavor, soggy bread.  Soggy fries.  1 star.  Only thing they got going is that they are open 24 hours.  Avoid!

HYWisvNPDtxyJVBA5W8vnA.text: I don't know how I should feel about this place.  Citizens Kitchen & Bar is located in the center of the restaurant row in Mandalay Bay, and as such, it ain't cheap. We had Kale Salad and Chicken Sandwich, while both were pretty good, they charged $5 each for the water bottle. We just asked for water and they charged $10 automatically without asking. It might work for one-off tourists, but I don't think that's a sustainable business practice for locals.  The food quality was not bad, thus three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale salad / Sandwich

0FTCem_yrmNWwzpjYlILkw.text: I've been coming to Mandalay for years and Citizens always being open was convenient. But today I encountered the rudest hostess and that ended my run. House of Blues serves breakfast too and they are welcoming and courteous. The millennial at Citizens that wouldn't even look at me as she was too busy tweeting or facebooking or whatever it was she was doing, can figure out that when you are in the service industry, people will opt for service with a smile every time.

5bhsjoHhepqkG2SedamONA.text: Was wandering around Mandalay Bay with friends after a night out clubbing looking for some late night drunchies and we were directed here by the staff.  Despite it being 3am there was a 10-minute wait, which we spent pondering the menu. We ended up choosing the tater tots, penne prosciutto, and kobe chili cheese fries. Maybe it was the alcohol, but we thought everything was delicious and devoured it all. Service was pretty decent too, and the prices were quite reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto penne, Kobe chili cheese fries, tater tots

h-KeOoL-Y-SMxUtUpg9n2w.text: I was somewhat short on time and ate at Citizens. Omelet, coffee toast and a glass of milk. $37???? Seriously? $37???  The omelet was not hot so it had obviously sat out there before being brought to me. The food is decent at best but the prices are just silly.   Drive or take an Uber/Lyft car 3.5 miles away to Mr. Mamas on S Jones for a superb breakfast or lunch.

kfOSTeMXAjCe80FaQIbYtQ.text: Since we were in Vegas again and had the opportunity we made sure to eat here again. This trip the Wife and I shared the Nachos, then split the Ruben with the cole slaw on the side. Again I am not sure why all the low stars for this place. Our waiter was awesome, Greg, there when we needed him and let us chill when we needed to. We had a great dinner with great service. If that is what you are looking for then give this place a chance. And about the prices, your in Vegas, in a casino, you are not going to get prices like your eating at Denny's. Note: most meals are large enough to be shared. That can help you save some money.

wALy9ZQ_eE0RQPyxshS3-w.text: Eggs Benedict and cappuccino! Best start to a day in Vegas. Staff is wonderful and accommodating. Amazingly quick but delicious!!

wkM34WpBURG_xhfB5PpzyA.text: My sister and I ate there on Saturday Feb 13 2016. Food is overpriced for the quality.  About twenty minutes after eating there  - had to pull over in a parking lot - and we both vomited.

wHrSCL8NP7ag6R6KVjTZyg.text: This place is perfect for a nice meal, without having to get dressed up or pay high prices.  I had the mahi mahi tacos. And the rest of my party all ordered the patty melt and fries. Everything was delicious. They had an issue with their soda machine so we all had water and the water wasn't too delicious. But the food was perfect.   I recommend this place for a meal, snack, or both!

g-60Riy8OOAqxAYA8QTpNw.text: Food was great. Service was atrocious. Had to get up and get a waiter to come take our order after waiting 30 minutes. The coffee urn did. It have a top, they just put a syrup cup on top which would fall off every time you poured a cup. Luckily the food was fantastic. Need to management and waitstaff here. They don't do a very good job.

kT-F5Y65BVM5DnE9HNp4xg.text: Great food. We had the breakfast burrito and it was large enough to share.  Blueberry muffin was also delicious.  Highly recommend

5uC6ec9IhoeMaKAOOHrqRw.text: I don't know why this place has such a bad rap. We had the kale salad with added chicken and an order of the fruit salad and it came to $27 which was way better than pretty much anywhere else in Vegas and it was healthy!

P0zJYS0eNNxDkj-8Aab_bg.text: Good service and yummy breakfast.   Had a vanilla latte ($5) and the eggs Benedict ($14) both were good! I loved the smashed Tator tot hash, very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumm
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla latte

YSBEPCB4mLgMrU4sMjgq7g.text: We were in town for my boyfriend's 30th birthday and had a fantastic experience here. We were walking around Mandalay looking for a place to eat during a convention lunch rush.
