The hostess Daija was super friendly, she sold us at the door when we asked about what Salmon dishes  they had and she recommended the salmon teriyaki bowl. She found us a seat right away. Our server Robert was personable, knowledgeable and gave us great suggestions, the Ruben was on point. We loved the food and service so much we asked to speak with the GM Marjorie so we could make sure the staff was recognized. She appreciated the feedback and recommended some other cool places to check out. All in all a great place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ruben our server Robert recommended

u8psMhHLPJSLLpXstCdLxQ.text: We started off with the shredded chicken noodle soup with buttered saltine crackers like when we were kids, then ordered the grilled Mahi Mahi fish tacos and there were 3 with guacamole, salsa and sour cream.  We also ordered the grilled shrimp on a bed of quinoa with yogurt sauce and steamed green beans.  All were delish and enjoyable and our waiter was attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled shrimp
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi mahi fish tacos
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of steamed green beans

J64kiN7GRF8nnLJPbvjM5Q.text: Talk about a disappointment!   I want to first say that our server was amazing and tried his best to give us the best service ever. Thank you!!   My friend and I were hungry after a late night on the town, we were staying at MB and were craving burgers. We got there and were seated right away. My friend ordered the French Dip Steak and it was horrible! The meat was dryer than the Las Vegas heat, no taste! The soup that came with it was bland and the pasta was disgusting. Meanwhile I had the hamburger that had no taste to it.   Now usually if we were paying a cheap price, you get what you pay for. But these orders were $20 bucks a piece. And I understand that it's late at night, but either lower the price or give us fresh food. We let our server know that we didn't like our food (we couldn't even finish it) and didn't want anything else. Then the manager came and basically told us that they did ask us if we wanted anything else and "apologized". Yeah, whatever dude. At the end of it all we did get a cut off our total, but the whole experience was a total let down. If you're going to be serving food, all I ask is for it to be GOOD. Avoiding this place from now on.

TAVPTDe8vkSbqjmUsjpoXg.text: I visited Citizens for a late dinner after checking in. The restaurant is pretty big so there was no wait to be seated. We sat in the "outdoor" area, which was nice to people watch and at least have the illusion of being outside.   We had the artichoke dip, which was among the best I've had and was served with both homemade tortilla chips and grilled pita. My friend is a vegetarian and ordered a veggie sandwich off menu. I had the Mahi Mahi fish tacos. The sandwich was huge and loaded with good veggies. I was barely able to finish two of my three tacos, as the portion was also large on my plate.  The service was sort of slow but our server was friendly. The only bummer is that, since the mini frig in the room is pre-stocked and full, we had no way to take our leftovers with us. Overall, the portions were almost too big, but the price was still reasonable, and I enjoyed the view of the restaurant courtyard area. Citzens is a good stop for a quick, simple meal.

Yi5wdyly9ylQZSyap01aXw.text: Super expensive but the food wasn't bad. The French dip was surprisingly not terrible, but the expectations at 2 am are tempered by the choices available. The bacon and eggs were fine and the potatoes were pretty food. No butter or jam for the toast which was disappointing but the bread was nice and thick.

HGN4wuQhbhKYxs0GdMx8SA.text: THE PORTIONS ARE HUGE!  just an FYI. Service here was great. Unfortunately I can't remember our waiters name but he was soo helpful and cheery. The hostess was helpful as well we had a show to catch and she made sure we were seated quickly.   The reasons for only 4 stars is the price. It's a bit over priced. I don't mind paying for food, especially when it's a large portion, but the drinks here are really expensive.

1E9DHfeU4j0zFeaBbJsltQ.text: Have been here 3x for breakfast in my trip. Staff is friendly & prompt. Food is outstanding!!!!

KYyPI5qtSiCW5Dcbe5Ow_Q.text: 24/7! One of the better 24/7 restaurants on the strip that's reasonable priced!  My group and I visited Citizens one late night after a night of drinking in the Foundation Room. Our server was so excited at first to greet us because we had a party of 6. He thought we were going to be a high value table, but his demeanor all changed when we told him we were only ordering a couple orders of those crispy piping hot waffle fries and the wonderful delectable sliders along with only waters. We only saw him once more after he brought us our food. I thought it was rude of our waiter to treat us differently only because we weren't spending as much $$$ as most tables would. It was am, we just wanted some snacks!  Despite the service snafu, the appetizers (sliders and waffle fries) were quite good. Even though we didn't order any main entrees, everything was reasonable priced. I will definitely come back to Citizens Kitchen & Bar to give their entrees a try!

dYjcaOGew0FurLYQuzA-tA.text: Went with a group here for lunch and it was DELISH. Majority of us got the club. I'd highly recommend that Service wasn't the quickest but we weren't in a hurry so it wasn't really an issue for us. Definitely wanting to check out there breakfast. Will be going again for sure

11sxBLuToeVcEeaGuFGnQw.text: Better than I expected after reading all the crappy reviews.  I've been here at least 3 different times on 3 different visits and it's been consistently decent.  On our last visit, Greg took our order and was really cool and gave us attentive and thoughtful service.  The food was not bad and was definitely good enough for a cafe type of restaurant.  I liked the chicken soup a lot.  Iced tea is brewed which is a surprise because the buffet and Raffles both serve crappy soda fountain iced tea.  The sandwiches are filling and pretty good.  The presentation is nice and the fries are tasty.   I personally prefer the tables away from the entrance but if people watching is your thing, the front location is the best part because you can see all sorts of people coming from the clubs and the arena when there's an event going on.  It's loud and lively and good to go at 2am for some steak and eggs or other late night fare.

IPgA8iAurxASfGFdkWMxzw.text: Being an M Life member, I was looking for a place that I could get a quick snack that would also help me keep my status. I ended up here and to my surprise, I have no regrets. The husband and I ordered a Chunky monkey drink and carrot cake. The carrot cake portion was HUGE!! That was way more than I was expecting to get but for the cost of $9, it def was a humongous heavy piece of late night cake. Was it worth $9 bucks?? Most likely not. It was moist and it was delicious but for a slice of cake, it was a little dent in my pocket for it. That cake served me as a snack and a part of my breakfast in the morning of the next day. As for the drink, it was good but also $9! The serving size for that was actually small, not worth the $9 even though the flavors were great. Peanut butter and dark chocolate flavors blended with bananas, soy and flax seeds. Tasty food but way too over priced. I get that we are in Vegas but for that price and the longggg wait for just my two items,  I am sure I can still find something  with more bang for my buck.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chunky monkey and carrot cake
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salads, sandwiches and even cheesecake!

uqPmZFLOmhdyoQrXnBXMAA.text: Me and my husband decided to find us a place to eat after our wedding.  And this was perfect.  The drinks were spot on,  the portions wear huge for the price.  Will come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat loaf with mashed potatoes,  prime rib with baked potato and siracha shrimp tempora!

YMUpnvywfXCMY2k-IZI1XQ.text: So this place was just ok.    Pros:  Really bright clean atmosphere which is welcoming. Open 24 hours which is huge. Teriyaki rice bowl was very good, but in all honestly, it's probably hard to screw up. My husband really liked his pastrami sandwich.   Cons: server was just ok. They messed up my husbands sandwich initially by sending it with no mustard and on the wrong bread which delayed our meal because I didn't want to eat without him.   Overall, not bad, not great. I didn't advocate to return during our trip because it was meh.

KfJ-bszXvWZgYJEXSzUSog.text: While at CES 2015 stopped by to grab a quick lunch and ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and coleslaw. I will say one thing the amount of food you get for the price is decent as my sandwich was HUGE. The chicken was fried well and the buffalo sauce was pretty good. The Blue Cheese was a little strong personal preference wise (I like bleu cheese but not the amount I had on my sandwich). Even given the portion, taste and ambiance of the restaurant the one thing that stood out for me was the price sadly. Even with the amount of food you get, the taste really didn't wow me at all and I left thinking "I paid quite a bit..." Probably won't come back as this place wasn't that memorable for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Sandwich

iJB3MLjUkKqePxOAw3L34g.text: O.M.G. Everything was well seasoned, fresh and high quality! Pastrami sandwich on rye dayum! Fries delicious and Cesar salad was so fresh! I want to come back here so I can try everything on the menu. Menu is not large, which is smart of them because the food they offer is on point! Hands down best pastrami I've ever had, bread was perfect, no fat on the meat, even their spicy brown mustard was bomb. This place is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich is delicious!

4LgLPsqnJVSzo9pikOFmoA.text: This was a Great Dinner with the Best Service in town!! Priscilla out-did herself with a truly genuine smile! So personable and real Get down to Citizen's tonight for a terrific meal.

r8gGhT20O7bUUwt8VnvQHw.text: $25.00 for a stale tiny chicken pot pie! Stay away from this place its a sucky rip off!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MVs0I7j6F41Sq0BSpjUrSA.text: The food is good for the most part.  It falls short in speed and value.  The to-go option is convenient but takes way too long.  They offer good portions and solid food, but it is priced like it is a higher level locations.  The kobe beef chili cheese fries were quite tasty.  The chili and the fries both had good flavor.  The queso cheese dip is ok.  The flavor is ok, but I expected more bold flavor from the Chorizo.  It is not a bad option, but you will have to be patient and be willing to pay a little more than it is worth.

p8gytT9md8ykHq_p5ACXZQ.text: Build your own omelette ($14). Everything else is an extra .50 or .75 for meats. I will note, they ended up getting the cheeses mixed up when our food was brought out. (Not a big deal, but thought I'd mention it, and they did remove the cheese from our bill.)   When the food finally did arrive, the omelette from the looks of it - was a little thin. It looked like it was made with egg substitute rather than real eggs.   Round it off with 2 (maybe) 8oz orange juices and 1 coffee the bill came out to over $40.  Conclusion: The place is okay, but a little pricey. Dimly lite like the rest of the places we've been to in Vegas so far.

kQ1Gz1v5xjALbjMqLVdrSA.text: Have eaten here two nights in a row for dinner and two of the best meals I've had in Vegas.  Impeccable service.  Apaca and Joe were our servers for our dinners and Robert served us breakfast.  All three servers recommended excellent dinners and Joe recommended a great breakfast choice.  It's a hidden gem in Vegas. Staff is friendly, restaurant was very clean.  I recommend the Reuben, Meatloaf, Gumbo and for breakfast sandwich or Eggs Benedict.    I have traveled to Vegas 5 times in the last 90 days and stayed at high end to average resorts and this is my new favorite restaurant.

l6w-YPLOjYT-2vlzLMAseg.text: If you're looking for juicing alternatives and something close, fast, healthy & convenient to the hotel convention, try the Green & Mean juice here. Juices seem to have a lil pulp included and are prepared like a light smoothie, but more juice. Includes Kale, Spinach, Green Apples and Banana just to name a few. Super delish! There are a few other juices to choose from, but this is the best among them. For to-go orders, they recommend placing your order at the deli area vs from the bar. Workers seem to be friendly & accommodating, yet understaffed. So, bring your patience then enjoy your juice. ;D

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juice Bar menu options @ Citizens inside Mandalay Bay 20150810

tKrDFGTZciZoHsSnaCoVWA.text: Generous portions.  Friendly staff. Food was excellent.   One of the best Carrot cakes we had, big enough for two-maybe more!    We had potato skins for an app and while it was four skins, they were big and came with plenty of sides to dress.  I had the french dip with a mac salad.  The mac salad was new the waiter said, and we unique as it had corn in it which offered a nice bite.  My wife has the BLTA and they do not short you on the B.  I was able to enjoy some bacon and leave plenty for the sandwich.  The coffee was the best coffee I have had.

Na1MfjyvKb_HBKIvqP9XLw.text: The quinoa vegetable salad ($15) was tiny! There was a tiny scoop of quinoa, which was actually cooked and seasoned well. Then there were a few green leaves. That's about it. I expected much more greens, or vegetables, when the name of the dish is something vegetable.  This was a convenient location to dine at since it's inside the Mandalay Bay hotel and we stayed there. One morning I came by around 8 am and wanted to get a quick breakfast. With all the convention going people everywhere, that was not going to happen so I went elsewhere (to a "dessert" place on the other side of the casino inside the hotel)....

57vC1vaMrvF8t08pJbxKPw.text: Not bad for desperate diners who have been on the road for 10 hours trying to get to Vegas and need something to eat at 2 am.

ru_HC3Eu32pDjZkkRuGGGg.text: Nice bistro/ cafe feel. Had an awesome breakfast and an amazing experience. Shanna was great with her service and super friendly bubbly personality. Will definitely be back and highly recommend.

7ZKhovxeSeQQfGp_r7xCbA.text: I made a bad choice coming here for breakfast/brunch.  My husband and I didn't want to drive out and we should have!  I ordered the biscuit with sausage gravy-- eggs where rubbery when they were supposed to be poached! Waffle was bland and the breakfast burrito was okay.  Even my son's kid's meal did not taste good.  We could went to Hash House or somewhere else for almost $90 bucks!!!! Lesson learned

hOzUeq-zNGuBJyguSwniIQ.text: Food was typical for restaurant in hotel chain.  Our service experience wasn't up to par with the experience we have had so far in vegas.  Our guy was jason. He was just regular. He seemed a bit rushed and doesnt even put on a smile .  Place wasnt that busy and didnt stay on top of filling up the water.

5iqppTOTwAyycp1vF_EuyQ.text: Stopped by at 7:38am asking for a travel for three at a restaurant that seats about 250. There are 37 total people here and the won't seat me even through my colleagues will arrive at 8:00. After reasonable requests to two indifferent hostesses, Shawn the manager was asked to stop by. After explaining a late arrival and the desire to start on a report, and asking Shawn to use his discretion and he was really offended when I asked him to use his judgement. No idea about the food, but considering the initial impression if service I'll make sure I repeat this interaction at least 10 times today.

BBWl4nEVOLc8KDWCGGKZ5g.text: Vegas Strip..... The streets where tourists wander and pay for overpriced EVERYTHING!  At Citizens Kitchen and Bar, you can either order and pick up at the cashier OR sit at a table and get waited on by a server. If you want to order yourself, you can only sit outside at one of the two patio areas (~7-8 small tables / 6-10% of the restaurant).   I got a tuna melt.... cheese was solid................ BLAH! Saddest looking tuna melt I've ever seen.  Host wasn't friendly either. Oh, and there was only one table getting waited on inside and the other patio for patrons who want servers was empty.....   #notenoughtables #wedontwantyourservers #saddesttunameltever

uRvc67rRhdhlfSQgZOZi8Q.text: Sometimes I wonder how people can be so insensitive to other people. I Ask if the chef could please make a salad that was nut free for my daughter, who is extremely allergic to tree nuts and he said "No" he was to busy and suggested she eat somewhere else!!!

8_qnT9xvo69zY8_euitf1g.text: AWESOME chips and fish! You get two HUGE pieces of fish and a good size portion of fries! The Mahi Mahi fish tacos are really good too! I was pleasantly surprised with the overall atmosphere and the service. Our server was super friendly and the prices were reasonable. Would recommend for a quick bite at Mandalay Bay!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the fish and chips - 3 of us shared and couldn&#39;t finish it!

SXTN3ozj9ikt8TzCvV_YCQ.text: Walked by this place and my attention was drawn instantly from the outside inside patio to the modern industrial decor. Upon seating and looking at the menu it was a full menu which is nice to see on a Sunday. The brunch menu usually ruins it for me. The menu is well organized and has everything to appeal to your tastes. Looking around seeing the different food coming out I was drawn to the sandwiches. I ordered the pastrami on rye with spicy mustard side of coleslaw and a Brooklyn lager. Prior to food coming out drinks were brought out fast and server kept water glass full. Once the sandwich arrived which was very quick I was welcomed with a high piled sandwich. The quality of the meat was outstanding and the bread was soft and fresh. The side of coleslaw was a light based dressing. Overall the dining experience was outstanding and will be back to try more items.

C__abmZeuocHxfBaf5yViQ.text: Glad this place is 24/7... Came here straight from Light Nightclub ;p in dire need of something to eat. I got the turkey avocado. Such a good choice! It was soooo good! The sandwich consists of: turkey & avocado (duh! Lol), muenster cheese, sprouts, lemon aioli, and cranberry walnut bread. Everything went so well together... One of the best sandwiches I've ever tasted! And I really don't think it was because I was a bit tipsy lol. I also got the chunky monkey smoothie. Forgot what's it in... Chocolate, banana, and other stuff I think. But it's worth trying!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey avocado. So yummy!!!

PSBlIEc4BG--bW7Tk0BRSg.text: I typically don't write reviews but I was so blown away by the service. I have NEVER had such an amazing bartender as Steven!!!!  And I love his mustache!!  He knew the menu backwards and forwards. And gave us great suggestions for what to do and see here at the hotel and in Vegas. Plus his drinks were amazing! We  so have to come back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lt0rSrpvSQj5fUzstN88vA.text: Great food, better service!  During the course of our weeks-long work conference, we ate at Citizens nearly every night for dinner.  We had the pleasure of being waited on by Priscilla.  She had exemplary customer service, and was friendly, courteous, and upbeat!  Now, on to the food -- over the course of the week I had a BLTA, Fish & Chips, Turkey Avocado, as well as the BBQ Chicken Salad.  Every meal was delicious, but be warned: portions are enormous!  So come hungry or be prepared to split a meal with someone.  For people staying at Mandalay, I would highly recommend this as a dining option!

XJiL1R0E-g4aGI5ztCDwPw.text: Very cute decor. We ate here for breakfast on NYE day. Take it or leave it. Food was not that great, it was a bit blan. But when your hungover and there aren't that many breakie spots open yet it will do the job. I got the breakfast burrito, it was small but fine. My BF has the eggs Benedict, it was also okay. The benny bread was hard and they could done a better job on the poached eggs. We just needed some fuel and it did the job.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AiMk9XES5oc1WGKKwa0P4w.text: Had the teriyaki bowl, which was pretty good. Ordered ahead of time and picked up, which I think is the way to go if you can rally.

y47rfDb0zOKqwoCPKXFyzg.text: Ordered the Crab Cake Benedict and it looked nothing like the photo on here.  Crab cake itself was super thin with hardly any meat, and the yolks on the eggs were way overcooked.  Service was good, but probably wouldn't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BvkhF-wiG0cm7L4kK5rz9g.text: Truly outstanding customer service!  I mean, really impressive.  In the middle of my meal I needed something and turned around to see if our waitress was around.  I thought I spotted her way back in the kitchen and I waved.  Then I realized that wasn't my waitress.    I turned around and got back to my meal.  But before I could take a bite, the waitress that I had waved to was at my table asking if I needed anything.  Dang, she wasn't even my waitress but she dropped what she was doing and hustled over to see what she could do for me.    That's just one example.  I could cite more.   All the waitstaff are like that.  Efficient, accommodating and super friendly.   This wasn't our first visit.  We've been eating here since the restaurant was called Red, White and Blue.  The name changed, but the food is still great, and the service is exemplary.  The food is a little more expensive here than the coffee shop.  Breakfasts are $17-$20.  I always get the Eggs Benedict, which is always prepared perfectly.  The Hollandaise has a subtle herb flavor that sets it apart from the typical version.  The breakfast potatoes are simple, yet delicious.  If you order anything with breakfast potatoes be sure to get a side of their sausage gravy.  It's outstanding and absolutely loaded with sausage.  My wife typically gets some sort of fresh fruit bowl.   I can verify the berries were fresh and delicious.  My nephew had the french toast, which comes topped with those same fresh berries, and it looked really good.    They serve Lavazza for their house coffee here.  They use it for their espresso beverages, too.  Good stuff!  Mikey C says: Liberte, Egalite, Fraternite yo!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage gravy. Get it!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lavazza coffee served here. Nice!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding Eggs Benedict.  Potatoes xtra cooked per my request: sooo good.

xRsP7QxLFn1WkrSfLSzgOg.text: So this is probably the most affordable place to eat inside Mandalay Bay . This eatery has indoor seating as well as patio seating . They are located next to Lupo restaurant .  I wanted a low carb option for breakfast so I stopped by to take a look at their quick to go offerings . They have pastries , salads , coffees .  I ordered a Cobb salad to go which cost about $11. It had lettuce , cubes of Swiss cheese , bacon , eggs , scallions , tomatoes . It was a decent size and the nice cashier gave me an extra ranch dressing for free . The salad looked a bit messy compared to the other ones I saw in display case but it tasted pretty good nonetheless .  The caffe latte was $5 and made to order . It was a delicious hot coffee that was made well .  I'd stop by again to try out breakfast items if I stay in this hotel again .

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caffe latte $5
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cTaCE4Urttz1WkkLSbaDFw.text: Citizens Kitchen and Bar would have gotten just 2 stars from me, but a couple of items are able to bump it up to 3 stars.  First of all, if you opt to dine in for dinner, at least the couple of times that I've gone (Sunday after 10pm), it gets really LOUD because of the band that plays just across the way.  Sometimes you just want to wind down with some good conversation, but you can't really do that with the extremely loud music playing.  If you have a headache, forget about coming here!  When we went back recently, we opted to just take our food to go.  Anyway, I like a cozy ambiance or a place with a trendy/sexy vibe; Citizens has neither.  So no problem not dining in that time.  On both of my visits, service was meh.  The hostess the time we dined in started to seat us out on their patio area closest to the live band. When we requested a quieter table inside, she sat us at a table right next to the patio making little difference in the noise level :/  There's definitely no service with a smile at Citizens, at least from my experience.  As for the food, I definitely wasn't impressed on my first visit.  I wasn't too hungry, so I opted for their french onion soup and got to taste my dining companion's penne prosciutto.  Again, meh.  Even though we weren't impressed on that visit, we went back to Citizens on a recent trip to Vegas since we were staying at the Four Seasons next door and our options were limited for late night dining.  We ordered at their to-go counter, and I chose their cheese quesadilla this time and their salted caramel parfait.  Their quesadilla I didn't care for but I did like the parfait.  I ended up coming back a few days later to pick up a blondie.  It had some toffee in it and was tasty overall and it did not disappoint!  (I forgot to take pics of the food I picked up to go.)  Overall, I would recommend Citizens for their treats at the to-go counter, or if it's late and you're not in the mood for fast food and there are no other options nearby.  Otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way to have a meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne Prosciutto
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup

_Rrex_eZ63B55w0tguOSkA.text: Love love this place!  Just got back from a trip to Vegas & had to stop in here for brunch one am while there .  The food & bloody's never disappoint.  If you are staying at Mandalay or happen to be in the casino go check them out, open all hours, late night munchies ...they got you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody good!!

vv-MYijLtQdcDRijBXWxgg.text: We stopped in pretty late, so could only order from the late-night menu. It did not disappoint. I had the French dip sandwich, the meat was very flavorful and moist, the bread was fresh-baked and lightly toasted - DELISH. We had the pleasure of sitting on the patio just across from where a classic classic-rock style live band was playing, what a treat! Although it was really late our server was incredibly friendly and courteous and nature we were well taken care of. Overall stopping here was a treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Dip Sandwich

Q90tuG90IdLi1-aTUl_YyQ.text: We only came here because they were open very late. They are incredibly expensive. BUT the food was very good. I had the Carnivore Pizza that was cooked very well and very tasty. My brother had Toasted Reuben with corned beef and mac and cheese as a side. I didn't taste the sandwich but did have a taste of the mac and cheese and it was delicious. They sat us "outside" and we enjoyed the band that was playing inside the casino while we dined.

6oPnuMeixBEz6b0DvV7VQA.text: I ate at Citizens twice on this Vegas trip. Once for late night and once for breakfast. Citizens is open 24/7. Good for breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night, etc.   We never had to wait too long for a table. Both visit's wait staff were cool. Very attentive and nice.   The food isn't bad either. A bit expensive but what else do you expect from a restaurant inside a hotel (Mandalay Bay).   - Loco Moco was good, needed more gravy over the beef patty though.   - Cheesecake was awesome...check into Yelp for a free cheesecake with your entree.   - Citizens' breakfast (pancakes super good).   Two good experiences here. Redeem your M Life card or use your M Life points.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco with my Leffe.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake was the bomb!! Check into Yelp and get it free with an entree.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Breakfast!!

ITl5ZMX_XLsrXqBEPTXaAA.text: I have ate at a lot of restaurant here and I highly recommend this place. Great food and Leslie is a great waitress lots of personality and great customer service.

eByMFEarlkVk1kvbVHmgYQ.text: Came here late on a weekend night needing to grub. No other restaurants seemed to be open in the MB so we were directed here. Found a late night menu that was a bit pricey but whatevs...we wanted fries, wings, sandwiches...they seemed to have all the things even tho late night menu was limited. Overall not a bad place. Food was decent but nothing out of the normal fare ( wings, fries etc) just had an issue with service as server seemed hurried and made a snarky comment when My friend was trying to pick a beer...mos def not my first choice...but if you're in MB late night not a bad option...

UvNOJbL4Bf0GJqnWp1M8FA.text: Nice decor and vibe but service is below par for the prices. Being a Vegas local, expectations are high but this spot is 24 hrs and quality and service is not their priority during late night hours which is expected. But late night prices are not enticing and for that reason, I can't give more stars.

CIuaP1mktQnQNB3hI14sQw.text: The turkey avocado sandwich is the best turkey sandwich I've ever had. The bloody Mary's are delicious as well. Beautiful dinning area and accommodating wait staff.

Yz8RCvy91BgPHPJKENJ5JA.text: I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a work conference and this spot was one of restaurants downstairs among the many others.  Walked around checking all the restaurants out and this one seemed totally casual and a good place to grab a beer, plus it had the shortest wait time.   They don't do reservations, so it's first come, first eat.    Nice decor inside, relaxing, place felt comfy and welcoming for all. Menu looked pretty good with burgers, sandwiches, salads, some signature entrees and a bonus that they serve breakfast all day. My coworkers and I ordered a round of drinks first, they too have a nice beer list, cocktails and wine list to get you going.    We decided to get some potato skins as an appetizer and it was pretty good, thick cut potato wedge with some bacon sprinkled on top and of course melty cheese on top with green onions.  You get 4 per order with guac, sour cream and pico.  We were quite hungry so we devoured it in minutes.    As for my main, I got the Mahi Tacos, 3 grilled Mahi pieces with all the normal fixin's such as pico de gallo, cabbage and avocado slices. Served with their usual friends of guac, sour cream and more pico. Fish was nicely cooked and good sized pieces and flavorful.  Anything with avocado or guacamole makes it that much better.    Forgot what my coworkers ordered but they enjoyed their first Vegas meal very much. Stayed a bit longer to have a few more drinks so no room for dessert.    Staff was fine, quite friendly, attentive and quick and helpful with making suggestions. No issues with our dining experience. If you don't want to sit in the dining room, there is a counter/walk up area where you can order to go. They are open 24/7 so this may be a good late night option before going back to your room to pass out.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi Mahi Tacos Tacos
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato Skins appetizer. (Pardon my coworker for digging in immediately)

uhYKDGch2uvls_Ax-GoWcA.text: Not really good. Especially for the price. But if you arrive too late to go to a nice restarting, and if you are staying at Mandalay Bay, it is open 24 hours.

rJlc42bLGNK-yfZYm2YnyA.text: Very delicious food! This is my 3rd time coming to Citizens and the food is consistently delicious. I LOVE the Turkey Avocado sandwich, the cranberry walnut bread adds a nice light crunch and flavor to your pallet. Jenna our waiter was awesome!

AD45dAFskx0IpzSrsc8ssg.text: Good breakfast, but like most of this city, VERY expensive. $21 for eggs, bacon, pancakes & potatoes. Coffee is $4.50

NPddVcGDkO9fNbLg9LQ_EA.text: Came here at about 2AM after a night of drinking to quench my munchies. It is very conveniently open 24/7, so we actually come here quite often when drinking at Mandalay Bay. The food is great for post-drinking, and my French Dip was exactly what I was craving. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 stars was that the service was not great (hard to blame them at that hour). Overall, reliable if you're in the area!

-OSQ1SWbYGQL-ngW23NGUg.text: This place was cool and a good place to get a quick bite. I had the eggs Benedict for breakfast, they were good but not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

Q50kVu2dXKCXJ0USVApnag.text: This was the worst customer service I had in my life.  I don't know if it as racist but they refused to seat met girlfriend and I.   And they were freely sitting other Caucasian people.

OQFZTYacNvG73ytaO1mP0A.text: Oh my gosh is all I can say about the grilled cheese patty melt that we got.I was only able to eat half of it. It was too full grilled cheese sandwiches with a great beef patty and caramelized grilled onions in it. Oh the grilled cheese sandwiches also had great slices of tomato inside of them and a patty melt itself had lettuce shreds inside of it. My wife had the same thing and we both knew this flavor from something else. Then all of a sudden it hit us - - please anybody doublecheck this going forward, but this grilled cheese patty melt taste almost exactly like an In-and-Out Burger Double Double. The service was good and attentive. Oh, I almost forgot we had the fried calamari as an appetizer and it was ok. The only real complaint was that the sandwich was extremely messy to eat and hard to control. With the size this thing there's no way around it. My wife's pickle spear was huge compared to the anorexic pickle spear that I got, just sayin'.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The toasted cheese patty melt. Huge sammy!

pd2Vn-0SSQ-uBifVFGbC_g.text: This place is one of the best dining options at Mandalay. I had a half portion of the french onion soup and it was magnificent - loaded with cheese, enough for every bite. The quesadilla I ordered was pretty plain, I wished I had gotten more of the soup. The next night of our stay we found ourselves coming back here for a quick bite. I couldn't help but order the soup again, along with the buffalo chicken sandwich. I was disappointed that the soup didn't have nearly the same amount of cheese as the night before, though the sandwich was really great. The food is pretty expensive, but that's par for the course for a vegas resort. One strange bit is that the regular portion of soup is $14, yet the half is only $5 and is a good size.

MAjflZEI0pcL2ZycByFpuA.text: Waited 20 mins for a microwaved burrito we had to ask the manager to check on...yes I said microwaved. Awful....don't eat here, go somewhere else. $9 for a microwaved breakfast burro is shameful.

f-qVvcwTwpoVABbOTuNvlA.text: A casual American restaurant located inside Mandalay Bay is a great option for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.  There is a to go bar to order off the limited menu, which has sandwiches, salads, juices and coffee. I dined in for lunch on Saturday and the service was horrible. It was not busy at all, yet the waitress was very slow to take our order and to deliver the check.  I ordered the mushroom bleu burger, which is exactly how it sounds, a burger with bleu cheese, mushrooms, jalapeno, lettuce, onion and tomato. It is a bit pricey for a typical burger that did not stand out.  I would try this place again and try another dish with another server, but it didn't give a lasting first impression. I recommend it to hotel guests not wanting to leave the hotel, but there are other restaurants in the Mandalay Bay Shoppes including another burger joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom bleu burger &amp; fries

jVKxU48wPTs0e9-x1F_3-w.text: Service was awful, no hostess at the door. We sat ourselves and a rude server told us we needed to be seated, and to wait for this imaginary hostess to appear. We ordered queso, and Kobe fries. Food was over priced, but okay not great.  They didn't ask how anything was! Our server was Robert, I had a beer served in a dirty glass, there was no apology. Then Robert lost our debt card upon trying to pay... We won't be going back. And good luck to anyone who goes there.

sjGxDe0FVdO6KwZ9MgsCuA.text: Great place for lunch, yummy food and yummy drinks! I definitely recommend the mahi mahi tacos, the fish was cooked to perfection!

1eDSar5I948dIclGN0jY3Q.text: Sat at the bar and truly enjoyed my experience. Bartender is very personable which pays dividends. Good eats and drinks. Killer music soundtrack playing as well. A place I may come back to tomorrow as I am here on a conference.

UkGj6UwOO7I-AHFMw3kB2Q.text: Great breakfast place, although awfully pricey. They make a solid California omelette that'll keep you feeling well fed for hours, which is great because if you're traveling for work it'll also eat up a good chunk of your per diem. I ordered juice and coffee also and believe I was at $25 before tip.

GPzOZcuXQ6rFkaXq2INILQ.text: This place was awesome!   We happened upon this place while we were knocking out our bucket list item of walking the entire strip. Our waiter Joey was friendly & attentive. The General Manager... I think his name was Nick (?) seated us, and was also extremely personable.   Will definitely be back when friends and family come into town to visit.   Try: Mac n' Cheese & Carrot Cake!

6PcW38XaugKd7yDSa2u0PA.text: I had the spinach and mushroom omelette. Food was fantastic! Tim, our server, was outstanding. We will definitely be back.

EOJ2gCXEc180eOrMxQ9FJA.text: This place is bomb. I stayed at the Mandalay for 4 nights. I could have hiked it over to the food court for a pleble $5 Nathan's hot dog, but for $15 for a sandwich 24/7 365, why now. The French dip is insane. I had it twice. Also had a cold turkey sandwich. Very legit. Also tons of pastries etc. Prices are not too bad, food is quality.

HEgYNgz0fzcasfkrikGdHA.text: Seriously worst service ever.  The waiter didn't even acknowledge our table for about 10 minutes.  We put our food and drink order then.  We waited and waited and waited for our food.  We ordered a salad and grilled chicken sandwich.  It took over 45 minutes for our food and not once did our server come over.  We almost left drink money and left.  The food was good but the service was  ridiculous.

ROe3VHD0kmWWcdg07Y2ECQ.text: They don't even deserve one star.  By far the worst experience ever!  After spending some serious money gambling my friend and I decided to have a very late dinner, we were seated promptly ... other than that we waited 30 minutes for water and still patiently waited another 30 minutes to see if we were going to be served.... wishful thinking.... A table of 6 who arrived after us were served... We got up and left..... Poor poor poor service!!!  Never again...  We went to RePete's  Bar and Grill .... Immediate service and awesome waiter!

rGOwuX2vg0hnEqsHpPeDPQ.text: PRO: open 24/7, cool ambiance  CON: food isn't great, very slow service  if you're looking for a quick late night bite be prepared to sit and wait around for your food. we waited for over an hour and it was pretty tasteless.

GvNCphf5CFzVwtmBftiuoA.text: A nice late night alternative in Las Vegas. Delicious healthy kale salad and a nice selection of home town deliciacies. Open 24 hrs     A enormous brownie sundae seals the deal. Ask for Chris for real good service.very good pricing and value for Vegas standards

4dncH0cEGGwqoY1SwigLaw.text: Like almost every restaurant in Vegas the food is good. Price wise they are fairly reasonable for the location. The sandwiches are always a good choice.

JFKXyTQqLT774ki3VLpueA.text: Excellent food! Our best dinner in Las Vegas. We went to see Michael Jackson One to Mandalay Bay and a security guard in the casino recommended it. After dinner we went back to thank him.

ACSflLjbnTetGBLoelj2HA.text: Ate 2 meals and a late night dessert here during our stay at Mandalay Bay  The service is extremely lacking - inattentive , slow and overall a negative . We  will not be back

FT1UL4fivDuuJ2MCGOtwaA.text: Roast beef sandwich to go was just what I was looking for after walking all morning and heading back to the room. The sandwich had just the right amount of Horshradish on it and the roast beef was sliced thin and piled up.

1Ypql0qdSQhVtv3PTZOCTw.text: Taking over the giant old space that was once Red, White and Blue, Citizens was designed by a 'famous' design firm for the Light group. The space is huge, and comprised of all hard surfaces; hard floors, hard ceilings, and hard walls. What this equates to is an extremely loud dining experience, even if it's not that full. The vaulted ceilings, light fixtures and finishes are all cool, but this place is just huge. I would also point out that if you want comfort, do not sit on the incorrectly proportioned backless bar chairs at the bar, and instead get yourself a table.  More importantly this place is overpriced; you'll notice that just about everything on the menu is about $2-3 more than you'd be willing to spend. I had this gripe when I ate at Mandalay's noodle shop a few weeks ago when my lunch special was an astonishing $18 for a soup and lunch-portioned dish. Apparently the property really likes to take advantage of their massive convention crowds. With everything from breakfasts, salads, burgers, entrees and desserts you can certainly find something you'd like, just expect to pay handsomely for it. Also, they use the words 'specialty' and 'signature' quite a bit on their menu, but looking around at other people's dishes and based on my meal this definition seems to be based around providing mediocre, high priced sandwiches.  My classic hamburger was placed in front of me and looked as mediocre as it tasted. The bun was dry and a bit too big, but well-proportioned to the patty. Not sure if you have a choice of cheeses, but when I asked for a cheeseburger I wasn't offered any options and was given American cheese. The presumably frozen patty had ok char flavor, but was of your extremely generic back yard BBQ variety, and very overcooked at that. But I guess one of this quality shouldn't be ordered any other way. One small slice of not too fresh tomato didn't provide much coverage, but I had plenty of pickles, lettuce and red onion at my disposal. Overall this had nothing great going on.   My waffle fries sucked as they always do, and considering the menu gives you the option of skinny fries, potato salad or coleslaw I'm not quite sure why I got these stupid fries. They're clearly never fresh due to how they're made, so why bother? Plus, $21 for a burger and iced tea is about $9 more than you should pay for this, even in a casino setting capitalizing on desperate conventioneers. After this awful experience, combined with Burger Bar's drop off, I can probably now claim that there are no decent burger options south of Tropicana along the Strip until you get much more south away from the casinos. If you're at Mandalay I would still recommend Burger Bar over this as you get far better quality for the money, but I can't promise anything there anymore.

3kzAPTcmSGTIQguwoPUw7A.text: Citizen's Kitchen ( Formely known as Red, White, and Blue) is a little bit better than it's predecessor.  I ate here so much during my week stay that they morning crew almost knew what I was going to order as well as my name. The food was good even though you had to wait a little longer than expected even when it wasn't busy. They now have a juice/smoothie bar that I think everyone is still trying to get use to as it took quite some time to make a juice or a smoothie ( no matter if it was busy or empty).  Prices are a little steep but again luckily for me, I was not paying for it.  The portions are a decent size, even when you are just doing a quick takeout from the front. At least this place is now open 24 hours as it predecessor was not. Will I eat here on my own dime, in a pinch yes I would as the food was good even if it was a little pricey.

jii1dVmEMYF5ddG0UdK4cg.text: Every time I come to Vegas, I look forward to eating here! I absolutely love their juices and salads!! I used to always order the Greek salad, but they don't offer it anymore :( disappointed about that. But, they do have other yummy options to choose from... Been coming Here for 3 yrs and will continue.

0ROog6YhXd9qVYkpbMPKnA.text: Love this place. The service that Kiana and Daniel provided was excellent. And I am sure that it all comes from great management Joe(manager) was very kind and welcoming. The Mac and Cheese is unbelievably delicious.

8sWH3uO-_2Svyem5hdZ1XQ.text: Best Reuben sandwich I have ever had.   The place is surrounded by expensive chef restaurants like Emeril.  Being a normal person, none of them appeal to me.  I would absolutely recommend that you eat here.

5WdVZVUCZIHj-jeAvGi7OQ.text: Food here was ok. Kinda of on the expensive side even for vegas. Service is where there was lacking. Never received  drink  refills and once we asked for a check it took 45 minutes to get it when there was barely anyone in the resturant. Their walk up  coffee  area was good though and had great cappuccinos.

WTlgCpG9IxkiRo1qF8ZfrA.text: The food and service were very good.  I was thinking that we had a good waitress, Melanie S., when I saw her stoop down and have a conversation with a sweet looking older lady sitting alone in the corner.  I was so impressed.  She definitely takes her job seriously and cares for her diners.  Ask for Melanie to have an even more special dining experience.

n2P0fwPRTr_0gd4OVB5_Rg.text: 3 stars for the food and fast service. But I'm pretty sure my friends and I got the Norwalk virus here. Minus at least one star for that! So that kinda was not fun for the rest of the weekend. The tot mash was great. But then we had lunch there and I watched a buser pick something out of our calamari bowl. Anyhow... Wish I could have given this more stars! But 3/4 of our group left with acute gastroenteritis. At least we didn't gain weight in Vegas!

6vbL-x8N_U2UZaD5n7P0Lw.text: Absolutely the worst & slowest service in Vegas! 50 minutes to get our food, an hour & a half total. There were only 4 tables with people at them. Ridiculous!

Mgh7Ie5bJ5Asmxlnd-DnDA.text: The most memorable thing about my experience here on Saturday night was I thought the light fixtures were cool.  We tried a couple of apps: chicken quesadillas and Kobe beef chili fries and nothing really good or comforting about them.  The server was nice enough but brought  the check without a pen and after seeing us looking for a pen could not find one himself and or ignored that we needed one.  I thought food was slow coming out of the kitchen as well.  It is sad this is only late night option available at Mandalay Bay.

ZXtwovSckWGYGR9uNXtIxw.text: Want to let you all know what an outstanding sever we had Bailey while we were attending a convention for 8 days - not only courteous, professional, attentive but truly a wonderful worker as she took care of us like she knew us for years!! Thank you Bailey!

i00zQ8rNBqp17-JzZG0d3A.text: For a city that doesn't sleep, it sure is hard to find a place to eat at 3 in the morning, and it doesn't come cheap. The food is not bad, but its nothing special. You're paying $20 for a Chilis burger, but drunk you probably wont mind, sober you will when you see the bill in the morning.

YInHfyL-Rrp8fxSBtiQ0Iw.text: Green & mean smoothie was good but really? $10 for 1 regular sized cup of pureed lettuce? Overpriced and It didn't make me feel magical. Make it $5.73 a-holes!

J4qw80vuybwC6-qkLrCFRg.text: So we are at a concert inside the Mandalay beach. During intermission my husband went out to get Starbucks; unfortunately they were closed. He came back to our spot and handed me this drink in a cup; I was like this is not Starbucks. He said he did not have any choice but to order from citizens because its the only place open. His bill was like $18 for two medium drink. I took a sip and phew, it tasted like watered down peanut butter and the bitter after taste of not so ripe banana. It made my tummy rumble inside and we ended up not finishing the concert because I don't want to have any accident in there. I don't even know if its a smoothie or a juice because its not thick or icy, it's watery and tasted so bad. Not a very good first impression. Makes me not want to try to eat here because they can't even get their drinks right.

TkdawvlqzZcZ_kdD6rgPGQ.text: We ordered the brick chicken and the steak frites.  The steak was ordered medium and came out very tough and dry, more well done than medium.  The chicken was also very dry and not good.  The food was very poor.  The service was excellent and to be fair, we didn't comment on the food.  We were in a rush and didn't have time to ask for correction.  Overall though, I'd expect food not to be so over done the first time.

Uroi1F7cJ5UHmo3Rf0xvVg.text: The food and service are atrocious. The staff isn't friendly and the food we had was awful and took forever. Let's not forget the prices which are 2x what they should be. Never again.

1dimp_6E-A0KwKzBn54pzA.text: Horrible food and even worse service. In fact, mandala bay should be ashamed that a restaurant of such scale is inside the hotel. DO NOT COME HERE! Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. Paid for $20 per person for basic food but was given the worst attitude by the waitresses in my life.

XJVFuJq617cHF1NcrvHnqQ.text: Horrible place, I was waiting in line for 5 minutes and place was empty.  That is unacceptable service and manager should really evaluate their process.  Four people on staff at the time.

tU7RdoorNu2ByFsYYQmWSQ.text: The food here is great! Ordered on several occasions and happy with every meal! Love the atmosphere, it's not a high end restaurant but more of an eccentric, rugged, everyone fits in type of place - modern American - and I loved it! The waiters are awesome, very attentive. Bonus: open 24/7 and it's perfect for those after the bar/club munchies.

LA84f_ryfVkyuNchZh7myA.text: Told you we'd be back before we leave!! Haha. Seriously, what is up with the low ratings for this place?? Second time here, on Sunday, on Mother's Day and still received amazing service and food! This time our server was Lane...awesome guy. Both times we've been, it was a phenomenal experience. See my other review. I can't wait till we come back next year. I will be thinking of this place until that time.

lKToTNtyOQzstMDB-plDPA.text: My entree was great! I ordered the brick chicken which came with mashed potatoes, gravy and broccoli. YUM. My boyfriend ordered the teriyaki bowl which wasn't very tasty compared to mine-pretty bland.   It is a bit expensive here, however, they have a prix fixe for $29 that includes a three course meal before 7:00pm. We did not do this because adding a salad and dessert isn't our thing but if you like a multi course meal this would be great for you.  The overall ambiance of this restaurant is very "kitchenette modern" looking. A lot of old school black and white decor and vintage addings. The dress code is business casual, however, in Vegas anything goes.   Out of all the restaurants in Mandalay bay this one has the most to offer.

nJtQ8o2Nt-1ddR5pbL-ZqQ.text: This restaurant says it's opened 24x7. We went there after reading good reviews. They would not seat us. Or anyone coming up to each lunch. I asked if they were "closed". She said they were transitioning from brunch to lunch and we'd have to wait about 1 hour. This place advertises 24x7, but it's not 24x7 hours in a row I guess. We Ate somewhere else instead.

PpHcl0Sy4GkoQaucr2tOYg.text: Ate here with some friends whilst waiting for a show at the House of Blues; since parking in the Mandalay Bay either involves coming a little early and grabbing a spot next to the escalators in the parking garage or coming on time, driving around for thirty minutes as you scour every level of the monolithic parking structure trying to find a place you can only barely fit your compact car into because the rented Hummers on either side are straddling the lines, we opted to come early and have a bite while we waited. The service was fairly good, though my iced tea ran out a few times during the meal. It wasn't hugely busy, but our waiter did have several tables concurrently and I can forgive that oversight. He was still friendly and courteous. It's service that sets most any restaurant on the Strip apart, since the food is usually pretty decent but often over-priced. The food was quite good; I had the double burger that's on two grilled cheese sandwiches, which is to say that my fiance wondered whether we'd make it to the show or not when the ambulance was called. I survived by some miracle, and came out of it with a smile on my face and half the burger in a to-go box so that I could finish killing myself later after NASA got back to me with the calorie count calculation for the thing. Overall, I'd probably come back here; it was a pretty friendly little place and you got a decent amount of food for the money. Yes, the prices are higher than an off-strip restaurant, but the portions are still good.

lDmnxdjRbqS6sX2brcH9-w.text: The food was very good during dinner service in the main restaurant, and the service attendant was very prompt. The Deli area of Citizens was also very nice and convenient. During a few trips to Mandalay Bay at different hours, I would grab a quick sandwich and drink at the Citizens Deli. The deli food quality was high, and the girls working the deli counter were helpful and pleasant. I would recommend giving both the deli and the main restaurant a try.

bFkGJoRY-WLWOdFW6wzMHQ.text: Open 24 hours, perfect for late night munchies. I've tried most items on the menu and so far I've been pretty happy with them. Will keep on coming for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled shrimp
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Burger

OIKMvelOTe-xuoZjrapDzg.text: I was just in Vegas for a convention and after a long day on my feet I decided to grab a quick bite and head back to rest my body. On the way to my room at Luxor I stopped by at Citizens.   We sat down right away and the waiter greeted us and got us drinks. He came back a few times but we weren't ready yet, but I appreciate that kind of service. When we did order I got the half chicken over mashed potatoes. The chicken was pretty good and moist and it came with a generous helping of potatoes and also a ginormous head of broccoli which was good. On top of that I ordered a side of brown rice to fill me up because eat larabars all day couldn't fill me up. The food itself was a 3.5-4 not knock your socks off but not terrible. What pulled this down to a 3 was the amount of time the food took to come out considering the place was relatively empty when we were there. I think the chef forgot our order. They actually sent out a Caesar salad to apologize so that was a nice gesture, would rather have had them discount the meal given I'm not eating the creamy dressings on salads anymore.   Hey if you need a quicker meal, you don't want to pay $80 for a salad and Le Fluer then give Citizens a shot, I'm sure the food order being overlooked isn't common and I'd change he review in the future if so.

b2d-DiE2OsGRA0zywOZ3uQ.text: After drinking numerous shots of who knows what out of a leg-shaped chalice, I ended up here with my husband hungry as hell. Surprisingly it was open. It is actually one of the few restaurants on the strip that is open 24 hours a day. Thank goodness! I was told that no outside drinks were allowed, so I had to chug the last third of my drink on the spot. #Winning  Our server was smug and took our order quickly. We ordered a Stella (I had water, boooooo), fried calamari and home mustard buffalo wings. When our food arrived, it was more than enough for two people. The wings were juicy and flavorful. The bleu cheese dressing was creamy and not tangy like some cheap substitutes. Fried calamari wasn't greasy and we ended up scarfing that down first. All in all, a good experience. So why not 5 stars? Our server went M.I.A. after he dropped our food off and getting our food to us took longer than expected for two appetizers. Still, this is a place I'll be coming back to the next time I'm in Vegas.

kWqxRgbUz725vIshptH_2Q.text: I went here with a group of girls, late night, and wearing everyday jeans and t-shirts. The server was very nice, but the service sucked. Not to mention that they set him up with three tables at the same time. After we ordered our food, it took them over half an hour to get our food to us. Other tables were being served before us even though they got there after us with the same amount of people in their group. Not cool.   The food was good. The pasta salad was not so good.  Experience it for yourself, but as for me and our group, we will not be going back. I think that I would rather get their to go before going back to the actual restaurant.

lvQU3YfJS7-ZqDaDeMVgVg.text: Stopped by citizens for a quick lunch. My waiters name was Kevin and he was fantastic. He recommended the French dip, promising I wouldn't be disappointed! Kevin was right! Food was great, service was even better! Thanks Kevin!

GNhLGzsJsualsn3Du-NBZw.text: This place was just want I needed. Has a bit of everything to make everyone and any one happy.  Huge portions of food! Very good as we'll worth the price!

Lx9rXj0A6CyzGvHgpxnj-w.text: Not impressed, not a lot of options, food was bland and over priced  Food - 1 star Service - 4 stars

02sSc64_v7S81ohsOMYQ6w.text: Oh Citizen's, how you never failed us. During my 5 day stint in Vegas, I probably dined at Citizens no less than 4 times. Maybe, because the restaurant was in our Hotel's Lobby or maybe I was too lazy to search for other food options. Either way Citizens was good. The first day in Vegas I ate lunch there and they were cranking out some good late 90's and early 00's R&B tunes. My guests and I were really enjoying the music, so much that the young lady at the next table over started dancing with us. I ordered the Chicken Sandwich that day and it was good along with their fries. Others in my entourage had chicken wings (good) and their mac n cheese (which was the bomb!). The rest of our visits to Citizen's were for breakfast and let me tell you, their breakfast is bomb. Their potatoes are too die for. I'm glad I stumbled across this gym.

-Vt4iqsF4n417tDavaxkWA.text: Vegas, in many, many ways, has it all wrong. Their motto should not be that it's some sort of city-wide ziplock sealing so tightly that not even vapors can escape, the metaphorically alluded-to "municipality as black hole". No. Their motto should be one more truthful and perhaps more pithy. That new motto of which I speak would go something like this: Nothing exceeds like excess.  And perhaps no place encapsulates that better than this place. Want to know what's in the dessert case? Well you can just walk (or waddle) yourself over there and go look. The dessert menu has five things on it (order any of these and they're huge). The dessert case has probably 5X that, but damn if they will tell you what that is. The menu itself has a number of things on it. Order any of them but appetizers and they come on a cookie sheet. This not only does wonders for the carefully crafted ambiance, but adds a flair of mystery to things. For instance, I can't begin to imagine the food waste this place must go through, but I'm betting they toss a lot more than anyone ever eats.   Actually, given the flavor, this is almost a guarantee. I can almost hear you smacking your lips right now? You mean to say we can get a bunch of substandard - and here, this word is best - "grub", served by some very smarmy prick who looks vaguely like Fred Arminsen, but is far from funny or even amusing (wait, maybe it is Fred Arminsen!), yet has a full-tilt condescending attitude that all but insists we should be grateful he can be deigned to bother with us mere mortals. Maybe that's it. Maybe the wait staff in this elegantly laid out pristine and serene little oasis from the flood of body odor and stale cigarette smoke isn't here for us, but rather that we're here for them. Now I know why I flew here. I wonder if it would be an insult if I tipped 150%...I'm in but I have to get back out somehow.  Then again, it's a great deal, if you get a lot, right? It may be expensive, but at least it's mediocre! Expensive is the nature of the biz in Vegas and comes with the territory and so, apparently, does throwing any old thing in front of people.  This place clearly doesn't care about patrons coming in and out and is one of the more jaded places I've seen. Maybe they ought to just throw all in and go for "Citizen" by way of the old Soviet Union. I'm thinking a food line with metal bowls and plates. The only thing served will be potato soup with cabbage and garlic, along with a small roll that may or may not be moldy. Drink choices are cheap vodka or brackish water. If nothing else, it would at least accurately mirror the contempt for the customers this place clearly seems to have.  Also, like everything else in Vegas, this place is loud.

OgFfETE9e80sMe4i25GOKg.text: food was fantastic.  try the turkey sandwich! and oooooh, the mahi-mahi tacos!!!!

w93ylKFtrMLJltzoUEJn9Q.text: Loved the Mac and cheese w/ham hocks. Wife had Chicken Noodles which had more chicken than Noodles but still good. This place is better than average for 24 hour service. It was a little pricey, even for Vegas fare. However, the service was decent and it was a good spot to eat and watch a band play in the casino.

hcm5Q6BkD2Gvdfx6y5VNEA.text: Went here late night a few times (after 1pm) service was good food was good. Nachos are so good!  restaurant is clean and usually does not have a wait.

Kw7nqs-0DDiD4EGugSsDhA.text: Went from a good place to eat and relax to a garbage of a place! Management here sucks! worthless, and have no respect for their customers or basic knowledge of their own menu. Never eating here again! SAVE MONEY, TIME, AND A HEADACHE BY JUST GOING TO THE 7-Eleven ACROSS THE STREET!

9mHYqvwEnB3-QuZQYZz5BA.text: Super nice waiter, who actually cared and was not rushy like most people are in Vegas. He was really sweet and kept checking on us to see how we were doing. I had the meatball which was to die for, topped off with rich ricotta and hit the spot at 3am ! Delish ! I also had a few bites of the french dip and it was a tad soggy but packed with flavor. Again, I don't understand why these resorts only stock Pepsi so that would have definitley put the icing on the cake!

5NpdpkTcihoXYSmKDVjVUw.text: Overpriced for.mediocre food. It seems they are more concerned with creating this hipster draw than serving food that warrants the price.    The servers try hard but there is a weak link in this chain from kitchen to table

j_DZwxzD4Lkta7G3H7oYAA.text: Citizens Restaurant in Mandalay Bay Hotel is awesome...Raquel that's works behind bar is friendly, easy to talk to, and always has a smile. God bless her and everyone else associated with Citizens!!!

U8tYIbxy3nWiG_LWYujAEQ.text: $4 iced tea. Unflavored.  Food is overpriced for the quality. Not worth wasting your money.  Ordered the turkey burger which had no flavor.

6MWcRq8-F_oUW_7hbumPlQ.text: Let's start on a positive note. It's open 24 hours. The atmosphere can sometimes be fun. But mostly it's loud. The furniture is not comfortable and it's overly crowed. The food isn't the best but if u are hungry at 4 in the morning then it will do.

uroY7_bQrnoXojzAPfRj9Q.text: I'm quickly learning just how overpriced Vegas is.   Typical hotel overpriced X 2= Vegas prices  Anyway, hungry. Want salad. So hungry regular sentences not used and speaking in passive.  Greek salad. Perfect.  $18. At this point don't care.  Take-out was super speedy,  Actually the salad was great and the ingredients were super fresh. Two varieties of tomatoes, tons of lettuce, onions, feta, red peppers, great pita chips. Literally my perfect version of greek salad.  $18...not the perfect price

cWN2swECW34o_wnaOny6DQ.text: Didn't liked my experience.  Waiting time was to long- we got our appetizer about 30 min after we order it. Chicken strips was moist on inside but really hard on the outside. My husband liked his lasagna it was big and testy. I order meatloaf, it Didn't say anywhere in a menu how spicy it's going to be. When I mentioned it to waiter his response was its probably that green peppers chopped inside. I couldn't eat it I got a few bites of it and ate mushed potato. They didn't offer to change my order or to take it off the bill or even give us a discount. Not even sorry u go home hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf, I m very picky about my meatloaf this is very good one , just little over spicy for me.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna look nice taste even better
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moist on the inside but hard on the outside

lYhdFhE9R0pS01FcZN4ThA.text: Citizens Kitchen & Bar is located inside the Mandalay Bay hotel. They offer the typical American fare. The interesting thing about this place that I did not know at first is that they have an actual restaurant and they also have a to-go area where all of the salads and sandwiches are basically pre-made and ready to be sold. I came here twice on my most recent visit and ate once at the restaurant and I also got some food to-go the other time.  When I did eat at the restaurant, the service was great. The host was very nice and so was the server. The manager even stopped by to ask how my meal was going. They definitely take customer service seriously here which is a good thing!  Food: Chicken Cobb Salad- Chicken, cheese, egg, cucumber, tomato and bacon. The salad was pretty good and refreshing. They also give you a choice of what dressing you want, but I stuck with the typical cobb salad dressing which is bleu cheese. $18  Turkey Avocado- Turkey, cheese, sprouts, tomato, lettuce, avocado, lemon aioli on a cranberry walnut bread. A really good sandwich for the most part. It tasted really healthy which is good since I always eat the worst food while I'm in Vegas. $18  French Dip Steak- Thin sliced prime rib, caramelized onions, provolone cheese and au jus. Served with cole slaw and a pickle. This was probably one of the best tasting French dips that I've had. Towards the end it started to be a little on the salty side, but overall I thought it was a delicious sandwich. $19  Typically, I would probably lower it to 3 stars since the prices are pretty high for the amount of food, but it is Vegas and nothing in Vegas is cheap. I've spent over $10 on a lousy piece of pizza before so I'd rather spend $20+ on a delicious sandwich! I would definitely recommend Citizens Kitchen & Bar to anyone that is at the Mandalay Bay and is looking for your typical American food.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French dip was delicious!

WOmqjpfiMz4_RQQRHvyShw.text: If you are at Mandalay bay this is only one of a few places you can get a late nigh meal. The other is an Irish Pub in the mall between Mandalay and the Luxor. Anyway went here twice. It's usually packed even on a week night, but there was a convention in town so that may have added to it. Place is quiet and quaint compared the crazy casino, bar, and rock band stage that is blaring outside. The touchscreen menu outside said they had hamburgers but I guess there grill was broken, kind of disappointing because the burgers are the reason we came in. Anyway I got a plate of a dozen wings, my girl got a plate of wings and I got two beers $70!. I know Vegas is expensive so I guess it is what it is. My girlfriend and I both weren't able to finish our food, maybe because we really didn't want wings or because we weren't that hungry, so I guess one plate would have done for both of us.

eiAgY5ziBG8MaEL5J-WGPA.text: This was among the worst meals I have had, ever. I ordered the fish tacos and they were nearly inedible. Noticed that everyone around me also sent back or complained about their food. Thank you for comping my meal, though, without question. Do not waste your time or money!

Y3YM1SMFqmeCZvIlGtqSpA.text: Ordered the signature Bloody Mary. Huge crab leg, shrimp, and beef jerky. It was a meal in itself. Worth it, even though it's kind of pricey. The creme brulee French toast was excellent as well as the corned beef hash. Service was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g8hv2jN-0WYkRvYVU6TB0g.text: My boyfriend and I went for a late night drink and snack. We ordered nachos and they're so good. Big enough to share among 3 people! The Cadillac Margaritas were good too. Their service is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7mOZ4Y_gDo8KlvPr6hztaQ.text: Overpriced and mediocre- only went because I was staying at Mandalay Bay.  3 stars for the amazing drink I had!! On the Beach  I had fish and chips the batter was so thick that it was still raw under the top fried layer. It was huge though!  I was pleasantly surprised by the free cheesecake with my yelp check in! It was delicious and covered with warm cherries!!!

StG2_OT4bj26Qt7HmkzwnA.text: Your better off ordering room service. Waitress seemed annoyed and didn't want to be working. The late night menu was limited and we decided to order nachos without chicken, hamburger and side order of French fries. We waited almost 45 minutes for our food and never saw our waitress again.   Nachos: chips were too hard and stale, they added chicken we didn't want and not enough cheese!!!   Hamburger with fries: room temperature burger and fries were hot...go figure.   A different waiter, Chris, approached our table to let us know that our previous waitress had an emergency and he would be taking care of us. Much more attentive and quick.   Not returning. Mandalay needs to get a better late night cafe/restaurant or have more options.

ENTlv2NDuKH4vI41gm_Yyw.text: This is my go-to breakfast place when I'm at the Mandalay Bay each year for a conference that my company exhibits at. I like Citizen's because it's quick and casual, and the food is good.   I had a great waiter this past week. He was attentive, cheerful, and remembered me after the first day.   Mostly I grab breakfasts here, but they have some great sandwiches that you can have made up and take to the room. I am pretty sure that ordering a half-sandwich is an option. And the salted caramel pudding cup is a favorite indulgence of mine after a long day in the exhibit hall.

zhctYSKOf-kgOxREWBsZfA.text: Went here with few of the Santana band members after their Santana show over a month ago and we all ordered chicken noodle soup, I have to say it was really good and I think its the best chicken noodle soup I have had in a long time.  Our waiter was very attentive to our needs  as well.

Np_3-pRYvKNDw-1m5HnvWA.text: We were totally hungry and wanted to grub before leaving Sin City. One of the homies recommended this place plus it was located in the hotel we stayed at.   It was a cute spot. Service was not memorable.  My turkey burger was good but meat kinda fell apart. The bf liked his food. But, it was kinda priceyyy!    3.5 stars for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forgot what the bf ordered!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Burger!

v9aXLyE0UEh9YqpsSAO-yQ.text: This was a great place to eat although it was inside a casino. The food was delicious, the prices were high, but the cocktails were good. Service was excellent. I had a great breakfast as well as a nice bar menu.

AO41d65yWYlQTEhCbM4BwA.text: The only reason we came here is because they are open 24 hours and it's late. We could have ordered Mandalay's room service but figured this would be quicker and cheaper. False on both counts. A sandwich, 2 salads, a soup, and a side of mashed potatoes (no drinks) was almost $80. After 33 minutes our extremely simple to-go order is still not ready and there are at least 4 workers behind the counter that I can see, possibly more in the back. Our friends went to the food court and already ate their food and came back to see why we're still here. Not convenient at all and the food I can see in the glass case at the counter looks exactly like your standard, overpriced airport to-go food in plastic boxes. Not holding out hope that anything we ordered is going to taste better than average. Not ever coming back here. Spend your vacation dollars elsewhere.

KPJbxQYhUwSU9TC03Kf5Pw.text: I thought it was a little pricey but then I saw the portions. They were very generous. I had the chicken club it was so good and I was full with just half of the sandwich. I didn't even eat my fries. They had good children options as well. My daughters burger from the kids menu was humongous!

YgZAu7Ms7DPIo5d6Uj7hHQ.text: The worst service. Other people that came after us got their food even though they ordered after us. This place is horrible. I do not recommend coming here. We have been waiting over 40 minutes. This is ridiculous.

TsdUBHM_1a11a4Ks8x5law.text: My husband and I were staying at the Mandalay Bay & went to eat here twice. both times in the late evening. The first visit I had best chicken quesadilla ever. It wasn't greesy & tasted fresh. The service was good too. The second stop here we had the dip, tuna melt & a burger. All tasted great!  The hostess, our server Junior & the bartender were amazing & provided such great service!   I'd definitely go here again when in town.

zMeoXz_LnaV7xuD52MjxmA.text: Just flew in from Birmingham, and boy are my arms tired.  I was so hungry it felt like my stomach was eating away at my spine. So I went straight to Citizens before check-in at the hotel. I sat at the bar and enjoyed the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and a cold Bud Light. The sandwich was big, and it hit the spot. The Buffalo sauce was tangy and it was neutralized nicely by the ranch dressing. The chicken breast was thin and fried just right. The side of fries was on point. They were hot and crispy.

xu6sRpS7F4YTNoCG4QlAEA.text: Went to Citizens for Brunch... Good Food and Service but a Bit Pricey. Good Sized Portions. I enjoyed my French Toast and Coffee. Overall I was pleased

vlcCF26JtEsWorXFeRHc1A.text: The food was good, the service was good, but it is grossly overpriced. $40 for one order of French toast and one order of eggs and bacon is a bit silly.

CN8rhznhjpiaNMasXUH3sw.text: Visited both in the evening and in the morning. I love that they make fresh juices here. Well that is where the love ends. Slower than molasses running up hill and would it kill the staff to smile? I did not see one person working there who appeared to be happy they where employed. Such a promising place but dreadful.

Og5yMN5CofM9dJtpMiroZQ.text: Even a hungry drunk person couldn't save this place. Seriously I am hungry and I am drunk but this place blows. I hate wasting food but I really don't want to take this burger home.

lzPImPeKxXStmQBn46pSNw.text: As good as it gets as far as comfort food goes! Love the meatball grinder. Can even grab a coffee here, lattes are great! Def a must!

Md0SkjrysA--wjMAs6JZ8Q.text: O my goodness gratuitous I am and was incredibly disappointed by the way this place is managed and run. Never have I had such terrible service but what makes it worst is that it was from multiple people (including the manager) WOW!! Only reason this place has 2 stars and not 1 is becasue it is located in a cool hotel. No way no how will not ever stop by at this place again. Incredibly rude and unhelpful people. I was appalled at the way the manager or supervisor lady we spoke to runs this place. We walked by on the weekend of my birthday before heading back to LA around 11:30am on a Sunday and was told by the hostess that they were currently not seating anyone and to check back in about 20 minutes. We tried to ask if we can just sit at a table and have a drink but again she was persistant with more or less the same answer but in a much more rude way.  So we took a walk around Mandalay for a bit then upon our return around 12 we were told the same thing. At this point we were a bit frustrated and mad so we asked to speak to their manager. The lady came out and explained to us that they were changing cooks so could not seat anyone. But not only that in a very rude and snarky type of way, almost as if speaking and explainng was painful. We just wanted to sit out by the patio area and have a few drinks and people watch. But apperantly thats way to much to ask for these people. We finally ended up getting a table after somewhat of a heated confrontation from the bitter clueless manager. We had a few drinks and bought a few bread items/pastries from inside but could definitely feel the unpleasent welcome. How difficult is it to say sorry the kitchen is currently closed but if you wish to sit outside and enjoy some drinks go ahead. I mean geez it is freaking VEGAS how can you deny people drinks, she was very clear and did not want to let us sit in the patio table area she said we could sit at the bar but I guess customer service and making money is not exactly their first priority here... If I were the owner or person in charge I would seriously think about training the employees better.
