I know the hostess was just following directions but one would expect a person such as the female manager/supervisor to be a bit more competent with customer service as apposed to chasing money away. Will definitley tell everyone I know that is going to Vegas (specificly Mandalay Bay) to avoid this place like the plague.

DRiwCSHyBDuH0yWwXFO16w.text: Horrible customer service. We ordered two sandwiches and two types of dip. We were told the dips were going to take a while and would be brought to us. We sat down and were asked to move 10 min later because they needed to clean the area we were seated in. So we moved, no problem. About 10 min. later we asked to move again, for the same reason. All while we're still waiting for our dips. We then asked us where our dips were... they then brought them to us in to-go bags?????? Absolutely rude!

LHUzvHWtbKND4oCEkzwGRQ.text: We went there for breakfast when we were at the Mandalay Bay on March 1st.  Tim was our waiter.  We were seated fairly quickly by a nice hostess.  The waiter was not the most friendly person, but was polite.  We placed our order, pancakes and eggs for my hubby and I got a Denver Omlette both with hash-browns and we split a side of bacon.  Tim comes by twice in the next 30 minutes to apologize for the order taking so long.  When it finally comes out, everything is cold. I'm diabetic and my blood sugar is so low that I HAVE to eat.  So, we ate it.  I don't mean it wasn't hot.  I mean the little balls of butter wouldn't melt on anything.  Not my hubby's pancakes, not my toast, not the hash-browns!  Also, know how I am when I was hungry so I didn't say anything, not that I was even asked how things were. Tim ignored us until he brought the check.  So, I waited two weeks to post this, cuz when I think about it I'm still mad.  Go ANYWHERE else!!

bR43ELowSr3z91Ysjt804g.text: What a great place for breakfast! I had the egg & potato skillet, which was tasty & nicely presented (in a skillet of course). There was no wait & the food came out in a reasonable time. The cappuccino was good, but had a burnt chocolate taste towards the end. The to-go line was long, but looks like it's a popular place among visitors.

sQNvacKwpsEP0qFbSNoRYA.text: Love this restaurant located in Mandalay bay casino next to light night club They are open until late food is great and fresh like there chicken Cobb salad And wing  and service you get I will recommend to everyone.

ReeYMQ-KTjr3vmEPjgzv3A.text: Great food option anytime, but especially late night after coming out of Light nightclub as they're open 24hrs. Burgers are big and tasty. Chili fries with Kobe were awesome. I've had breakfast there too and it's always quality. Great spot for a good meal anytime.

jL1U5oFIvGeo-2Gnhb9qIw.text: The best breakfast in Las Vegas! Especially since I refuse to go to any of the buffets. The service was prompt and our waiter was great.

fAydyz5l5YBtnmHos8rJng.text: The absolute worse breakfast I've ever been served. Greasy hash browns, gross pancakes that tasted like they forgot to mix the bisquick batter and the most bitter cup of coffee I've ever had. All for the low price of $25, what a joke. Also I could not get the waitresses attention and she didn't come back to my table for 20 minutes. When I told her I almost did a spit take when I tasted the coffee. She took the cup and came back 10 minutes later with the same bitter brew. If you want bad food and bad service this is the place for you. I can't believe food this awful would be allowed in Mandalay Bay. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!

fovTvuEQiJ0LVM4WheTZPA.text: We had to wait 30 min before the food came out, and the waitress was a stoic bitch. The food was just mediocre and over priced.

U4wH0AzzOa_I38eVIC2BXQ.text: After a long day, I wanted something quick and delicious. I chose to try Citizens and had their Reuben (no kraut) and fries.  This was probably some of the best corned beef I've had in quite some time and it certainly hit the spot.  Good food with great service.  A hit with me for something quick and simple but yet tasty.

Vx9Th1tHgfZpiQCDChMTjA.text: Good, large portions of food. Ate here twice, since it's the only 24 hour restaurant open in the Mandalay. Service is a bit slow, not enough servers both times we ate here, and had to send back our food twice. Hamburgers were extremely undercooked, RAW, not medium well, and fries were just overly salted. My turkey Reuben and slaw were pretty good, as were the Mahi Mahi fish tacos.

VmKqWNaTHNKnQpIxRa72UQ.text: I don't get to Vegas often, but since most of the times have been at MB I was looking for something good and not too expensive.  Without question, Citizens has been my "go-to" place for consistently delicious food and stellar service.  I've been to Citizens several times, both in their dining room as well as the bar.  My absolute favorite has become the bar, primarily due to the gracious bartender Raquel.  She always warmly welcomes me with an infectious smile, caring attitude, and never-ending perfect recommendations.  The food is delicious, and Raquel is the "icing on the cake"!

NGW_Glrpi5PJynFF0bA2HQ.text: Amazing food and great service if you get an awesome waiter. My first morning we had the best service ever. The waiter was spot on, the food amazing. The next morning the waiter chose to not listen and didn't communicate to the chef what my travel partner wanted. He asked specifically for Banana pancakes that were on the menu. He ended up with regular pancakes with a couple of bananas thrown on top. The manager was spot on and professional and took control of the issue. I was very impressed and will be back. The food is top notch and I highly recommend Citizens for breakfast. It was quite tasty. The overall feel of the restaurant is spot on.

MKjGl--zfryjR3x3SSrbog.text: Only place to eat after 2am at Mandalay or Luxor except McDonald's. The food is decent. Great Chicken Soup for 2am. Appetizers were fairly good. The chili is too spicy with the cheese fries. Service is very slow so don't be in a hurry.

05rELSyenYzLETT5X4cjOQ.text: Came here on business and prioritize exceptional customer service in my daily life. I went to The Citizen 3 times for sit down service (twice for breakfast and once for lunch) as well as twice for take out. Yes their food is excellent but Robert was our server the three times we had meals. He made the entire experience here absolutely wonderful. He took my daughters special diet needs seriously and had an impressive memory for details. He was a pleasure to watch his interactions with other guests and  is truly authentic in his demeanor. He is a True gem and will ensure every detail is exceeded. I hope he gets to read this and knows how appreciated he is and that what he does each day very much matters. Those who value that personal touch with excellent food should request him. Thank you Robert!!!!!!

Df5jnJZSD8NXea5eoSt20A.text: I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a conference and tried many of the restaurants there. Citizens was one of the better ones. Firstly, the food is very good. The cob salad is perfect. I liked their clean fresh decor.   The service was mixed. Depending of who's working there, you may or may not have a good experience. I often walked by to see if I Katie was working at the bar. If she was, I'd definitely walk in for a meal. You need more like her Citizens.

4u4aIWEVMDe6b2zLGL1BQA.text: This place is awesome! The juice bar is my favorite thing. I had the South Beach. I also had the turkey burger which was very yummy. My friend had the fish tacos.  Went back for the Cobb salad for dinner. This is a must try.

gSo0Ep8yQyDG9FX3Cnet_w.text: This Gets 4 stars, for 1 reason, OPEN 24 HRS. And its really good food. (Recommend the Bacon Burger and NY style pastrami)

9-3kep7mqNjSrMGAw2A5Qg.text: The important thing is they have breakfast food 24/7. It's an alternative to riding to Denny's 20 miles away. The other alternative to this place within a similar distance is Raffles... With a crazy hangover, though, guess where we didn't end up. Solid breakfast food and fast service is the solution to any Vegas ailment except maybe losing your dignity to a stripper. Also, coffee. Lots of coffee is the answer. The question? I forgot.

M2otOBf10n0-_aDjwIehyw.text: Staying at Mandalay Bay, we ate breakfast here several times, and the breakfast was always solid. The lattes were good, regular coffee was also tasty, and you get a lot of food for the price.   The downside was the service - we never really had a good server the whole time we were there. I'm not sure why the middle-of-the-road restaurants in Vegas seem to have such lack-luster staff - you'd think that people would be lining up for those jobs, but we seem to only get good servers in the super-high-end places.   Anyway, Citizens is worth the money for breakfast - and if you can share a plate, even better.

8mqE049D8pcvnbBQ_hcQcg.text: The coffee is here is terrible. They don't know how to make it. I asked for a macchiato with soy milk and they told me "There's no milk, it's just foam." Um, so what is the foam made out of? And then I got a mocha the next day and there was no coffee in it. So I paid $7 for a hot chocolate.

eYKFlmCgI3vVEuuESWxmKg.text: This restaurant is so Vegas. What do I mean by that? I mean this place embodies the whole high/low theme that is Vegas. This place is set up like a diner but the menu items have high-end prices. Any entree cost anywhere from between $40-$60. It's located conveniently next to the club Light so you go at 4AM you will see a lot of drunk, post-clubbers (like me).   I ordered a filet mignon and fries which was around $58 (another high/low thing). The steak fries were delicious! Nothing better than some comfort food after drinking! The filet mignon was very tender and juicy too, but for some reason I filled up on the fries. I found it a bit hilarious that the filet mignon came with fries instead of mashed potatoes or creamed corn like traditional steakhouses, but, hey, that's Vegas for ya.   Overall the environment of the restaurant was not that memorable, but the food was pretty decent. I did find it rather funny that this place looked so casual but the menu items would be something that an upscale (okay, at least business casual) restaurant would serve. I would probably end up here again if I went to Light, but not something I would go out of my way for. Plus, it's also rather pricey considering what you get, but that's Vegas *shrugs*.  The service was pretty good too. I don't have any memorable stories, but my other friends actually came here as well and saw me eating with someone and told the waitress that they were going to leave because they saw someone they knew. The waitress replied, "Don't worry, I'll hide you."  That's top notch service right there!  Yelp should really do half stars. I would give this place 3.5 stars but I rounded down to 3 because I was less than impressed with the decor.

zPKcjNZWD9wt95cBHbgYug.text: Well.. Vegas came n went.  No response from this management group who "reached out" but didn't follow through.  this management group is horrible and the service reflects poor management.  Lip service is all you really get.  I will NEVER eat at this place again.  Do not make the mistake I did by giving this place a chance.

UHndJ0H1_JGJPC0MDL_NZw.text: Love Citizens. It's a reasonably priced place to eat at Mandalay Bay if you just want food and aren't looking for a particular vibe. Good food and decent service. Worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uBXPG8g8QKsDfynCHYkBww.text: We came here as the only late night option that was available in the hotel, and we were very happy. The food was good, and we had wonderful service. Our waiter Steven was very attentive and offered honest suggestions about the menu and drinks.  I had the kale and brown rice salad and added salmon and my boyfriend had the rueben. My drink was peach iced tea with whiskey and it was excellent.   One note we went into the restaurant and not just the counter.

OvsP1cWoyTRh193KIOstUQ.text: We ate here and we all loved the food. This isn't gourmet dining more like a higher end coffee shop in my opinion but with more selection of booze. I found the prices to be reasonable for a Vegas restaurant, people can't expect to eat at Denny's prices in Vegas in a higher end hotel. Even Starbucks charges double the price in the hotel. We ordered the chicken sandwich (excellent and fresh), Caesars salad (just enough dressing),  chicken fingers, buffalo wings, and nachos( it was a huge platter). All the portions were huge and was just yummy, if your kids aren't big eaters they could easily share a platter. I recommended this place to a friend and they loved it also. Our server was Lerani and she was so nice and just a great server, I would ask for her if I was to go back. This for sure will be a place for us to eat at when we stay at the Mandalay or Delano.

opkxw3FtCfoTt8orBRl8Gg.text: We just came out of LIGHT club and wanted some late night grub. This was delicious!!! We ordered the French dip and lobster roll with potato salad and coleslaw. The coleslaw was great, and I'm sure the potato salad would be to someone else (big cut pieces of potato), but I love my mother-in-laws the best. This was a breath of fresh air from the food at LVH hotel. Bill was $45 we ordered waters ;) they need to work on better service though, it took mustache forever.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Dip
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

NQDjbH2FsIkmK3aU7biEFg.text: For the food, I would've of given them 3 stars. I had the tuna salad sandwich. But the service is horrible. I was sitting inside with my daughter because I had just ordered my sandwich and she was eating her donut. I was drinking my hot chocolate. The gentlemen who called my name to give me my order decided to approach me & tell me to get my daughter and sit outside!! Because I wasn't dining in. Very unprofessional and douche bag! Just because I wasn't dining in, didn't give him a right to treat me that way! Never again am I even stepping into that place!!!!

W-Bc11jGJkpYMcS0NOGhXw.text: I was staying at the Mandalay Bay for a conference so I came here quite a few times during the week. It was one of the closest food spots next to the conference rooms. It also was one of the few full menu places in Mandalay that stayed open late. Surprisingly most of the food spots shut down at around midnight.   Citizens was a bit of a hit and miss. Two of the four times I came it was great. The other two were just ok. I liked that they had 3 sections (bar, restaurant and counter). The counter was a quick line that basically had sandwich, salad, coffee and other quick items available for immediate purchase. This was convenient for conference breaks as I was able to just run over, grab some pre-made foods and coffee before heading back. The restaurant and bar were nice for late night dinners. We came here twice to eat at the restaurant portion. The food was ok. The only thing I ordered here that I hated was the mixed green salad. The leaves were very bitter and the dressing was sub-par. Most of the other dishes we ordered were good, but nothing stood out as extraordinary.   Everything here was overpriced. As I mentioned it's a convenient spot and it's open late so they're able to get away with the prices... But don't expect the quality to match the price.  The service was on and off. We had one server who was great. The barista and employees behind the counter were also good. But we also had a server who was terrible. But overall it had decent service.    The number one thing this place has going for them is the convenience of location and hours.

7GFHWqiFGHlO7udANthj-Q.text: They stop serving breakfast at 11am. The turkey avocado sandwich was super good. Chili cheese waffle fries not so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey avocado with pasta salad. In the back is the waffle chili cheese fries (not worth it).

11ENdjDbW6gC0QN0sMuklw.text: I must say I have been to every major hotel in Las Vegas and you probably know how hard it is to get the best food so efficiently sometimes. I'm here at the JC K jewelry show and I must eat quick and I must eat good and healthy and with a lot of taste yes that's what I like and I have happen to find that for my morning take in my lunch and also dinner if I'm not going to fancy restaurant here at the citizens the service is fast the food is delicious and extremely well prepared from the Apple cinnamon muffin which is my favorite to the kale salad which has an anonymous amount of taste try it you'll be addicted.

hw1ecSJRZOglWcLLUpE1vg.text: Service was average. We went for breakfast and split an omelette. I thought the food was fine although definitely overpriced..even for Vegas.

EVLwbqI36h3jPheHndK_UA.text: I'll give it 3.5 stars, but I only got food to go. I found out its the only 24 hour place in Mandalay which is nice. Their take out menu is much cheaper than dining in.   I asked what salad they recommend and they told me the Cobb so I got it. I was hoping it was the same size as the display in the counter but it wasn't. $11 for a salad is high, but it's Vegas. The salad wasn't bad.

tcumYIV0BAXFgifaHo_9Sg.text: Only ordered at this place from the walk up counter for breakfast and lunches. In a sea of super expensive mediocre spots, I found Citizens to be a good place for a sammy and salad. Was the the food pricey for what it was? This is The Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas, so yes and yes.  I gave it 5 stars though because of all of the restaurants in the hotel, this seems to be the only one that deserves to have a line.

v1NZSyh2BboAVeljUKEnyg.text: The bartender Raquel was very personable and was so knowledgeable with the menu. I was here for a convention and she definitely made my experience memorable. I will be back.

9EvXSlOs9T2z5koj9wNTLA.text: This is basically a counter style food place.  Everything is fairly fresh but all pre-packaged. The coffee selections are oddly named but the coffee is decent.  My son did not like the tuna salad at all but scarfed down an apple cinnamon muffin easily enough. My Cobb salad was chintzy with the good stuff and used iceberg lettuce, ack.   It filled the need but barely.

T6zNY7fsCjr8gY6d4twZ6Q.text: Oliver is the best waiter.   Haven't had much luck at other locations so it's nice to finally have a friendly and prompt waiter.

wYlBP8utBNMW8An2KOXEBQ.text: Just finished eating naked chicken wings and Caesar salad and it was delicious! Junior was our server and he is amazing! Not sure if he remembers us from a time in the past but he is awesome. I love coming here for the late night snacks and good staff makes the experience even better!

HI4SVvJ9VwJI3YYradDIhA.text: This place is a joke. They basically force you to eat here late night out of lack of options. We called ahead to place a late night to go order and waited the 25-30 minutes that we were told, when we got down to pick up the order, we were told that they couldn't make a quesadilla because the menu changed a few minutes prior. First, I thought this was absolutely ridiculous to not be able to make a quesadilla and secondly I felt they should have called to inform us before we waited and walked down, because after 30 minutes we had to reorder and wait again. The man appearing to be the manager didn't speak to us at all and appeared very unfriendly to the guests and not helpful to the 2 young girls working behind the counter. The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the chocolate cake was phenomenal but the pizza was discussing and the service is a joke.

EoUYb32FQrACUxZIBcuztA.text: Citizens Mimosa is the best! I ate breakfast here twice this week. Breakfast burrito is delicious and today I had the corned beef hash skillet. My husband had the Eggs Benedict. Service is just as good. Love love love the Mimosa.

M7vkBqyCBJWJnNkhx4rBIw.text: This could have easily been a 3 Star review if the manager came to apologize. My husbands espresso was literally cold, my daughters pancakes raw, my over medium eggs were sooooo overcooked. They gave us 7.80 off the bill, should have been more. For being in the Mandalay Bay, they should step-up their game. If I ever come here again and the service improves, I'll update my review.

tlt8b2yU8cOG_QzHiSo8Vg.text: We eat at Mandalay Bay occasionally, when we get enough poker comps to enjoy a nice lunch  We were there with our 9 month old so we opted to sit outside of the main dining room on the "patio." The hostesses were very sweet, one even came over to meet our little guy. Our server Deon was great, very personable. When the food & beverages arrived he even made sure they were far enough from the baby so he couldn't grab. We had the lasagna, french dip, cheesecake and I enjoyed a blueberry spritz - all were delicious. It was a very nice experience and I'm happy to give them 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Spritz ... One of the most refreshing drinks I&#39;ve had!
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake ... I asked for chocolate sauce instead of the cherry.

myQLg4daX-Gox-oQyYdstw.text: Omggggg love this place!!! The food was really good and drinks!! Bartender Erick was so sweet and gave us amazing service!! Would definitely come back again :)

0r5O6sies2v56vddfT8TAA.text: The Ruben was to die for. The ultimate Bloody Mary was decadent and came with a crab leg!

nDYYu41uaCyzuGOHm10zlw.text: Late night Christmas eats in Vegas! Citizens is the only place open beyond 10pm tonight. But...mmm...this is still a great choice.  I had the fried calamari, French onion soup, Caesar salad, and steak frites -- to go. It was packed perfectly for me to take back to my room.  The calamari was tasty and lightly beaded. It was great even without the two sauces it comes with - cocktail and Thai chili. The salad was crisp and as fresh as you'd expect with a couple of large croutons. The French onion soup was savory with shredded onions and a layer of gooey cheese. No croutons in the soup and it was on the slightly sweeter side. The steak itself was good. I ordered it medium and it was a full 16oz steak. The fruit bowl was a nice way to finish it all off.  Service was fast but the wait for the food was over 20 minutes. *sigh* Pricey too but what else are you going to eat at this hour on Christmas day?

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit bowl
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak frites

8VmeKIcuHsDBtsutkkYhUA.text: Just a meh.  chicken avocado BLT who is you're so so late night snack you'll be okay nothing spectacular just made me a chocolate milk which is badly needed

2nzvt93Yc3hwWd0Tqdn3SA.text: Poor service. Waited nearly 30 minutes for drinks, restaurant is not even full. Food came out cold. Some food over cooked, bland.

iQwDHGLD6vSJB-W0oDDRIA.text: Located inside Mandalay, I was in search of a good breakfast. This place was ayyyy-ok, but not the greatest. I ordered the corn beef hash skillet and was a little disappointed on how salty and greasy it tasted. I know, it was corn beef hash, but I was hoping for a little more pizzaz. The coffee though was really good. I am happy I did not stand in the long Starbucks line in the morning. Next time, I am not sure if I will visit this place again since it was not that memorable.

3U4r3al1TZwipjQkfMGhTQ.text: How do you say S     L     O    W ???????/? Waited 12 minutes for a scoop of ice cream that was premade. No one on one side of the restaurant. Other side had 7 tables.

hPwgiMnuWFHkSTVM0ZKZXA.text: Service was really slow and disinterested. My medium poached eggs came out hard as a rock. We had much better breakfasts at Bellagio and Wynn. Not a fan.

4AB6nzqEWaDQ1Db7eSLuxw.text: The worst, pizza is great if you are missing all your teeth.  Best thing about this place is that they are open 24 hrs, didn't have any dessert. I wish I did because I'm sure you can mess up Rice Krispies as bad as those "honey mustard wings" they were soggy as hell. Spent 60 dollars on wings, a pizza and a tuna salad sandwich. Over priced and overrated. 3 Stars is too kind. I had to take 5 Imodium to keep from losing my colon once I got back to my room. Should have stopped at Sonic on the way back to the hotel instead. Would have been a better value and a better meal. They're tater tots are gourmet compared to this slop. Blech, don't do this to your stomach after all you only have one!

u-Yr026wEqn9kELQeWUDKg.text: Came here with my husband. I ordered the appetizer articoke spinach dip. The spaghetti Bolognese was way too spicy I had to return it. Since it was passed 10pm their menu reduced to small options of what to get. I chose the lasagna it was ok. My husband ordered mash potatoes and gravy and the half chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and mash
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too spicy spaghetti Bolognese.

NuuWVTtuLad7tZ12Z1KHGQ.text: Nick was an amazing server ! He had so many tables but was very thorough and sweet. Thank you!

588MKYvCQcW7iMRGgwRLVQ.text: This review is for the chocolate cake they have at the cafe counter only, I have not eaten anything else there.  But I've come multiple times just to get a piece of this cake!!  It is giant and so moist and delicious, the best cake in town that I've found.  Is it weird that I drive all the way to Mandalay Bay just to get a piece of cake?  Perhaps.

hUBohXCRiZVBcff6sTWkuA.text: I stopped in Sunday morning before leaving Mandalay Bay. The food was good- I decided on the creme brulee French toast ($16), and a classic mimosa($13)... however, the staff wasn't very friendly/attentive. I think the waitress spoke to me once the hour I was there- and that was to take my initial order. I would definitely try it again, but I think the next time- I would opt for the to-go service.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citizen&#39;s Mimosa
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brûlée French toast

3zntiQSE7peO099a1PHRvg.text: It was horrible my French onion soup was salty it was like the chef poured a whole bottle of salt the service was horrible the womens attidatide was horrible.......SO I RECOMEND NOT GOING HERE!!  Later for breakfast we came back are eggs were under cooked and so was the pancakesanf also the bacon was burnt

2Ar1kfbMvC3a2WqVk-Uhkg.text: Love the location inside the Mandalay Bay. They have inside and outside seating, we chose the outside (still in the hotel) and ordered breakfast. Their food is really tasty and made with quality. Our server was very sweet and I can see why people chose to dine here. Will definitely be coming again the next time I'm staying at this hotel.

Pipi5MMAY3aTK4xjJ_bNNQ.text: Great Reuben and fries!  And Ejay at the bar was awesome.  We were in a rush to grab food before our flight and EJay made sure we got taken care of and even ran into the kitchen 10s after we ordered to put a rush on it.  Food was excellent and service was great!

rzLmKaVw_WTC-0-olvLbAg.text: Tried to get the prime rib special but was sold out, waitress told me it's cool to pick something else was unsure about the gumbo so asked to see a menu to choose. Waitress orders me gumbo without confirming brings it out and it's horrible 90% salt not much seasoning in tomato paste three pieces of tiny freezer shrimp. Crab leg only thing decent, was forced to pay for crappy gumbo I never ordered thanks.

nIk0LUyOcdBSwv_qnxdvtw.text: I had high hopes for Citizens because I liked the concept - a grab-and-go counter and espresso bar along with a 230-seat casual dining room split between two sections. A full service bar is open to the dining area and offers a huge selection of beers. Decor is a bit industrial with touches of muted metals, antique mirrors, weave pattern tiled floors and banquettes with leather seats and straps. It's loud and fun with a cool hip vibe, and service is casual. Open 24 hours 7 days a week, the menu is classic American fare meets local diner style favorites (breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night staples are offered). We started with the Artichoke Dip - very good except the chips were a mix of tortilla and pita. The pita chips were way too thick. For dinner we all ordered something different - Toasted Reuben (yum) comes with fries, macaroni salad or coleslaw; Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos (3 pcs); Brick Chicken (half chicken, garlic mash, broccoli) and Spaghetti Bolognese. Portion sizes are smaller than what you would expect for the price you pay, but then again, this is at the Mandalay Bay so I guess they can charge $25 for spaghetti and $24 for 3 tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke Dip with tortilla and pita chips
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full service bar
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of 2 dining rooms

OvuuCmJRfMD1h348PM-8fw.text: As someone who is super hungry and all the restaurants are closed, I'm super happy that this place is open 24 hours. Plus, they got the most delicious and decked out Bloody Mary called the Ultimate Mary.  Unfortunately, their computers are down and we've been waiting 30 minutes for our food. My date looks like he's about to kill someone out of hangriness. The food is delicious but the wait delayed our long drive back home to SoCal.

tuXLvWggVi4mQSaH4T4Fcw.text: Overall, the experience at Citizens was pleasant and had a fun atmosphere with great food.  Unfortunately, our waiter (also was the bar person) was what prevented me from providing a 5 star review.  Food, which I had a chicken Caesar salad and pretzel bites, came in great portions and had a great quality to it.  Salad had a perfect amount of dressing too I must add.  My friend had the nachos and we would never have guessed they would be a mountain of nachos.  Leftovers were taken home.  Our waiter who was the bar person did move with urgency, but after we had ordered, his attention seemed to grow less patient with us and he engaged with us much less than everyone else around us. This was most noticeable when asking to box up the leftovers. He made a comment to boxing the nachos that seemed to imply he didn't want to waste his time if we were not going to take it home.  His facial expression and tone made it seem like we were going to waste his time by asking to box the nachos.  Even the gentleman sitting next to us caught wind of it and was slightly put off by the remark.  Do not get me wrong, this bartender was incredibly nice and respectful everywhere else, it was just this interaction that really left a lasting impression.  Perhaps next time I'll just stick to the regular dining experience with the waiters and waitresses.

j9BnTSMNeDk7wkFYW7kpEA.text: Their prime rib "medium" is super rare. Chicken tenders made my niece and me super sick.

cflaTdqWDj_weDbL9fJK1A.text: After a SUPER FUN Friday night out in Vegas, we needed some breakfast to kickstart our Saturday.  I suggested Citizens Kitchen and Bar to my husband as I thought the menu looked yummy.  I was not wrong!  The food is SO GOOD!  My husband ordered an omelette with breakfast potatoes, and I had a breakfast burrito kind of thing that was served with chips.  Everything was brought out to us super fast and piping hot.  And the service was A+.  We had questions on the menu and our server gave us his excellent opinion on choices.  Can't wait to try more stuff on the menu!

t9Q3oR2XUEAQheGlZNp2fQ.text: Burger was dry...Along with my server Jason's attitude.   Walk in on a second occasion, the women taking orders says " I'll get to her When I get to her"  Nobody wants to go on vacation to deal with people's nasty attitudes.

8RcglqjszBFJfrzNmn2f8w.text: Very Rude Staff !!!!! We here with guest from out town because was town was great place to go. Order a "Dirty Shirley" which Bartender didn't know how make . Staff  standing by register talking about the table. Which we could clearly see . Manager then came out and instead of stop by table to check see everything was ok , she also started to talk about us with her staff. At one point the waiter was asked for hot sauce and while turning away from table with attitude hit my husband in head with his elbow and had seemed very unapologetic when told that he had did so , I then grew very angry and ask for bill which manager came over denied all actions about her and her staff but seemed to not care either way. We  paid our bill and left but I'm over shocked by rudeness of staff and wouldn't recommend this place.

3LI-jULWRPlLP7UTVKjWyA.text: I came here because it is open 24/7. It was only late night menu being served at 4:00 am.   Spinach & artichoke dip- $16: extremely bland and devoid of taste, only ate 1/3 of it.   Cheeseburger- $20: please see the picture I posted. More lettuce than hamburger. Bun was over-toasted and hard. Burger patty was once again very bland. I had to ask for mayo to just give it some taste.  Only positive was the french fries, which were   Service- hostess was very friendly, server was average for a late-night diner sort of place, however he brought me the wrong bill. I was one of only 3 tables currently occupied.   Summary: Hands down worst food I've had in a while. I have never given a 1-star rating before,. In fact, I would happily go to a Denny's everyday of the week over here, and also for half the price. $38.97 pre-tip, even on the strip was a complete waste for the quality of food.   I sincerely hope the F&B department @ Mandalay Bay takes time to read these reviews. Honestly, just a little effort would go a long way at this establishment. Just because this is a 24/7 eatery, does not mean that everyone who eats here late at night is intoxicated and would scarf down whatever is put in front of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More lettuce than beef!

5BCQWguQO9kDansIS0ol4Q.text: I should have known better, when a colleague had told me the day prior that he had ordered the worst tuna melt ever from this place.  BUT, it was late and I needed a snack and this was open.  At the late hour, they have a limited menu. Asked the clerk what was best on the menu. She recommended the French Dip. She warned me it could take a while. I agreed.  Food came out faster than expected (10 minutes). French Dip with au jus and fries. Fries were no good. Ate 2. As for the sandwich, bread was too hard. I ended up picking out the meat with a fork.  Disappointing late night snack and pricey too boot.

09Z35PxdjKfzSJfj3iDgpw.text: Oliver gave us excellent service! Exudes happiness. Very nice to our kids who can be a pain.

dmkmuC7dWTNRpjxa_VSdng.text: We ended up here after going to the shark thingie in Mandalay Bay. We were 5 adults and three kids aged between 10 months and 3 years. Food is overpriced and subpar but it was not a surprise. My friend asked if it was possible to get bolognese for her 10 months old. The waitress didn't even blink to tell her "we don't do that". We then asked another waiter for it and then our waitress came out again that she spoke to the chef and he agreed to make a one time exception and prepare a small portion of it but that it will be $7. We didn't care about that - she could have/should have said that from the beginning. Then, after a lifetime the famous order came out and it was super spicy. It was for a 10 month old. We haven't touched it - but of course we were charged and we paid the $7. We took it home and it ended up in the trash.  Overall, I would give 2 stars for the food - nothing special, overpriced, and over cooked, but edible, and 1 for service. There's nothing more annoying than not getting any service when dining.  Would not eat here again.

You may be tempted to eat here because you are drunk and it is open, but don't. Do yourself a favor and save yourself some money and get  Uber eats or grub hub or door dash to deliver you food from literally anywhere else. You will get better food from Denny's. You will get better food from Mcdonalds. Just. Don't. Eat. Here.

X9zqvs1cdB4Ro071CF1w3A.text: Customer service at the take-out counter awful? Check Bad food? check Never again? check  Waited, waited, waited... (it was late and everything else was closed)... finally! assistance!  Me: I'll have the Caprese sandwich Employee (worried look, confers with a manager-type who can't be bothered to look at or talk to me): we can't make that because we're out of arugula. We could make it with lettuce Me: I'll have it with no lettuce Employee: On sourdough or wheat? Me: The menu says it's on ciabatta Employee: we're out of ciabatta Me: okay, I'll have the roast beef sandwich on sourdough. Can you make that warmed up? Employee (bewildered): No, we can't warm sandwiches up. Me: okay, fine It took about five minutes for her to make the sandwich. During that time, several potential customers walked in, waited, and left because their presence was not acknowledged. At least twice, she had to go back to the (presumably) shared kitchen of the take-out counter and sit-down hot food restaurant to find ingredients.  I got the roast beef sandwich, a bag of chips and a water for $23 dollars. It was a cold sandwich on cold bread with cold cheese with overwhelmingly hot horseradish sauce (and I like spice). Just a crappy sandwich. I'm not even asking for a panini press, just microwave that SOB for a minute.  It would not take much effort for this restaurant to make better food and no effort at all to provide better customer service.

7D3ySsGsWUFrcuKmzNdyhA.text: One of my favorites for a slice of cake in Las Vegas.  Portions are huge  Fish tacos are what I had this last visit.  I loved them and wanted to go back on this trip and didn't...  Cheesecake was a great dessert

pWPLTzrJvcHgO8cwsVM9ZQ.text: Went in for a piece of chocolate cake and waited 45 mins to get it! A manager kept walking by us with her nose in the air not giving a shit or even noticing. I couldn't even believe it! Terrible service every single time.

i7lTJwOWdHM8HyNxEExBEw.text: Most of the restaurants in and on the strip come with their hefty price tag for convenience, no doubt! When friends or family come to Vegas and stay in Mandalay Bay we do recommend Citizens!  There's a little bit of something for everyone! From sandwiches to salads, vegetarian to meat-lover, appetizer to entre, it works for everyone!   I love their kale and brown rice salad! You can add salmon or another protein to it (well-done salmon is my spirit animal!) and you're solid! Their artichoke and spinach dip isn't too creamy and packs a perfect punch for small bites everyone can share.   Their wine and craft beer selection is just right along with having cocktails that fit the happy hour vibe.  As with most places on the strip, the service is under par which is my reason for not rating this place higher. Our server wasn't very attentive or friendly this time around but I've had better service in the bar area.

8_7SR5DBt8KR5EnFMSqAPQ.text: Such  bad service experience. Sat down for breakfast, waited for 20 minutes no server to come by. Finally got up told bar we had been sitting and waiting. Server finally comes over takes order. Wait again and just watching... All the other servers are hustling around working their tables, ours was in her own slow world working the pace of someone who should be in  slow hotel gift shop not a busy restaurant. Another server finally brings our food which was warm, not hot, because it probably had been sitting on the counter. We had to tell another manager our food was cold now and she apologized. I've eaten here a few times, but will probably pick other places in the future.

Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white omlette served warm. Potatoes warm.

pjxQRsKU02N8asVZ6Gm9yg.text: We visit Vegas a couple of times a year and we always stay at Mandalay or Delano.   Love that Citizen's is a 24-hour eatery; makes it convenient. They also change their menu after 10pm to the late night menu.  We shared their Turkey sandwich.  They serve it to you on 2 different cutting boards with full portions of fries and coleslaw.  They did the same thing for the full rack of ribs we ordered on a separate visit!  The food is tasty, generously portioned and the wait staff are all friendly and attentive.

Waitress was sweet was about $62 including tip for two sandwiches bud light and a coffee! Nice place to get a quick meal before a show! Lost a star because they have Pepsi and not Coke cmon who drinks that!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VpEX925nm2wSrxmLjKLAiw.text: I visit Mandalay and Venetian convention center for week long business conferences and trade shows through out the year. This is one of the more reasonable places to eat inside the Mandalay Bay casino located near the convention center entrance.  We found ourselves coming back to this restaurant during a 5 day conference. The menu is so varied, and we were never disappointed in the quality of the food, whether breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The portions are huge so consider sharing. The kale salad with fresh egg whites and avocado was wonderful. Same for the pancakes for breakfast. They also offer large range of burgers, sandwiches, salads and breakfast 24/7.    They have a take- out counter with some popular items if you are in a hurry. Expect a wait, especially when the hotel hosts large conferences.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citizens deli and bar menu. This place is open 24/7.

BnEFd2kaUuTeGSNKi3GKWA.text: Okay, so it's midnight, you just got out of the Michael Jackson One show, you are hungry and don't want to drive and lose all that money you spent at the Mandalay Bay Valet Parking. Your selections are slim for food. Alcoholic beverage are what most places offer at this time with alcohol snacks. But wait, the Citizens Kitchen and Bar is open.   There are two parts to this restaurant. There is a "to go" side where you sit on bar stools to wait for your order and there is a "sit in" restaurant side, which is what my wife and I picked.   Our waitress Lotus was very friendly and and checked up on us frequently despite being very busy. Although, it was a sit in type of restaurant, the menu was very slim. It was basically a card, no bigger than a greeting card with less 10 options. All sandwiches, hand burgers and breakfast burritos.   My wife ordered the breakfast burritos which came with nacho chips. The chips arrived warm, hinting they were freshly made. The burrito was filling for my starving wife and she could only eat half of it. I ordered the egg and ham croissant. It was good. But it arrived warm cold at best like it was sitting for about 15-20 minutes. The potatoes squares that it came with was cold. It was sitting for at least 30 minutes are more. I couldn't even finish it.   They were pretty busy at the time, I'll give them that. But, it also got them a 3 Star at best. Would I try them again, probably not anytime soon.

P5h_Lognb1rdMXABXcT3gg.text: We went there after the Michael Jackson One show and were blown away by this place. Really nice comfort food. We were late and had to order off the more limited late night menu but there were plenty of options. We ordered burgers, fish tacos, a chicken Caesar salad and a French dip. Every dish was presented well and was delicious, we did a lot of sharing

16Xq8zoIJr36s7sq0_c7Jg.text: This place has decent to-go food prices for Las Vegas strip. However, I would rather pay the inflated prices at Starbucks for better customer service and warmed pastries.  Management should ask how the cashier is doing (morning shift of 7/7) because her harsh demeanor is off putting.  Not everyone is fit to be in the hospitality industry regardless of wage.  My entire interaction with her was as if I was bothering her.  Usually, I'm able to ignore rude interactions but when I asked her if it's possible to warm up my purchased pastry instead of a simple apology and explanation I receive a sharp aggressive response.    I'm unsure if it's truly a policy thing or if she did not want to do her job.  It's very questionable when there's a toaster oven right behind the counter.

0XyExP1cwMh9Lypv9kvN7g.text: Yes, I know this is a restaurant within the hotel, Yes, I am prepared for the overpriced menu, Alas, I'm still disappointed with flavor and the portion size.  We ordered quinoa salad, burgers, pasta, and some kids menu items. Surprisingly the best value items were kids menu with an entree, side, and drink, which could have easily fed an adult.  The regular adult menu items are hit and miss. After finishing their plates, most of the adults in our party ended up finishing my nephews' tater tots since we're still hungry.  Surprisingly those tots are quite good.  TIP: You could ask to substitute fresh cut fruit, tater tots, fries, or pasta salad as side without additional charge.
