cliKLwE5gElWAWud_ESWNg.text: This place is conveniently located in the Mandalay Bay basement shopping area. We came here specifically looking for healthier options, so we tried their fruit salad, Caesar salad, mixed green salad, and quinoa salad with seasonable vegetables. The salads have extremely fresh ingredients, which is great. But what I love about this place is that each piece of lettuce and ingredient is generously drizzled with the dressing, yet the taste is quite balanced and not overpowering. The decor of the restaurant is also nice and clean, which helps with the appetite for certain. For those that want to easily bring food to go, Citizens offers many easy to-go options right at entrance, which you can just pay, go, and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lasagna is huge at Citizen&#39;s but extremely delicious.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying our lovely dinner together.

6TMDh6h-ebZzoIizT9Y8RA.text: This place is amazing!!! My husband and I split the Lasagna. BEST we have ever eaten.  We will go back everytime we are in Vegas.

1F0W4Bk9Hn7N7kVlqn_yNQ.text: Stopped in on a Sunday at 11pm   Had the spinach artichoke, cheese quesadilla and chili fries.  Nice dime place and reasonable pricing

0X7UFna42BVHnjd4GgA6IA.text: Nevertheless I must stress that this restaurant is remarkably forgettable. In fact, I busted out this phone piece just to write this in hopes that the next time I come to Vegas, the most meaningless city on the planet, I won't make the same mistake. I paid $20 for what was most definitely a DiGiorno's veggie pizza, complete with the world's most self-loathing olives and a crust that could cut through a human neck of equal or lesser girth to that of Penn Jillette (if thrown passionately). To make matters weaker, me and the crew had to mange that gange while getting blasted by a Bruno Mars stunt double.

NsmHPcwU-_b6V70VQV2QdA.text: This may seem a little but like a harsh review but I feel like no one should waste their time or money here, the food was ok, nothing special and waaaay too over priced (our final bill for 4 people would have been the same as if we went to a buffet, and the buffet we had gone to in the same hotel, Mandalay Bay, was way better than this place), they definitely take advantage of you if you don't want to go out looking for food somewhere else, we had gone on a tour earlier and were really tired. They have a really good spot and the restaurant itself looks really nice but with the mediocre food, overpriced menu, and ok service (waitress got our order wrong, she didn't write anything down) it is definitely not worth it. I suggest you take the extra steps and probably look for food outside the hotel.

YUMQQQtm4-63iVqhRbefDA.text: Went for breakfast.   Had the eggs/potatoes and Bacon.   Bacon was super greasy and the whole meal was over $100 for 4 people and not that good....... House of blues has a $9.99 breakfast special so you can avoid this place

trlS6uf4vTUBqETLDJEbfg.text: Only reason im leaving a four stars is our waitress priscilla was super sweet the hostess was rude and sat people before us who showed up after us..  She was not friendly at all...  Was very  rude. Not what  I expected from my first visit here.. If i come back will only be because our waitress!

NaaTkM1ZbqG8gQ4dTueRwA.text: Great experience at Citizens today, with I believe the best Bloody Mary I've ever had!  It was bodacious in volume and adorned with many accoutrements including a split crab leg, shrimp, cherry pepper, pearl onion, olive, celery, and a big honkin piece of beef jerky.  Great, great, great.  The pico served with the chips was very fresh and bright, and the kids had the disco fries.  I tried one and they were super 'potatoy' and tasty.  Nice work.

SItCnbSFDorrId6FvQJrLQ.text: I probably suffered hearing loss at this establishment. After waiting for fifteen minutes, my boyfriend and I were seated in the main dining room. The music was so loud that we literally could not be heard by each other or the manager - who stopped by the table to check on us. He asked how our experience was and if he could do anything to improve it. We asked for them to lower the volume of the music. He replied "What?" because he literally couldn't hear us shouting.   During dinner, in which we both donned earplugs and entertained ourselves with our phones, my boyfriend downloaded a decibel meter onto his phone, and found that the ambient sound level peaked at 97db.  I honestly feel so sorry for the staff who's forced to endure the noise in this establishment.   The food was fine. The service was minimal. Our server had two huge tables in addition to a number of four tops, and was super overworked. She was doing her best, but it was clear we were on our own. We saw her twice during the whole meal.   Avoid, unless you want to hurt your ears.

3b2wpldSkh83CTWDh3uiKQ.text: Chic but casual restaurant; service was incredibly fast for lunch, and the portions are huge, so super glad the husband and I split the caesar salad and tuna melt. Very fresh and hits the spot for a quick lunch.

AmKKIum_IXCrLhMiMcyVQw.text: Do not eat here. An order of nachos, you know chips, liquid cheese, olives black beans and cilantro takes 45 minutes to prepare. And when you stand at the counter looking for answers. "The kitchen was backed up."  I could count the number customers on one hand! Eat at your one risk!

QdqeJtFwfUdT-8UeErAvzg.text: What can be said about Digiorno Pizza that hasn't already been said? Maybe that I've never paid $16 for it, in the past. I wonder if this place has worked out a bulk deal with a distributor to save them even more money. Vegas is an expensive place. I guess I would probably serve overpriced garbage too if I had to run a business in this hell hole.

uyMcLyfA9TQ2qwnc9FUxNw.text: Less than impressed. The chicken tasted like fish, the spaghetti Bolognese was watered down, the kale and quinoa salad was sweet and dry and the brown rice was old and hard. Also, everything was expensive and the service was slow. One compliment: the frisco melt is good.

rNGEGJjwT6pV-xK16crpCQ.text: Quite literally the worst customer service I have ever encountered. A 15 minute wait greets you for 'to go' orders, in which time the single cashier serves 2 people. The other 10 or so staff stand out the back of the restaurant joking around. Once you finally place your order you can expect to wait a further 15 minutes for your nachos to be served without any of the 3 toppings listed on the menu. Literally just corn chips with cheese. You will then proceed to request those 3 toppings. 2 of which will be brought out to you in little tubs. Finally after another request and 40 minutes you will receive what you ordered.

vrVPIKEekJ6Z9e-M1S_JNw.text: 5/8/16: Just don't.  Yeah, it's the only restaurant in Mandalay Bay open late (past 10pm ?).  And no, nothing wrong with the service or the environment.  But really.... better to walk out onto the strip and take a short stroll to try your luck with fast food than to empty your wallet here.  Yeah, the food was that bad and that expensive...  1. Chicken Soup $10.00:  Ever had a $10 soup?  I have.  I believe one was a farm-to-table asparagus wonderland of flavors.  And I've had some others at various ultra-high-end restaurants, most of which very special and very delicious.  But... diluted canned chicken soup with some extra vegetables and spaghetti thrown in?  Seriously?--ten bucks!?  1/10  2. Frisco Melt $16.00 "sourdough, grilled onions, swiss, thousand island dressing":  And if the chicken soup didn't blow your brains, well, here we have a burger for $16... how do they top the ten dolla' canned soup with spaghetti?--with multi-day-old leftover over-cooked cardboard cheap frozen patties.  I couldn't eat it.  Took 3 bites and threw the rest away.  1/10  I dunno, maybe if you're high and couldn't make it to White Castle?...  Otherwise, just turn around.  Just don't.  1/5  PS--It appears the manager left a comment to this review with her email.  I want to note that I did in fact write her an email, but am still waiting on a response.  If there is a status update, I will update you here.  #american #vegas

rSl9DWIF8tMdqDpl0Ib8EQ.text: Stopped here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised!  I would have given a higher rating but I felt our sever was unfriendly and slow. Tables around us got our food when they ordered after us. I got the quiche and it was good, not great. It seemed like more breading and less egg where I wish it was more egg. My husband got the chicken sandwich and loved it while by daughter got the blta sandwich and it had us all wishing we ordered that. She said it was AMAZING!  They are open 24 hrs so whether your looking for a nice lunch or late night snack Citizens its a great place at stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLTA sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quiche with mixed greens

WVv_Aq66ZWnvqhqgrRRz1A.text: Terrible service! Slow like a turtle! Very frustrating. I think the servers needs more training and efficiency.

3x9dqA5RmtLXko-UVU8eLQ.text: We stopped in for snacks at this casual Mandalay Bay restaurant since we weren't in the mood for another casino buffet just yet, and the wait time for a table here was zero.   The "Ultimate Sliders Challenge" (24 Sliders in 24 Minutes) looked interesting. Seems like a whole lotta mini-burgers to choke down in not a lotta time. Impossible for many and conquered by few. $40 Challenge declined.  Hearty plates. We tried a couple dishes which were decent to share or sample. Rather pricey, though, for mostly standard fare IMO. Relatively spendy menu prices aren't exactly budget friendly because Vegas, but the food should fill nicely whether before or after your bender. There are bargains to be found if you're motivated to pinch pennies elsewhere.  -$21 Fish tacos. Nicely battered fish and not oily/greasy. Fresh veggie mix and soft tortillas. Good, but not so much 21 dollars great. Southern California is still tops for best fish tacos and value priced to match. -$18 Corned beef pastrami sandwich. A nice stack of toasty, melty, meaty, deli goodness that even a New Yorker might appreciate. The consensus winner from our table. The cole slaw side was ok, but probably should've gone with the fries. -$18 Bacon cheeseburger. Three slices of fine bacon makes for a tasty cheeseburger and the fries were served hot and crispy. Now we need some luck at the tables to recoup the steeply marked up lunch tab.  Service was friendly and efficient. Drinks were refilled regularly. All good there.  There are several restaurant options conveniently located within the Mandalay labyrinth to keep you intrigued, and Citizens Kitchen & Bar is a 24hr accessible spot with familiar fare to satisfy.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. slider challenge wall. shame...shame...shame
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bacon cheeseburger
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. reuben

IOlTdWBAZnRU4pj2-GZ3UA.text: We hesitantly came here for breakfast on our check out day at Mandalay Bay. Other recent reviews left us skeptical of food quality and service. Service wasn't the quickest, but the overall experience would be hard to beat. It took us about 45 minutes from being seated to leaving the restaurant. My husband and I decided to split the ultimate breakfast and we ordered an extra side of sausage to make sure there would be enough food. We were pleasantly surprised when our breakfast came pre-split for us, with way more food than we expected! Each of us were given a huge plate with one egg each, 2 pancakes, 2 slices of bacon, and breakfast potatoes. It was exactly what we were wanting and didn't even have to ask. We felt like we got much more food than had they just left it all on one plate. It was a simple breakfast that was the perfect way to split between a couple, all for the price of the regular menu item. We will definitely be back for breakfast here and add it to our list of regular restaurants on our Vegas cycle!

xcy9ABJ27CCSpdTMrxu52A.text: Ate at bar. Bartender / server Raquel could care less.  No sense of hospitality. No greeting. No eye contact. Not that busy. Not even basic Waffle House service. As a local our visitors deserve much better and there are people here who need jobs and could easily make a better impression. Who trained and supervises the staff here? ** UPDATE 2/10/14 ** Within a few days both the bartender and GM wrote to me directly with their sincere apologies and regrets for this lapse in service. While you would expect this of the GM, for the bartender to do this independently is a very stand up thing to do.  Both showed integrity and pride in their work in doing so.  I'm a local and will go back on my own (no comps) in the near future and see if this was an isolated incident or not.

xvwKoeHlo4BrvFs_qRrIeg.text: Went here to meet some friends for a quick snack. Food was good. I had a marble cake and my boyfriend got a sandwich (forgot what it's called) but it's like a double cheeseburger sandwich which was so good. If it wasn't for the hostess/greeter, I would've given this place 5 stars. We were ignored when we arrived. Seems like she was busy working on some papers when she should be greeting customers. She just looked at us and continued to work on her papers. We sat down, waited for about 10 mins, nobody came to get our orders. We decided to walk up to the cashier and just ordered for to go.

z2OFjY64VfaQYHhxYp4R9Q.text: A great find in the Mandalay hotel. Had the chicken club and it was a great hearty sandwich. Our waiter was Robert and was very professional and attentive. The Manager Marjorie came over to introduce herself to make sure everything was fine. It was a nice touch.

GywtDwgB7LKYz5PlhDAtTA.text: Was at Citizens a couple of nights ago and had a fabulous experience. They primarily serve comfort food and do it extremely well. I had a corned beef Reuben with mashed potatoes. The Reuben was well made and the mashed potatoes were perfect. Neither were particularly special but they were executed perfectly which is exactly what you look for in this type of food.  I sat at the bar and was served by Steven, he was truly a pleasure to talk to. He was helpful about the menu and suggestions and I could tell he really enjoys what he does. He made this experience feel like home!

-bCScVYmi1l-tmoiGR3fzQ.text: I had a horrible experience and bad customer service, dry and lousy croissant that they wouldn't even warm and very bad PB&J sandwich. Beware of this cafe...

tv2jlTxIX4RBbs7uZs0e6g.text: Been here a couple of times. Strip-pricey, but great food and portions. Burgers/wings/nachos are all very good. Large bloody Mary's look awesome, but didn't have one.

N_7Vo29Dux6smuz7M4SjaQ.text: Went in around 2 am, to just the cafe part of citzens...not the sit down restaurant part. & IT.WAS.AWFUL, terrible, quite shitty in fact.  Ordered a small size of the kale salad which was inedible and pretty sure against FDA regulations as it seemed it was kept unrefrigerated. Then I ordered a $10 "juice" that  was actually a smoothie. I'll give them points for using actual free fruits, but being from LA, I am very particular on my freshly PRESSED juice.   NEVER AGAIN. Go to the little mini mart near the elevator and buy some cup of noodles there to satisfy your late night drunk munchies. Although there's no coffeemaker in the rooms at Mandalay, so ask for a cup of hot water from starbucks or citizens (they'll charge you $1)

c_4953VOK--biaPHxfLF6Q.text: Sorry, sometimes you got to be honest on a review.  The waiter was great, very attentive and at one point seemed like he was going to sit down with us to tell us about every item on the menu - maybe he was new.  The first hint was during a conference with 30,000 people this place had tons of open tables.  Food was not so great at dinner - ribs were not great, wings were not great, rice bowl was not great, fries were not great, get the picture?  I guess it's better for breakfast in the AM but there isn't much else open either at that time of day.  Bar looked well stocked, I will give them that.  Pricey for what it was, I think the hotel should tear this out and make a bigger Starbucks, they would have happier customers.  Sorry, go in for a drink or coffee and you'll be fine - avoid the food.

DUZwUVTSwtZdxqi0RwM_6A.text: After logging in some time at the Daylight day club we were hungry and looking for a good place to get our grub on within Mandalay Bay. A friend remembered having a good experience here so we figured it should be pretty good. Well, it fell a little short of the mark with pricey food and slow service. My tuna melt was good, but it better damn well be for $16! The accompanying seasoned criss-cut fries were a tad overdone, making them overly crunchy. The service was nice but slow; it seemed like it took forever for the food to come out and we were HUNGRY. It was crowded, to be sure, with 4th of July weekend and the MMA fights and all, but it seemed like they should've anticipated this and staffed appropriately. Not a special destination in my book.

Y3wbI5v1IZ4C71gPo8uO7Q.text: So Weird to be in Vegas at the Mandalay and not have much choice for good food after 10 p.m. (that are above standard Denny's type food). This place is better than Denny's but the price for what we got is not equivalent to the lack of quality in the dishes.   If you are starving, it will get you by. With extra spending.  If you want some GOOD food of quality and care in preparation and presentation, PASS!

LR77XDRZ8STgmS1waBDLrg.text: Ate at the bar side on the 26th and had the best service out of any restaurant we ate at all week. Are server Joyce was awesome. Are drinks always full, never sat with dirty dishes, even brought us new napkins after we had the wings. Was recommended by my cousin to have the hot wings, I wasn't disappointed. They were the best wings i have had in a long time. Also had the stir fry and it was pretty good. Cant wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas.

QnoVGfBK4L-zeqgf_X7Xig.text: I stay at MandalayBay/Delano about 2-3 times a year. I always walked past this place and told myself one day I would try it. That day came. I will probably keep walking by in the future. We arrived and there was a 5 minute wait, not bad, we did get seated within that 5 minutes. Once seated it was about another 10 minutes before our waitress, who was very nice, came over and asked us what we wanted to drink, by then we were also ready to order. I got the bacon egg and cheese sandwich and my husband eggs over medium, sausage, potatoes and sourdough.  We got our food on about 20 minutes. Mine was ok, just your basic breakfast sandwich. Their potatoes though wow, it's like the cap was loose on the paprika bottle and someone dropped it in the frying pan. I like paprika, but this was overkill. My husband on the other hand. Well let's just say I felt really bad because I picked the place. His eggs were not over medium they looked like hard frisbees with brown crispy outer edges like someone forgot them on the grill. You know what else they forgot was cooking? The toast? Yeah it came out served burnt. I am shocked they would send that out to a table. His sausage came in the form of bacon.  They left our plates so quickly it took a while fir him to get someone's attention to let them know he had ordered sausage. When he finally did, they brought him a side of sausage. He should have kept his mouth shut, because unlike the eggs and toast these were not over cooked. He cut them open and they were mushy and pink. So maybe breakfast isn't their thing here, maybe they need to hire more people, maybe it was just an off day. Anyhow, I don't think I will be back after that experience.

czz0by2Ul5zwIGhY_7h4Lg.text: I've decided to hold off this review because I wanted to come here a couple of times to make sure it was just because I was starving. The food is decent, but massively over-priced, but it is open 24hrs. Large portions, make it easy to do a tapas style meal. Order a couple of appetizers and get a salad and you get a pretty decent meal without having to gorge yourself on one entree.  OK service, decent menu selection, and they have pastries, and smoothies. Try it out.

Rf4b5I8RtgGwCXKGV7oVOQ.text: I stopped by for a smoothie which tasted pretty good. I had the Berrylicious for about $10. The problem was the service. The girl who made my smoothie made it quickly but left my drink behind the counter and went to the back. Someone else happened  to come out and noticed that I was waiting for my order. The girl came out again but never even bothered to look at me. I shouldn't have been surprised because a customer before me was waiting and had to ask for her order which was sitting on the counter waiting to be picked up.

h4v_JH0leVQp-MDHEK17Ig.text: Absolutely fabulous food and service!  I'm so glad we decided to dine in while visiting the Mandalay Bay!

-PPloud8aTsK-foAxz0Jyw.text: Ugh! I only went here a second time (on a separate Vegas trip) because my group was starved and drunk... and couldn't walk another hundred feet to another restaurant or something ridiculous....  I can't remember.  BUT I CAN REMEMBER HOW SHITTY BOTH MY VISITS HERE WERE! The first time, I ordered a pretty basic burger that ended up coming to the table late and undercooked.  While I would typically eat it if it was anything else (my standards of food are pretty low), I would probably have yakked it out if I decided to eat it.  I asked for it to be recooked, but the waiter was pretty unresponsive about me getting a new one, so I didn't even end up eating it as my group was in a rush.  I gave up and decided to never come back again....  But I did, several months later.  This time, our group was much bigger (about 10) so understandably, it would take a while to get our food.  However, we were there for maybe a half hour-45 AFTER ordering and our waitress passed by our table once, only after we all spent time staring at her from across the room.  Finally got the food and it was cold as Antarctica.  Wow! It's like they cooked it on time but left it on the counter to hang out or something.  Some people at my table refused to eat most of their food so I asked (shamelessly) if they "were gonna eat that" so I could doggy bag it.  Even the boxes took some effort to acquire.  I was determined to salvage as much as I could from this experience and never return again!    Oh, 24 hr Vegas McDonald's.  I will never forsake you again.

NolRt_KxURuOmUtzBhJiJA.text: We had a breakfast meeting here during a convention. It was a bit loud even at 9am but then again this is Vegas. Service was very good. I had a stuffed French toast (banana and Nutella) which was good but a bit on the sweet side. I know- what should I expect when I ordered it!   I came back the next day just to get coffee to go. But at $4 I thought differently! It doesn't seem bad with breakfast but just a cup to go...

fmdXxmrsNOvivPxPrwkHlA.text: The French dip was really good. Staff was pretty friendly until we had to ask for something they forgot to bring and then they didn't show up as much.

jGAxurRNJclfQOcTFN-Stw.text: Great decor. Chunky monkey drink was great!  Food was better than average. Service has been below average - poor the last two times we visited.

E6lazvtYfX8Ip1nmrH8AHQ.text: Had lunch here. Sat in the outside seating, which unfortunately included the smoke from the rest of Mandalay Bay. Small table for 3 folks; can't imagine trying to seat one more.  Ordered the chicken wings with sweet chili sauce (GF!) and they were decent. My husband (who travels and dines out a lot for his job) said his French dip sandwich was the best he's ever had....The prices are quite high, but it's a nice resort, so we understand. Our server was nice but not over the top.   I'd probably go back for late-night grub, but not lunch or dinner.

v9Pm59n6mcHwtG2y-jtBJA.text: Citizens breakfast was average. The eggs were made over medium as requested, but the bacon was not hot and the Tator tots with bell peppers and onions weren't my favorite. I had sourdough toast and it wasn't sliced or buttered. Could have had better at Denny's for a lot less.

USWeEDlA0oiwIsOaaI3xJA.text: If you happen to be in Mandalay Bay, check out Citizens restaurant. I was showing my "tourist"  friends around this hotel last night when we decided we want to rest our feet a bit. And there in the middle of everything was Citizens. It seemed like a pretty slow night. Few tables in the other side of the restaurant and just us in our side :) exactly what we needed. Lotus ( i will never forget this name. I mean how can you? ) was our server. She was professional and had a great personality and funny at the same time. She made us laugh GOOD at least 3 times. Lol. She helped us navigate through the menu and recommended her favorite bottle of of wine. It was spot on!! We then asked her to get us some munchies and said we trusted her. She got us some calamari, artichoke dip and potato skins. AGAIN SPOT ON!! They were all delish. She finished us off with a carrot cake to share ( it's HUGE) and some coffee. After chitchatting and winding down for abt 2 HOURS, we were all refreshed and left to walk some more. Great food and awesome service. Thanks for awesome experience to citizens and Lotus! I will definitely be back :)

467STiSneO7_-Ye9-E6t_g.text: If a $20 plus tip martini is your idea of a good time, this is your place. The food is like a medium burger place with premium prices. Decent for breakfast to go though.

TxVly09Let43P0pBhfvbzQ.text: Overpriced,  mediocre food. Should have walked over to Luxor's 24 hr. cafe instead.

p-nDKvpFFQY1Qn7TrQHLww.text: Breakfast was great! Reasonably priced...good service. The manager, JR was very friendly and made us feel at home!

RyBEHrSHva7yDEiCRAc0xQ.text: I went here for lunch and it was very good. I ordered a cheese burger and their fries with some green tea. their fries were the best fries I've ever tasted, the burger was a bit dry but it was still very good. My mom got the lamb burger with the mashed potatoes and she absolutely loved it. She went back a 2nd time to get the lamb burger because it was so good! The only thing that I can't even call in issue it was just something that was a bit annoying was our waiter talked very quiet and seemed kinda out of it, like he had a hangover or something so we had to keep repeating or selves when we ordered and he asked the same questions a few times after we already answered him.

vdcdWBtL967c2A-3pikU1w.text: Service was not the worst but definitely not the best.  All the food tasted frozen, the artichoke dip, the calamari, even the beef. Not good. Pricey for frozen food!

0YwaBJ4j8s-GTm4rz71lVw.text: I love this place! Stopped by in here today looking for breakfast and the decor caught my attention right away. My server Chris was very attentive and made great reccomendations. The food was really good. I recommend the ultimate breakfast cause the pancakes were delicious. I also got a iced coffee to go. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

-FGSmf2KdwnkLS4bLod_tg.text: Food & service alone would have been 4 stars, "management" deducted 2.  Small issue, could have easily been rectified, no biggie, but ended up talking to this "Marjorie" person who said that she was the GM. What a pathetic excuse for anybody who believes that they are actually running a business. Make the customer feel like a jackass, then berate your staff (within earshot of at least 5 other customers, who, by the way were also appalled by her behavior). I actually tipped the server double because I felt so bad that he was subjected to this hostile work environment even though what happened was not his fault. PS. Marjorie; I saw your electronically generated responses to other Yelp posts. Save your time & please don't respond that way to mine, if you don't have time to respond personally, don't bother. After witnessing the way you openly insult your customers & your own staff there is nothing more I need to hear from you unless it's your supervisors contact information.

qlxXTvE55estazEaBOw75g.text: Went for a late night dinner after checking in at Mandalay Bay. Had one of the best fish and chips ever. The fish was nice and thick also huge. The batter was thin and crispy exactly what you would expect. My party also ordered the fish tacos and brick chicken both were recommended as well. Only thing was there was music playing really loud just outside the restaurant made it difficult to talk but the food made up for that.

83gq2TjodYNBFOGgf9ffWA.text: For a 24 hour restaurant the food, look, and service are very good. The menue is simple but good. The bar offers great drinks. Our service could have been faster and the noise can be an issue but I was very happy with my late night dining.

I20yXBpUo8hebcdBCGjNbg.text: Me and my family are here in Las Vegas for the SuperZoo convention and decided to stop and grab some lunch here at the Citizens Kitchen & Bar. That was a bad decision. It all started out alright, service was okay, server was nice enough. We came in and we're almost the only ones there.. As we sat they got busier and busier and that's when our service got worse and worse. Our food came and it was very bland, drinks very dry, and the service getting worse and worse. We would get the occasional how is everything, how are you guys doing followed by a dash off, not even to stop and hear the response to his question. My brother ordered a drink, to which he got a response that they don't have that drink, this was not the case. The actual waiter didn't know that they even had this drink on the menu.. Very disappointing service, very bland and tasteless food.. Definitely wouldn't recommend it if your here in Las Vegas..

bL2Cbs1mXudcOc_7VVi5Gw.text: Great steak and rib-eye! Watch out for the portions! They are gynormous!

NyFQBanVqH9z80QObCszSA.text: Breakfast was a waste.  Pancakes were not fresh.  Tasted like they were out of a warmer. They were stuck together as if they had been sitting and sweating on each other for an hour. Eggs were a 3 on a 1-10 scale. Then the dish came with some unadvertised glop that appeared to be an attempt as a south west style hash brown mixture but all it did was make the rest of my food taste like hot peppers.

VFt5WU2oHnM1xz0NL5zv_A.text: I would have given this place 3 stars but the service was horrible. Anthony, "our server" took our order than never returned to the table to check in on us or refill our drinks. Food was decent and prices were standard for Vegas.

UH5o75d5H2lsavSd5Y9ESQ.text: Ate at this place a couple of times during our stay in Vegas.  Food at the sit down restaurant was good but it took forever to come out.  The Bar was ok.  The bakery items did not taste too fresh.  The good thing about the Bar is it is open 24 hours so it is nice to be able to eat at any time.

0kdI-wPeoBUipjJ9V5O43g.text: Low quality food, I've had salads and their burgers, while not being terrible, it's not good.  Typical strip prices (relatively high) and quality comparable to a cheap grocery store deli.

h3knC8X0dTwTYR60XLjhzw.text: We ate lunch here, it was just ok.  Not great, but not horrible.  We ate burgers and the wings. Price wasn't too bad.

33uOfXJAjVE4VjeGGijSeQ.text: Like much in Vegas, pretty on the outside, but no substance.  Ate here twice on a recent business trip. The space, redecorated from its previous goofy pseudo-diner style, is quite nice, masculine and casual yet well-appointed, with a classy bar and the now-ubiquitious but still pretty old style light bulbs. Sat at the bar and had friendly and attentive service.   The breakfast was standard - eggs/toast/sausage/potatoes were like "diner plus" with a flavorful pepper mixed in with the potatoes and thick texas style toast. Fine. The major disappointment was dinner. I went in craving something just barely healthy (after a few days in Vegas I was desperate for a vegetable) and the main recommended entree at Citizens is a chicken/brocolli/potato plate that looked great. Unfortunately the execution was inexcusably poor, especially for a "signature" dish. The chicken was flavorless and dry, even with the skin left on. Broccoli rabe was undercooked and also flavorless, and the potato quarters were the least cooked of all, with a full half of them too hard to even cut with a fork, and inedible. Everything sat in a plate full of broth, perhaps that's in an attempt to disguize the dryness and blandless of the food, but even the broth doesn't help. Chow in San Francisco does this chicken/brussel sprouts/mashed potato dish that's just bursting with flavor and juiciness, and it's like 12 bucks. This $25 plate was just sad and pointless. Again, like so much in Vegas in general, it's an opportunity to spend twice as much on something half as good.

XJw-650zPJ6gMB2CvL0dxg.text: Do your self a favor and skip the patty melt, perhaps the worst burger I have ever had in my life. The patty had no seasoning what so ever, the fries were not even warm. The bread was thick but hard on edges. Waiter never checked back u tip the end, only reason i gave it 2 stars is because it was open 24 hours and  my fiance liked her rueben.

lD4MxI4SHP9EHHAaw5cWOA.text: AMAZING food! Very fast too. Marlise was our waitress and she was so sweet and on top of everything. Would definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XDQAEmZbNBabYC1iXA5i4w.text: This place was whatever. Nothing too special about this place. Was staying at Mandalay Bay and decided to check this place out.   The food. It was honestly whatever. Given that it was Vegas, everything was overpriced. That is fine if the food was somewhat good but it wasn't. The food was mediocre at best, and nothing that I would rant or rave about. I was hoping and expecting better given that it was inside Mandalay Bay but that was wishful thinking on my end.   When we walked in, it was pretty empty and only a few seats were taken. It took an awful long time for our waiter to get to us. For what reasons I do not know. Still, he took his sweet time, and once he took our order disappeared until it was time for our food to come out. Still no drinks and still no silverware. We had to remind the waiter when our food came out at which time he went and got it. It would be hard to understand a place like this inside a huge casino would have service like this when busy but when not busy blows my mind.   It was good that my buddy and I tried this place. But many of the other restaurants we ate at Mandalay Bay were much better.   Good place to try but nothing so special I would want or recommend coming back to.

UMlk3kdBT7q_S0EoiH05YA.text: Disappointed with the food and service. Stay away from the patio seating. It has the most uncomfortable chairs. Our server was slow and disinterested in providing us service. We had to ask twice for our coffee to be refilled. The server did attempt to make amends by offering a coffee to go. The corned beef hash was mediocre and overpriced.

hPh4Wl0bNmJuRyA6U3laHg.text: Call me crazy, but when I order a $23 dollar Crab Cake Benedict there better damn well be an English muffin otherwise you don't call this a Benedict.   A Crab Cake Benedict without the English muffin is just crab cake with a poached egg and hollandaise. What the hell kinda place serves a Benedict WITHOUT the English muffin??   smh.   2 stars is being generous.

BymTN_Jwch7p3DJLE5zG7A.text: Food is extremely mediocre. The service was ok nothing great. We came in around 4am and they only had a late night menu available. It was overpriced for what we got. My friend ordered a tuna sandwich it was very dry, canned tuna taste better in my opinion. All of the sandwiches come ale cart. The fries were disgusting and costed 7 bucks. We also has breakfast burritos which were ok nothing amazing. I would never come back here and don't recommend anyone else either.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry tuna sandwich
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito

XD9csg-qg3_8lFtol_rjRA.text: Awesome location and people. If your ever here please ask for Ivonne she will make your day lovely. This lady should get a raise just for how inviting she makes the atmosphere feel. Definitely a must try!

UNLXHa4B_Zw1ttOoLYLYQg.text: Didn't get a chance to even eat. We just left there moments ago. Both hostess were really rude for no apparent reason. Gave them a chance to correct politely. No luck.

doMod86a02jR1z2Qd9UE7w.text: Well when everything else is closed at 4AM and Mandalay Bay room service wait time is 2 hours, there's nothing left but Subway and Citizens.  Service was really nice but the food was okay.  Chicken noodle soup was not pleasing to my easily pleased, drunk tastebuds.  Nachos were good but when is nachos never good?    Oh and another thing, we had a party of 6, but only 4 of us were present at the time. Hostess would only seat us at a table for 4 and said we can move to a bigger table when the rest of the party arrived.  I meaaaaan, the restaurant was practically empty at 4am, but okay.

11T3R4_W56nwZVwuTf1QAw.text: I ate at Citizens almost every day for breakfast during a work event. This place is fantastic and quick in the morning!  Their green tea is easily one of the best I ever had! Coffee is great too but I suggested buying it in the to go line as it is a few dollars less than the sit down menu. My favorite meal was the standard 2 egg, meat, toast and breakfast potatoes. PLENTY of food! All portions are pretty large. One day I had the pancakes with chocolate chips- 3 enormous pancakes!! I couldn't eat more than 1/4 of them. Their berry bowl is large and comes with raspberries and strawberries!  Their to go line moves pretty quickly- I usually would pick up a croissant and some fruit.   The interior is quaint and beautiful! Very attractive from the outside looking in, the patio was fun to sit on and watch all the patrons go by.

pfKx42srFD4i85aeUuxCOA.text: Excellent atmosphere and great drinks! The food was ok but the price did not match the portions, mac n cheese was super dry and the gumbo was not worth $27. Our server Tony was great!!

_Fk1zXN-hMrO1COIPrPExg.text: The food is OK but the service isn't great... I waited 45 mins for a soup and a bacon egg and cheese sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foods ok but to get the food after you order is insane. I won&#39;t be going back.

nkpXDLO6a1rx69kDoL2NMg.text: Tried Cobb salad for lunch.  Not bad.  Big enough to satisfy hungry appetite.  Service was decent.  I would go back.

jN63v12eH0jG2x5t0kdy8w.text: My wife and I just enjoyed a delicious prime rib dinner, the meat, broccoli and baked potato were cooked to perfection. We enjoyed a wonderful glass of Pinot Noir and the service was excellent. Nice casual atmosphere. Most enjoyable. We'll definitely be back!

ZnL9dVDMJvP7OAMHMlwUAw.text: Food was alright. I ordered the corned beef skillet and the eggs were great as well as the corned beef hash. My only large complaint for the food was the temperature. The food was under warm and that's concerning only because poached eggs and meat should not be near cool. The service was fine. We had three different people tend to us and that made it confusing for the tip amount. The food was high priced for the portion as well. I usually never finish a meal and today I ate all of my food because there was barely any on my plate. So if you do go here expect to pay more for less. Another person with me ordered the ultimate breakfast and their meal was a large size for a good price. So be mindful for that!

iWWqYqG_apps5Y5RouL3Ew.text: If you go here expect to be overcharged and disappointed. I asked is they had actual corned beef hash or the stuff from a can. The server said they do their own. So I ordered that. The only thing they do is open their own can and fry it up. I had more oil in my dish than a super tanker. I pointed this out to the server who asked if I wanted him to take it back and get something else instead. I sent it back as inedible and I was not happy that they tried passing of the $2 canned stuff as their own. I got the eggs benedict which was mediocre but not terrible. I was then billed for both items when I asked about this they were not willing to correct it and said that they had to make both dishes it is not their fault I am not happy with their food.  If you want actual corned beef go to Ri Ra in the same casino. If you want good food and service try any place but this one.

eX5qoc0FCqPHHKq0--Pevg.text: It's a solid choice for hotel place. Not fine dining but not fast food. Solid selection and if you stick with wheelhouse (prime rib special, spaghetti and meatball, sandwiches) you will be happy. Prices are more reasonable for the location. I really like the "cafe" side for sandwiches and desserts where you order at the counter and pick up when ready. Great place to grab a late night snack or treat.

Rx5p4oPXcHIKlLj44oP0SQ.text: 2 egg breakfast and the ultimate breakfast (don't remember what it was called but it was basically 2 egg bfast + pancakes). Service was very prompt as we were in a hurry - EXCELLENT mimosa cocktails  Bit pricey for bfast but with it -

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 egg breakfast plus pancakes and mimosas

VinWAtVseaC1GfXSL_ES0w.text: While staying at The Mandalay Bay, we came here twice. And that was for there turkey avocado sandwich!  It was very delicious! Nice thick cut turkey meats. A deli style sandwich on a cranberry wheat bread. Yum. I would rate it 5 stars, but since the sandwich costs $13, I had to remove a star!

ymXCiDjoNJmBcNyh4UgpJw.text: Unless you really have to eat (no other restaurant exist on earth), do your body and wallet a favor and avoid this place. It easily goes down as one of the worst restaurant on earth.   A $35 steak ? Looks like they cook it in microwave, and it came with plastic utensil. You have to push, then they give you real utensil. $20 salad is probably as good as the $2 one at AmPm   Customer service ? Just as good as the food ...

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cant tell if it is a rag or $35 steak
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5_THj1LNJYiyQMGjUjrHJQ.text: I dined here three times during my recent stay at Mandalay Bay, twice for breakfast and once for dinner. Breakfast is good, not great. Dinner is much better. Service is okay. Overall a three star experience. Highlights... Breakfast service is very quick and there's a good variety on the menu. The omelette I had was very good. The breakfast potatoes were very bland. The dinner menu accommodates almost anyone - vegetarians, pescetarians, and carnivores alike. I had a fabulous shrimp and pasta dinner while my friend had the prime rib. The portions here are huge and you get a good value for your dollar.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend&#39;s prime rib special. She said it was very good. Great value for $35. Enough to feed two people.
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and quinoa dish
Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta with creamy pesto and shrimp. Very good.

JwfxOljYCoyiZ4ExVZZ5sQ.text: Just Tore Up Some FISH (Shark) & Chips.. And A French Dip!! This Place Had Great Service.. Thanks Nick!! Very Cool and Made Great Recommendations!  This Spot Has Music, Full Bar & Even A Deli To the Front For To Go Items.. Will Def Come Back!! Great Decor.. Really Cool Laid Back Spot!!

pdLJ2R4kOx-AtSc4gVhPVA.text: We arrived on 8/21 around midnight and found the only 24 hour restaurant in Mandalay Bay (why!?). Waited for 10 minutes to get seated when the left half of the restaurant appeared empty. Hostess acted like she was doing us a favor by speaking to us-- not friendly at all.  We were finally seated in a small deuce crammed next to a party of 4. We felt like we were sitting on top of our neighbors, when there were at least 3 other open tables nearby that weren't jammed top of anyone else.   We waited for 10 minutes with no greeting by anyone. We finally just cut our losses and walked out, figuring that if our experience was that bad already, it wasn't worth waiting to see how bad it could get.

sKjO-ZrU-6b3lD0oph2i2Q.text: The food was surprising good.  I ate the reuben sandwich with a side of cole slaw which I thought was so delicious.  Never had I ate a sandwich like this!  The bread was toasted well, light and very crispy.  The corned beef was generous and tasty.  The thousand island dressing, sauerkraut, and Swiss cheese together made the sandwich awesome.  Cole slaw on the side complimented the sandwich.  Excellent!  Loved this place so I came back in the evening and had their popular French onion soup and a side salad.  The soup tasted like heaven and portions were generous.  3 different types of cheeses, thick and gooey, covered slivers of soft sweet onions chunks of bread soaked in the soup...It was the first time that I couldn't finish my soup!

PULzbzxCbJDomMhMPpyD-g.text: The food was amazing and the server was so helpful and promp...had an awesome experience...will recommend to all my friends and I will be a returnng costumer.....

Qa6j6jDSZLVqnsQpmWgITQ.text: The only thing more tired than the subway tile and faux shabby hip interior was their attempt to create a line by telling people there was a 20 minute wait when the restaurant was more than half empty. Was it incompetence or flawed marketing? No one will ever know, and perhaps we're better for that fact.  How was the food? I didn't wait to find out. If their front of house management is any indication then the food is inedible and will needlessly take 20 minutes to find your table. Honestly, it's Vegas. There are restaurants everywhere and most of them won't punish you the way Citizens does for attempting to give then your money.

xE1jvgXRQC3H9NNsIatdaw.text: Best Bloody Mary's around town. Food is delicious and couldn't get any better service. Bartender Raquel was  super nice, helpful and fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MG1xbhyeWIZG9WgX676Vxw.text: We come from Philadelphia for Thanksgiving every year.  We always make a stop at this restaurant for some healthy and delicious food!  It is a little pricey but worth the price for the delicious breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our six year old loved the red velvet pancakes!

OLhU-1kiyAbNFcQFRjRI_g.text: Food is very tasty here but avoid breakfast items. They tend to be bland.  The late night menu was amazing!!!  The French Dip Steak Sandwich was the best French dip I've ever had!!! It came with Thin Sliced Prime Rib, Caramelized Onions, Provolone, Au Jus, and Crispy Shoestring Fries The au jus alone was very tasty on its own but i agree that towards the end things got a little too salty.   I also ordered the potato salad on the side! It was really good as well. It came with red potatoes and dill :)

AAUfU6Nq5DZVXear_t7JIA.text: Really delicious foods including sandwiches, appetizers, steak, burgers and salads. The service was amazing! They also have a bar and a cafe like spot where you can pick up food on the run. However, I did think the prices were a little high for what we got, but what else would you expect from a luxurious hotel!

photos.caption: Photo of Citizens Kitchen and Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken club and french fries

rBkbTq-Msc7ypW7HFGTkZA.text: Came to Citizen, for a quick dinner with family.  At 7pm on a Thursday they weren't super packed, they seated us immediately. I didn't drink however, a member of my party enjoyed their lemon drop martini. Our waitress, was very attentive and quick! I order the Turkey Burger which was massive ( I added some pepper jack cheese to seal the deal) .I quickly chowed down and couldn't attempt to even eat dessert. I left happy and fell into a food coma less than an hour later.

gIWRfLeOFadEAJEExw1cHg.text: Citizens is the only 24 hour joint in MB. So while they may not offer the best service and are overpriced, sometimes you have to bite the bullet.  I visited here twice during my stay, both times only using the counter service. The first time was late night for dessert. It took about 20 minutes for them to box up 2 pieces of cake and deliver them from the kitchen. That seems a little excessive to me. Good thing they quickly made me a tasty decaf mocha to sip on while waiting.  The second time for breakfast. It is nice to have healthy options, so I indulged in a fresh made juice and a breakfast sandwich. Juice was good (I would hope so for $9!) and the sandwich was just ok as it was warmed in the microwave. We waited again about 20 minutes for the juice and the sandwich.  On a previous stay, we have had sit down service. The food was pretty good, nothing stellar.   I will be back because it is the only place to grab and go with decent food any time of the day you are ready to nosh without wanting to leave the hotel.

UYrt2gpmZlo2EY1yA5xOpA.text: The food was great, I had the bisquits and gravy skillet, I was so full I couldn't even finish it, my bf had the ultimate breakfast he loved it, the pancakes are supper fluffy

IffSD6NEIOko8txBBB-OFQ.text: Food is Ok. Nice selection of healthier fare. However, the staff needs basic training in customer service. We were given the wrong food item and when it was brought to the attention of the staff, the response was "I know, I know. I'll get the right one."  It took 10 minutes to get a juice with ingredients listed as follows: kale, blueberries, grapes, apple and beets. Unfortunately, the main ingredient was apple juice with honey running a close second. Yuck.  The last straw was when after waiting for 10 minutes at a nearby table (for the juice), we were told we had to move because the table was for non-"to-go" guests. The place was empty and we would have stayed exactly 5 minutes since we were running so late already. Horrible experience.

9X4YTeWBH25EwjZ8A1vADg.text: This is my go to place to eat when at Mandalay Bay.  Unique style, always great service and awesome food 24 hours a day!  Honestly, this place is as good as any of the "high end" restaurants at Mandalay.  The have great ribs, sandwiches, a lobster roll that is amazing.  I give it 4 stars because it is the only place that gets 4 stars at Mandalay and because they do every meal, and do it better than any restaurant on the property.

ttzLHBufrDAdVglI8_KO_w.text: Went there this morning for breakfast, and in the past was very pleased with the service and quality of good.  However, Sat morning 3/5/16 my fiance and I went to Citizen for breakfast after grabbing a cup of Java at Starbucks.  As we approached the young blonde woman who was the hostess, I immediately saw the sour look on her face.  She was leaning on her elbow and was either in a bad mood or had a terrible hangover. I stood by and waited for her to look my way so I could make my request.  Mind you there was only one other guy waiting to get in. After waiting a minute with no acknowledgement,  I walked all the way up to her, and said excuse me, but we'd like to have breakfast.  She looked at me like I kicked her buns, then said just two of you?.  I said yes, and thank you. She said sternly, stand close!  I shrugged her attitude off and we checked out the posted breakfast menu.  Then she smugly told us," I'm sorry, but no outside drinks are allowed you'll have to throw it away". That was before she even planned on seating us. At that point I told her to forget it, and we would go elsewhere. Round 2... We returned for dinner, and it was like night n day.  The young brunette woman greeted us warmly, and sat us within 10 mins.  The waitress was excellent as was the food.  I'm giving this a 3 star but would give it 5 had that first employee not ruined my morning .. Management should do random attitude checks to improve their customer's experience. Their Mac n cheese and mahi tacos were outstanding.

_FUOsBbghfrbGksMpWo9DA.text: My party and I are currently staying at the Mandalay Bay and we were pleasantly surprised to find a deli-style restaurant on premises, that is reasonably priced and open 24 hours. The food is excellent, we have eaten at least one meal a day at Citizens for the last week and plan on continuing the streak until we leave next week. The staff is incredibly helpful, personable and professional. In particular, we've had exemplary service from Cory, Cady, Justin and especially Brianda, they have all gone above and beyond in being helpful and attentive. (I know I've forgotten some names that also deserve a mention.... sorry). Favorites: Corned beef reuben, French onion soup, open-face Prime Rib sandwich, Carrot cake So-so: Pastrami sandwich - too crisp for my taste (management promptly took it off our bill and offered a replacement free of charge.) Outside patio is loud at night with a music venue nearby but hey, you're in Vegas not a library!

YUoYbdLOppFQFW44jg11vw.text: Please don't go to this place. Management is horrible. This place never takes their customers seriously. Now I know why many people left bad review toward horrible/rude customer service and managers. When the good service comes along with the good food, then it makes the restaurant good.  Menu: I think this place has good selections from sandwiches to good soup menus. But I have no idea how the taste are because I had to return the food. I bet the overall quality and taste decent by reading other people's reviews.  Price: Pretty high as a quick bite casual place. Of course, this is in Vegas. But Wynn has much better casual restaurants with the same price level.  Service: If you are planning to order something over the counter, don't expect to get treated nicely. Just think you are at the local $3 burger shop, but the price is 5 times higher. First, the cashier / hostess at the counter, is not professional (I don't think they are rude. It seems like they just didn't get trained enough about how to serve customers politely).  The worst part is the manager, who is even worse. This place's manager (Mike) is the RUDEST manager I have ever met in my life. I saw another bad review about this place's manger, now I know why. if you have any issue with this place, don't even try to make it fixed with a manager, cuz it will make you look like you are the one with the problem. And don't try to explain what went wrong with your order, because the manage won't listen you.  If you don't care about the service, this place is good to go.

s9pH58LH0T3-Xn1II5eXKg.text: Sadly I used to love this place and I used to tell people about it all the time... sad that because "it's convention week" they aren't offering employees a discount at this time. Way to take care of other people who work there too. Sad bc their food was good but sadly they stopped caring about other people who work in Mandalay Bay as well.. it's ok there's plenty of other places I get amazing service! I'll send my business to them! And they didn't answer the phone when I tried to call in my order... and when I asked about why they don't answer I got the response of oh there must've been someone placing an order in the back because then it doesn't ring to ours. Cool I tried 3 different times and no answer at all. Absolutely sucks.

Dk_LiTW5a0UR1XzkR5CU6Q.text: It is mind numbing to realize that an operation like Mandalay Bay could invest so much into their Foodservice program yet deliver such an inferior product. There was really nothing good about this dining experience. Let's start with the waiter, "Erick".  Someone needs to explain to him that good customer service does not include a phony, smarmy attitude. Erick didn't seem to comprehend that when a customer has an issue, he needs to respond, not just give lip service. Citizen's Kitchen is supposed to offer comfort food. But it isn't comfortable on any level. After I was seated, it took Erick quite a while to approach. I ordered the potato skins appetizer and the BLT & A sandwich. It took forever for the appetizer to be brought to the table. The potato skins looked great, but were cut so thick that the potato remained raw and hard. Difficult to eat and cold and bland. To make matters worse, the sandwich came out within two minutes of the appetizer, forcing me to try and quickly eat the appetizers so I could get to the sandwich and fries before they turned cold. When I mentioned this to Erick, I got a blank stare and an apology. But no action. Sure enough, by the time I got done with the appetizer, the sandwich and fries were cold and hard. Again, Erick didn't seem able to comprehend why this was an issue. No action. Eventually the manager "PJ" came by and I asked him why they served appetizers and entrees together. He stated they didn't. I explained my situation. He apologized and offered to correct the situation. But by that time, it was too late. Raw potato skins and cold BLT aren't a great meal. In fairness, PJ did take 10% off my bill. But I'd rather have a good meal than a discount. If you like mediocre food, bad service and "Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap" blasting in your face, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, avoid it if you can.

-oXa4yb4rjYM2fWL2jHKqQ.text: This was bad.   We had a dining credit due to our room at The Hotel being booked up so we tried it and it did not work out.   This is the Mandalay Bay's answer to a 24/7 restaurant.   We tried to go here twice. The first time was around midnight. The place was empty and I asked for another table so my sweetheart and I could sit side by side. There were probably 40 tables available. The hostess told me in an extra snotty manner that they are a 24 hour restaurant so they will need the four top table for another party. My sweetheart was offended by how she addressed me and suggested we leave immediately which we did. I should not have returned.   The second time we returned I tried a side of mac and cheese and the French onion soup. The soup was meh. The mac and cheese was cold as if they didn't microwave it long enough. It was definitely microwaved. They were out of carrot cake. It was super super expensive- around $30 for one person. It was really really loud and hard to talk. Don't go here at all. There is no reason to. There are other places to eat like Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian which are open 24/7 who won't be rude while overcharging you for bad food.
